reviews.review: Fresh sushi. Great setting. Highly recommend for sushi lovers.

On a Wednesday evening, we had 2 AYCE dinners for ~60. 

- Accommodative. They changed the channel for the olympics for us :)
- Get the oysters. small but packed with flavor. beware! rocks with the oysters? too fresh :/. LOL
- Calamari was a bit too oily. no flavor
- Get the baked green mussels. they even cut it in half for you :)
- big pieces of yellow tail and salmon for the nigiri :)
- The monster roll is deceiving. it's not all soft shell crab. sad that they only use the legs. Ends are shrimp tempura.  
- LOVED the salmon skin roll. more skin than salmon means more crunchy :)
- the NYI roll barely has soft shell crab. even smaller legs!!! :(
- Nuclear roll had a bit too much cream cheese. :/
- Yellow tail trio was a bit too tangy. small pieces of yellow tail
- you only get ONE DESSERT! FAIL...
- Mango mochi was average. they put a toothpick in it with the plastic on. LOL
- Parfait was delicious. but needs more granola. i think the berries and strawberry pieces are frozen.
- Although it may sound picky, overall it was pretty delicious or OISHI :)

Went in with my girl for lunch and had a HORRIBLE dining experience.  I have worked in the restaurant industry for over 7 years and it has been awhile since I had such horrible service/food.  

When we walked in, there was no host/hostess to greet/seat us.  After waiting for 2 minutes, we decided to seat ourselves at the sushi bar.  The restaurant was not packed but had a decent lunch crowd for a sunday.  Numerous servers passed by us and pretty much ignored us.  On top of that, there were 4 sushi chefs behind the counter who did not acknowledge us at all.  Probably after 5 minutes, the manager came by and asked us if we would like something to drink.  It took him probably at least another 5 minutes to grab us our waters.  After placing our order with him, it took another 15-20 minutes to get any of the sushi we ordered.  Talking from a server perspective, how hard is it to make sushi??? There is no cooking involved!  When we finally got our order, I was very disappointed.  The quality of the fish is very subpar and the portions are very small for the price. 

All in all, the restaurant itself is nice and has a nice ambiance, but the customer service quality of the servers and sushi chefs are waaaaayy below average.  I would not recommend going here!!

Thanks Neal V-G for recommending this place!! Great place to eat before a bachelor party.

5 Star rating for sure, here's why:
Came here after a 3 hour trip from Los Angeles. Arrived around 4pm, with a group of 12. Was seated promptly in the back private room. Drinks were served quickly, left us with a large jug of ice water= awesome. Waiter was very polite and patient with our large group of guys. We all ordered different rolls and shared them. Each roll was delicious. Presentation, taste and size of content to each roll was perfect. I remember getting the Rattle snake, Heart attack, Lobster fare,  shrimp tempura, miso soup, fried scallops, warm saki and calamari. Absolutely no complaints of any item ordered.  Best, made to eat, all you can eat eat (AYCE) sushi joint ever. 

Caution: Do not over order!! Take your time and enjoy each item is my advice. After your first roll you will want to go berzerk and order everything on the menu, trust me just enjoy and order what you can finish. You may feel pressured by the two hour time limit, but don't worry you will have plenty of time and the food is served pretty quickly.
Best Sushi in Vegas! $21 All you can eat lunch, $26 dinner. Clean restaurant with cordial staff.  They offer more rolls that any spot I've been and the quality of fish is top notch.

The sushi is good for an all you can eat. The atmosphere is surprisingly comfortable. Originally I was going to give this place 4 stars, but the extras like rib eye and green tea tiramisu bumped me up to 5. The sushi is not the best, but it's pretty good, all you can eat, and only $26... Excellent value

First time here, and we really enjoyed our experience. The food was delicious, and the service was great. Our server was very helpful, explained the AYCE options, and made several tasty suggestions. We look forward to our next visit!
Great service and wonderful food. All-you-can-eat is a must if you're going in a group. Check out their special menu located behind the bar.

Competition in the Las Vegas AYCE (All You Can Eat) scene is fierce, one of the most recent causalities is Sushi On Rainbow on the Westside of Chinatown.  It's somewhat hard to standout in such a crowded field.  Generally, I like to categorize them in which part of town they are in.

One of my "must go" places have been added in the Southwest section in Las Vegas.

Oyshi Sushi won't have the premium quality sushi, expect the fish to be previously frozen but still is not bad, the rice to fish ratio is more fish than rice, the rolls are not too over sauced, the salmon roe and flying fish eggs to be plentiful.

Customer service is excellent and attentive, they will stop by frequently to check if you want more orders.  Several notes:

They charge for green tea, so don't be surprised to tacked on a few more dollars for this.  The prices are in line with other AYCE restaurants, just a few dollars above $20 for lunch and around $26 for dinner.  Pass on the green tea creme brulee and green tea ice cream, barely any hints of green tea at all.

I'm a fan and a regular but sometimes the service is hit or miss. Sitting at the bar is fine, but a couple of times finding your waiter\waitress when you're sitting at a table is ridiculous.

With that said, AYCE sushi is not as amazing as "regular" sushi places (i.e. Sushi Fever, I love Sushi, Sushi Loca, etc) but Oyshi is always consistent when it comes to quality and quantity. Definitely worth a trip if you're looking for good AYCE sushi.

I like this place not to busy when they open r 11:30am more people started coming in r 12:30pm when we were finally leaving. Great little place and sushi was so good and the service was good also. The green cold tea was OK I have had better. But all in all everything was really good. Going back again soon.

Ever since I can remember, Sushi-Mon (the one on silverado ranch/maryland pkwy) has been my favorite go-to spot. Words couldn't describe how good it is. But I decided to try something new. This place had 270 reviews with an average of four stars. So they must be doing something right.

After one minute of walking the wrong way..we finally got into the entrance..by Following THE ARROWS...

Decor was really nice, bigger than the usual sushi bars. Great Location too. The VIP room and Lounge room was a nice touch. It was slow mind you, during lunch when I walked in with my "friend" Karlee. We started off with, my favorite Ahi Poke and Miso Soup. Karlee had the soup as well and Gyoza. Ahi Poke was ok, but not better than sushi mon, the flavor wasn't just there. Miso was good, not fantastic. Karlee loved the Gyoza, she said it was better than the other Sushi place she goes that serves it. 

I had the J&b roll, baked, with salmon and cream cheese. It was good, juicy, hand a hint of soy sauce. hats off to the sushi chef because it was awesome. I had a cucumber roll, asian strip steak and this deep fried california roll, with hot mustard and albacore tuna. All was great but the J&b roll was the highlight. karlee had 2 orders of the shrimp tempura roll, apparently it was good, I couldn't have any because I am allergic to shrimp. She tried to Force Feed it to me, knowing I was allergic, I think she tried to kill me, because I tried to make fun of her Sirarcha/Hot mayo sauce that she custom made..oh and She had chicken teriyaki and I think another order of Gyoza, apparently she loves that stuff.

 The service was a little slow, especially when they weren't busy. This was all you can eat, and what I was shocked about how they did not serve Half rolls!! I was like WTF? how could I possibly try more than 3 types. Other than that The waitress seemed puzzled and brought us the wrong dishes a couple of times. No big deal. The Food was great, service was so-so, and It is a place I would come back to again. I also ate too much, because I regret not getting desert (no one really gets more than one desert, but why would they limit you to JUST one, its all you can eat!!!), being that it was one of the reasons I came here for, Green Tea Tiramisu, I'm Coming back for you!
All you can eat... Check. Great quality fish... Check. Open for lunch... Bonus! We'll be coming back!

I'm always looking for new late night spots to try in Vegas because I usually eat dinner here around 11 or 12, so I decided to give this one a shot. I especially love a good late night happy hour, but here it's only with the sake, not the food. 
Great service, the chefs were really friendly and always checking to make sure if we needed anything. But the food (in terms of good sushi and authentic Japanese) was mediocre. It's one of those Americanized places where spicy tuna, fried California roll, and yum yum sauce are dominant on the menu and where most of the cut rolls taste the same because its all different variations of the same ingredients. I ordered their white tuna sushi and sunomono salad as well. White tuna was decent and sunomono was something errr else...cucumber was shredded thin, not sliced thin and they put a sesame peanut sauce on it instead of the usual rice vinegar. Let's just say I didn't finish it and I'm one not to waste food unless it's truly unappetizing.
Went with a large party this past week, more than half of us became VERY ill with food poisoning Beware!!!!!!  Never again !!!!

I am a Las Vegas native and a big fan of sushi.

I've seen so many sushi places open and close. Oyshi...is one I would never want to see close its doors.

This is, for the affordable price it offers, the best sushi in town. The salmon sushi is just about the closest thing to edible heaven.

The venue is open and airy. The music is upbeat (don't expect some slow, romantic songs). The staff is friendly and everyone pitches in. I've seen managers roll up their sleeves and help out the servers when it gets busy ---very impressed by that.

Definitely one of the best sushi joints in Vegas. It's really far from my house, but when I happen to be in the mood to make the drive over the only thing I ever dislike is the bill. Not crazy expensive, just not the cheapest place in town. You get what you pay for in this town, it's worth what they charge on the occasions that I do go.

It's pretty decent, not that I had high expectations for it. It's my first time just now because I had heard bad things about it a long time ago (quality of fish mostly). 

There's nothing special, in my opinion, but my friend wanted to come to try one of their desserts (IKR?). 

They only allow you to pick one dessert item (not including unlimited ice cream, though). Another friend stated when they came before they didn't have this restriction. Well, looks like it was just mochi ice cream for me then, which comes only in strawberry, by the way. 

They have some daily specials so check out that list on the way to your table. Fish wasn't as shabby as anticipated so that was a plus. I love salmon nigiri but theirs wasn't too good, actually. So I definitely ate less than usual in that department. 

In terms of hot tea, they charge you $2.50 for the pot at the table so I'm thankful it wasn't $2.50 per person :). 

Overall, it's pretty much a just as expected / average place for me. In this area, it's not my to-go place for ayce sushi but hey, this visit just means I won't say no if another friend wants to eat here. :0)

I often used to come to Oyshi because it's close to my house and it was very delicious. Fish was always fresh and service was always good, but ever since they got popular, everything has down-graded. 

I tried to give them second chances because I used to love this place so much! But lately, their customer service has been way too slow. I get that they're busy, which IMO they need to hire more staffs. My last visit, it took them at least 10 mins to realize that we were standing there waiting to be seated. Then, it took 30 mins for the server to bring us water and miso soup. The owner walks by and doesn't acknowledge us at all. You've got to be fast and efficient, especially a busy place like this, you've got to have more staffs. I will never come back again, even if it's a block away from my house. 

Despite my horrible experience, I still love their Love Affair roll, it's the only roll that doesn't fail to satisfy me.

Been here a few times and I must say, I like it here. We usually get the AYCE. The menu has a good variety and includes dessert. The sushi is decent to good. There's a board with specials as well so don't forget to check that out. 

Oyshi offers the usual Japanese fare from sushi to specialty rolls, appetizers and other small plates. Some of the sushi have options of preparing. ie. you can have your albacore regular, seared, seared with garlic, etc. Same goes for the salmon and yellowtail and a few other fish on the menu. 

I really like the yakitori, baked mussels, sushi options and desserts. 

This location is way off the strip. It's worth a try if you like AYCE. They also accept reservations.
So the place is beautiful, the sushi is nice and all, but... My husband's rolls arrives after 40-50 LONG MINUTES! And he went for the "all you can eat" menu... What's that all about?!

Never disappoints! Absolutely delish! 
The only thing I would change is the price on the kids all you can eat! My daughter is 5 and like most kids don't eat a bunch. Their price is pretty ridiculous for a child. Also ive gone to other places and they offer half roll items. They should too!

Me and Jessie B. wanted to try someplace new so we ended up here. And boy were we glad we did! The service was top notch and the rolls were huge and yummy!!
The price was great as well for lunch..I think it was 21 bucks!
They have a full bar but we came for the sushi.
And I am sure we will be back soon.

The sushi is really good but it is the Hotategai sushi (raw scallop) is what keeps me coming back as a regular and I didn't give this spot five stars only because the waiters can be hit or miss for good service

If I could give this place 0 stars I would!

The worst sushi I've ever had. It was falling apart, it had no flavor and very low quality. Even the hot green tea they brought us was burnt.

Our waitress ignored us and we were only able to order from her twice. We didn't even have water to drink until the end of the meal and we had to ask for it twice from two different waiters. 

I'm hate leaving bad reviews but this place seriously sucked, what a waste of money! NEVER AGAIN!
Friend brought me here after a long wait for luggage at airport..and with the all you can eat menu hit the spot ....  nice service ..

Another AYCE sushi joint in Vegas.  I swear there are one in every two blocks.  Bigger than most, this place is usually busy at night but very chill during earlier hours like  most places.  But when it's busy, it's really busy which leads to service sucking!  But overall the atmosphere inside is pretty good and seats up large group of people which is good for birthday dinners or just a bunch of friends coming from out of town.

All you can eat I believe was $25 for dinner.  I'm just gonna point out what I like and usually order. Baked mussels, dynamite roll, volcano roll, nigiri is not as tasty here, oysters are the best I've had in Vegas but unfortunately only 4 per person so get your friends to order it as well even if they don't eat it so you can have it, surf and turf (highly recommended), and for dessert the fruit parfait. 

This is not a quiet place for dinner so bad idea for a date if you plan on having a meal with a quiet conversation.  People come here often with their kids and big groups of people, which shouldn't surprise you are very loud.  This place is a hit or miss but fortunately I'm patient when it comes to bad service when it's excusable because of how busy this place can be at times.

My favorite sushi spot thus far in Las Vegas! They have this awesome VIP room that can seat 10-12 people with a plasma tv. They offer all you can eat which is my kinda sushi spot! The quality of the sushi is awesome! They offer rib eye steak with shrimp, raw oysters, fresh sweet shrimp (along with the shrimp heads deep fried upon request yummmmm!) and dessert included with the all you can eat! Some times the waiter(s) cant believe how much I order and consume but its because their sushi/food is that bomb!! A must go n enjoy if you live in or even visiting Vegas!!

5 MF stars

ALL YOU CAN EAT for $22 my dude

Great music

Friendly staff

I cannot stress how freaking delicious this place is. My radio co-host from Cake And Sausage brought me here because she knows my heart.

We EASILY ate OVER $100 in sushi, surf n turf, tempura and poke for $22 my guy. Twenty two dollars total!!! It included dessert 

Lobster rolls, BSCR iCant. Just come here

Oyshi Sushi place that I pass by few times and believe might have gone long time ago. Unfortunately nothing really stood out for me or remember wow factor so took longer time too come back. Nowadays in Vegas AYCE sushi is so competitive and dime dozen that it really hard too stand out unless really good. My opinion the sushi is good but not great or definitely no Wow factor for me. The menu has a nice diversity too it between the appetizers (oyster on the half shell by far my favorite), nigiri, and speciality rolls (i had some kind of spicy tuna roll; sorry forget the name but was really good)  too choose from sure find something like. Whenever I go AYCE more all about the nigiri style because feel that the true barometer of quality of the fish. I felt like compare too other places especially my top spot sushi house goyemon not in the same class. The irony was originally went too sushi hour goyemon but the wait was ridiculous. Me and Roy was hunger so decided too check out something new. Thankfully on this night Oyshi Sushi not packed went right in and sat down went sushi crazy!! 

The restaurant is lot more open then most AYCE so usually not lot of waiting too sit down. They do have private rooms for big parties. Not sure if charge extra but nice option too know if party of eight or more. The sushi bar is decent size with two too three sushi chefs going at time. Most part even on say that night half packed we were getting our sushi in timely manner. The server was great keep up on everything and even nice enough towards the end we ordered one too many speciality rolls (thanks Roy) she like no worries no forcing not going too charge us for waste! Think that was really cool! 

I like that the restaurant is open because you can have conversations without screaming with other person sitting next or across from you. Oyshi Sushi is place that come back too again but with so many other ones and not that high on my list. Not sure when next time will be but if in the area and out of options good choice.

1) Ambiance: Modern, busy, high energy with techno/dance music playing.

2) Price: Comparable to most AYCE Sushi Joints $21 Lunch/ $26 Dinner

3) Service: Slow as far as food preparation. Spent nearly 2 hours on AYCE for 2 people. The servers & management were very nice though. Drinks were always refilled and they came around to check up on us often.

4) Food: Some of the things we ordered.

Appetizers-
Baked Green Mussels were good. I could eat 100.
Asian Style Skirt Steak - Came out on a sizzilin' platter & smelled terrific but I wasn't diggin' the taste. Nothing special.

Sushi-
Fish was eh... just ok. Not as fresh.

Favorite Rolls-
Amigo - jalapeno, combination of fish and cream cheese w/ flaming hot chili sauce. Jalepeno-licious!
Love Affair - shrimp tempura roll with yum-yum lobster, crunch flakes. Scrumptious!

5) Overall: Satisfactory. There were a lot of things we wanted to try but were too full. I would give this place another shot.

I went to oyshi for lunch on a Friday and was immediately seated. The ambiance was beautiful.

The food was really good with a wide selection of rolls . I love how the customize what goes on the rolls if you ask . The nigiri was really fresh but I've had better. What really stood out for me was the desserts 

Our server Julia was the bomb ! She was really friendly and answered all of the questions I had . Although she was quite busy , she still kept tabs on us and made sure our drinks were always full and our tables were cleared . 

Oyshi is definately a place you want to check out , from the food to the amazing service.

Oyshi used to be one of my favorite binge eating locales, however the last time I went was an utter letdown. 

What differentiated Oyshi from other "All-you-can-eat" sushi spots was the quality of the fish. What used to be fresh, now looks and tastes old. Basically, all of the nigiri sushi was disgusting; uni being the worst. 

The cooked food is still good (hence two stars instead of one), but its "All-you-can-eat SUSHI", not "All-you-can-eat-tempura-edamame-teriyaki-skewers". 

Would I go back? Probably not. I'd rather spend $5 more and go to a real buffet like the M Resort. At least you know the sushi is going to be sub par there and gravitate towards the other entrees.

The service and food is okay. Although there sushi is always gonna be same amount of fish and rice ratio. The only bad thing about this place is the sushi takes 30 to 40 minutes to come out. I ended up staying here for 2 and half hours because the food took so long to come out. I would rather go to other location which gives better service and food. 

They had already did auto gratuity which I don't mind but they could at least did a better job on taking care of us.

Oyshi is not a fancy smancy sushi restaurant, but  It will definitely please your stomach if you are hungry .Plenty of sushi to choose from and side dishes as well. All time favorite side dish has to be surf and terf which consist of fried steak and shrimp handed it to you still sizzling! One of the best sushi rolls is the love affair because tt has some lobster in it ;). 

Their alcohol prices are reasonable for the portions they serve you. It can be slow at times when its busy, but definitely worth the wait. Every time i go they, it seems like i'm in a club since they play house or clubbing music lol. A great place to go but not in a large group. 

Great place overall :-(D

I have eaten AYCE at Oyshi literally about 30 times. 29 out of 30 of those times the food and service was impeccable (the only minor issue  I had once was a new waiter that mixed up a few of my rolls). The waiter/waitress are fast and attentive, the place does no smell super fishy when you walk in (because the fish is fresh), the actual sushi tastes a notch above most in Vegas,it is super affordable, and they are open late. Everybody I know that has gone there loved it. Oyshi is a must try. It is across town from me now, but it is worth the drive.
This place has the worst hostesses , it is ridiculous how stupid  can be , they should take an IQ test and score at least 10% before they get hired anywhere to deal with people
Probably won't be coming here again. Fish and rolls just weren't that fresh or flavorful. And they don't offer 1/2 rolls.

Best all you can eat sushi I've had! I was SO surprised at their huge selection for all you can eat! Not only are their rolls all you can eat... so are their appetizers :D Although they limit desserts to 1 per customer, I left completely satisfied! 

The restaurant is very clean, and the environment was enjoyable. When I went, we came in a large group so they put us in the side room, so it was a little more difficult to get a hold of the waiter, but they came by often enough to keep taking our orders. 

DEFINITELY will be going back when I'm in vegas!

I had a horrible experience so I may have to revisit this at a later date.  

We sat at the north end of the restaurant with one long table.  There was about 16-20 of us doing all you can eat.  From looking around I didn't think the decor on our end of the restaurant was complete.

The dishes were good.  I'm in love with their oyster dish.  The only problem i had was that what ever we ordered, the food went to a random spot on the table.  We were forced to share.  I have no problems sharing but let me have my cut first especially since I don't like some sushi rolls with certain ingredients in it.  Hence, that's why I don't order the whole menu.  

Food is 4 stars, staff is 4 stars, service is 3 stars, price is 3 stars.  So for now, 3 stars until I revisit!

When I visit Las Vegas, I usually come to Oyshi Sushi for sushi. There is plenty of parking around the center. I did not have to wait long for a party of three (15 minutes wait time). The restaurant is a good size and is able to accommodate large parties. I was quite hungry and decided to do the all you can eat sushi! The price for the all you can eat sushi was definitely a good price! For the all you can eat, you can order anything from the menu! The sweet shrimp and dynamite were my favorites. Also, don't forget to order dessert! There are some limitations on the menu for the quantity of sushi that can be ordered for certain items. Also, the restaurant limits only one dessert per person.  

I'll definitely be coming back here when I visit Vegas again!

Been going here for over a year now, after hearing that it was the LVRJ's editor's choice for Best of Las Vegas. Proximity to home was a big plus, of course!

It will likely remain my favorite, but I was incredibly embarrassed last night when bringing friends from the UK there for dinner after talking the place up so much. The service was WAY off, although the food was still excellent. They recently opened a new location on Sahara, so I'm hoping that this was just a matter of a bunch of trainees not knowing what they were doing (everyone looked new and got orders wrong, not providing place settings until after food was already served, not knowing which tables ordered what food, etc.).

Here's hoping that's all it was. I still suggest everyone give them a chance, as the actual food will not disappoint!
Cajun albacore was delicious! Service a little slow today but friendly staff and good apps, sushi and rolls!
ayce is the best. great flavor. less one star though because 3 times we did ayce, food was really sloooow to come out from the kitchen.

A more classy/upscale sushi restaurant. It is very nice inside and has a great seating arrangement. They have the best appetizer menu out of all of Las Vegas(yakitori, skewers, and rib-eye) and the sushi is very good it is well prepared and presented and the quality of fish is very good and has some of the best specialty rolls too. The servers are very fast and attend to your needs in a orderly manner.

Best AYE sushi place in Vegas!!! Make sure to sit at the bar!!! You can do happy hour and half rolls. The server was great he ordered his favorites for us!!! Come with a big group so you can share....

I come for lunch special. 12 bucks gets you soup,salad,cal roll, tempura plate, and stir fried meat dish (chicken,beef,or shrimp ) with veggies. All freshly prepared. Nicely decorated.  A good deal!  American pop music too loud, would like something a bit more ethnic and softer.  The food and service is 5 star though, so that's what I'll give them.
Amazing food and service! Some of us went for the AYCE and wow! Didn't have to wait long for the food to start coming even though the places was packed. A must bust in Vegas!

No more sushi-mon for me -  ever.  This place has only decent service but very good food. 
No sushi place can be great unless it is by the sea.  We are in the middle of the desert in America, so let's be real; this isn't Japan or Korea.  However, that being said: for Vegas it is pretty good. Not a lot of rool options, but the ones they have are tasty.

I loved this place. The food was excellent and the service was great. I went there with my wife and mother and 3 kids. It was the day after Mother's day since my dear wife had to work on Mother's day.

We loved pretty much every thing that we ordered. Now like all the all you can eat places in Vegas you can order sashimi but only as sushi and they make you eat everything.  Still at 25 dollars a person and 20 for kids it was well worth what we paid.

If there was one negative it was that at such a small place they still added 18% gratuity onto the bill. I would have tipped much more than that if they didn't add it.

We really loved the Lobster Fair and the Las Vegas Roll. Especially the Las Vegas since it didn't have any rice.

I do think that the staff needs better training. Although they were sweet and charming they did mess up a couple of times on the order. But we did order a lot and there were at least 3 people ordering. I guess I wouldn't have done as well as they did.

If you have a  Sushi craving stop here and squash it.  Its like $26 for all you can eat.  You have to finish everything you order, but man we eat so much Sushi I will not need to see Sushi for the rest of the year... Well maybe in a month or 2 I could enjoy some Sushi again.  Eveything tasted great and we all enjoyed it.  A party of 15 and everyone liked the place so I will be back :)
My favorite AYCE sushi joint! The food is served fresh and the workers are friendly and nice! a Must try.

I'm a BIG fan of "All you can eat(AYCE)," when i'm extremely hungry. i've been to hikari and i've always had a BAD tummy ache when i leave that place.  i live on the SW of vegas and always driven past oyshi. "AYCE" sold me. i went online to check the reviews on yelp. i was excited and drove down to the restaurant. 

the ambiance was hip and played house music. i sat at the sushi bar and it was a huge table. everyone was 'nice' when i got there.  i am a petite girl.. 105lbs less.. and i love to eat! i had a minimum of 2hrs to eat. they warned me that if i had leftover rice or sushi, i will be charged.  i was game.  i got there at 8:30pm. ordered my miso soup that they had forgotten 20mintues later.  i must admit the sushi and rolls were delicious. i think once they got the hint that i kept ordering and ordering.. no sushi chefs didn't want to serve me and it was only 1/2 hr into dinner. everytime i wanted to order something, they walked away and pretended not to hear me. i assume they want to stretch the 2hr minimum by not serving me. then i felt like i was begging for food. at this moment, i remain a big smile on face and it turned into a nightmare. everyone was sooooo mean!  they wanted me to leave! whatever i ordered in the kitchen.. the items were for smurfs! asparagus wrapped with beef were the size of chopsticks!  it was 9:30 and the 10th server gave me the check! i was not done eating and haven't gotten to my dessert. i am a polite customer, fun, and spoke to the chefs the entire time. i ask the server if my 2hrs were up and he said the manager gave him the check! WTF??? i ordered my dessert paid my check, gave them a 20% tip for the food and promise i will never come back even if it was for free. 

i was hoping this was going to be a great experience because once i tasted the food, i fell in love with the freshness. nonetheless, i am loyal customer anywhere i step foot in and it would have been sooo convenient. no matter how great the food, if you don't have customer satisfaction, you will never have them coming back!

Sunday night here is pretty packed but people here are very accommodating and friendly. Their AYCE is the bomb!! So my mom and I ordered their Monster, (a little sweet for me), Lobster Fair (omg this is one is freaking good!), Japanese Garlic Lasagna, and many more! However, their Salmon Lover was a little bit so so for us cause the salmon wasn't fresh at all, they used frozen ones. For appetizers, their Seaweed Salad, Ahi Poke, Baked mussels were pretty good. And of course, for dessert, I got some green tea ice cream and their tiramisu too! So yummy! We're definitely looking forward to eat here again besides we just live near here!

The food was good and the price was right.

We ordered my nephew the Ninja meal which came with a house salad, miso soup, half california roll, teriyaki chicken.
For my niece we ordered the Cheesy Katsu meal and that came with a house salad, miso soup, and 3 sauces on the side of katsu sauce, honey mustard, and nacho cheese and a good size of katsu. The kids meals didn't come with rice so we ordered each a bowl on the side.
It was alot of food for just the kids, my boyfriend and I ended up eating the left overs and we were stuffed.. it was definetly worth $6 each for the kids meal excluding the bowls of rice.

My boyfriend had the unagi bowl which was perfect as we both shared 1 big bowl of rice unagi and grilled onions which was Delish, an order of a rainbow roll which was ok, as it didn't have avocado :(  but it still took care of my craving for sushi and a salmon handroll which was ok as I've gone to other resturaunts that pack it with salmon and the slices are big.  

I like oyshi.

We go here when their competitor gets crowded. When we got there we were seated  promptly. The food here have alway been fresh and consistent but this time it wasn't so. Most buffets start out strong then lose its luster over time. This place is getting there.  I noticed my sushi was packed with a lot of rice. I was kinda full upon ordering the second round but that didn't stop me.  Also the sweet shrimp was a little fishy but it didn't cause any havoc to my tummy.  I hope the owner reads this because we really like this place.

I've been here once since moving to Vegas so far and I LOVED it.  Service was great, menu is HUGE especially for all you can eat (AYCE), and the sushi chefs were very nice and welcoming.

I cannot wait to return here again and eat as much as possible.

Hands down my favorite sushi. My wife prefers baked rolls and they have a great selection for her. I like it all and the all you can eat rocks!  Plus there are private rooms for parties. We have held a few larger birthday dinners there with great success!

By far the best sushi we have ever had! Everything was fresh from the sea urchin, salmon belly, to tuna. The service was great to. The waiter (i wish i cpuld remember his name) was very friendly, knowledgeable and attentive. We will definitely come again!

Definitely one of the best sushi places I have ever been. You get a great deal when for the all you can eat. Great service and excellent food. About a 15 minute drive from the strip, but sooooo worth it

My cousin took me here before I left the country and it was delicious!  We ate so much we had a hard time walking out of the place :)  The prices were good and the selection was great.  Everything tasted fresh and they had some good flavors as well.  If you like sushi, you should give this place a try, it is better than anything else that I tried in Vegas while living there.

This is one of the best AYCE sushi joints out there. Their fish is fresh and the portions are right. The sushi is big enough for you to actually taste it, but at a size where you don't get full quickly. My staples at any AYCE sushi joints are eel and avocado handrolls and nigiri. I'm not a big fan of rolls and this place does it for me. They also have additional appetizers that you won't find at typical sushi restaurants. I really like their seaweed salad, which is quite the generous portion. Seaweed salad is expensive and this place does not skimp out. The albacore is especially good at this restaurant. They have these sizzling plates which comes out on fajita wooden plates. I have tried the surf and turf which is really delicious. I would recommend getting one to share with a few friends. The appetizer portions are small, but they do fill you up. Try sharing the appetizers so you can save room for the real stuff. With this said, the best part truly is the dessert. This place by far has the best tasting Creme Brulee I have ever had. The only bad thing is that dessert is not all you can eat, it's only one per person. Make sure you leave room for dessert because you do not want to miss out. I have been here twice and will definitely come back the next time I'm in town. The service has been great during both of my visits. The food is usually out at the right time and you never have to wait too long for your orders. The waiters are also really sweet. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE!!

Love this place! Tried many different sushi places and no other has come close to the perfection of this place. Can be a really long wait, but well worth it. Only complaints are that club/techno music is always playing and that your clothes tends to smell like smoke. Favorite rolls are the lobster fair, atomic bomb, Kami-kaze, coco, Japanese garlic lasagna, and the Nyi roll. To go ordering is a simply easier way to go to avoid the crowds. Like to end the meal with the ever tasty berry parfait. Customer service is always friendly with a smile.

Update: I visited the Rainbow location last night at 12:50am with some friends. (They close at 2am) We were told they were closing early because they were slow and they took last call at 12:45am. I questioned the guy and mentioned that their hours say 2am. My friends drove 45 minutes specifically to go to Oyshi! He said they decided to close early and we couldn't eat. I even mentioned that we knew exactly what we wanted, since their "last call" was 5 minutes earlier. He was not very friendly! 

During the time we were standing outside deciding where to go, more people came and got very upset. That's at least 9 people they turned away! If your hours are until 2am, you should be open until 2am. From what I saw, they lost enough business to make it worth being open until the normal time. Next time we are going to eat, Oyshi will not even be an option unless it's early in the evening. When businesses aren't reliable, you're not gonna go out of your way to visit! Or tell others to visit at all! My review went from 5 stars down to 2. This isn't the first issue I've had at this location! Customer service is everything. 

As far as the food...

My friend told me about this place and their All You Can Eat sushi but I wasn't too sure about going because I only like one kind of roll. When we decided to go, I asked her if they had a regular menu because I wouldn't be able to eat that much sushi to justify All You Can Eat. When we arrived I was shocked that their all you can eat menu included appetizers, sushi, and dessert! This was perfect!

My friend and I both ordered the Love Affair roll which is shrimp tempura roll with yum-yum lobster, crunch flakes and masago on top. (no eel sauce for me) It was delicious!!! We also ordered....

Gyoza- nothing special but yummy!

Surf & Turf Platter- all the platters are small, so you can easily order two. The steak is pretty good and the shrimp was amazing. (I am very picky when it comes to shrimp)

Ebi- the best I've ever had. 

Teriyaki chicken- yummy

I absolutely love this place! I love variety without spending a fortune AND they are open late. (Well they are when they DECIDE to stay open) 

Price: 
$22 for lunch
$27 for dinner

This is my favorite AYCE!  Service is good, nice environment, and good food!

Just be patient if you're going with a big group.  ;)

This is my favorite sushi place in town. We eat here (and order to go) very frequently. They have really fresh fish and some interesting combinations. My favorite roll is the screaming roll, with shrimp tempura, cajun albacore, avocado and ponzu sauce. Yum! Their dinners are great, like the sukiyaki, rib-eye teriyaki and asian style skirt steak. Also love their appetizers, like popcorn scallops and calamari tempura.
Best AYCE Sushi in town. Try their berry parfait for dessert!

Very disappointed ! We came here with family since my brother highly recommend this place. We were a group of 12 and had to wait because the place is packed on a Saturday night. Almost an hour had passed and they said it will be ready in 10-15 mins. Then came a group of 11 who came and were seated right away. I don't know if they had reservation but we just felt ignored the whole time. So I asked the receptionist that why is it taking too long? And she said that we are a big group blah blah blah. My dad was really upset and confronted the manager and the manager "Kevin" said if you continue to complain then the more you are going to wait. That made me really furious because nobody should disrespect anyone no matter what. So I told him to cancel it and the manager said "Good!" 

I don't know if this manager had restaurant etiquette but even if people had high praise about your food but the service sucks it doesn't make you of a good place! I'm not sure if he owns the place but if there is a bigger boss he should not be working in a restaurant since he doesn't respect the customers and honestly we felt discriminated. 

I've never felt so bad like this because it involved my family and it was suppose to be a nice dinner to wrap up our vacation in Vegas. I just hope this would be the last time they are doing this to anyone because it's a waste since my brother said its one of the best in Vegas. And to Kevin the Manager, one of your job Is to respect your customers the food just comes second your service is more important just in case you never knew that !

We get into Vegas Friday evening, checked in, and began our weekend off with a night of debauchery.

Food porn at Oyshi. Yessiree, four hungry men and a AYCE Japanese food? This is gonna get ugly fast, real fast. We get there and it's packed. A nice waiter greeted us and told us it might be a while. 20 minutes. Shit, thats it? His reaction made it seem like an hour or 2. Dude! We'll wait. 

The restaurant is nicely designed with modern furnishings. Its set to look very relaxing like a lounge. Like Gerald S pointed out, it's not set up well if there's large groups. The good side is that it doesn't feel overcrowded. 

The AYCE is probably the best and only way to go here. There are so many items to choose from and the quality was not as bad as I thought it would be. They do limit the expensive stuff like uni, amaebi, and raw oysters, but it was well worth it. The sushi was very well made and fresh. Their sushi cuts are very generous. They hardly give any rice, so it was perfect. Everything was awesome, from the salmon, tempura, ribeye, and unlimited green tea or vanilla ice cream!!! 

Like hawks, we swooped down and attacked everything. Nothing was safe. We washed it all down with hot house sake ($7). For $25, I would do it over, and over, and over, and over, *deep breath*, and over again. The food came out slow, it was expected because they  had a full house. The service was simply awesome. If it's a Friday or Saturday, give them a call to make reservations. We left hurting and sat in our car like beached whales. 

You may have defeated us Oyshi, but we'll be back. Back with bigger and hungrier guys. *waives fist*

This place was initially introduced and highly recommended to us by a friendly bartender from the Silverton Casino.  He informed us that this place was a spin-off of Sushi Factory (in Las Vegas).  It's a bit out of the way from "The Strip", but if you have the time it's well worth it.  Anyway, after a horrible experience at Sushi Factory (see my review) several months ago, my buddies and I decided to give Oyshi a go.  We couldn't have been any happier with our visit to Oyshi.  Our server (Justin) was very friendly, helpful, and accommodating.  As for the food, the sashimi was fresh, the rolls were tasty, the ambiance was comfortable, simple and modern.  By the way, the Ama ebi (sweet shrimp) and Uni (sea urchin) were both very fresh and delicious.  However, I was bummed that each customer was limited to one order of Ama ebi and Uni per customer.  But being that both are very expensive items, one can understand.  If you're looking for a great, affordable sushi dinner in the Las Vegas area, look no further than Oyshi.  I hope they keep up the good service, and not falter like that of Sushi Factory.

This place is probably one of my favorite sushi restaurants.  It has a spectacular AYCE menu with tons of appetizers and rolls to choose from.  My favorite appetizer is the surf and turf.  My favorite rolls consist of the Red Rock, Volcano, and Rainbow.  You can order half portions here, so that way you can choose to sample several rolls, or just stick to a couple full rolls.  There is almost always a wait, but it's well worth it.  The staff is super friendly and I have never dealt with poor customer service any of the times I have dined there.  The couple times I have sat at the bar have been great experiences too - the chefs are all nice.

It's in a great location, but I have driven past it a couple times without realizing it. Really, I have nothing but positive things to say!

Love affair baked roll my favorite as well as Asian skirt sizzling plate. All you can eat is $26 and it is all delish. Don't forget you can order appetizers and dessert with all you can eat! Oh and large cold saki is enormous! Good for a few people

This place used to be good with good service and atmosphere. Now, hands down the WORST thing about Oyshi is the SERVICE. We have given this place multiple chances thinking something would change, but it just keeps getting worse. Unless you speak the language there, they don't care about your service. It's so frustrating to be sitting there for 30min, with nothing but a drink, and seeing so many others (who even come in after you) get served their food. Never again is this place worth our time or money. Definitely DO NOT recommend Oyshi if you're looking for good food or even relatively descent service

Oyshi has a delicious and extensive ayce menu, there is no doubt about that. Many of the items are interesting and full of flavor. Some of my favorite items are the Love Affair and Japanese Lasagna rolls as well as the beef wrapped asparagus and sizzling ribeye. The quality and creativity of their menu items deserves praise. For example, the cucumber salad isn't the typical you would get at another sushi spot, they have a peanuty sauce laid on top that really individualizes it from the standard version of the dish. All that being said, I still would not say that dinner there should be several dollars higher than other ayce sushi places. 

First of all, the service at Oyshi stinks, to put it plainly. Don't get me wrong, the staff is pleasant and at times can even be friendly. However, the food just comes out way too slowly. Other sushi restaurants really leave Oyshi crying in the dust when it comes to this. On top of that, they definitely pull the "always filling up your drink" technique to get us full. This just doesn't give your party a lot of room to appreciate all of the items they offer simply because your appetite duration can only hold out for so long.

Secondly, the dessert choices are outstanding, BUT you are limited to one special dessert! Their desserts are the best I've seen so far at a sushi place, but oh my goodness, for $26 dinners, I personally think we should be allowed to try them all one time each, at the very least! I am in love with the green tea tiramisu and the green tea crème brûlée. The fruit parfait is also very tasty, anything but disappointing.

For these reasons, I award Oyshi three stars. Their food makes them a great establishment, but I strongly feel they need cater better to the customers.

This is one of our go to sushi places because it's close to our house, but also because their AYCE sushi is excellent.  The fish is very fresh and flavorful, except the oysters, which I thought were a little bland.  Lately we've had to wait about 20 minutes to get seated, so this place is definitely gaining in popularity.  The menu has changed somewhat in the past year and now they have more appetizers and dessert, which is definitely a plus!  However you can only order one of the special desserts but you can have all the ice cream you want.  The rolls are solid and the uni has been fresh every time we've visited.
We eat here a few times a month.  My faves are Double Screaming and Salmon Lover.  Sushi chefs always super friendly. I would highly recommend!

5 stars for the interior decorations.  This place is very upscale and the ambiance is nice, great vibe for a date night.

2 stars for fish quality.  I ordered a few different nigiri: salmon, halibut, red snapper, yellowtail, and scallops.

First of all, the fish to rice ratio was 1:1.5.  I am not sure how most people like their sushi, but I tend to I like my sushi a little more meaty and less rice-y.  Everyone has their own opinion on this, which I understand.  The salmon was alright, but I didn't get the "melt-in-your-mouth" sensation.  I'm not sure if I came on an "off" night, or if the fish just wasn't fresh this time.

I guess I expected more for a nice-looking restaurant, but I will definitely try it again next time I am in the area.

Great service, fresh food. Our party ordered all you can eat. The atmosphere is great here and the restaurant is very clean. The food was better than other sushi restaurants in town. The service was quick and the staff was friendly. Will definitely be coming back soon

I have been here about 10 times, everytime except my last visit has been 5 stars ayce sushi with 3 star service.  The lasttime I went may be my last though.  When in the bathroom I saw a server use the toilet and NOT WASH HIS HANDS, I was beyond disgusted and just flat out left...  GROSS.  Sucks cause this was always my go to sushi spot in Vegas!  Just thought others should know what I saw.

Pretty good sushi at a fair price.  We did not do the AYCE option, but ordered 4 different rolls, a (huge) house salad, and a soft drink for around $30.  Service was slow but the food was good and it was a nice meal out.

I'm not too sure I agree with the bad service comment people have mentioned, but then again maybe they've stepped up their game since then....But I experienced great service and the sushi was the best I have had since moving here from SoCal. Plus the price was pretty decent for all you can eat. Make reservations on weekends though as there may be a long wait.

Celebrated a birthday here the other night.  The AYCE is a definite plus especially since we are all sushi lovers. We visit this place a lot since its close to our house. We had made a reservation since we were a large party, so we were sat right away even though there were people waiting outside.

Sushi was pretty good, no complaints. Definitely love the yellowtail with ponzi, garlic tuna and uni. Tried the tiger roll this trip and loved it. 

The service was the only pitfall. Like I said we have been here quite a few times and the service was never amongst the best but this night was especially unfortunate. The service was extremly slow, it took about 30 minutes to get our second round of sushi and we had to keep asking our runner/busser to find our server.  The server was super nice and polite but i think they were just understaffed and not prepared for how busy the restaurant was that night.

It's not my absolute favorite sushi or AYCE sushi restaurant, but it's good and the location is wonderful. If there's an AYCE option at a sushi restaurant, I always order it because the price equals 2-3 specialty rolls. It just doesn't make sense any other way. Besides specialty rolls, I like hand rolls (tuna, salmon, yellowtail) and certain appetizers depending on my mood. I wasn't impressed with their hand rolls and although their specialty rolls are good, they're not amazing either (I've had better counterparts at other AYCE restaurants). I really like their DOUBLE SCREAMING ROLL (without cream cheese) because the special sauce makes it unique. Their desserts are really good too. I like that they offer a PARFAIT that features ice cream, fresh assorted berries, and granola. Very good. On my most recent trip, I found out I could get Green Tea ice cream rather than Vanilla and it was even more amazing. The service is good and the food is usually quick. The only thing I really hate is the restaurant's lack of appropriate venting, so you end up leaving the place smelling like the inside of a fryer.

Would have given a 5 star but the service was a bit lacking. However, the food made up for it. Went to lunch there with our staff and the menu was wonderful. I ordered the lunch special sizzling plate with chicken teriyaki and it came with miso soup, salad, tempura shrimp and vegetables, and California roll with the entrée. It was a boat load of food for $10. I had to take a portion home. BTW: the green tea ice cream is also a screaming deal for two scoops $2.50. Great food but I should caution you to go early for lunch because you will wait for a good fair amount of time. I will definitely be back to give the service another chance.

This place is GREAT! Food is awesome, I'd recommend sitting at the bar if the offer is available because this place gets pretty busy on a Saturday night. 

The nice thing about the Sushi bar is the counter space is a lot wider than most sushi spots, this gives you a lot of space for all your AYCE plates ;)

My favorites, Yellowtail Trio and Love Affair roll. The Love Affair roll is full of so much flavor thanks to the mixture of the scallops and crab mix, the crispies add the texture that makes each bite easier to chew.

I love this place. 2 blocks from my house. I would give 5 stars, but the waitress must have been new cause I have to keep asking for stuff.  Can I get a lunch menu? Can I get wasabi with my sushi? Lol. How u forget that?  I still love the food. This was the first time the severs was ok, not great.

Wow, our food took 25 minutes in between each dish.  Don't know if this is a gimmick they use for all u can eat so people can get mad n leave n don't eat lots of their food.  I'm not coming again.  Good or not, it was a waste of my time sitting and waiting for food.

They served good quality fish, but they used waaaay to much rice.  And the sushi man must have had a bad day because the rice was kind of dry and was hard to swallow.  
I asked them to reduce the amount of rice and they said that is standard for all-you-can-eat (hardly, ive been to many and only one other serves that much rice Kobe - right up the block, read my review of that one!).

The worst place ever my family and I went for sushi there and 3 out of the 5 of us got food poisoning so bad that I missed work for 2 days. It Was horrible and when I called in to let them know that something may have been wrong there food the manager told me well that's too bad and hung up on me 

I would never go here again and unfortunately prob turned off sushi for a while 

The service was horrible and then the food I have heard bad things from others as well and some swear by it that they would never go there again. I guess it's a hit and miss situation with this sushi place

Went here the other day and was the only patron on the right side of the sushi bar. Had already ordered and asked if they could switch the TV from ESPN to World Cup and was told they wouldn't switch it because they don't like soccer. Thought he was joking and asked again and he confirmed they wouldn't change TV due to not liking soccer. Spoke to the "manager" and told her that was the worst customer service I've ever heard and barely got an apology. Got a 10% discount lol. Never going there again.

I simply cannot believe in all the times I've come here I've never checked or written a review, that being said this is long overdue. We literally eat here nearly every week. Our 3 young sons have great taste & lobs family sushi night! Their Cajun albacore is fresh & has the perfect spice to it and we seriously can't get enough of it! My favorite are the Double Screaming O & Tiger rolls, but also enjoy the Love Affair, Oh My Heart & The Kamakzi! We used to always eat the Spicy Tuna Crunch but stopped only because we try to avoid eating deep fried food all together. It's worth a cheat though! Dynamite Roll is another! Quite honestly, there's not much here that we've tried that we haven't absolutely loved. The hot tea is the perfect end to your meal with the dessert options included with the AYCE! Crime brûlée (my only complaint is they keep downsizing it, it's become about 2 bite dessert...maybe it's a 100 calorie choice) the green tea tiramisu is my current favorite!! Whatever you do, get AYCE & start trying different rolls. You won't be disappointed.  And finally the chefs & wait staff...what can I say, they're phenomenal!

Generally, I wouldn't recommend a place if I wanted to keep it a secret. I would say something like, the place sucks and not to go there. I thought about it, but then then it might backfire and the place closes down. Therefore...

Yes, I am a big fan. I'm not the biggest sushi lover as some people are, but when it's good, it's good. I do believe I've had a wide enough sample of restaurants to know the difference. This place is definitely a place I would recommend. 

The place is cool, kind of a drive from the strip, middle of nowhere strip mall with tumble weed crossings, inside is not TOO fancy, and not TOO much the other kind. But really you don't need to care much, as long as it's clean.

The place is all you can eat, not all you can pay for. More like... You can eat all, for one set price (within two hours). Three of the four pages of the menu are all included for that price. And let me tell you, they had every roll I've ever seen or heard of along with many many more that I haven't. But there are also all the wonderful appetizers like the Rib Eye and Shrimp called "Surf and Turf" tucked all the way on the last page at the very end. Ya we ordered about 8 of those. That alone, would probably be worth the price. 

Between the seven of us we ordered more sushi than I could ever imagine. But it wasn't so much about the quantity but the quality was just as impressive. Of the different rolls I did try. I had, not one complaint. They were as good as I've had at any other Sushi restaurant. I'd go into the names and ingredients of the rolls but if you love sushi, and even if you don't just imagine the ones you like and it's probably on the menu.

Service was pretty good considering how many people were eating all you can eat sushi in the restaurant. I really did expect the sushi to come out one every half hour. But I didn't even notice any wait between drinks, appetizers, sushi, more sushi, more appetizers and finally dessert. In fact, upon ordering an extra Miso soup, It seemed like it got to the table before I finished ordering it. They were that fast.

Eating good food releases endorphins in your brain. A good sign that you just had a good meal with good friends is how much everyone is laughing at the end. And there was plenty of that to be had for everyone. The only reason Its not 5 stars, is because I've had some really good Sushi, but I can't order it here because it's usually a Chef Special at the other places.

By the way, this place sucks.

I just love it when AYCE sushi places not only serve sushi but all the different tapas style appetizers! Dinner is priced at $26.95.

Service is usually very good. Last time I went, had to wait 20 mins for a table (it was a little busy) and the waiter did not come around as much as I had hoped for. Our water and teas were never refilled without asking. But the other times I have gone prior, service was fine.

When it comes to sushi at Oyshi, ah, I've had better. Their spicy tuna for me was too mushy. I like spicy tuna when the tuna is cut into chucks then mixed with the spicy mayo. So, I was quite disappointed with that. The salmon nigiri was fresh and quite tasty though. I try to stay away from the rolls because they are huge, will become quite full from one roll. 

Whenever I find myself at Oyshi, I tend to order a few nigiris then I ransack the appetizer menu! lol. I love the steak. It comes out sizziling on top cabbage and onions. They also have, shrimp/vegetable tempura, bacon wrapped asparagus, scallop poppers, oysters, agedashi tofu, etc.

Oyshi used to be a favorite of mine for AYCE sushi, but after discovering Island Sushi... I don't know if I will be back to Oyshi.

Oyshi is awesome. The food is amazing. Love the fact that the menu includes steaks. The waiters are fun and easy to talk to and I always have a good experience with them. They made my birthday really fun.

Thank you sweet tiny six pound infant baby Jesus! I have been on the hunt for a great sushi spot ever since a horrible experience at my previous spot. Oyshi did not disappoint today. the AYCE menu is extensive. The only bad thing I have to say about Oyshi is the music selection, you will need glow sticks to enjoy it.

Dude, seriously. All you can eat everything. Anything on the menu except sashimi is fair game. 

If you go here and don't think it's the bomb, we can't be friends anymore.

My Dad, Uncle and I came here at the recommendation of my brother-in-law. It did not disappoint. We had to wait a while to get a seat at the bar. There's also rooms around the main dining area that look like they're available to reserve. 

The decor is pretty Neo-Far East trendy. Between that and the music, it comes across as a pretty hip, young place. This is not the place to go if you're looking for a quiet, traditional Japanese style sushi experience.

Where should I start?? My Fiance was craving oysters and we wanted to stay close to home! I yelped oysters and OYSHI popped up with 4 stars so we decided to give this place a try! I'm a huge fan of Japanese food and oysters and let me tell you this was the most DISGUSTING food I've ever tasted in my life! 

1.  When we first walked in this place was bz, good music but it was a scorching 100 dg in there! Even the waiters were sweating and fanning themselves.

2. The Oysters were room temperature and very fishy! FYI oysters should be left on ice until serving so it stays fresh and cold!

3. We ordered the basic yellowtail, salmon, tuna & sweet shrimp nigiri! Omg it was absolutely sickening!!!! Talk about grocery store sushi!!! It's worse!!!! The color of each fish looked washed out ESP the yellowtail it looked like someone had soaked it and rung it out like a wash cloth!!!!

4. Also got the ahi poki. WTF was that!!??? A few diced pieces of dried out tuna on a bed of seaweed salad cucumber and onions??? 

Omg I'm burping up the disgusting fishy Oder from that food as I'm writing this review! I am about to hurl!!!!!  Worse of all now we even smell like the restaurant because of the horrible ventilation!!!! 
In closing I will definitely never go back nor would I ever recommend this place to anyone!!!!!!!!! 
FYI I had to take a 10 min break because I just threw up everything I ate! I've never threw up b4 in my life!

Hip and trendy. Probably the most attentive service I had in a long time! 
The server constantly asked us if we needed anything and made sure our glasses were filled with water. 
The place is clean, aesthetically pleasing. 
They have an all you can eat deal for 20 bucks for lunch..but I decided to go with a la carte. I ordered the Chirashi bowl hoping to fill my craving of when I get the Korean version called Hweh do bap. 
The rice had too much vinegar flavoring, the sashimi wasn't cut thin enough and didn't taste too fresh at that. 
My search is still on for THE BEST SUSHI in town.

Our go-to place for ayce sushi!!! Best place ever...

Picture says it all so you've got to try it out. Almost all special family occasion is an oyshi ayce night for us!
Love love love! This place is the best, large assortment of rolls and so many options so other menu items that are included in the all you can eat.

I absolutely loved my experience here! 
I was reading the other reviews that had bad ratings and most of it came from bad service and about waiting too long. Well first of all, you gotta come early! You can't just be walkin in like you own the place. If it's busy don't expect to be waited on hand a foot. C'mon give these guys a break! They do their best to accommodate the guest they have. I mean, would you be able to handle 6-8 parties yourself? (Unless you're and server than ok. Haha) But nonetheless, they continuously checked up on us and I think that's all we can ask for. 

I'm gonna keep this short and sweet. Besides the outstanding service, if you love sushi, Just come here. It's sooo good and During lunch too cause it's cheaper! Hahah Enjoy!
Went back in October, still outstanding food and service, and  you can not beat the all you can eat price or wide variety of ordering options.

My boyfriend and I decided to try this new sushi restaurant on Sunday for dinner since it was just opened right by our apartment. The sign "All You Can Eat" really lured us in. As we walked in, we immediately noticed the decor and thought it was so modern and clean. The place looked very inviting and the hip "ultra lounge" type music was cool, too. We sat at the sushi bar and opted for the all you can eat for $26 each. The menu had several good choices and all the food items, excluding sashimi, was included on the all you can eat. The quality and portions were pretty good too. We made sure we got our money's worth..and we did!  And they serve redbean ice cream as one of the dessert options. I would totally recommend this place if you want to try a new sushi restaurant in the Southwest part of Las Vegas. Great date night place, hint..hint to all you guys wanting to impress a girl.

A little more pricey than most other sushi bars, but the music and atmosphere is great! One of the more trendier sushi spots on the SW. Happy hour specials on fri and sat from 12 - 2am. Good spot to take a date!!

I love this place beyond love. We eat here every time we are in Vegas. I wish I could box them up and take them back with us to NC. I love all the rolls but my all time favorite roll is the Love Affair. The crunchy topping with the sauce is absolutely amazing. When we lived here we ate here almost every single week. I highly recommend everyone eat here. The all you can eat is the best deal in town by far. It's off the strip always but TRUST ME it's worth it!!!

While the place is nice and close to home, I was not a huge fan of the sushi. I always start with spicy tuna before pointing to a handful of other rolls on the menu. While I of course ate the spicy tuna I thought I may have ordered "sweet tuna". Because of this I only ordered one more roll (shrimp tempura) and that didn't have a wow factor either. Reasonably priced, nice location in southwest area, but nothing to rave about.

The rolls were delicious. Their appetizers such as ribeye steak, chicken teriyaki, shrimp and vegetable tempura, oysters, and green mussels are a must try especially when you're doing all you can eat. The service was superb. The ambiance ok.

Regardless of what the others have been rating this place, I can honestly rate it a good 5 stars! Our first time going because the other place we usually go to; Sumo Sushi 2, which now closes earlier than usual. Tonight, we have ordered the Spicy Tuna, Love Affair, Lobster Fair, and the Vegas Lasagna, let me tell you it was AWESOME ... Absolutely enjoyed ourselves, great customer service, just real nice. It is more of a social sushi spot rather than the one we are used to; which is a more private one, but it was good! It is small, but very comfortable! Highly recommended and enjoyable ..

Let me start of by saying that my hubby and I use to come here often until we moved closer to the other Oyshi location on Sahara (which btw is awesome). I was shocked at how much the service has changed since we last came. The hubby and I came for ayce dinner and were seated right away since we came at a good time. That was about all that was good about our time there. After being seated the waiter took our drink order and brought us our drinks. We then placed our order for 3 sushi rolls. 30 min later we left without getting any of the rolls. This is why. The table across from us who came in about 10 min received a ton of food both sushi and cooked food from the kitchen promptly after ordering while we received nothing. Our waiter kept on telling us our food was coming over and over again but NOTHING EVER CAME!! Sad really! Never coming back to this location again and DO NOT recommend this place at all!! Service is horrible and can not even tell you if the food here is still good. Really wish I could just give this location no stars!

Omfg!   Everything from the wasabi to the rolls was FANTASTIC.   The sizes are cut appropriately small so you can thoroughly enjoy an AYCE experience.   Definitely will come here again on date nite with my wife.

I'm a huge fan of Oyshi as it is just minutes from my house. There is definitely something to be said about convenience! That said, the sushi is pretty damn good here as well. Much better than other AYCE (all-you-can-eat) places in town. Though I do argue with my friend about what's better between Oyshi and Sushi-mon so I'd call it a coin flip.

The only reason I didn't give Oyshi 5 starts is because of the service. Every once in a while you'll find yourself wanting to order sushi for 10 minutes or more because you haven't seen your server. Simple solution for this is to sit at the sushi bar. Nothing I would knock it down to 3 stars for because overall is still great sushi and a good experience!

There's no other food out there that I can say that I could every single day.  With as much sushi choices as there are, who can ever get tired of eating it?! Seriously. When I first discovered this place, I was so enamored by their flavor and service, that I told every single person looking for a good place to eat, local or tourist, that they HAVE to go to Oyshi Sushi and get AYCE!

I'm a big fan of nigiri and I highly recommend their nigiri because the ratio of fish to rice is 80-20. The fish they use is very fresh and they use a huge slice! OMG! My top list of nigiri: Cajun albacore, salmon, and eel! Have to have it every time.  Also highly recommended: Love Affair, Salmon Lover, Sunrise, and Red Dragon.  Their appetizers are awesome as well, but the ones that stick out the most that some sushi bars don't have are: Surf & Turf, Potato Croquette, grilled beef asparagus, and the Unagi (eel) bowl! Mmmmm!

They also do dinner reservations if you have a large party coming. They have VIP rooms that can accommodate large parties if you call ahead.  I've sat in their VIP rooms and their chairs are extra comfortable. The dining area near the entrance has a huge mural that gives this place it's feel and vibe. If you speak to the sushi chefs, they're pretty funny too! And if you're cool with waiting a little bit to be seated, get your Oyshi on!

Over the top service and very cool atmosphere!  

I had a Volcano Roll and Love Affair roll.  Both my wife and I absolutely loved!  Best Sushi we have ever had in Vegas.  And we live here.
I ate there on 4th of July and got food poisoning. I felt it was weird since the fish wasn't really cold. But now I'm spending my 4th of July on the toliet. I'm never coming back to this place.

Used to be my favorite AYCE sushi place. They have really good rolls here. My favorites include Tiger roll and Lobster Fair roll. So delicious!

I would say...better than Kaya (Spring Mtn & Arville) worse than Goyemon (Hacienda and Decatur?)

Been here couple times when visiting Vegas. $22 lunch special for all you can eat sushi?! Worth it. Market price on sushi can add up so this all you can eat deal is the best deal you can get so I would suggest not getting ala carte if you're a big eater on sushi. Two rolls will already set you above the all you can eat price so you might as well get the AYCE deal! I've tried several of their signature rolls such as Oh my heart, Pink lady roll, Dynamite roll and Rock & Roll. All good! Be sure you don't order with you eyes because there's a policy that you have to eat everything. Always best when shared with others, don't all order the same thing. Try a little bit of everything. I always make my money's worth it with orders of shrimp tempura. It's a must whenever I come here. You also get a free dessert with your meal as well. I love the creme brulee, soooo delish! I always leave here with a feeling like a I gained 10 pounds.
Sushi is always fresh always good service. Love the vibe this spot has. I love how they're open late.
Another great AYCE experience today at Oyshi for Mother's Day!!! I made reservations for noon and was seated where we requested immediately.

I love this place!  Yes the wait times can get crazy, but that's because they're in high demand.  Here are some tips: get there before 6pm if you don't want a long wait, and if you are eating AYCE, go ahead and order the next round when they drop the first (don't wait until you're done eating or you'll be waiting awhile).  Also, you can't go wrong with the Ian Special!

Talk about #yummy sushi this place is really good. We dropped in on a Friday afternoon for lunch...all you can eat of course.

It was actually pretty busy for 2PM. Still the sushi was fresh and the service was impeccable!  We never waited more than 7 mins for our next round of sushi orders. We sat at the bar and I think our chef was listening to our discussions over which rolls to get lol by the time we put in our order he was sliding 2 rolls to us!!

Our favorites were the: Snow Mountain, Love Affair, Lobster Affair, Chung Hua and Sibuya. We tried maybe 11 different rolls, poke and nigri.

Awesome place! !!

Very good service and selections. Steak, pork belly and oysters ( dinner only ) are available with AYCE.
Nice ambiance and not much noise. 



I'll continue to visit.

We arrived before the crowd and had a wonderful experience.  As we were leaving, the place was filling up and service was starting to slow down so i would suggest that the ideal time for eating at Oyshi is not during the rush.

The sushi was good, the price was good and at the time we went, service was very good!

Update:
We've returned several more times and the food is consistently good but the service has been hit or miss...more miss than hit.  Downgraded to 3 out of 5 for this reason.

I have been coming here for years...unfortunately a good place is not so good anymore. Went to dinner had the all you can eat. The Gyoza n shrimp tempura were good bc you can't mess up fried stuff. The ribeye app was tasteless n not even sizzling when it came out. The sushi was sooo disappointing. Not fresh at all.....The sushi rice was obviously pre-made (main inside rolls w/ the crab n sushi rice that comes under the fish) meaning that they mass produce the main parts of the sushi- refrigerate it and then just added the fish and toppings after the fact. The rice was sooo cold that when you were eating it, it felt like you were eating ice cream with warm sushi toppings. I know this place is busy but when a place moves in that direction to get people in n out not good;( 
Very sad that this restaurant is cutting corners like that, especially with sushi. I rather go to an a la carte place and get my sushi made and rolled fresh.
AYCE dinner for $26, best price! Fresh fish, which is rare in a desert environment; good portions, lots to go around the table. Smooth sake. Friendly, quick service. All around good eats!

Had dinner here tonight around 6:15. There was quite a line of people but we got seated within 20 minutes, which was great.

First of all, walking inside the restaurant, there was a strong scent of frying oil. I assume the ventilation inside is not strong enough. I've been to KFC and Popeyes without smelling that much oil frying.

We told the hostess our party had 4 people, when she walked us to the table, she took away a setting and set the table for 3, I didn't understand why she did that. So we asked a server to get us another setting, I'm not sure if he didn't hear us or if he was confused because we had to point out what a "table setting" was before he went to get it.

We didn't do the AYCE, just a few menu items:
Unagi & Avocado Roll:
The sushi roll was made badly, the rice was falling apart and there was a lot of avocado, barely any eel and smothered in way too much sauce.
Donburi:
Donburi is a combo of thin sliced beef (that is NOT all lean meat), egg, onions over rice with sauce in it. The one we got was dry, barely any sauce until you hit way bottom. The beef used was all lean and definitely not thinly sliced.
Kids Popcorn Chicken & Teriyaki Chicken meals:
The popcorn chicken was overcooked. They definitely fried it for too long. It was dry and some pieces had a burnt taste. My son ate a few pieces and said he didn't like it. The Teriyaki chicken was also overcooked. The chicken was hard to chew.

Service:
We saw a lot of servers walking around, but it didn't look like they were doing anything productive. Only the manager (we assume, he was well dressed not in server type uniform) came by multiple times to see if our table was doing OK. Otherwise, the server would come by drop off food and disappear before we can even ask for anything.

Maybe, we'll give it another try in the future, but for now, it was not the dinner we expected to have.

The sushi is awesome but this update is mostly for the service:

unfortunately, i did not catch our servers names but.... everytime I go, he's usually there.

Both servers were incredibly nice and despite it being close to closing time, they were very upbeat! We didn't finish all the sushi for all you can eat but they allowed us to take it home. We just had to pay for another roll. Not a bad deal!
Was here on a Tuesday it was kinda busy but nothing crazy. Service seems like it went downhill. I have been here before but never checked in.

Where do I begin? It was a Tuesday night and the restaurant looked busy. My group of 12 had one of their private rooms. The biggest stink about this experience is the service. They took my drink order 3 times and all I asked was for some water. I asked them to bring out a birthday cake after we were finished eating. One server came in and told me that he would clear out the dirty dishes before coming out with the cake which he didn't do. I had to get up and ask for extra dishes and forks from the hostess desk. They brought out the cake without lighting the candles that were provided and the cake still in the box. The food quality was not very good. The steak teriyaki meat crumbled in my mouth which basically meant that the meat wasn't fresh but frozen. I won't be coming back since there is so many better japanese spots in town.

Service was good. Clean inside. Went in for AYCE sushi it was very disappointing. The rice tasted at least two days old. The fish itself was somewhat ok. Complete waste of my time and money. Will never return...
Our good friends favorite place, half way across town and the service is horrible. .......

Food is always fantastic. However the floor management is very poor. It is frustrating to stand and wait at the door when only 2 seats are occupied at the bar and half the tables. Then to be sat at the bar 15 minutes later and all seats are still open. They either do not have enough servers or just poor table management. Whoever owns this restaurant needs to spend more time to see the flow of service and the dissatisfaction of the guests. Our server was very good by the way.
