I've been giving this place many, many, many chances hoping their food would be fresher/better but after being disappointed time and time again, I've decided to finally rate this place. I live off nigiri and their fish here is rancid, including their version of toro. Cut of the fish is also thinner than usual. The rolls are decent; the best thing on their menu is the poke bowl and sizzling platters, but both not worth the AYCE price. Better bet is to just make the drive to goyemon or sushimon. Service is ok, a hit or miss. All in all, Nothing worth warranting another visit.

This place has some specialty rolls that are way more unique than most sushi joints. Other places would get repetitive and would lack originality to they're recipe kinda makes me feel like a similar franchise concept such as McDonald's. definitely not this place though. You can go to this place and pretty much order anything and it will be good.

Horrible customer service, the sushi is frozen and not fresh, I asked kindly to replace the bad tuna for something else and they said I would have to pay for it, can't believe a place like this is still in business.

By far the best all you can eat sushi in town. The staff is amazing and the food is even better definitely worth the 15 minute wait. When they say it's going to be a half hour it's always sooner. We come here at least once a week.

I will never come back to this place again.  It takes 25 minutes to get your first plate of sushi and another 20 for the next plate. They take forever on your orders.  I felt like I had to rush and order quick so they can hurry to make it.  It was horrible and this happen like 4 hours ago and I am still mad.  Plus their sushi is not worth the wait.  The only thing I can say I really like is their egg rolls.  I don't recommend this place .

Been going to this place since it first opened.  David always takes care of us.  This place is always fresh & has high quality AYCE sushi, that rivals non-AYCE places!  Huge assortment and great appetizers too!  Awesome & friendly staff.  It can get super busy, so we usually just slip in and take a seat at the bar rather than waiting for a table.

Sweet! 2hr time limit for AYCE..  Too bad you'd probably need all 2 hrs of it as service here is inadequate.  

The restaurant was pretty much empty with maybe 5-6 other tables with about 5 or 6 front-of-the-house staff and 2 sushi chef.  The FOH would much rather have their backs toward us and mingle amongst themselves than to help the hungry (me). Kind of funny as It felt we were sat at the table with no server or porter assigned to it.  I ordered miso soup 3 times before it finally came out.  Our water and drinks were never refilled.  Sushi took too long and they just mediocre.  It was just one thing after another making it a very unpleasant dining experience.  

Only thing i have positive to say about this place is that eel sauce is extra sweet without the heaviness and they offer dessert you normally wont see at other AYCE: green tea tiramasu and creme brulee. 

My friends and I just finished eating sushi here since one of them recently reside in the area and he'd mention that we should have gone to Koji sushi just down the street instead.  I'd never been there, but i couldn't agree more.

An extensive AYCE menu at a low price. Especially for this area. Lunch for two with a bottle of sake came to a little over $60 before tip. 

Oyshi is one of the only places that uses lobster in their dishes. I wish it was a little more distinguishable though. Mixed in with the diced crab stick, it is difficult to taste the natural sweetness of the lobster. I am not a huge mayo fan either, but did not dislike any of the dishes because of it. The fact that it was not mixed with half a jar made it bearable.

The rice is the most important part of the sushi. Even though we were there early, the rice was cooked off early enough to let it properly cool. There is nothing worse than warm fish and rice that falls apart when picked up. 

The nigiri list is smaller than some of the other sushi joints, but the items we got were all fresh.
Chirashi is good, but prettty limited on the quantity of fish,,,a few fillers.  Service at the bar was great, the guys are lively and keep a fun atmosphere.

Non sushi lover but loves the food here, there's so much to eat non sushi and it's delicious, I had to do the all you can eat, I couldn't get enough of their teriyaki and steak. It's a nice yet fancy feel on the inside. I will be coming again and again when I have a craving for some oriental cuisine.
sushi was good but the service was bad. we were seated over the sushi bar. the sushiman never asked us what we wanted to get. so we waited for a long time until our waitress came again to order.

I remember why I choose other places over this one because their service is inconsistent sometimes fast sometimes slow n it doesn't matter how busy their are and the biggest one for me is I never feel gratitude from the employees there. Sushi is good I do have to say

Pretty amazing. I was a little nervous going to a place that does all you can eat sushi, but wow it was great!  You could order anything you wanted except sashimi. Big rolls and cuts of fresh fish. Yes I stuffed myself to the gills with some of the best creative rolls I've ever seen, and walked out of that place with a $52 bill for 2 people. When income back to Vegas I will run to this place!!

Scale of 1 - 10 I give it a 5 at best. The service is adequate but food takes a very long time to get. Yes, it was a busy Friday night but you know what, Friday is busy, staff up already. 
The portions of food and presentation are both sub par. The flavors were good but honestly I am not impressed. 
It almost feels like they just want you to eat and get out. 
The atmosphere is okay. The booth that we sat in had its upholstery all torn up. 
Will I go again, NO. Not with all of the sushi joints in town.
Sin City has always been my favorite sushi place and now Jessie is back even better Young, Jimbo, and everyone else ill see you soon:P

I would've given this place 5 stars, had I reviewed it the first time I ate there. I don't quite remember what I had the first time coming into this restaurant, but I do remember having their blueberry parfait, and that alone deserved 5 stars! My second visit to Oyshi was for dinner, and I ordered the Ahi poki salad, the Love Affair sushi roll, and a parfait of course! The salad and the sushi roll were excellent, the best part was probably the Love Affair sushi roll.. probably the best roll I had in a while, from what I remember, it had lobster and crab meat, it was awesome! So here it goes, if so excellent, why the 4 stars you ask.. 

Well.. the parfait. It was so much bigger and tastier the first time around.. from what I recall, it was served in a taller glass the last time, more ice cream and more toppings.. This time, it was skimped down to a smaller glass, and yes, smaller glass means smaller parfait. It also lacked the toppings I once remembered it had. Therefore, I conclude this review by saying Oyshi is an awesome restaurant, but they need to overcome this economic slump by serving MORE not less! =)

Came in here for the first time on a Sunday 2pm, off peak lunch hour. There were about 4 other groups eating there with 5 sushi chefs working. Our initial order took quite a while - it did not all come out at once which is understandable, but I've definitely eaten at other places that don't have as many chefs that was much faster. 

Anyway, the first round was all nigiri - the first half came out great! Fish was fresh, rice portions under them were very reasonable. When the second half of the nigiri order came out.. The ENTIRE PLATE was drowned in ponzu sauce.. Gross. This is a big no-no, the rice was so drenched in this sauce that it couldn't even be picked up without the rice falling apart. For this I am docking a star.

I then decided to order some of their appetizer fresh oysters (to wash the disgusting ponzu sauce out of my mouth). They came out promptly and we're definitely fresh. They came out with a little bit of a pico de gallo type salsa on them and already had hot sauce on it.  The oysters were very clean and shucked properly - an observation I did have was that the oyster itself was almost tasteless - as in, no Oceany taste - perhaps they were farmed oysters if that's a thing.  (We paid dinner price to get in on these and the uni/sweet shrimp during lunch hour, definitely worth the extra $5pp if you eat these)

Also tried the lobster fair and spider roll - the spider roll was kind of bland and the lobster fair was a California roll with crab salad burnt on top - I would not order either one of those again. 

The wife got green tea tiramisu and green tea creme brûlée. I sampled both and they were quite delicious.

Service was ok, our waitress must have ended her shift while we were half way through eating but the other servers were all willing to help.

In summary, not a bad AYCE sushi joint - but make sure you tell them to hold that ponzu sauce if it's not your thing.  Also choose your rolls carefully if you order any - I won't order rolls from there anymore but would definitely eat there again.

This used to be our AYCE spot but not anymore!

The food is great however the service is not so appealing! This actually caused us to venture elsewhere and now there's no turning back. You shouldn't be questioned whether you can eat all you order! I am there to eat for goodness sakes don't tell me not to order too much. I do understand there's time when people do order excessively and cannot finish their food. But that's not everyone so please stop asking us if we can finish what we order, I'll pay for extra if that day comes! 

My new spots, Yama sushi, Sushi Koma, and Umiya!

great environment, great music (if you like techno), great food, great menu (some real good and nice signature rolls) , i took my girlfriend out there today and bill was 20.54 so prices are great, lousy service is its only downfall =/

Went for AYCE. Food was good, service (today) was terrible. 

Our waiter was quick to take our first order but then disappeared for quite some time afterward...even the other tables in the same section began to complain. The only time he was prompt to act was in collecting his tip (which would have been less had we not been a party of 6)

Still have love for Oyshi, but it's unlikely that it'll be our first choice for AYCE in the future.

yum.

it's gooood here. hubby likes this place..

cool setting.. it's very chill..
they could put a halt on the continuous rave music. lol..

but it's cool.. whatever.

it's a good place.  

all you can eat sushi for 21 bucks! 
definitely keep the rolls on a minimum because it's easy to lose control in this setting. haha..
they have a lot of other things besides sushi..
must haves:
ahi poke
seaweed salad
surf & turf
garlic tuna
calamari
veggie & shrimp tempura..
??? miso. haha

all the rolls start to look the same eventually.. 
just put together differently!

Oyshi is a block from my house so I eat here twice a week minimum .  It's an above average all you can eat sushi spot . Like all ayce sushi places in town they load on the sauces and mayo etc... I like most of the appetizers including the grilled ribeye and seaweed salad which is hard to mess up . At times they are very busy which leads to extended waits for ordered items . Not too much to complain about though . Green tea tornados is really good !

Good sushi, greater service, perfect for groups. 

Walked in with a group of 11 friends and we were seated in a private room. It was perfect for our group and very relaxing. We all had AYCE.

Food came out faster than I expected, and not all at once. Service here gets an A+. 

For  AYCE, sushi is very much up to par. It's not the best, but you definitely appreciate the taste. The best rolls were: Lobster flare, tiger roll, spider roll, and monster roll. Uni is good but you can only get 1 order.  Also, we saw that they ran out of ingredients or particular sushi (it's never fun to pay for AYCE only to find out the items you want had run out). 

Still - great place. 

Clean bathroom, so clean kitchen!

Not impressed.  Fish for their sushi was not fresh.  Not sure what the hype is all about.   Sat at the bar to have AYCE.  Felt rushed by the sushi chef.  Asked for recommendations and before you know it, we were getting heaps of food.   None of which was ordered.  There was nothing spectacular about their dishes.   Our servers were deasant.

Wow! The service and wait time is extremely slow tonight. So slow that I'm on my phone more than ever at a sit-down dinner. It's so slow that I have the time to check-in here on yelp and write this long review. As I'm writing this it has been 10 since my last order came out.  In between orders we've had our coke refilled like 3 times. I'm waiting for the last order to come out. I'm not even full... At this point I just want to leave.

ALL YOU CAN EAT SUSHI and they have a wide variety for the AYCE not just strictly California Rolls like some other places. The menu contains things like sushi, beef, oysters, etc. When you order, it's appetizer/ tapas size so you're usually left ordering more, and more, and more. The food is great, pretty quality stuff. 

Atmosphere is nice, pretty modernized decor, nothing fancy but classy. I like that they have private rooms for those looking to have an event celebrated there. We went there for a friend's birthday and the room that we had fit about 8 people comfortably and even had a TV in there. We were able to watch a football game. I believe that there is another room that fits more people. 

Service was great, they took real good care of us and even gave the birthday boy ice cream with a candle and sang happy birthday. The times that we sit at the sushi bar, the sushi chefs chit chat with you. 

When we're craving sushi and know that we're bout to consume lots of it, we go here.

By far the best sushi on the SW/West side of town. Thankfully I don't live to far so I frequent often. But if I didn't this place would be worth the drive. You can't beat the AYCE. I hate when you go to an AYCE sushi restaurant and almost every roll tastes the same. If that's your thing don't come here because everything you try will be different, fresh and so good!

I cannot believe the amount of selection that you get from this place. 78 rolls and tons of choices for sushi, plus its not like other all you can eat places where the rolls are California Roll based; I counted only 4 that are out of the 78. They also have daily specials that's included in the all you can eat menu adding in oyster and sweet shrimp to the dinner menu.

The quality is higher than some places I know in California and this place is located in the middle of a desert. I always make it a priority to visit this place at least once when I'm in Vegas.

I ate here for my best friend's birthday but found a baby fly on my salmon sushi. The server took the plate, removed the piece with the dead baby fly and returned our plate to us. Kind of an appetite buzzkill. Still got charged the same Ayce price. Otherwise, service was great which really matters. The rest of the food was good. They just use more rice than other places. Food coma

We decided to have a surprise birthday party for a friend, and she loves Oyshi!  So we arranged to have dinner in the private room, there was probably about 15 people with our party.  We enjoyed beer and sake, we then ate soooooo much amazing food! Everything was great! The staff was attentive and we all had a great celebration!

Great sushi, great service. Hostess accidentally gave our reservation away but when we pointed it out she apologized profusely and got us sat quickly. It's a great environment and great food. We have been coming here for many years and we will continue.

Dinged one star because this place always seems unnecessarily busy... It's pretty annoying when you're waiting for a table when there's four or more empty tables in the joint. Food is always great--standard sushi fare. I believe it's $27 for All You Can Eat dinner, also pretty standard.

I guess yelp deleted my review.  Too bad im writing another one.  Came here with my niece.  Stood in line waiting to be seated.  Ignored.... then a party of 4 behind us got greeted instantly and then sat. Right away.  This was before i found out about goyemon.

Crap service.

Btw hamachi here smells like old fish.  Fresh hamachi doesnt smell.  

Also ordered fresh wasabi here once.  Bought me the regular wasabi then charged me for fresh wasabi...

Mmmm yummy Oyshi sushi oh how we adore our monthly AYCE visits! My sweet cheeks and I really enjoy coming here as part as our dining out rotation as it is always a real treat.

We always sit at the bar in the back corner as it is cozy and has a great view of the flat screen TV on the wall that always has the latest sports game playing. 

We have our favorite rolls and this time we enjoyed a new appetizer that was really good. The popcorn scallops was a yummy appetizer we tried which came with a honey mustard and a spicy ranch dipping sauce. 

What we really like about Oyshi is the consistency in service and food quality. We have never really been disappointed with a visit, it is an easy and happy relationship we have with Oyshi.

I really enjoy the flavors of the Oyshi roll and the Lobster Affair which both melt in my mouth. My lover boy likes the spicy rolls such as the nuclear bomb and the atomic roll. He loves anything that is spicy and that has jalapeno in it  When I want a satisfying mouth orgasm this is where I go to get it over and over and over again.

I like mouth orgasms caused by Amazing flavors exploding in my mouth!

Food is outstanding. Most of the time the service is good. Went one day after class and had to wait one hour for our food, but the quality of the sushi made up for it. Always go for the love affair roll. If you're going to get more than three rolls and you have a big stomach you might as well go for the all you can eat.

When I went, I think they were only open for a few months. My friends really liked this joint and said I had to check it out. 

The food was decent. Although we ordered salmon and got lox. Which I guess if technically salmon. Just not very Japanesey. They also didn't have negi-toro or shiso leaves or white tuna. Shiso is a very basic requirement! 

Ergonomically mediocre. Like the counters are too deep ... for a sushi bar. The decor was still coming up. There was a ugly mural on the wall. Although, I did like the little pieces leading up to the bathroom, like little Basquiat post cards. 

The sushi chefs were also quarreling behind the sushi bar. Our servers weren't very warm, but got the job done. They were all boys. I think half of them were from Hawai'i. Not that you have to be Japanese to know how to slice a mean sushi ... but it didn't seem these kids had much formal training. Just sayin' ... 

* off the strip, non-casino

Been here enough times to state that the food is very good, service is great, AYCE is tops and the place has a nice ambiance. 
I highly recommend the Tiger roll, spicy tuna roll, poke salad, and the ribeye. Stay away from the cucumber salad. Too much dressing with a weird aftertaste. I think the chef just had a heavy hand that night with the dressing.
My friend loves their baked mussels. I'm not a fan of mussels so none for me. 
AYE includes a choice of dessert. Their berry parfait with your choice of vanilla or green tea ice cream is devine! They also have mochi and green tea tiramisu. Stay away from that green tea tiramisu...not good at all!! Other than that great place to tame a AYE sushi craving with fantastic hot dishes!
Just dine in with four people and they don't have oyster and uni, still charge for dinner price without those items. Very disappointed and never come back again.
This is the best sushi ever! The sashimi, sushi or rolls are to die for! Great service and great food. This is the place to go!

Love this place!

Great food and atmosphere.  Nice selection on All You Can Eat menu.  Only minor drawback is that I wish they served smoked salmon, but the rest of the food more than makes up for it not being on the menu.  Always my go to spot for sushi!

Always great food. The dining area can get a little noisy when they are busy. They have private areas for big groups. The waiting area up front is limited and uncomfortable little stumps are all you have options to sit on. The bathrooms are routinely unkept and slightly dirty. Great all you can eat deals.

Use to be my favorite spot in town for sushi but over the last two years I had twice food poisonining from the raw sushi.3 stars because I am sure they can bring it back to what it was a very nice clean place to get your sushi.

Variety versus Service - this is my headliner for this place.

The menu is excellent, and by that I mean I have many choices, in fact too many that on my second visit here, I think i have only tried an eight of their items. Quality and freshness of their seafood are outstanding, and I've had them on roll, sushi, and sashimi.

The stand-outs are: Miso soup, Ahi Poke, Shrimp tempura, Calamari, Surf and Turf, Eel and Avocado, Creme Brulee.... food is four stars hands down.

Now, the service is not the most accommodating, I'm afraid to say. Some cons on my last visit: our waiter forgot our three orders of Calamari and had to be reminded, as we waited for a good twenty minutes, grave sin on customer service definitely. For the pros, we were greeted and seated very quickly and our drinks were refilled readily and I appreciated the fact that our waiter apologized for making us wait on our calamaris. In the end, I would give them three stars and believe that they could do better by following up with an order.

I think that Oyshi is one of the best AYCE sushi restaurants in Las Vegas.  It is a bit of a far drive from the strip and from where I live, but it's worth it.  The AYCE prices are $21 for lunch and $26 for dinner.  The AYCE not only includes various sushi rolls, but also includes various items such as steaks, mussels, sweet shrimp, some nagiri choices, and dessert.
 
My Top Picks for AYCE:
-Ahi Poke
-Kamikaze Roll
-Tiger Roll
-Rainbow Roll
-Rib Eye Steak (comes out sizzling on a hot plate about 6-8 oz)
-Mussels (2 comes in every order)
-Vanilla Berry Parfait
 
Oyshi also has a normal non-sushi menu such as teriyaki chicken, egg rolls, and a beef bowl, if you ever have any non-sushi diners in your group.  The service there is decent, some servers are friendly some are not.  I've never had a problem with trying to get a table here.  My only qualms with Oyshi is that they tend to play rave/techno music there that does not match the ambiance.  And they also automatically add gratuity or parties of 6 or more, when it is usually customary to add gratuity for parties of 8-9 or more.

The lunch specials are great deals and the food is good too.  I don't come here often as it can take a little longer than the average lunch break but it is well worth it on days when I can afford the extra time.

This was our first time coming to Oyshi and we will definitely come again! The food was delivered in a timely manner and tasted delicious! My boyfriend is allergic to avocado and cucumber (unfortunately) so finding good sushi can be a bit hard for him. Our waitress, Odi, was very cooperative and made sure that whatever he ordered was completely free of his allergies! I also noticed that she was really busy, every table in the place packed, however she remained very calm and checked on us frequently to make sure we had the food we needed and that we were doing okay. Thank you Odi for making our first experience a great one! We will be returning soon!

The service is absolutely terrible and the wait time is reallllllly inconvenient because the staff are so unorganized. I literally walked in and waited at the podium for 15 minutes, and servers were just staring at me and I was like HELLO WILL ANYONE HELP ME? There was also tons of tables like 10+ and they still made me wait 30 minutes... for what?! The staff were just chatting, hiding behind the podium right by the kitchen. They also don't take reservations at the weirdest times. The hostesses are sooooo rude here and will ignore you unless you ask them for an update.

The staff spent more time cleaning the tables while there. There were probably 30 people waiting outside, because when I was seated there was 5 empty tables around me! The rolls are just okay, but their fish/sashimi was good, even though the servers DIDN'T KNOW WHAT THEY WERE???? How do you confuse a white fish with octopus ?! Their prices for AYCE are pretty standard, not too cheap or expensive. The quality of the food is pretty good.

The interior of the restaurant is gorgeous of course and very roomy. They also have an incredible sake selection ranging from hot-cold, fruity-to house.

$27 for all you can eat dinner was too much to pay for my group of 5 and it wasn't worth it. We should've just ordered 1 or 2 items each and it would've been cheaper at the end. Appetizers, salads and the scallops had very small proportions. Rolls were okay, only roll we liked was the Tiger roll. It's not worth coming back, spent too much money plus service was ehh barely checked on us, always had to wave him down.

This was my second visit to Oyshi, my first to the main dining room.  It was fairly busy, but we had a reservation and were seated immediately.  Our server was friendly and extremely prompt without being pushy at all!  She never let our drinks get completely empty and always made sure our plates were full!  My friend and I shared the Spicy Tuna Crunch and I devoured the Japanese Lasagna and the lobster/crab roll alone as he isn't a big fan of any warm sushi.  We also shared some Gyoza and the popcorn scallops (my favorite appetizer!) As always, everything was fresh and extremely tasty.  I can't wait for my next visit!!

I guess it depends on what kind of Japanese food you want.

Their rolls?  Fantastic.  Their heart rolls and volcano rolls were strong in flavor with soft textures.

However... their nigiri is only so-so.  I'd come here if you just want to go wild on ROLLS.

That being said, the service here was excellent.  They really try hard to satisfy your needs here.  The atmosphere/decor was nice too.

We use to come here all the time, but I will never go back. The place use to be a packed house, and now there's no wait on a Friday night and I can see why. The waiters are snobbish and rude and the manager has no backbone to stand up to them. On top of that, they super pack the rolls and sushi with rice and if you can't eat it all, they'll charge you for it. Our waiter was a fat dick (not the good kind, fat and an a$$hole) from the start of the night. He barely acknowledged us the whole night. Anytime we signaled him to order, he looked annoyed and wouldn't come over until ten minutes later. Again with the rice, the douche bag wanted to charge us $14 for not eating all the rice. WTF man, all the rice we didn't eat didn't even equal a bowl of rice they normally charge you $1 for. When we asked the manager about it, he was useless and just said, "You don't have to tip the waiter. He doesn't expect a tip." After arguing about fairness and how the establishment has gone to crap, we walked out of there paying $4 extra for rice... You can have your $4 worth of rice along with the out of business sign Oyshi. Rude, snobby employees coupled with declining quality of food ain't keeping you in business much longer.

I go to this place due to its near by location.  It's an all you AYCE Sushi place.  Now you would expect low quality from somewhere like this, but it is actually pretty decent in some respects.  However, it is also lacking in areas.

Pros: The price was the norm for this type of establishment.  The food is good.  I'm not a big time roll eater as I'd rather eat nigiri over some American take on sushi.  The nigiri was of decent quality, not outstanding, but hey, it is the desert after all. The appetizers are great!  Yes you can make a meal out of the appetizers.  The sauce on the surf and turf was outstanding.  The tempura dipping sauce was also great.

Cons:  First of all, this place has gotten very busy.  I used to be able to walk right in, now it can be up to a 45 minute wait.  Once you get in you get the feel that this place is understaffed.  (Update!!!  Staff seems to have increased, speed of orders has improved....some.  Still a packed house.)  The servers come around, yet your order does not.  I came with a group of 7 big time eaters and we put in big orders at a time.  Not only did our orders take forever to come out, but it felt like the manager was watching us to see if we were really eating all that food.  It got to a point that they stopped taking our order.  It says all you can eat on the door buddy.  (Update:  Management does not do that to us anymore, are they reading this?  Great job if they are!)  They didn't even bring out our oysters and claimed that they did and we could not have any more.  I had to explain to the manager that we are not asking for more, we never got any to begin with.  They figured out that our oysters were taken to the wrong table.  Lucky them.  We ended up paying the bill and leaving having not received everything we ordered. They couldn't even take the time to fill a drink.

UPDATE:  The last few times we went we got better service, the rotation of fish is fast, so the flavor has improved.  Still not the fastest, and still a wait to get in, but it's a slamming busy place now.  I have found one big dislike that is totally not the restaurant's fault.  Every time I go there now, there always seems to be the loudest, most obnoxious, cussing, group of trendy punks sitting right next to me.  It's like man, if you've got all this money that you seem to need to yell about so everyone can hear you, why are you at an AYCE sushi place.  Go eat at some rich place where everyone else is yelling about their car and their money.  I don't want to hear you, I want to hear the person sitting next to me.

This place has excellent sushi and the ayce menu is very extensive. It's priced about what all other sushi restaurants charge so that is fine. It's also pretty big and open which is nice because you don't feel too packed in. 

I really enjoy all their different rolls but my favorites are the Rock n Roll and the crunchy scallop roll. The scallop roll has these little popcorn scallop pieces that are just so tasty. 

For dessert I always get the creme brûlée. If you get ayce, you only get one, but if you order a la carte the creme brûlée is served with three flavors (vanilla, green tea, and chocolate) but the vanilla is the best. 

The downside to this restaurant is the wait to get seated which can sometimes be a good hour or more because it's popular. The second downside is the service. Sometimes they are pretty unattentive due to the fact that they are so busy.

I have been here several times hands down best sushi joint in Las Vegas. Always clean & efficient with great food and service not to mention amazing happy hour specials. Don't forget dessert because the green tea ice cream is the perfect way to end the night. Also all you can eat
Cool local sushi joint, shows paper view for free.  Must try the all you can eat, well worth it.

Definitely a place to seat down and have your family dinner. Service is great, weekly dinner with husband and kids. Look for waiter Toshi or waitress Pink they will guide you in ordering exactly what you like and you'll have no regrets :)

Oyshi was one of my favorite sushi restaurants until my most recent visit. When my family, and I arrived we waited six minutes to me seated there was no host so a waiter finally came to us and asked how many where in are group. It took the waiter over ten minutes to take are order. My wife and I order all you can eat sushi, we told the waiter which rolls we wanted to eat first that order took twenty minutes to arrive at my table. When we finished that order we had to ask a bus person to hunt down are waiters to place another order of sushi. We ended up spending over two hours eating sushi not because we ate so much but because it took for ever to place orders and to receive it. The sushi is not all good as I remember it being in the past I will not be going back.

Oyshi's AYCE sushi experience is kind of, well, meh.  It is neither exciting nor disappointing.  I felt that the fish to rice ratio on the nigiri was a little rice-happy.  The rolls were not too exciting.  I would go back, but only if someone else insisted.

Food quality and taste 5/5

Service 2/5
If you do the AYCE (all you can eat) they take years to bring anything and forget some of your order because they take so long which forces you to constantly repeat and ask about the food you ordered. 

Price 3/5 
Kinda expensive

Overall experience 3/5

I would rate them 5 star if this prob didn't happen. But at the end going on dessert you are only allowed to order one (as in just one piece) dessert. I'm a dessert person, so if you are too, I don't recommend this place. Too much rule when it comes to eating all you can eat. Where can you see all you can eat but only allow you to eat one piece of dessert per person from the entire dessert menu?? They taking time on serving your food too and leave you one napkin and you have to ask for extra. This is my first and will be the last time eating here.

great deal for all you can eat!!! 21 bucks for adults and 15 for kids. i treated myself and my cousins to a lunch before taking the red eye back to nyc.

i wasn't sure if we were going to be able to eat a lot but we sure ate more than we paid for! everything in the menu was included except for sashimi (easy fix: order it sushi style and don't eat the rice), uni and ebi.

we had gyoza, edamame, seaweed salad,  seven rolls (from regular spicy tuna and alaska rolls to specialty ones including a spider, baked rolls, and a deep fried philly), two hand rolls, two orders of tako nigiri, two orders of hamachi nigiri, an order of tamago, and green tea ice cream for dessert.

i'd say we did a but of damage at this joint! what i also liked was that our waitress was recommending specialties to get and told us that appetizers and dessert were included. she was also helpful when my cousin wanted green tea ice cream and parfait by combining the two together. it was pretty much the green tea ice cream instead of vanilla yogurt with fruit and whipped cream on top. what a way to end a great meal!

***YELP 100 CHALLENGE 35/100***

I have been to this location about 4 times total, service was never really extraordinary but it wasn't quite as disorganized as it was last Saturday. They had us sit in a private area because we were a party of 15, and I don't know if it was due to that fact but the total experience was dampen by their lack of organization when it came to ordering and getting our food. 

We all got the AYCE, so that right there was already less of a headache or so I thought. We even helped out by writing our orders on the napkins. That part was a cinch but when it came to actually receiving our orders, it was a mess. First, the dishes came out one at a time and then later on we were told that they were putting orders together in one plate: the tempura for example, which had we known, wouldn't have been a problem and could've just passed it around. Instead, people were waiting for their orders to arrive only to find out it was already given to the end of the table. We didn't want to keep ordering as we weren't aware if they were just backed up or totally forgotten. We were finally told towards the middle of the meal what they were doing, when half of the party was agitated already. Don't mess with hungry Filipinos LOL.   

The food is just OK, quality is nowhere as good as some of our preferred sushi places, it's AYCE I know, but I've been to other AYCE places where their nigiri's taste so much better and fresher. Now their green tea crème brulee is in a league of its own, I could eat about 5 of those suckers lol, it might be the only reason for me to come back hahaha oh and the unlimited ice cream.

AYCE sushi. 

I enjoy this place. It doesn't have the best sushi in town, so I usually just stick with the specialty rolls and hot dishes, which is a nice change of pace from time to time. If you are trying to satiate a serious nigiri craving, go somewhere else. 

The potato croquettes, dynamite, buttery shrimp and scallop, yakitori, surf and turf, seared tuna and salmon skin are some of the regular menu items I order. I'm a fan of the amigo, red dragon and hawaiian rolls. 

I wish they had a better happy hour deal, like Kobe and I'd probably visit this place a little more often.
So me and my friend asked for water THREE TIMES AND NO ONE WOULD GIVE US ANY.  We've been seated for about 20 minutes and literally everyone got their drinks but us.

AYCE this place is awesome and everything tastes great wish I could have more than one premium dessert but I guess I could just have another sush roll instead? Don't do one offs just go AYCE so worth it!

After years of going to crowded sushi bars with minimal arm room between me and others, I found a location with comfort as well as a great selection of sushi creations. The restaurant is an upscale environment with room for large parties. 

 - The restaurant offers a huge menu of both sushi and hot kitchen items (e.g., sushi, koma, Hamachi, sizzling hot plates of steak and seafood, tempura, oysters, soups/salads, and desserts). 

-  There is usually a wait to be seated. The wait is sometimes as long as an hour during peek dinner times. You can drop in to be put on the list, and they will text you when they are ready to seat you. They take reservations. 

- They offer an all you can eat sushi menu for about $25 that includes one desert (e.g., green tea ice cream, creme brûlée, Moche ice cream).

- My favorites are the yellowtail koma, double salmon roll, surf and turf sizzling hot plate, spicy tuna hand roll, fresh sashimi red snapper and halibut, Red Rock sushi roll, and the vanilla creme brûlée with green tea ice-cream. 

I've been to this location over a dozen times in just the last four months - my most frequent visit being last week for lunch. I generally ask for my favorite sushi chef and server, and I am willing to wait for them. Vincent is the best server!  This restaurant generally wants the server to tell the sushi chef your order even as you sit at the bar. At first I wasn't fond of this process, but it works well and there isn't a lag in service. The sushi chef still hands you your order -it just prevents you from yelling out at a busy chef. Vincent offers exceptional service that includes getting your beverages, kitchen items, and sushi bar order. He is exceptional. 

The sushi chefs are all awesome, but my favorite is Ivan. When the restaurant isn't too busy, he will inquiry if you want anything. If you request, he will also make creations for you based on what he notices you like. He is efficient, creative, and humorous.

We tried Oyshi on a recommendation from a Renoite transplant that lives in Vegas now, we were expecting decent ayce sushi, much like the ones you can get in Reno....not even close.  

Sushi-
The sushi is just, ok.  The fish wasn't super fresh, some of the cuts of fish were thin and cut poorly, falling apart.  Most of the rolls had the same notes of lots of imitation crab meat mixture, so they all tasted the same.  

Appetizers-
I'm a fanatic for raw oysters, they had small Pacific oysters that were a bit on the warm side and very bland tasting, flavorless even with the siracha sauce they dotted on it.  It tasted as though it was about to go bad and they rinsed it with tap water, even the shell the oyster was served in lacked oyster liquor, which isn't a good sign.  Needless to say, I was only able to eat 1 of 4 that I ordered and it was a struggle to keep it down.  I've eaten raw oysters from a jar and the raw oysters here came pretty close to that.  I told the wait staff that the oysters were a bit off and she replied, "that's odd they're usually not like that".  The manager was attentive and came to our table to see if we wanted more oysters, stating that there wasn't enough sauce on our previous order as to why they tasted that way. If the oysters are fresh, why would you need to drown it in "sauce"?

The sweet shrimp with side of fried heads, amaebi, were not so sweet, which means they weren't so fresh.  The shrimp heads weren't prepared properly, (not fried well) and so it was tough to bite through it.

After having the oyster and amaebi, we passed on the uni, because if you can't get the other 2 right, there's no way we were going to try the uni as it needs to be super fresh.

They were pretty busy for a Tuesday night, so maybe I just have high expectations for sushi, or maybe we just got the Sushi chef in training, but if your like me and your jonesing for some great sushi, this place isn't for you.

Wow!! I love Oyshi! I'm definitely coming back and recommending it to everyone I know! I have been to a lot of AYCE sushi places in Vegas and there hasn't been a place that I really loved more than this one.

My absolute favorite was the Dragon roll, it is ell with avocado. mmm! The Nigiri is super fresh and delicious. It was great all around. TY

I wasn't really impressed with this sushi joint. Typical AYCE format, however, the rolls didn't taste fresh. The calamari was just empty breaded rings with tentacles here and there. At the end of the night, I ended up having more gas than a Texaco station. If someone lit a match, the joint would be flammable!

This is our go to spot for sushi. The sushi selection is awesome, but if you're with people who don't particularly like eating fish, they have a ton of choices to choose from. Service is really hit or miss here. The restaurant itself is really clean with modern decor.

Very good as far as ayce goes. They really have some quality rolls. I think I've had some better starters/appetizers at other ayce sushi spots but as far as rolls they are solid. My only drawback is the last few times I have been in this restaurant there have been lots of flies buzzing around for some reason. The food still tastes good but flies ruined our last few experiences landing on our table and even our sushi. We haven't been back since.

When eating AYCE here, stuff your faces with everything from the appetizers, nigiri to the dessert... everything was good.  Especially the dessert.  The maki rolls are packed with a lot of rice and are portioned so large, they do not fit the mouth, and they will fill you up after 1 order.  

We would go back if the service was a little warmer.  I was "reprimanded" by the host for letting my toddler walk around the dining area.  Says he's getting in the way.  Seriously?  I'm already not fully enjoying my meal coz my kid is acting up.  You're supposed to make me feel better, not worse.  I curse you host with tantrum toddlers, many of them!  Hehe.

I'm sorry but it bothers me that this restaurant is highly reviewed. Everyone has different idea about sushi but this place disappointed me, who is not so picky about sushi. 

Wish I had the picture of the sushi that I ordered but it's been a while and unfotunately it's hard to find from thousands of pictuers I have. 

This restaurant is great for people who loves "rolls". I enjoy rolls too but I enjoy regular nigiri sushi, which, I think, is the best way to enjoy the quality of fish. When I order Tuna nigiri, the sushi came out WET & SOGGY like the fish was just microwaved and defrosted. I do not know what caused it to be wet & soggy but I've never seen such thing in my life. Sea Urchin is not edible if they are not decent quality and this restaurant's sea urchin was not good at all.

Again, rolls are enjoyable but I don't know if  I can call this restaurant a "good sushi restaurant".

This restaurant is right in my neighborhood and very convenient. They are reasonably priced and quick with Togo and dine in orders. I often place to go orders and on one particular night as always, I ordered sushi to go and waited..... There were 4 servers standing around chit chatting behind a "wall" which was merely a beaded divider. They cussed and spoke rudely about guests in earshot of guests, like myself. I work service industry and understand that on occasions you get rude and sometime intolerable guests and need to vent but speaking poorly about a guest or anything else on your restaurant floor is immature, unprofessional and rude at best. 

You're open late, have great food and are quick with service..... I suggest your team be properly coached on the importance of guest relations and the impact one sentence may have on guests in the building.

Love the all you can eat with a variety of options!! The staff is friendly, it's very comfortable, and I enjoy the atmosphere. The only flaw is I feel it took a long time for things to come out - but that meant I had time to digest in between rolls.. I really enjoyed the experience overall!!

The all you can eat sushi menu is pretty extensive. At $26 for dinner it is right on par with other sushi places I have been to. The sushi is fresh, the steaks and meats are tender and juicy, and the appetizers like the gyoza and seaweed salad are tasty. The calamari could use some work in the flavor department however. The service there is second to none. You are greeted when you walk in by nearly all of the staff, the waiters/waitresses are friendly and attentive, and the bus staff makes sure your table isn't cluttered with plates and your drinks are never empty. The wait for the sushi can get a little long, so order up some appetizers and sides while you're waiting. Just remember that there are other tables waiting for sushi, and only a few sushi chefs to make all the sushi so patience is a virtue here.

Food is good.. but the staff seems not so happy on their job.. the whole time that we were eating we didn't see a single smile.. place is good a little pricey but it fine.. i don't think we'll come back here..

If you want to receive any of your rolls in under 20 minutes don't go here. Went on a Tuesday night and it took forever to get even some soup (13 minutes). I didn't know one of the rolls had mushrooms in it which I'm allergic to, and instead of being more considerate the waitress argued with me and said I should have read a different part of the menu where it have the description. I didn't know the roll was In the menu in two different places so I was a little upset. She ended up charging us for two all you can eats even though I only got miso soup because when I got the roll and took a bite I got sick. So I really paid 27$ for miso soup. She could have had the courtesy to charge him for his all you can eat and me for just my soup. 

Won't be coming here again. Rude server and roll took 20 minutes to get to me anyways.

Extremely disappointed. I was told by a friend to try this place and it sounded like some great sushi. Wrong. Walked in and half the tables were reserved. But there was space along the sushi bar. Took them 15 minutes to seat us, then we had a horribly slow server. Took 20 minutes to order sushi, and the sushi wasn't anything amazing. I suggest trying somewhere else.

Super disappointed. On my previous trip to Oyshi, I thought it was decent sushi and service. However today's trip to Oyshi was a super disappointment. The hostess was no where to be seen, so we had to wait 20 minutes before someone even noticed we were there. We finally got seated, got out drinks, and ordered our first selection for the all you can eat sushi. However, we had to wait 35 minutes until even just our appettizer of the small surf and turf came out. After that it seemed like we were invisible to the waiters before we even got one to awknowledge that they were having staffing problems and that we should wait another 15 minutes for our sushi to come out. When we finally got the sushi it was horribly made and cold (we ordered a baked sushi). I happened to order calamari for my 2nd selection after finishing the 1st. That never came. After being ignored for a few more minutes another waitress came by to see if we would like anything, I was already super pissed by that time so I just ordered a dessert and asked for the check. The $26 for a dinner all you can eat sushi was not worth it. So sad that this place did not meet up to my expectations

AMAZING
I have been going here for close to six years and it is still my favorite place in Las Vegas

We randomly tried Oyshi on whim and I'm glad we did. The reviews are so harsh so I decided to write one. Our servers name was Jane, and she was great! The food is so good, you need to try the dynamite appetizer probably the best one in Vegas that I've found thus far from living here for about a little over a year. The atmosphere is great. They have private rooms for party's and they play some really good music. If I had to choose between sumo sushi 2 and Oyshi, for some AYCE sushi on this side of town, it would be Oyshi!! Lol anyway we will be coming back for sure!

Favorite AYCE sushi place in Vegas.  It's a 30 min drive one way and still we go.

Quality and selection is excellent.  Many AYCE places will not customize orders... these guys do.  The staff is great... food is awesome... atmosphere clean and club/trendy.....but everyone knows this...

so I recommending calling ahead... don't be suprised to wait a while for a table during peak hours.

AYCE Sushi for $26?  Ladies nights I think is Thurs after 10PM...for $21?  How do you beat that?  Well, with good sushi of course!  The amount of items you can pick off of the AYCE menu are aawesome...

You can get oysters, poke, and all of the sushi you want...of course, Sashimi doesn't count, but hey, get it all.  I like how you can pick a lot of the sides in the AYCE menu as well, particularly the seaweed salad, and the oysters...  

VERY good value, good quality food, fresh sushi, and a good atmosphere to boot.  Only thing is that service can get a little non-attentive, but they're serving everyone pretty much everything, so just make sure you check up on the many things you order.

Came here for a bday dinner..and they sat us in our own private area on the side, which was perfect.  $25 for all you can eat and that pretty much included everything on the menu besides sashimi... They had many rolls to choose from and they also had yakitori dishes(bacon wrapped asparagus, steak, chicken, shrimp, scallops), poke salads(delicious), poke bowls, oysters, mussels.. There was a great selection.  Since we had a big party, our order took some time and some got missed but the servers were more than helpful and they made sure we got everything we wanted.  After our meals they also had parfait, mochi, and tiramisu for dessert..I would definitely be coming back..Only downer is that it is pretty far from the strip if you don't have a car, its about a $30 cab ride, but if you split it, its not so bad.  After 2 hours of stuffing our faces and many bottles of sake, we left stuffed and satisfied and it only came out to $40 a person! We were expecting way more!

Lets see All you can eat appetizers:

Might just go back to Vegas just for this: $21 dollars a person.

The appetizers comeout pretty fast.  The sushi is slower. 

List of normal stuff we got, Spider Roll, Rainbow Roll, Tempura, Chicken Yakitori, and Edamame.  They have a good list of Baked Sushi too. 

You can't get Sashimi but I got something just as good.  Ahi Poke.  

The Sushi is made to order.  We we're full and it was really worth it.  You do have to finish most of your rice with the Sushi.    

And to top it off 1 dessert.   We are definitely going to make this the go to place whenever we are in Vegas.

Sigh. We were *really* looking forward to this after all the stellar reviews. I've been to Vegas many times and always thought the best sushi would be at some swank place on The Strip, but Yelp claimed otherwise.

The good: The food was, overall, fine. We didn't do All You Can Eat because my wife wanted two orders of sashimi (salmon and hamachi). Both were excellent. Nice large meaty pieces, well trimmed, nicely presented. We had two rolls each, which were fine but nothing special. I also had two orders of nigiri.

The bad: We arrived around 2pm on a Sunday afternoon. The restaurant was MAYBE half full. It more than half hour before our first piece of food came out. It was 40 minutes before I saw any of my order. The (nice) server came by at 30 minutes and offered us free miso soup to help pass the time. Meanwhile we watched every other table in the place get multiple orders of sushi delivered. Completely unimpressed, and cost them several stars.

Other issues: I asked if they had aji bones they could deep fry, and the server went off to find out but never came back to tell me yes or no. My aji nigiri had the tiniest pieces of aji I've ever eaten on top. It tasted fine, but they amounted to table scraps, not at all like the beautiful pieces of sashimi my wife got.

This place is so yummy!

My friends and I came here one day for lunch while on a trip to Vegas for our friend's birthday.  We heard from our party planner about this place that has all you can eat sushi and we were there.

There were 9 of us and the service was quick and friendly, and we definitely stayed a few hours to milk the all you can eat deal for what it was worth! Sooooo good! Definitely go! Tons and tons of choices on the menu as well!

Were I come from, all you can eat sushi means buffet, which also means stay away. So when Khatherine T. and I made a sushi date and she suggested AYCE, I about died. Thankfully, Oyshi Sushi has opened my eyes to the other side of AYCE.

Even though this was my first real experience with AYCE, I still ordered off the menu, LOL! Should have and would have tried it, but the BF begged me to bring him left overs, the AYCE rules require you to finish eating everything you order. Nuts! Next time the BF can get his own sushi, I'm going big or going home!

Our server was so nice! He made several recommendations of really good rolls, I like mine spicy and he knew which were hot and which were too hot. He even told me one roll to stay away from. He was attentive and made sure we always had food in front of us and our water glasses stayed full. Khatherine was a pro at this, she didn't even have to look at the menu, she knew everything she wanted and ordered each time he came back to the table. She knew how to keep the sushi coming, and everything that came to the table looked delicious!

The sushi was good, not amazing, but good. I tried the Monster Roll (it was so big I had a hard time fitting it in my mouth!), the Rainbow Roll (by BF's request), and the Red Dragon. The Red Dragon was by far my favorite!! My order actually ended up being more expensive than the AYCE, but at least I could bring leftovers home. Now I need to plan date night with the Beau so that we can come back and try the AYCE together.

I've been to Oyshi several times now and I absolutely love the sizzling rib eye, beef yakitori and vegetable tempura appetizers. My favorite rolls are the oh my heart, to die for! And the Philly roll 

The food is great, the reason I'm only rating 3 stars is because the last 2 times I went the service was awful. Our server was super busy with a large private party and forgot to submit our order, of course it felt like forever to get food. I truly hope the service improves, if not there are plenty of other great restaurants to choose from.

Oyshi is my go to ayce, they are always consistent with quality, taste and service.  I always get Monster roll, tiger roll, NYI roll, sibuya, Love affair, surf&turf app, beef asparagus app, gyoza, uni, ikura, unagi, and usually try some specials, The green tea creme brulee and tiramisu are very good, and I'm not usually a dessert person.  These guys are always on point! I love Oyshi Sushi!
Horrible dining experience.  Service was extremely slow. Ayce sushi but I got full with hot tea waiting for the slow food. Never coming back.
Terrific all-you-can-eat sushi. If you're going huge, it's definitely worth the money. Service was slow when we sat at a table but very good at the bar.

This restaurant used to be okay both food wise and service wise. I'm not sure what's going on these days but the service isn't as good as it used to be. The half of restaurant is empty and they are making us wait 10 min. Why? I always tell myself it s my last time here when I come here. This time, I am 100% positive, WILL be my last time here. There are SO MANY other GOOD aye sushi places. I suggest try them not here

Yes, only 1 Star.. Sorry!


We wanted to try a new spot and came upon Oyshi Sushi; checked out the reviews and the pictures posted, so we decided it was a GO.

When we got there, I asked to sit by the head sushi chef just to see what he can offer.. The guy didn't even introduce himself?!
Don't get me wrong, the sushi was alright; not the best though.. the atmosphere was actually good, but the service was horrible!
1. We waited forever for our order and our appetizers.
2. They forgot our orders, more than once.
3. We noticed that the guest sitting right next to us was getting better service than we did. They even got the check before us?! 


Nice place, but we won't be back there anytime soon.
Oh. Also, while we waited patiently for our food.. We could see the waiters and waitresses flirting with each other constantly. How cute.
(I agree with Rachel, SushiMon is still our choice..)
really good sushi restaurant for those who like to eat a lot. The sushi is fresh and really good. Its a bit pricey but worth it.

Who ever was my sushi chef tonight didn't really do a great job on my shrimp tempura roll.  It was soggy and the crunch wasn't there.  I ordered two in case maybe there was a mistake on how it was made the first time.  The second was as soggy, if not, more.  The flavor was there, just the texture was not correct.

I normally come here with my cousins when we feel like sushi and in the past the sushi has always been top notch.  But tonight, I think the chef was probably in a bad mood, hence the mediocre sushi. 

I also ordered a sashimi salad.  It's also not so great here.  I've had it better in other restaurants.  Oh well, maybe next time I try it might be better.  As long as the sushi chef I had tonight isn't the same as the next time.

I love this sushi place. It has one if the biggest all you can eat menu I've ever seen. The service was a little slow at first but I'm a pretty easy going person. These rolls were amazing Love affair, Cater cheese, Full moon,Spider,& Rock and roll.

Usually come here for a guaranteed good to amazing AYCE sushi experience but my most recent visit here today proved itself to be less than good let alone ok. 
In short: the food and quality of it is amazing, not sub par by any means. I highly suggest their nigiri as well as their Red Dragon and Crazy Philly roll. Their ahi poke is fresh and the bed of seaweed salad it's placed in is on point. 
However, the service (today at least) was below average. It's understandable if a waiter is slammed with tables, if errands for sushi bar needs to run, miscommunication with orders happen ---shit happens and waitressing is a tough job. But when you don't even bother to check your tables on the way of running food or when you're plain MIA for the duration of our longer than expected stay---It's simply no bueno. Our waiter Josh was sweet and was probably jam packed with errands but when it comes to an hr wait for the check let alone dessert orders...well hmm :/ 

Still love this place but maybe perhaps don't understaff?

The service has been decent,  food has been decent as well.  I just wish they offered 1/2 order options for sushi /rolls.  Also, the happy hour time and offers could definitely be better and more expansive as far as time offered and selections are concerned.

I have to say that this all-you-can-eat sushi buffet wasn't too bad. The service and ambiance was definitely better than Sushimon, but when it comes down to quality, taste, and presentation....Sushimon wins the competition!

If you don't mind driving a bit off the strip, then come to this sushi place. It was only $22 for lunch when my friends and I went here on a Saturday.

Sorry, peeps...Sushimon is still better for me...
I used to work next to this place, I like their staffs, friendly n quick service, food is decently fresh.

Fast service and good food, this is currently my go to Sushi place. They have a wide variety of rolls and will adjust the food in each roll as needed. I have only done the all you can eat option but with all the rolls and sashimi choices it is the best way to go.
The food maybe good but the servers are rude. I wanted to sit at the end of bar and they had seats open, but Vince the server had a problem with me sitting there. Place stinks.

My server for tonight was Odi! She was incredibly attentive & caring with our needs. When we sat down she did an outstanding job at explaining the menu to us and checked on us consistently. If you happen to stop by Oyshi and your expecting quality service I would recommend Odi, plus she has the most contagious smile ever :) 
Oyshi truly is the best deal in town for your money with unlimited kitchen/sushi included in the All You Can Eat menu. Definitely a must on my list

Its not Nobu. Its not Yellowtail.  It does not compare to the top quality sushi I get back in Hawaii BUT you can have an entire meal for the price of just two pieces of sushi at the other places.  

$21 for lunch.  $26 for dinner.  All you can eat (with some exclusions).

The food is good and well seasoned.  Fish is reasonably fresh.  Rolls are creative and good eats.  Excellent interpretation of classic sushi dishes.

The ambiance is a little weird (nightclub meets strip mall Japanese sushi joint) but who cares.  The food and service are good and the price is right.

Got finish our meal... Sushi was superb, service was good but not great... The sushi was good and rice to sushi ratio was good, not too much rice to fill you up.. A lot of baked rolls... Good for kids...lots of options... Overall was one of the better AYCE sushi places in Vegas

I cant believe its taken me this long to find this place! stumbled upon this sushi restaurant while out doing some errands today and what a hidden treasure! Usually sushi bars have a very boring decor and bland music but this place was playing Trance music.. that is awesome! with beautiful decor to the wall art and the exposed pipes it has a very stylish/modern feel to it. I almost felt like I was in San Francisco. 
I ordered the seaweed salad. It was a very generous portion but my only gripe was it was completely covered in sesame seeds which i am not a fan but know next time to request them to be left out. The seaweed itself was very fresh and the right amount of dressing was used.
Then i ordered the Hawaiian roll with soy paper. It had albacore, shrimp, and cucumber inside wrapped in a Cajun albacore and avocado tossed with some ponzu sauce... heaven. Seriously one of the best sushi rolls I have ever had and I consider myself a sushi connoisseur. 
The popcorn scallops are amazing as well. they're little scallops deep fried and served with a wasabi ranch and honey mustard sauce. 
I had the all you can eat which was only $25 and that even included 2 oysters! Amazing deal especially for the quality. Ive already been 3 times in the past 3 days and Ill probably end up here at least 3-4 times a week. LOVE LOVE LOVE!

Oh! and the sushi chefs are awesome. :)

Oyshi sushi have the best sushi in this area .there is a big variety of sushi , sashimi and rolls . The restaurant looks very nice and  clean . The service is good ,too. I recommend this place to everyone . You will
Not regret .

**if you're a sushi snob please do yourself a favor and move along by picking another restaurant from your yelp search result. ;) **

if you're less critical and like a variety of sushi and rolls then this just might be your spot. this little gem is definitely located off the beaten path and was suggested to me by one of my best friends who used to live in vegas. like most restaurants in vegas the most accessible/convenient places are pretty much buffets so i was a bit hesitant when i heard this is ayce (all you can eat). okay i'm not gonna lie...my first response was a NO to the idea of ayce, but fortunately my group and i caved when our pick was closed for some reason.

i've been here three times now and they've all been enjoyable experiences. the staff there were not only friendly (a must), but ATTENTIVE. our waitress checked on us frequently, but not to the point of annoyance. lastly, oyshi is not just a good place for sushi, but you also don't feel gouged when you're done...

helpful suggestions:

-this restaurant is off the 215 freeway so plan your transportation wisely;  cabbing it over there might be a bit expensive.

-make reservations if you can as they can be extremely busy, but if you can't then go early. my group showed up around 6'ish and was seated immediately _barely_ missing the dinner rush.

-the menu selections are pretty big so try not to make multiple orders of the same item so you can try different things. this is also important because not all their items are fresh, like uni or oysters.
This place is awesome everything is good ask the chef for special made hand rolls they're off the hook

Generally speaking, I'm not one that craves sushi. However, I DO find myself craving sushi from Oyshi.  The taste and presentation of everything I've ever ordered here is amazing. You've definitely gotta try the Japanese Lasagna Roll!  

Great atmosphere. Great food. Great price.

All you can eat Oyshi Sushi. 
It was good. Good quality. Anything on the menu goes.

But all the rules! One desert per person. Eat most of the rice. Limited raw oysters. Limited hand rolls, and all you can eat ..in two hours. 

All for around 25 dollar a person for dinner. 

I came for a bday dinner and we had a little room with dimmed lighting and trance music in the background. 
Good customer service too. 

It's just a little too strict to really enjoy yourself and to enjoy the company you're dining with.
My favorite sushi in Vegas! Here with Sidney Eileen

One hour wait. Okay this place has to be somewhat of a decent AYCE sushi. No. Just honestly go next door to Soyo and save your $27 bucks. 

We finally sat down and didn't see the waitress again for another 15 minutes. We ordered a couple random rolls, a bunch of sushi, and appetizers. 

So the rolls we're just rolls. I'm not really a fan for rolls. The food runner finally gave us sushi and didn't even know what was what. 

Food runner: Heres your octopus...
Me: Thats not octopus. 
Food runner: oh sorry, red snapper. 
Me: That's not red snapper. 
Food runner: Ohh.... *walks away... 

It was actually surf clam. Learn your sea creatures if your going to work at a sushi place! 

The sushi was not fresh. All of them were small and slightly fishy. The uni was literally orange brown and tasted so weird I couldn't eat it. 

I think then only thing I enjoyed was the miso soup. 

Service needs to be a lot better too. I know now the only reason why we waited a hour was because they took forever to clean the tables around us!

I'm from San Diego and when I heard "ALL YOU CAN EAT" sushi -- I had to try this out. My family and I had lunch here and It blew me away. The decor was gorgeous and modern and for $21 dollars for all you can eat sushi plus sweets! 

Went here on the weekend and there was a good amount of people dining. The sushi was good and I even tasted some sushi that I wouldn't normally try back home. Because of the "all you can eat deal", I took advantage of that. As we ordered it took a bout a couple of minutes for our food to come out. 

I gave this place 3 stars because our waitress Vivian had forgotten some of our food.
The food was good and I wanted to try as much as I could, I got too excited.. but when you forget an order, it bums customers out. She did apologize. 

I would like to come back again and try more of the food here, just hopefully they wont forget our order :)

I pretty much had a good time the two times I went here. My favorite are their salmon dishes. Anything on their menu with salmon in it is a definite favorite. I don't know why we can only order ONE dessert out of the AYCE menu though...

The only thing that bothered me was the service. It was the slowest I've ever had, ever. (And I've been to a lot of places, not just in Vegas). If they fix their slow service, this place could definitely become my favorite place for AYCE sushi.

The all you can eat meal is by far my favorite in town, and there are a plethora of non seafood items included that appease many different tastes. Service is almost always swift and affable. 
They should consider improving their wait time estimates for accuracy so guests can make informed decisions, expand for surplus business, or allow small parties to makes reservations. I waited over 1.5 hours after being quoted 45 min on a Friday evening, as I watched many parties that arrived after me get seated first.
This only happened twice out of many visits, so it is a forgivable offense.

For $26, get the all-you-can-eat menu.  The sushi is only ok and not authentic Japanese food.  The fresh oysters, ika with massago, uni, beef terriyaki, and salad are not bad.  The service and chefs are really friendly.
This is a decent place for AYCE. Price is reasonable. And the fish are mostly fresh. Not the best but I would go again.

Wide variety of rolls and appetizers. Pretty good, BUT...some of slowest service I've ever received at a sushi joint. I heard so many good things about this place and with the service alone...I wouldn't come back.

This sushi place located in a strip mall off the strip is a good find.  We went here for dinner after house hunting around the area and decided to go with the all you can eat option for about $25.  The all you can eat feature allows you to order anything off the menu (rolls, hot japanese items, soup, tofu, nigiri sushi, and a selection of a few desserts including mochi).  The only exception is sashimi.  Each of the rolls off the menu ranges from $12-15/per roll so I think the all you can eat is worth it if you've worked up an appetite.  The rolls are pretty good and made to order which is different from a typical Japanese buffet in which the rolls are sitting out there for who knows how long.  Service is pretty good and the decor of the restaurant is modern and clean.  

I enjoyed coming to this sushi place and for $25, the food and service can't be beat.  Thanks Oyshi for a great meal.

This place is a delicious all you can eat sushi joint. The variety is good, the quality is good, the service is good, and the price is relative to any other all you can eat sushi place. I have come here multiple times, and I will continue to.

All you can eat sushi in Vegas for $27?  

Skeptical at first, but definitely hit the spot with all the rolls with jalapenos. Average sushi, but even the Professional Fat Kid has been hit hard by the economy.  

I'm just glad it wasn't Todai.

Oh...and saw Chandella Powell, UFC ring girl.  Didn't want to pull a tourist moment, so I didn't ask for a picture.

Great food !!! Good service. Probably the best sushi in Vegas. I've tried quite a few spots too. Oyshi's wait list can be long but typically no longer than 30 min. I recommend making a reservation the morning of or day before. Try the sizzling skirt steak.... Yummmm

Geez - the service has really gone to shit ! 
4 of us for dinner last night.  2 had AYCE, 2 didn't .  Server had attitude from the beginning - my sense is a combination of being annoyed by the questions, that we all didn't get AYCE and I was the only one drinking .

We were told the problem was the kitchen was backed up .... Really ?  More like the kitchen was fucked up and the server was backed up and someone needed to stick their foot up her ass to cleanse her of the crappy attitude.

The food ?  Gotta admit the sushi was good - sweet shrimp, garlic tuna and Cajun tuna as well as the yellowtail were the stars.  Unagi also worked for me.

The hot dishes ?  The ones we actually got ? Calamari, popcorn scallops, asparagus beef ... Very average.  There were at least 5 dishes they never brought us.

This was a very rare occasion I didn't tip much - $95 bill, $2 tip.

Get it together OYSHI !

Probably my favorite AYCE sushi restaurant on the face of this planet,

and I don't even live in Las Vegas.

It's a really fun place to take your friends.. I introduced a group of my gal pals to Oyshi last December when we all came to town for my 21st birthday, and now they won't stop asking me when we'll be coming back!

(+ For sure, you'll need to try to Love Fair or Lobster Fair, those are our favorite rolls.)

You know how there's good imitation crab meat and then there's bad imitation crab meat? Oyshi serves the latter. It was very disappointing. 

I suggest sticking to the nigiri rolls, or the traditional sushi rolls. None of that spicy tuna stuff, or anything with cheese in it. Traditional is the way to go. We ordered two rolls that were non-traditional, and we found that to be a very bad idea. On the other hand, tuna and salmon were not fresh the day we went (salmon was more fresh, but still...). It worried me. 

My favorite thing on the menu that night were the ama ebi (sweet raw shrimp). They were probably one of the freshest items on the menu. For this alone, they get another star because it was unique. I've never had this before at another restaurant.

Why did no one listen to me when I suggested Kyara for Japanese tapas instead?

I was in Vegas on vacation recently and went to this restaurant based on it's Yelp ratings.  BIG MISTAKE!!! The service was slow and the sushi was awful.  It seemed like a good deal.. $21 for all you can eat sushi.  The trick, however, is that all their rolls have some sort of cream cheese or mayonnaise in it and make them so heavy and sweet tasting that you can't eat more than a few rolls.  If you like an extra helping of creamy toppings on your sushi than this place is for you.  If you prefer fresh sushi rolls the way they are supposed to be made than stay away!

Horrible service. Went 20mins before getting our drinks, half of the food we ordered NEVER came out! Most of the food served for one of my guests either tasted like freezer burned sashimi & tasteless ribeye! This is the 2nd Sushi place I've tried here in Vegas & lets just say that I am far from impressed. 

Kudos to our waitress Toni for picking up the slack of her coworkers & handling what could be an irate situation with patience.

Oyshi has AYCE appetizers you can't find at any other AYCE sushi place. The beef asparagus, skirt steak, rib eye, and a few other things are unique to oyshi. Beef asparagus is especially tasty. The rolls are similar to what to get anywhere else. So is are the nigiri. I think the bonsai roll is very good. Spicy tuna inside with Cajun albacore outside. Probably the best roll we had. The biggest thing is the green tea creme brûlée. No other AYCE sushi place has this. It is so good!!!! Without it I'd probably give 3 stars. But the green tea creme brûlée alone is worth 1 stat!!!

I decided that I wanted AYCE sushi last night (Saturday) so I headed over to Oyshi.  I checked in with the host at about 8:30pm and was informed that it would be about 20 minutes for a table.  It was a nice night, so I just grabbed a chair on the sidewalk in front and waited for the other half of my party to arrive.  There were probably four or five other small groups of people milling about waiting for tables too.

We were seated at the bar just after 9:00pm.  The place seemed pretty busy...  some uncleared tables, a couple large parties (one with kids) occupied the "VIP" rooms behind us.  It was on the noisy side, especially with the techno/house/electronica music pumping from the ceiling speakers above the four chef's stations.

After a few minutes we were greeted by a friendly server who confirmed our AYCE preference, took our drinks and asked if we were ready to put in our first round of orders.  We were.  I started with miso soup, an assortment of nigiri style items, an "ahi poke" and an order of four oysters (limit 1).  Note:  I thought it was interesting that even though we were seated at the bar, our sushi requests were made with the server.  I guess the server was attempting to queue the orders for the very busy chefs.

The nigiri items on first order arrived quickly and we were told be the chef in front of us that the oysters would be out in a "little while".  The nigiri items were nicely presented and of good quality.  The ahi poke was just a small clump of chopped tuna on top of a mix of seaweed salad and sprinkled with sesame seed (not exactly what I think of when I think poke, but I'm not trying to get techincal up in here son).

The oysters came out a few minutes later.  They were covered in green onion, a bit of masago and a squirt of sriracha.  I can only assume that the toppings were meant to cover up the tasteless, been sitting in a fresh-water tank, half-dollar sized oysters.  Engh, I figured I'd keep moving forward, after all this was AYCE...

Round two:  More nigiri (including surf clam, tamago, masago, quail egg, tako, and scallop), something called "oyshi scallop", and a spider roll.  We also ordered the chicken, beef and shrimp yakitori, which were all paired with asparagus and came sitting in a sweet teriyaki sauce.  Again the nigiri items were of nice quality.  I'm not sure we ever got the "oyshi scallop".  There were two items in the order that looked like a krab salad (the california roll stuff) that I was sure we didn't order.  The spider roll was basically a California roll with one meager soft-shell crab in it, and it had been covered in the same bbq sauce they put on the eel.

Since I was disappointed with the Spider roll and I love soft-shell crab, I put in an order for a Monster roll, which was also supposed to have soft-shell crab in it.  What came out was something similar to the Spider (covered in the same eel sauce) only with the addition of a few slivers of eel and a refrigerator cold tempura shrimp stuffed into it.  Slow down on that eel sauce dawg.

At this point, I was pretty full and done trying...  The sushi chef in front of us was closing down his station, giving it a quick wash down with a wet rag and mumbling something about this night being his "early out".  By this time the dining room was starting to clear out too, but the party with the kids were still in our audible vicinity.

I finished up my second pot of hot tea (which was a nice quality loose leaf green) and enjoyed a green tea ice cream mochi ball.  Both of these items were good.

After tipping out the chefs, server and taking care of the bill, I had spent about $75 for the two of us.  I'm not sure I'll be back anytime soon, but I made the best of it while I was there.

Got EXTREMELY HORRIBLE food poisoning here as well did my bf. The service was nothing great especially seeings how when we told our waitress about the roll tasting funny she didn't even notify a manager. I will NEVER eat here again as long as I live!! After my experience I had multiple friends tell me the same thing had happened to them as well as the people in their parties!!!
