Obviously food is being kept wrong at this place for multiple people to have food poisoning!! I never have written a yelp review but this experience has pushed me beyond belief with the way It was handled. When I called to tell them something was wrong they might want to not serve that roll and its ingredients I was told a manager would call me back I then called the next night and said I wanted my money back I was heated from no manager contacting me which by the way the money was taken out of my account and not refunded. The girl on the phone went back and forth with the manager it pisses me off you're a manager GET ON THE PHONE AND HANDLE THE SITUATION!!!!! I shouldn't have to demand to speak to a manger!! Food poisoning isn't to be taken lightly and I absolutely feel like they don't care. Please be careful eating here it's not worth getting sick! I only put ONE star because you clearly can't post a review unless you give at least one star.

Random nights with good friends are always a blast!  I've always said it.  Spontaneity really makes the activity better!  So when I was invited last minute for a sushi dinner, I knew it was going to be fun.  We settled on a place one of us raved about.  I've been to Soyo restaurant many times but never Oyshi.  Time to Yelp!

The only down side of this place is the location.  I live across town from here.  Oyshi is in a really cool strip mall in my opinion.  First, you have one of my favorite Korean joints.  Now you have my favorite fried rice joint, Rice Trax.  This location, although far, will be frequented a lot.  Although the wait was super long, the restaurant is pretty cool.  Love the concrete floors, the wood accents in the front and the half table chairs, half booth options for seating.  Our service was pretty good.  Multiple servers came by our table at most times.  It was enjoyable. 

For dinner at a sushi joint in Vegas, the ONLY way to go is to get the AYCE special (All You Can Eat).  This place charges a $26 price tag.  The one thing that threw me for a loop were the rules involved.  I've never seen a place have all their rules listed on their menu.  With this dinner, you can literally order anything off the menu.  Granted, there are a few items that limit one per person, but you have access to everything.  My recommendations to get the most out of your AYCE is to stick to non-rice dishes.  I know, I know, it's a sushi joint, but trust me.  You can eat so much more if you stick to the protein.  For dinner, here's what I got, grouped in categories:

Things I loved: Seaweed Salad (with sesame seeds), Fresh Oysters (with ponzu sauce, green onions and hot sauce), Baked Mussels (topped with yum yum sauce and ponzu), Miso Soup (always a hit), Shrimp Tempura (lightly breaded), chicken yakitori (2 skewers with dark meat chicken and yakitori sauce), 

Things I liked but kind of disappointed with: Ahi Poke - Bowl filled with seaweed salad, shredded cucumbers and onions on the top, was small chunks of tuna with a little sesame seeds.  Kind of a disappointment.  I understand that tuna is expensive, but the dish was 75% salad and 25% tuna, which should have been the star of the show. 

Things that were questionable:  Yellowtail or hamachi nigiri - If there's any rice dish I get, it's nigiri because of the small portions. The yellowtail is usually my favorite fish, however, this specific yellowtail was a little discolored and questionable to me.  I took a bite and ended up finishing the dish but it didn't taste like what I'm used to.  Make sure it's fresh!

All in all, this place is actually good.  I'm definitely coming back for another AYCE session.  The place is still convenient and the staff is nice.  If you're looking for a good sushi joint on the SW side of Vegas, for sure check them out!
Amazing food, amazing service, all you can eat for about $30, clean and awesome restaurant aesthetics, and private rooms. Will definitely be going back regularly.

January 11, 2017 @ 10:30pm 

Let me begin by saying that this was the worst possible service ever! The food was okay and I have had much better, but this review is strictly based off of service. I've worked in the restaurant industry so I know that when an incomplete party of 8 show up at 10pm, it could be annoying, however, you don't let the customer know. Well, thats what the male busser with spiked black hair and glasses made clear last night. Every question I asked him about our table he would give a short answer and then turn his back on me immediately (Keep in mind, I worked as a hostess in Vegas for 6+ years, I know how to passive aggressively tell a customer F* you and this kid did it.) Next my friend and I asked if we could wait at the bar and grab a drink and wait for the rest of the party to show, then the hostess says,"If you don't plan on buying anything." I get it, they don't want to transfer the bill or whatever, so fine, we wait. Our party arrives and then we are seated and our server, a lady, I don't know her name because she never introduced herself and made it clear we were annoying her. We ordered a lot of food and tons of sushi and when the sushi came out, the staff didn't even know the names of the rolls, so when we would send it back because we did recognize the names, she would immediately come back and act as if it was our fault and stated the correct names (wow). Towards dessert she lightened up a bit. We aren't a difficult crowd, we all work(ed) in the industry and understand the difficulties of customer service (I'm not saying we're saints because we work in the industry, but we are more courteous than most that don't).
 I don't recommend this place for service, the sushi was alright. We ordered gyoza, rib eye (which they didn't ask which temperature and we were lucky to get beef jerky), miso soup, calamari, shrimp tempura, creme brûlée, mochi, and different flavor ice cream. It was all O.K. All you can eat was the best part of our experience.

Walking in, the decor is chic and modern.  The music is hip lounge style music - and I swear someone has stolen my Upbeat station on Pandora.  The staff is young, friendly, and fast paced.   

The food comes two ways - ALL YOU CAN EAT or ala carte. I opted for the more modest ala option as I am flying solo.  The food tastes fresh, the presentation lovely, and the delivery onto the plate quite speedy.  My only complaint about the food was that the rolls are packed very tightly...loose rolls aren't awesome.  I can understand how an AYCE would require trading speed for firmness but would rather have the firmness especially via ala carte ordering. 

All in all it was a pleasant experience and I will likely return. Four out of five stars for what it is.

Best sushi buffet! So good! We definitely ate our money's worth of food! The service was super slow, which is why I gave 4 stars instead of 5. They have a huge parking lot right outside. there was no wait when we went in for dinner on Thursday night. Too bad this place isn't on the strip, or it'll be packed! Should definitely drive out from the strip to try this place!
Good food overall. But nothing special. But it is ayce so cant be too picky. Surf & Turf is great.

This place is close to my parents' place in Vegas.  I came here with my mom around dinner on a Monday.  Not very crowded.  We ordered the AYCE.  The quality of fish is decent, they don't give you a lot of rice on the sushi which is good because that is a total filler when it comes to AYCE sushi.  The price is pretty good, its under $30/person for dinner.

The service here was good, they check-in on us often, but were not overbearing.  The only thing that sucked was at the tables, they don't offer the half rolls.  It's only available at the sushi bar.  So, if you want half rolls, request to sit at the sushi bar.

There wasn't anything that really stood out.  They have specials written on the chalk board in the front.  When we were there, they had a pork belly appetizer, which tasty good.  Nice and fatty, but it was a little chewy for my taste.

This is good for the local area.  You don't have to wait as long as one that is closer to the Strip, but if I'm in this area and crave sushi, this is a good spot to go to.

If you're gonna do all-you-can-eat sushi you might as well come here. The sushi is decent, the service is good and the vibe is great! It's great that you can order hot plates, appetizers and desserts in addition to sushi.

We've come in with our two young children a few times and the staff has always tried to get us comfortable (read: secluded) table which we appreciated.

Not sure if it is poor ventilation or what but I always walk out smelling a bit greasy. Keep this in mind if you plan on going out afterwards.

Not worth it. Portions are tiny, have to order twice, most of their rolls have 'Cajun' rub, not many choices for the price they offer. 
Our server was okay but alittle off. I first ordered gyoza and after getting everything we ordered I told him I never got my gyoza his response was, "I never heard u say that" clearly my girl friend I came with heard me and so I said ok can I get an order he walks away. Then we ask to order more, we put an order in for two more rolls, waited 10 mins he comes back and asks if we wanna order dessert so we order that and he brings them over so me and my friend look at each other confused bc we ordered two more rolls and he clearly didn't put that order in so we just paid and left. Totally by wort it and I recommend trying to ignore that server never even got his name! 
Yama on flamingo and Maryland is the best ayce sushi too bad they don't stay open late or we would of gone there!

We thought we'd try this place instead of going to our usually sushi spot, what a mistake that was! The service is terrible, we had a server that was just wondering around like a lost puppy. Our waters were empty on several occasions and I had to ask twice how much longer it would be until we got our sushi and then was given the confused "let me go check" look. Also, we were told they only did half rolls at the bar, which makes no sense! The sushi was mediocre at best. In a town full of great places to eat, skip this one and go somewhere else.

After reading all the great reviews, I came here with high expectations. We got the "all you can eat" sushi. It took us about 30 minutes to receive each order. The waiter didn't bother to check on us unless he had food to deliver. And the Sushi was warm. I've had way better sushi at other places then what we we're served at Oyshi. And the oysters we're only 2 per customer. So don't expect all you can eat oysters. We stayed about an hour and 45 minutes at Oyshi. Half of the time we just sat there looking around for our waiter to come by and refill our drinks. The best thing on the menu we're the baked mussels.

This little sushi treasure is not at all far from my home right down Rainbow. They have one of the largest sushi menus I have seen in Las Vegas and every roll on it is a winner in my book. It has been a while between when I went and when I am posting the review so I don't recall any specific roll names, I just know everything we ate, was excellent. The atmosphere is awesome and on the wknds they are open late. We love this place and are soon to be regulars.

Love this place! It's so close to my house too which is a plus. I always get shrimp tempura rolls at sushi restaurants, and here they have a whole shrimp tempura roll section on the menu, with different toppings, sauces, meats, etc. Thumbs up!

Dislike!!!! I don't even know why I even bother coming to oyshi's anymore. I gave them so many chances & I swear this is the last straw. I think I have given it so many chances because it's so close by my house. 

Oyshi problem is waiting too damn Long for  our order.  we get there at 1:45pm, didn't order til about 2pm. our food order came at 2:40pm. talk about annoying & getting super impatient. I feel like the waiters talk so much more with co workers that they don't even care that there are so many hungry people there. & to top it off they never ask for drink refills. never once I got my cup of coke refilled. ridiculous I tell you. I usually can stuff myself with a good amount of sushi, but buy waiting & waiting, my hunger just went away. 

sushi wise, it's alright!! it's not the greatest fish I've tasted. it could be better . only thing good I have to say about oyshi is there ice cream parfait & creme brûlée for dessert. 

I will never go back again. unless my dinner gets paid for!!! otherwise it's just another disappointment.

I'm going to be in the minority here and state I do not like this place. They have a vast selection of rolls, which is great for that type of sushi lover...I prefer a wider variety of nigiri sushi and other items.

Our most recent visit here was a group of 8 and it was terrible. Our server was slow in taking our orders, and also kept messing up. Our orders were either incorrect in terms of quantity and selection, or they didn't arrive at all. The quality of the sushi was average. They didn't have enough teapots (we ordered hot green tea) so we had to WAIT for one to become available. Really.

They added on the automatic group tip that is typical with parties of 8+. What was suprising was that it was for 20% of the bill. We were so anxious to be done with that place, we didn't even bother bringing it up. And just to put things in perspective, our bill listed we ordered 12 items for a group of 8.  So that should tell you we were in no way high maintenance. I cannot stress how terrible the service was. This should not be acceptable, especially in a town that has a ton of sushi restaurants.

I would never go back here again, especially in a large group situation. So disappointing.

This place is poppin on a Saturday night!

We won out last game for the day and wanted to celebrate as a team. 

I'll be hella honest, I wanted to hit that plant based fast food spot around the way. But being the team player (haha get it?) that I am I went along with the plan.

We ate in one of the back rooms that we actually had to customize the tables/set up ourselves because there were a grip of Samoans in a small room haha

My table did not pick the AYCE option but I got a few veggie rolls and the yakisoba which I did not care for but the rolls were really tasty and fresh!

The service was on point. They were bringing rolls out left and right. There were about 4 folks serving us and they were super chill.

One even participated in our mannequin challenge haha

I really like this place. $26.00 all you can eat sushi and hot entrées for dinner...and not cafeteria style where everything is already made for the taking...the food is made to order. It annoyed me that the seemingly easy to make sushi, nigiri, took the longest to be served. The rolls came like clockwork but I had to remind the waitress several times that my sake, hamachi and unagi nigiri hadn't come yet. By the way the unagi was cold and didn't taste fresh.

Living in the Bay Area, this place was a pleasant surprise in terms of quality and price. I will try again before heading back...perhaps a second chance at 4 stars. I'm assuming that there are 5 star sushi places in Vegas, but I would probably pay double the price for less food.

So the beautiful girl I've been dating told me about this place being one of her favorites so of course I had to take her there.  We made sure to sit at the bar because you get excellent service when you do.  The food was amazing and the staff was super friendly and upbeat.  

Tun was the chef making most of our rolls and he even introduced us to the supervisor Nye who offered us some complimentary Sake which we turned down because we were already on our second bottle.  They have a happy hour from 11pm-2am with buy one get one Sake or Beer.  They also had just launched ladies night which knocked down the price for the lovely lady on the All-You-Can-Eat to $21.

We started with the Seaweed Salad before we moved on to the fabulous rolls.  We had the Monster, Japanese Garlic Lasagna, Dragon, Vegas, and Oyshi rolls.  We wish we could have tried more but we were stuffed.  We sat around chatting with the friendly staff and drinking Sake until we had a little more room in our tummies for dessert.

I highly recommend this place for the great food, fun atmosphere, and they play House music.

Very nice restaurant, usually always poppin' so you just have to be patient with their staff. I would recommend going late night if possible. 

Not only does all you can eat apply to just sushi, you can basically order anything on the menu (as many times as you want).

Recommendations: Salmon Nigiri, Sweet n Spicy Pork

Oyshi Sushi Bar Restaurant is definitely a must go! I've been here three times since it has been introduced to me on July 5th of 2014. It obviously hasn't been that long ago and it has already taken my interest and satisfies my cravings! I love their Ayce pricing ($21 lunch/$26 dinner) and of course the all-you-can-eat selections! I highly suggest their yellowtail with pico de gallo, seaweed salad, fresh oysters, and shrimp tempura as starters to prepare you for this sushi selection like Kami Kaze, Dragon, Rock N' Roll, Catepillar, Treasure and etc. Seriously though, this place is amazingly delicious. My only complaint as to why I gave this place a four star instead of a five because customer service can take you a long way and two out of the three times I've been here was a little below fair. It took them almost 20 mins in order to finally give us some attention and take our second order, they didn't refill our drinks unless asked and our wait for our entree was quite some time. Asides that, the food is heavenly mouth-watering and the AYCE pricing is good!

I don't eat rolls with that fancy mayonnaise on, just nigiri for me and the sides. I don't usually do all you can eat but this place is almost always fresh. Almost. They get deliveries every other day so that's why I dropped a star, just for the off day here and there.

Oyshi Sushi is a pretty good AYCE sushi restaurant located in the SW.  After hearing my coworker praising it, I finally hit up the place with a few Meetup folks from Las Vegas and SoCal.  It is the sister restaurant to Soyo Barestaurant in the same plaza, so yes, this is another Korean owned sushi restaurant with some items that has a more Korean flare/flavor.

The restaurant itself is well-lit and trendily decorated, and attracts a diverse crowd of patrons looking for good AYCE sushi at a reasonable price.

The AYCE menu is practically the entire menu (mostly nigiri and rolls), except the sashimi and if I remembered correctly some salads.  They also have expanded their menu, and the new items are printed on the paper place mats, so don't forget to check those out too.  Plus the numerous options available in the appetizer section is more than adequate to round out the sushi dining experience.  There are three special items (uni, ama ebi and raw oysters) that is limited to one order/pp with AYCE, and the restaurant reserves the right to charge you for the food you don't finish to minimize unnecessary waste (standard rules of the AYCE realm).

I Enjoyed:
Sibuya No Rice Roll
New Moon Roll
Vegas No Rice Roll
YumYum Scallop
Ama Ebi and the fried shrimp heads
Surf n Turf
Popcorn Scallops

I Didn't Care For:
Japanese Lasagna (topped with way too much mayo that it overwhelmed and masked the flavor profile of the rolls underneath)
Asian Style Flank Steak (basically a not so good version of the traditional Korean Bulgogi served on a sizzling plate)
Green Tea Tiramisu

Service was good, especially considering that Ted, was our only waiter, and he was looking after our party of 7 plus his other tables.

We were seated in one of the side rooms with really comfortable seats, so it was extra relaxing.

Ambiance: 5/5  Great vibes.
Service: 4/5  For a busy night, our service was still great.
Food: 4/5  Overall, I think it is pretty good for AYCE.
Price: 4.5/5  Very reasonable.
Parking: 5/5  Never been a problem finding a parking space when I come to this plaza.

4 Stars!

Not too bad. But not my first stop if I have a craving for Japanese. The rolls aren't that great. Or it could just be ones that we ordered. The service is great though. So that's a plus. Very polite and always askin if we needed anything. I would come bavk again but order something diferrent everytime until I find the right one.

This place used to be great but it has completely gone down the drain over the last few years. I will never come again unless the  food quality starts to improve. The rolls are 80% rice and barely any pieces of good fish. The worst part is the smell. You leave there with your hair and clothes smelling like you just hung out next to a deep fryer for an hour. They really need to fix the ventilation problem. It's too bad because it used to be a great neighborhood option
Great menu, and the food is fresh!  We live around the corner from this place so we hit it about once a month.  The prices are reasonable and we always end up eating too much.  HIghly recommend!

I used to love this place but after coming here last night I've lost all hope in this place! 

I came with a party of 6 all hungry and ready to eat.  I ordered the lobster fair and love affair .. Which I got about 25 mins after I ordered.. Once I got that me and my friend both ordered the surf and turf (which after 40 mins we never got so we just said f**ck it) our waitress was pretty much non existent the only person we saw was Stephen the server who was a complete douche every time we asked him if we could order he gave us the biggest attitude and said what do u want? One of my friends said to him" well if u don't wanna take our order can u send our waitress" who came to our table 20 mins later at this point we all order the ayce and only got 2 rolls each after 2 hours of not eating we were fed up ordered dessert that took another 20 mins to come out so after that we asked to talk to manager... Andy came out listened to our spiel and look uninterested and walked away ..not really say shit to us.. So we got out bill they took off ONE ayce and ONE sake without an apology or even an explanation...  Management and staffing need a total re-training you guys are all unfriendly and obviously don't want anyone's business .. We won't be coming back

I was regular here but, probably won't be back again :( my waiter kept forgetting to bring things and i didn't have anything in order for me to eat sushi like chop sticks and wasabi and little stuff...food wasn't that great this time either I've had fresher sushi here before and it's right next to my house so it sucks but, service was bad & food was bad so, good-bye Oyshi!

Tried ayce sushi for the first time here. It did not disappoint!

The servers are attentive, but the food sometimes took a ridiculous amount of time to come out. I also think they forgot some of the rolls we ordered which was somewhat irritating but we just ordered again.

Get the rolls! The fish to rice ratio is awesome. The rolls are smaller than you'd expect though so don't be afraid to order lots. The gyoza and poke bowls are delicious.

Fish was fresher than I would have expected which was a pleasant surprise. They have oysters on a half shell as well. And uni!!! One per customer but still great.

The green tea creme brûlée was awesome. Tons of matcha flavor. Don't bother with the  green tea ice cream though - worst green tea ice cream I've ever had. Also don't bother with the yakitori it was disappointing.

Overall it was a successful first time for ayce sushi. I'd come back here again when I'm in Vegas.

This sushi place is both mine and my husbands #1 choice! We are both huge sushi lovers, and have tried many sushi places and this is by far the best one. We start of by getting an appetizer each and 5-6 rolls and a dessert for each and our bill always comes out to less than $60! Def worth every cent! Music is great, staff very friendly the whole atmosphere makes us keep going back! Makes it very hard to want to try a new place.

this is one of my favorite all you can eat sushi places in vegas! i always have oyshi cravings every time i crave sushi... i love there oyster shooters in the all you can eat. Most sushi places don't offer that.  The ambiance is pretty bumpin... they play good house music that keeps you going. The rolls are phenomenal and satisfies my cravings till I'm about till I'm about to fall over. Dessert is great i always order the green tea ice cream parfait *drools* Price is $26 for dinner and lunch is about $21 before 3:30pm...

This is our absolute favorite place to eat sushi! Great atmosphere, friendly staff and a great variety. You absolutely can't beat they're all you can eat price. The bonsai is my favorite. The only downside that I see is the wait is sometimes long but with food this good, it's worth it

I dined here for the first time last week.  I was in town visiting some friends and family and went to this place with a large group.  i read the reviews here and thought this would be a great place to try. Especially with the $21 all-you-can-eat sushi for lunch.

The servers were prompt with taking our orders.  Our table was the second to place orders so I thought we would get great service...NOT!  I ordered a cucumber salad for an appetizer and three sushi rolls (rattlesnake roll, crunchy scallop and yellowtail trio).  Well,  it took OVER 30 minutes for my cucumber salad to arrive.  And I had to say something TWICE to the server before it came out.  By the time I got my appetizer just about everyone else in our group had already received and eaten their sushi rolls.  Why did my little cucumber salad take so long to arrive? Did they have to plant the seed and grow the cucumber?  My brother-in-law sitting next to me even got his sushi roll before I got my appetizer.  That was strike one!

Now for strike two - I had to remind the server that I hadn't received my sushi rolls.  This was after everyone else was pretty much finished their rolls.  So even after I reminded him it still took another 25 minutes to get my rolls to me (Yes I was timing everything).

Strike three - I get my sushi rolls. Luckily I wasn't dying of starvation because some others in our group were able to share their rolls so I was able to eat a few pieces while waiting for mine. One thing I noticed was that most of these specialty rolls had this stupid sweet chef's sauce drizzled all over. I don't mind this sauce as its great on dragon rolls.  But this caused everything to taste the EXACT same.  And this sauce was TOO SWEET.  It really killed the individual flavors of the fresh ingredients inside each roll.  My brother couldn't stomach it.  And when I finally got my rolls two of the rolls (crunchy scallop and rattlesnake) were DRENCHED with the sweet sauce.  And the yellowtail trio roll was nasty. It tasted sour like they marinated the fish in vinegar or something!

If you like sweet sushi rolls then this is the place for you.  However I will never set foot in this place again!
What can I say...ALL YOU CAN EAT Sushi...its great!  Great kitchen items too.  Service was good, and the California and California-based rolls were out of the world delicious!

Went again yesterday with a group of 7. It seems as if the service gets worse, which is a shame because the food is still great. After we placed our first orders, it took almost 25 minutes for the first items to come out. Again, this waiter forgot a handful of our items and we had to remind him multiple times. One of my friends was really upset because he ordered 5 things from the menu in the beginning and it took 45 minutes for them to bring out just one! Like I said, the food was still great but having to wait what seems forever for your plates ruins the whole experience. They state you have a 2 hour limit, but what's the point if you are waiting for your food for more than half that time?

On a plus side, they did add new items to their AYCE menu; more rolls, salads, and rice bowls. I tried most of the new rolls and they were fantastic!

This isn't a go-to place for me  anymore but it will be if the services quality catches up to the food on my next couple of visits.

Horrible service extremely long wait for our food all the drinks sat on the table empty with a nuclear roll burning through the skin in my mouth I'll never be back be sure to take my business down the street to Kobe or ohjah.

I was really looking forward to eating here the last time I was in town.  I have to agree that the decor is really savvy and modern.  I was disappointed with the quality of everything else about our dining experience here.  We'll certainly give it another try to see if the food and service are any better.
Nice all you can eat menu...watch out for the Oysters not so good at room temp!!
The greeter was rude and unprofessional! She brought 1 Manu for 3 guests. The food quality is not the best . I saw better .

My boyfriend & all his buddies introduced me to this place, and all I can say is amazing!

I love, love, LOVE sushi and this is hands down one of the best places I have ever eaten sushi at. The employees are always super duper nice and accommodating, the food is delicious, and it's in a nice area. We always get the all you can eat, duh!! ;]

I'm from NY so whenever I visit my bf in Vegas, I always come here at least once. Don't forget to order the parfait for dessert!!

I have always enjoyed Oyshi, ever since it opened years ago, I've been a huge fan! It was the first AYCE sushi place I had ever been to. And after all this time, they still serve up pretty yummy eats!

AMBIANCE: 3 - The space is intimate, but at the same time, still pretty well lit. Usually has a good amount of people inside, I recommend calling in advance, especially with a big party.

SERVICE: 4 - Service is okay, especially when you call in a big party reservation; everything came out fast and hot for our bday party celebration! It's also pretty fast seated at the bar.

when you're not at the "party tables", regular service is a bit slow! I really hope they get better, but it's been that way for a while. Also, they charged full price for a kid under 10! Say whaa?! 

FOOD: 4 - I have a like/love relationship with the food. So I'll just tell you my absolute favorite dishes to order: Love Affair, Fresh Oysters, Baked Mussels, Japanese Lasagna Roll, Vegas Roll, Garlic Tuna nigiri, Oyshi Roll, Strawberry Mochi, Green Tea Ice Cream, and the Ahi Poke :) All delish and some of the best sushi around. Though, not a huge fan of all of the nigiri that they serve.

Oyshi is always a fun time for me, so I hope that everyone that has a big reservation or sits at the bar feels the same way as well!
Great service and fresh sushi!!!!!!  Never fails that the freshness of the food is on point and the prices are reasonable. Family friendly. Quick service

Oyshi has been my favorite all-you-can-eat sushi restaurant for a long time.  Great food, great service.  This visit was no exception.  Went after work in a group of 7 around 10 pm.  No problems!!  We ordered a LOT of food...different rolls, sushi, appetizers, all of which were delivered quickly to our table.  Our server, Thomas, was great.  He and his staff kept our drinks filled and our table cleared of empty plates.  I've tried other places for AYCE sushi....and they've been good as well.  Oyshi always hits the mark, though, and they are open late allowing for late night dining.  Except on Sunday when they close a little earlier.  Me and my co-workers will definitely be returning!!!
The AYCE sushi is one of the best I have had. A new favorite of mine

We love it , we go few times every month , it's clean and have fun environment. The food is good and come very fast .
Everyone there is very nice and friendly .

I brought a friend of mine to this, my favorite sushi restaurant, and I could not have asked for a better experience. Although we had to wait 30+ min to be seated, everything was great once we got to our table. Here is a recap:

Service: Awesome! Our waitress was friendly and checked back with us often. Our food arrived quickly at our table (even faster than the times when they were less busy and I sat at the bar), and we were made to feel comfortable by the staff.

Food: Better than ever. All of our rolls were presented with delicacy and tasted great. Even though the place was packed, I felt like the chefs really took the time to prepare the best rolls for us, and yet did not take forever to make our orders.

Quick tip: Do yourself a favor and try the heart attack and the amigo roll. They are out of this world!
I've had sushi from Japan and this is by far no where near the real deal. Blue fin is some what closer to what you could expect in a sushi restaurant in Japan.

AYCE Reasonably priced - stylish ambience and decent service... Huge selection of rolls and side menus so if you like non traditional Japanese sushi/food, by all means, go and stuff your face! I went there for traditional nigiri, so it was disappointing because of the selection and quality. I know they would charge me for not eating what I ordered, so I literally had to shove the last piece of mackerel: it smelled so fishy, I almost puked.

It's good for AYCE sushi. You won't be disappointed. Plenty of room, nice decor, and wide menu. My disappointment is no half orders on sushi like other places. Limited to certain order amounts on certain items. Rib eye was a overlooked and tough. Order it rare to medium rare. They didn't ask so I guess that's my fault. Extra charge for tea. Worth a try but I probably won't be back. Our server Toni was great.

If it wasn't for a stubborn friend, we would have gotten here earlier and avoided a "long" wait.  This friend said take the 95, take the 95, blah blah blah.  Even after the waiter said take the 215, my friend INSISTED on taking the 95.  The waiter probably said: "whatever, dude, get lost and then wait longer and have your friends kick your ass before you eat our delicious buffet".  After another friend looked Oyshi Sushi himself, we found out that we should take the 215 and did so after I got all frustrated driving in the 15 fwy traffic.

In any case, after waiting and getting seated at our table, we went straight to ordering our all-you-can-eat, which includes 2 uni (sea urchin) pieces, 2 amaebi (raw, sweet shrimp) pieces & 4 raw oysters.  Yep, there's a limit on those but you must understand that there aren't that many other places that would even give you these premium sushi pieces.  Just a note on the uni - slightly less fresh than I've had before.  In any case, you get these in addition to their fresh & delicious sushi.  Their salmon, yellowtail, albacore, halibut sushis are great, plus they don't give you as much rice in their sushi as other places.  Their rib-eye teriyaki is also an excellent dish to have.  Their tempura is also very good.  As for the dessert, we all had the strawberry mochi ice cream, which was very good.  All for $25 per person.  Not bad at all.

I only have to mention a couple of cons: there is a 1 dessert limit for each person.  However, you can have all the ice cream you want since this is not considered one of the dessert items.  Plus, I find it just strange that the place is so huge and yet they waste so much space & put tiny little tables in the center when you can get bigger tables there to accommodate more people.  Last con... service.  A bit slow.  It was a really busy night, but I'm still surprised that they took more than 15 mins to take out raw food.  There was a 2-hr limit, but I don't think they pushed this limit all too much.

My coworkers and I went here after shift .. we arrived 12:30am, we were told that last call is at 1am. They were going to close early that day. (Last call is usually 1:30am).. anyways, the reason why my friends and I went there is because one of us had a birthday. But the birthday boy was running late. He arrived after 1am, (past the 1am last call for that day) but they still took his order which I thought was kind of them to do. We didn't finish our food, but we only had to pay for two rolls extra. Again, that was a nice surprise. I was expecting to pay WAY more for the leftovers. I was highly expecting them to be mad or to show sings of irritation because they ended up not closing early and instead closed at the regular time of 2am. We were one of the last two groups there.. They were very accommodating throughout the whole time. Our server, Tony/Toni, was very friendly. She was very nice and always smiled throughout the whole dining experience. I think she was the one that recommended the 'love affair' which was really good!!! Anyways, during dessert, one of my friends joked around saying they were going to bring the birthday boy cake, but said it only as a joke. He said 'just kidding' and mentioned it was our friends bday which is why he said that. Tony/Toni asked if it really was our friends bday and later she came out with a green tea looking cake. I was very happy with the service !! The food was really good, but for me, service is important.. If a restaurant has good food, but really bad service, I would most likely not go back. Well Oyshi had good food AND great service! I am sold. I will be going back here soon! :)

We've been here multiple times, probably 5+ times with good results. My husband and I went yesterday and things just tasted off. I ordered the teriyaki beef roll and wow it was really disgusting but you know if you don't finish it you have to pay for it. I choked down two pieces, it was horribly nasty. Also at the same time I had a baked roll with shrimp w/crab and lobster on top. The crab was super fishy smelling and just didn't taste right. I should have sent it back but our waitress was never at our table. Twice we had to have one of the guys who brings out the food go get her. 
I've been in and out of the bathroom since we got back last night and needless to say I think I got food poisoning. After this experience I'll never go back!

Food quality was tasty, but the rolls have too many layers of rice! Service was disappointing, the waiter delivered my drink holding the rim of my cup - gross! The menu didn't have the correct pricing, so I was over charged, when I got my bill, I questioned it and I was challenged - I pointed out their error was told "it's already in the system, I can't change it" - Bad customer service.

I've eaten here twice now; both times were all-you-can-eat.  I absolutely loved it the first time.  The second time failed to live up to my inflated expectations.  To summarize the Oyshi experience: good sushi in a nice atmosphere with unpredictable service.  Some items come out after the appropriate amount of time while others take an inexplicably long time to arrive.

The best all you can eat Sushi! Customer service is excellent and the food just kept coming! Their Salmon and Ahi were fresh, and all of the rolls we ordered were just delicious! We had a 20 minute wait because it was a Saturday night (expected), but well worth the wait!

I did the AYCE (all you can eat) dinner for $27 and I thought it was worth it. The menu is pretty big but there are a lot of items on the menu that is not included in their AYCE meal. On top of that, you are only allowed to get one dessert. One thing that I like about this place is the fact that they don't make their rolls as if it was for 3 people. This gives you room in your tummy to try more items. Service was above average. They never fail to give you the wrong order at least once while you are dining with them. If you're looking to try a new AYCE sushi spot, try this place.

I've been to many sushi places in Vegas and Oyshi by far was the worst.  The all you can eat is for 2 hours which is fine but it took over 20 minutes to get my one simple roll and it wasn't even busy. It also took me getting up and taking my glass to a waitress to refill my glass of water and the sushi was very average, for $27 you can find much better sushi with good service.

It was an unfortunate experience.  We wanted to order the kampachi and the chef advised that he wasn't comfortable serving it - although it was listed on their "specials"  board.  Guess what it really means is this is the fish we really wanted to get rid of.

Rest was just ok at best.

Too bad - so many other places near here so we won't be back.

Lets start off that oyshi sushi is one of those places in Vegas that has really good sushi and appetizers. There is alot of things to choose from and all of there sushi taste hella bomb.com lol. Due to the fact it taste pretty fresh and its tasty. And I love the fact this place is All you can eat for the price. The only downside is the deserts isn't all you can eat. But it's all good after eating a gripload of sushi, all you need is a order of one of there deserts, which they are also bomb diggity lol. I also like the fact that this place is very nice and clean

Now here's is why I did not give this place all 5 stars.  The reason is there service. It's a hit or miss with this place. Unfortunately there is like one or two servers who are freaking awesome as hell with there customer service and always brings food out really quick. I can't really say for the other staff members. It seems most of them got a attitude problem or something when you order and are hella slow. It which is kinda sad. Hope they start changing soon cause its kinda hard to go back when you have a couple of bad experiences with a place.

This was meh. Nothing great about it. The rolls were so small and the fish wasn't that fresh. Service was okay.. The server was getting annoyed because I said I didn't like eel sauce..which was difficult because almost every roll they have is smothered in eel sauce. Not going back

This place has easily become my favorite AYCE sushi joint after Luisa P. invited me to come for her brother's birthday dinner here. I had a bad experience here in 2011 so this was their second chance. Boy have they been delivering! We had one of the VIP rooms all to ourselves for his birthday because we were part of such a huge party. They did a great job of accommodating our big group and even brought in more tables as well as chairs so that we could all be included.

Be prepared to wait! If you plan on bringing a large group, have someone.. or a few someones come early so that you can put your name on the list. Just make sure the majority of your party is there to be seated. I want to say that all 3x I have came (during dinner time), the wait has been about 20 mins - 35 mins.

I love doing AYCE because as long as you eat about 3 rolls, you're getting your money's worth. Plus, it is fun to share delicious food! Make sure you're only sharing with those in your group that are getting AYCE or else they will get charged the AYCE price as well. They have an extensive rules/information outline on their menu.

I think that the service here is really great for them being busy ALL of the time. They were always coming back to check up on us and asked if we wanted to put in more orders. Our tables were never cluttered because different people would swing by and grab our empty plates, plus everyone was more than helpful when we needed anything.

My go-to rolls: MONSTER ROLL: ORDER IT, JUST ORDER IT! Pink Lady Roll. Spider Roll. Dragon Roll. Japanese Lasagna Roll. I need to try even more of their specialty rolls, I am guilt of sticking to my favorites! For appetizers, order the baked green mussels, they're amazing here. Only a few sushi joints can get it right, trust me.

If you know me, then you know that I LOVE white tuna nigiri/sushi. The first time I had it here, it was amazing. The second time was decent. Haha, hopefully it just keeps getting better because I order a lot of those wherever I go for sushi. 

For dessert, order the Green Tea Tiramisu with vanilla ice cream on the side. Your mouth will thank me, lol.

I will definitely be back!

I came at lunch. There weren't much people-- probably 3 tables besides us. Their food was coming in fast, while my sister and I waited about 30 minutes until our food started coming... Really slowly. I'm guessing it's because we look like college students, and they typically don't tip well. When the orders started to slowly come, they kept mixing our food with the table next to ours and vice versa the entire time. It took us an hour to finally get our 5 orders of salmon, eel, and yellow tail nigiri... Well, never coming back here for the super bad service we received.

This place is pretty cool! This is my second time and pretty impressed! The sushi was really good and creative and the sizzling meat dishes are off the hook! Nice vibe and for lunch the $10 special is way too much good stuff to eat!!
Oyshi is a great place to hang out with friends and family during lunch to check out the fun atmosphere.  If you are a fan of sashimi, then this is the place to be.

AYCE sushi!! Apparently there quite a few of these places in Las Vegas, but Oyshi cannot be beat! 

My cousins ordered for us since my BF and I were first timers. Some of the rolls they ordered included the Sunset, Spider, Philadelphia. And of course - lots of nigiri! The ahi belly and salmon nigiri were my faves. 

Finally, dessert! we had the green tea creme brûlée, the vanilla creme brûlée and the green tea tiramisu. All were winners!!

Lunch for us was $22 per person. We went around 1pm on a weekday, which was great because it wasn't that busy. Be warned that the appetizers are not included in the AYCE, so be sure to ask your server what's included. Our server was helpful and gave us suggestions for various rolls and nigiri. However she got busy and would disappear for long periods of time... oh and the hot water machine was broken, so no miso soup or hot green tea :(

Cheers to AYCE sushi!! We'll be back!

Omg...after all these time that passed by and I am back here again ..same problem exists, the long wait to be seated even if we came after dinner time already. It's taking sooooo long for us to be seated and it's only 2 of us...frustrating and disappointing. So if you guys are thinking of coming over here make sure you bring a lot of patience! I tell you the food is nothing extra ordinary eithet. The only reason I am back is because I thought their service has changed. Double thumbs down again so sad :((

From someone that hated sushi, I've learned that's it's all in how it's prepared....Oyshi Sushi converted me into someone that can't get enough now!  The place is always busy, and the crowd is very diverse.  

Waiters are good at suggesting items if you're not too sure, and the menu offerings are plentiful.  Only once did I attempt AYCE....but my stomach wouldn't allow any more after the 3rd dish. But if you can, go for it...very affordable.

Okay, went there for lunch with few of my co-workers, we flew in from los angeles for the all you can eat sushi work for the airlines so this is easy.

The sushi was a hit and miss, some of the rolls were good and some were not. The nigiri sushi was also a hit and miss.

Most of the fish seemed fresh, some seemed like it just came from the freezer and thawed.  

The selection was great you had  a lot of choices in terms of rolls and appetizers

1. when we got there the place was empty except a few couples, but why did the sushi take so long to get, no lie it took like 20 minutes for our first order which didnt make any sense to me.

2. the side orders (appetizers came out really quick. i really believe you can make a meal out of the sides alone. they were really good. like the Asian skirt steak.

3. would i go back and try again , ya i would give it one more try.

So we walk in and see a bunch of servers walking around and eventually one of them comes up and points to our table.  Whatever...
We sit down, order our drinks and our first order..all was fine till then.  After we order, a good 10 minutes pass by while I observed the chefs, servers, and tables.  
There were about 4 other tables and 3 of them were finished.  The one table next to us seemed to be about midway into their meal which seemed like hours between dishes.  They get one dish, finish it, then wait for another 5 minutes for the server to bring their next order. They looked irritated. And so about 20 minutes of watching 4 or 5 chefs looking busy, we get our first order.  After we finish through our first order we order maybe 4 more orders of nigiri. (Which shouldn't take more than 3 minutes) And by then all tables were gone and about 5 people at the bar. So I expected it to come quick. Nope...20 minutes later we get our last order and by then I was fed up with everything. 
There were about 6 servers(why??) and they seemed more excited about talking to each other than even looking to see if the customers were okay.  
Nigiri was like 80% rice 20% fish which you can expect from a Korean run sushi restaurant.  And of course they charge you if you leave rice.  How else would they make money? Not by quality, that's for sure.  
Overall, the worst experience at an AYCE sushi restaurant.  
If you want quality food and service, I'd recommend xtreme sushi.  Best sushi I've had in vegas by far.

Now that the idea of all you can eat sushi doesn't creep me out I had the best experience and a new loyalty to Oyshi Sushi. The ambiance is hip and cool the demographic is everything from older couples to young Hipsters. 
 You don't feel like you are in the suburbs but you don't feel like you are in a Las Vegas suburb either. The service is friendly and fast. The Rolls & Appetizers are made to order. If you throw down @ the Sushi Bar you will no doubt get your money's worth. They have an all you can eat lunch & dinner special. The icing on the cake (har-har) is the desert. Yes, it's true the green tea tiramisu is as good as it sounds. 
 I have to thank fellow yelper Cameron G for the info on this one

Loved this place!!! I ventured here, because it is quite a distance from my abode. I was not disappointed in the least and plan on making the trek regularly in the future. The combination of rolls and appetizers on their AYCE menu is vast. They have the cooked rolls with mayo and crab and crunch that my sister loves and they also have the poke and Cajun albacore that I adore. Service was impeccable and the lunch price at $21 is totally worth it. My nephew ate for $14 AYCE. This is definitely one of my fave AYCE places in town!

They don't put the server name on the check, other wise I would be bragging about how great his service was.  Seated quick and served quicker, although he did not think we got our food fast enough and took care of the first round of drinks.  Great experience, especially after our first stop.

I enjoy coming to Oyshi on a regular basis. The food here is good and pricing is fair for their AYCE. Sometimes I do catch them on an "off" day and their salmon is not as fresh tasting as I would like it. But what I'll do is order their yumyum overload rolls (any of the big ones). As for their desserts, I think they're ok. Nothing too spectacular. I'd recommend coming here for the consistently good AYCE. Be sure to come with an appetite!

We went there on last Saturday nite expecting full house, but the place was only 3/4 full.  We sat at the wide open bar for all-you-can-eat so it's easier to order sushi from the chef. Our first impression was good atmosphere and hip music.

We found the service excellent, contrary to some reviews. Maybe because it was not busy or from over staffing, we were asked "How is everything?" every 5 minutes, even thought we were sitting at the bar.

The food was just OK. We liked the ahi poke, spider hand roll, white tuna, and especially the green tiramisu. On the other hand, we were not excited about the miso soup, bland tasting sushi, water-down soy sauce, light wasabi, and $2.50 xtra for hot tea.

Over all, we thought $67 for two AYCE including 15% tip is just a little higher than most places in town especially for average food.

We might or might not go back.
Great food and good prices. lve never had bad service even when they're jam packed, servers are attentive and prompt. Sashimi platter and Poke are my faves from here

More than half of the time I visit Vegas, I spend the whole time off of the strip. Lately, I've really been trying to find local "Off strip" eateries and establishments. The last few times I've been to town, I've gone to Oyshi Sushi. It's conveniently close to my folks' house. Oyshi has two different set-ups. One is AYCE (All you can eat) and the other is A la carte. I've done both. The service and staff are good, the place is clean, and the prices are average. The sushi is good but not spectacular and the portions aren't as meaty as I'd prefer. Now, this isn't a reason for me not to eat at Oyshi, but yeah, it's nothing to write home about.

Highly recommended from a fellow Yelper and also a dear friend who is a Vegas resident and an expert on ayce sushi bars who even made rotd on such, what can go wrong.  He was right.  This place is awesome.  

The locals know where to eat.  And its not on the strip with over priced and under flavored eats.  Its far away from it HA!

The place is well decorated.  Very modern.  Very clean.  However, you don't get the true, authentic feel of a real japanese sushi bar.  But their ways was cool too :)

Anyway,  their fish was above average as far as freshness.  Their rice was tastey but couldve been a little bit more warmer.    I love the fact that they didn't make their nigiri with so much rice like other places would.  That was a plus:)

I'm not a fan of rolls.  However, my company tonight ordered a few rolls.  I prefer strictly nigiri.  But the ones my friend chose was actually ok.

My friend always takes us out to his spots.  He is totally my go to guy for good eats here in sin city.  He hasn't disappoint:)

Not as good as it used to be. But it's still so busy..! They always seem to run out of uni which is my favorite thing.

Limit one dessert with the AYCE. And my dessert of choice is the green tea tiramisu. Yum! Though the parfait is a close second.

The AYCE price is the same as most places. The items were good, but nothing too special. Service is kinda poor. Maybe because I am usually here with a larger party so we are usually in one of the private rooms. I must say though, the room on the left with the couches is nice, but not ideal for a dining area...

Not a bad sushi place food wise, but service could use improvement. But really nothing special about this place, I don't get why so many people love it here... And I AM a sushi LOVER... well.. a food lover in general. :)
My wife and i have eaten at several sushi places around vegas and we keep coming back here. There is a reason. Creative chefs, great atmosphere, and we have never had bad service.. It's awesome

This place was great.  Great food.  Great Staff.  The thing that impressed me most was how they treated my family.  I went with a friend and their kids so we had a lot of kids, some very small.  They treated them extremely well, explained the parts of sushi ordering culture we weren't familiar with, and were super attentive and patient.  This is how a restaurant should be.

My new favorite sushi bar.

The fish has always been good so far and the variety of what is included for all you can eat can't be beat.

Find me another place that includes green tea tiramisu and chocolate creme brule in their all you can eat menu and I'll think about changing my alliegence.

I am a huge fan of sushi and usually always go for the AYCE option if one is available so I can try many different option. This is the first place I have gone where I was really disappointed. There were flies everywhere and the food just did not have that fresh flavor I am used to. All the items I tried were pretty bland and almost tasted stale. There are better sushi places around so I don't think I will be returning :(

The food was fine, but I just don't get all the hype.  The food is far from complain-worthy, but, why would I eat here when i can go to Kobe Bistro and pay half as much for the exact same fish!?

Kobe is great and is almost always 50% off (they also have ayce).   

Oyshi is good, but quite expensive.

Consistently good food and consistently bad service.. what can I say I am torn.  They have a great menu of rolls, decent ayce prices, their ahi poke is on point, but on the other hand I have had too many bad service experiences from them to count.. For that I would say there is better in Vegas and its worth looking for.
for all you can eat, you can't beat this place... service is great and the ambiance is pretty trendy, especially if they play trance during your dinner... can't beat that...

If you are a fan of the AYCE and westernized style sushi, you will really like this place. 

1.  Service - 5 Stars - This place rocks with service. This is a key at the AYCE places as I think that they will automatically "pace" you with the limited staff and service. However, here, we had numerous people helping, providing us food, taking orders for additions and even the manager or owner (didn't get his name) came out to help.  Very, very nice.

2.  Ambiance - 5 Stars - I was kinda irritated as to why my pals were asking to meet way out here in the middle of where, and it was not a disappointment at all. The table set up is great, nice waiting area, very comfortable flow.  I felt very, very relaxed here and not rushed at all.....

3.  Food Quality - We ordered some real sushi like Amai Ebi with the fried shrimp heads and they were tasty. The Uni or sea Urchin was very flavorful and the texture was spot on.  Then, we had a bunch of westernized sushi that my pals ordered and while I cannot tell you what was in them and the conglomeration of sauces that hid the fish taste, I can tell you that as a food group, this stuff was pretty darn good. I wouldn't call it sushi, I would call it "chop suey sushi".  I give the food quality 4 stars.

4.  Pricing - For AYCE, the price is not bad 21 / 26 per person depending on lunch or dinner.  Many of my favorites don't qualify for AYCE, so I will be going back to clarify this as I did not pay this bill, and so I am not 100% positive. However, in reading the bill, the more traditional and higher quality stuff was not included.  I will check this as I may be wrong.  For now, I give this 4 star.

GK says, check it out!

"Oyshi" is Japanese for "delicious" and indeed, this place is delicious. I used to work nearby and this place would be my default dinner spot when I was too tired to really "go out" on the town. The food is fresh and the prices are reasonable. Service is excellent. 

I've never had anything there that I did not enjoy. The atmosphere is nice for a date. They also have a great all-you-can-eat for a set price which includes everything on the menu except for the sashimi. 

Maybe I'm sentimental, but now that I don't live in the area anymore, I sometimes find myself craving the sushi here. 

If you're looking for food off the strip, away from the traffic and the tourists, this place is definitely worth checking out. It's not too far from the Strip.

1 star?  Why?  2 Words - FOOD POISONING on the night of 11/05/2011

Totally ruined my last date night with my wife before I deploy for the military when you are praying to the porcelain gods hurling with nori blowing out of your nose...graphic I know...


To top it off, the rolls were mediocre compared to Sushi Twister and Sushi Xtreme and the service was slow for the amount of people in the restaurant.  

What are my credentials to be badmouthing this "highly" rated yelp institution?  5 years living on Honolulu and knowing what sushi restaurants are supposed to taste like, but what do I know...uggh worst night ever afterwards SMH

I do love sushi and Oyshi's is good, but the AYCE service leaves something to be desired. Service is very slow, and orders come when the chef decides to prepare them, not when you ordered it.  Orders have been forgotten and errors made repeatedly. Because its all-you-can-eat maybe there's a sense that mistakes don't matter if you accept the dish, since it's all the same price.  

Those complaints aside, the food is done well and isn't oversized and sloppy like some AYCE places. You can tell the chefs care about presentation. I can't think of any food of poor quality there.  

My tips for this place would be to:
1) come with a list
2) order a variety of items at once. When they arrive, order the next batch. 
3) make sure everyone at the table agrees to order in batches, otherwise everyone  will be sitting around waiting for ages until your next lonely order arrives- and that second order could take 30 minutes or more!
4) save room for the tiny dessert. It comes with the AYCE.

I'm giving this place 4 stars. The rolls are really good and they have a variety of different ones to choose from. I think I'm a third done with trying all the different rolls.

Last time I went they were very pleasant and attentive to our drinks and our rolls came out in a timely fashion. (Which I love cause nothing sucks more than having to wait for AYCE. You get full faster.) This experience varied extremely different over my first visit where it felt like they couldn't wait for us to leave!

I can happily say that Oyshi has taken up my favorite spot on this side of town. It beat Nagoya hands down.

Must do AYCE! Definitely worth the price. Not only is the sushi AYCE, but the full menu as well. So you can get appetizers with your sushi. Fish is always fresh, and VERY tasty rolls. good, quick, friendly service, lots of seating, can be busy and a lil loud at times, so call for big groups. But i cannot say anything bad about this place. I'm very surprised it only has 3.5 stars.
All you can eat style dining but what makes this place nice is the decor and friendly staff. Worth the wait for a table at 6:30 pm Sunday September 1st, 2013. $26 AYCE.

What a great meal!  You can opt for all you can eat for $26 or order a la carte.  $26 for all you can eat sushi is an amazing price!  The only thing you can't order is from the sashimi menu and your limited to 1 dessert item.  The menu is abundant and creative.  
We ordered... 
Appetizers
Oysters - so fresh and delicious!
Tuna Poke - mixed with seaweed salad and oh so good.
Sirloin steak teryaki - sizzling right off the hot plate, very tender.
Sushi rolls
Losbter Fair - scrumptious!
My Favorite - scallops, variety of fish, topped in eel sauce.
Yellowtail trio - fresh hamachi mixed with a ginger sauce.
Dessert
Green tea terimisu - to die for!  It's made with marscapone cheese, it's smooth consistency just melts in your mouth!

I've been to this sushi place 3 times.. My first two experiences here were alright.. The all you can eat is at a reasonable price and the rolls were ok. But the third time I came in was this last week.. I was very disappointed.. First it took them forever to seat us and there wasn't a lot of people.. There was no one in line and they only had a few people in the restaurant. Then all around our service was bad. Our waitress took a long time to take our orders and once we were done with a dish multiple waiters and bussers would walk by and they still wouldn't take away our dirty plates.. Eventually the dishes just piled up. Even when they brought new rolls out they wouldn't take our plates away.. Then to top off a bad experience the sushi was subpar if that. We could tell the fish was previously frozen so it took away the flavor of the fish. I was very disappointed.. The whole experience was bad.

The lunch specials here are amazing!! The staff is always friendly and while they're always busy it's never too long of a wait for a seat. There is not a full bar so I docked it a star, personal preference really(not a beer drinker).

Just came here tonight. Our server, Odi, is awesome. We got AYCE, and she recommended a lot of great stuff to us. She also comes back to explain the dishes to us after somebody else serves it; we liked that. Just me and my boyfriend. With green tea and AYCE, bill came up to $58, without the tip. 

We had:
POKE SALAD - 3/5 - Maybe I should've eaten the fish with the rest of the salad because I ate all the fish first. My bad! Fish was so fresh. 
SEAWEED SALAD - 4/5 - Pretty good. 
OYSTERS - 3.5/5 - Pretty good. 
TIGER ROLL - 4/5 - I liked this one, but my boyfriend said it's just alright. 
MONSTER ROLL - 4.5/5 - We both liked this one. 
SHRIMP SKEWERS - 5/5 - Great. I like the sauce, and the shrimp is delish!
ASPARAGUS - 2.75/5 - My boyfriend said he didn't like meat wrapped around it. Ironically, that's the only thing I liked about it. 
SURF AND TURF SIZZLING PLATE - 3.75/5 - I like the shrimp, but the beef was just alright. 
UNI - 4.5/5 - First time having Uni. It was delicious! We would've ordered more if we weren't getting full already. 
LOVE AFFAIR ROLL - 4.75/5 - We both loved this one. But my boyfriend later complained it was sweet, which I completely didn't understand because I didn't think it was sweet. 
GREEN TIRAMISU - 5/5 - I like that it's not too sweet. It's perfect ending to your meal. It melts in your mouth. We love this one. 
CREME BRÛLÉE - 5/5 - We also love this one. The server said they got reviewed as having the best creme brûlée in the city. It was really good. The glaze is delish, but it's also delish without the glaze. 

We'll be back!!!!

I can't give this place a 4 or 5 because the last time my friends and I went here the service was horrible...especially coming from a certain female server. She was slow with our orders and kind of stand-offish. I understand if you are having a bad night but don't ruin it for the customer.

Other than that, the food is great and I have never had any problems with it. The all-you-can-eat price is worth it especially if you know you are going to eat more than one roll including appetizers.

The ahi poke can use a little bit more pieces of tuna instead of being drowned in daikon and seaweed but it is still good.
I liked our server Min. She anticipated our needs and was attentive. She got everything we needed.

I have been going to this spot for a couple years now and the food and sushi chefs never disappoint. The last two times I have come in, the hostess has skipped my guest and I and has seated people who came in after us first. When it happen the first time I contributed it to it being busy. But when I came in Friday night, it was pretty slow. We gave our name to three different hosts that came to the podium. We even just asked to sit at the sushi bar. They needed to clean it and they would seat is is what they said. Well another couple that walked in ten min after we did came up to the podium and the girl sat them at the sushi bar first.  When we finally sat, I told the girl that this is the second time it is happen and she looked at me in disgust laughed and went back to the podium. Hungry and wanting to just hang out with my room mate, I let her finish her shift as I enjoyed yummy sushi and laughed with the chefs.

BOMB food for all you can eat.  You don't have to lower your standards because it's  AYCE.  It takes some time for them to bring out your food, so do yourself a favor and put in a couple choices so there's a steady flow of sushi coming.  There's so many good ones, I can't pick a favorite.  Be patient, cause they do tend to get backed up.

The AYCE sushi is great! The sushi rolls taste amazing, my personal favorite is the Nuclear Bomb and the Love Affair! Small appetizers and spicy sushi bowls are included as well as a specialty dessert. Get the green tea tiramisu, you can make all the other stuff in your kitchen and it tastes amazing. 

Although the food is great, service is baddd. I'm pretty sure our server forgot the entire entree for my friend, as his food didn't come out until we were very much done with ours, and the rolls were not very difficult to make. Some servers took their sweet time just walking around the place with an FML look on their face. Overall, the food was great which keeps me coming back, but I definitely have to tolerate the service.

Today was my second time visiting this sushi place. First time I was there, I wasn't too impressed. But I came back again today, and oh boy.. I completely changed my mind about this place.

My family and I had shrimp tempura, baked mussels, heart attack roll, salmon roll, california roll, oyshi roll, lasagna roll, yellowtail nigiri, salmon nigiri, white tuna nigiri, and the vegas roll. Everything that we ordered was completely delicious. I really appreciated that the sashimi slices for their nigiri were generously thick. The fish to rice ratio of the nigiri was perfect. Not too much rice.

Only reason why I gave it a 4 is because the service was kind of eh. And I really didn't like how my 3-year-old was $16 for AYCE. My daughter doesn't even eat much sushi at all. I like sushi places that have children 5 & under free. So those two would be my only reasons as to why they don't receive 5 stars. 

Minus the cons, I think this place is a very decent place to eat sushi. I would go back. Not often, but if I'm ever in this side of town & craving some sushi.. I'll definitely stop by.
Went there for the AYCE and the food was really great. They even made something for my vegetarian girlfriend. Service was good too. Overall, had a great experience..

Hands down my favorite All You Can Eat sushi in Las Vegas. Always enjoy myself here with the friendly service and excellent rolls. The nuclear bomb roll is so delicious if you like your rolls more on the spicy side. I also love how I can finish off my meal with a Creme brûlée, which is included in the all you can eat.

This is some seriously good sushi! And they are super quick!!! 
The heart attack roll is a favorite! 
The AYCE is soooo worth it!
Always able to get a reservation when I need and food is absolutely delicious. Favorite ayce sushi restaurant by far!
Thank you Vince for being our server... Excellent service and I'm so stuffed; all you can eat sushi....

UPDATE: 5-28-08: Went back 4 times since review every time was awesome. We even had the AYCE at a table instead of the sushi bar and the service was great. Before our rolls were done our server got our next order. This place impresses me every time.
i like here so much . good service and good food. very fresh. sever is very nice. i like here's dessert too.

I'm not from Vegas but today marks my 3rd time coming here and I look forward to making it a tradition each time i'm in town. This place is awesome. It's a bit of a drive off the strip, about 10 minutes but well worth it.
It has a nice ambiance perfect for a date or a night out with the girls. There were quite a bit of families there also. 26 dollars ! All you can eat. I've been to many AYCE sushi places and they always give you fewer choices and just the basic appetizers and maybe a green tea ice cream for dessert. Not this place. They have a huge selection of rolls. They are so delicious. Ummm. They have so many appetizers to choose from. If your a meat eater you will appreciate it because they offer a lot of meat dishes. Last but not least if you have room the dessert is heavenly. They have creme brulee, green tea tiramisu, berry parfaits and one other that I cannot recall. 
All this for 26 bucks. It's unbelievable that you can get all this and still have great quality. The only negative thing I can say about this place is that on Friday and Saturday nights it gets busy so you may have to wait a while for them to come back and get your 2nd orders. This still doesn't deter me from giving them 5 stars because the servers are really helpful and cordial when they do come back.

Really bad service. We ate AYCE here, had to wait almost 10 min between orders. We had to watch verities of different sushi and rolls going to other tables while we sucked on our chop stick. Even after they apologized same thing happened. We got tired of it and asked for the check, what a surprise they forgot to bring us the check also. We ended going up to them with the money and paid for it at the register. Manager, who was doing absolutely nothing didn't even bothered to offer an apology.  Tip for people that wants to go to this restaurant, make sure you are already full.

This place has the best sushi! I usually go all the way to a kona grill to eat but I have this place a chance cuz it's closer to where I live now and omg... it's amazing!!! Highly recommend! I gave 3 stars because the service sucks. They don't listen. They forget half your order and when reminding them they act like it's such an inconvenience to have it fixed. Other than that, the food is great!

I love this place ! I am a Sushi fanatic, and quite picky about my Sushi, when my son and I went to Oyshi, we were quite impressed with the friendly staff, the fast service, and the fresh Sushi ! This place is 5 stars to me and I will continue to recommend them to all my friends ! They are really busy so be prepared to wait a bit, but well worth it !
Kellyann

Great AYCE. More of a sushi fusion restaurant. Great place to take friends new to sushi. Their rolls are unique and the menu is very easy to read. The atmosphere is modern. Service is great 75% of the time. We have had a few servers that are slow and inattentive, but if you let management know they are very nice. I love the green tea tiramisu! Delicious.

Wow...I didn't realize that I haven't done a review for one of my favorite AYCE sushi joints.  Anyway...here it is:

Located on the southwest side of town at the corner of Rainbow and Robindale.  Plenty of parking.  Customer service is a bit lacking compared to when they first opened but I'm sure it's cause they always have a full house.

Reasonable price for AYCE at $21.00 for lunch and $26.00 for dinner.  They have a wide range of menu options which includes appetizers, sashimi/sushi, signature rolls, entrees, kids menu, and my favorite...desserts.  They also have food options for vegetarians.  

There are private dining areas for a more intimate experience with seating from 5-20+ people.  The smaller private room seats about 5+ people and has couches for seating and a tv, so while you are dining you can chillax, enjoy your food, and be entertained by the tv.  The larger room can seat about 20+ so it's ideal for larger parties but there are no couches, just regular seats, however, there is a tv.

This is my absolute favorite place to visit! Best sushi in town for a reasonable price. They have some creative rolls that are worth Atleast one try. My favorite is snow mountain and japanese lasagna! Only complaint is they had amazing music playing old school RnB and hip hop, but now theyve resorted to boring radio music. Kind of ruins the ambiance for me but food is good

This review is well overdue. 

AYCE here is great - we were so impressed by everything we ordered. 
We sat at the bar.
 Thick cuts that melt in your mouth. 
Fish or meat.. execution was perfect. You can't go wrong with any dish you order here, I really can't say that one was my favorite. I love them all equally. 
Service was friendly but not overwhelming. We will most definitely be back to try other items on the menu when we are in Vegas..  I can't wait!

TELL ALL YOUR FRIENDS: Best and freshest sushi place in town!  If you can splurge for all you can eat It Is definitely the way to go!  Super selection-The yellowtail and garlic tuna are amazing!  Fresh everytime  and melts in your mouth.  Top 5  favorite rolls - I think what makes these so good is the eel sauce (slightly sweet):

1) Atomic bomb (kind of a sad name for a japanese roll but I digress) - spicy jalapeno on top and siracha
2) Monster roll - huge but has all the goodies 
3) Simply shrimp- light and sweet
4) Red dragon- spicy tuna roll sweet and spicy yum!
5) Tiger roll - similar to red dragon buy with shrimp tempura added

Just tried their hand roll last night - They have a killer shrimp and avocado one. Not on the menu but they'll make it for you. 

Appetizers:
Seaweed salad
Excellent tempura-always fresh and hot never oily
Surf and turf-steak and shrimp appetizer. One order enough for two people to share

Desserts (all you can eat is one dessert per person)
Mochi of course!!
Yogurt parfait is big, especially after a large meal, but very tasty

Some negatives:

Oyshi can get really busy.  They do take reservations and have two private rooms available.  Also, not a big fan of the "baked sushi" although the california crunchy roll is pretty good if you like baked.

All in all, this is my favorite sushi place in town and really hard to beat.  This place is a "must" for any yelper!

I am still in love with this place!! Since it was just me and a friend, we opted for first available seating Nd that ended up being at the bar. It's a while new environment when you sit at the bar! If it's just you and a friend, I recommend sitting at the bar. If it's you and your family or a large group, stick to a table. But I do recommend experiencing the bar when you can. 

By sitting at the bar, you are face to face with the sushi chefs. You may order your rolls directly from them and if you are daring, you can just have them make rolls for you without necessarily going off the menu (AYCE guests only, I'm guessing). Since it was the first time sitting at the bar for both of us, we didn't know that was possible until we had already ordered the world and we were just about bursting at the seams. We did try a fatty tuna sushi though which was basically made with tuna belly. It was sooooooo good!! 

We also had a bottle of lychee sake. It came in a wine sized bottle, but we decided to take shots of it. It was so yum and it basically tasted like juice. Which is dangerous because it had the same alc vol as wine, and my friend and I finished the bottle like it was nothing! 

Here are a few things that I think would be great to keep in mind while you're here: 
-if you and a friend are looking to hang out, enjoy great food, and be social, definitely sit at the bar and have the chefs make you whatever your heart desires 
-it's all you can eat, so definitely come here with an empty stomach and be prepared to eat the world! BUT...on busy nights, the wait can be awhile and if you come here super hungry, once you're seated, you'll want to order everything at once! This may not be a good thing, cuz if you're anything like us, you'll stuff your face and be done within 30 minutes. 
-if you're paying with multiple cards, make sure the person taking your payment knows what exactly is going on what card. Although  we thought that we were clear in our instructions, she still managed to charge the wrong amount! (I'm not sure if this girl just wasn't paying attention or just wasn't having it because it was so busy, but I remember she was also being a bit rude when she was calling people for their tables)

Chef Ivan is our favorite! Always a great time when we come for dinner. The food is always delicious and he is always attentive no matter how busy it is. Tried the quail with ikura and it was pretty good. I didn't even have to order it because he heard me asking the waiter about it. 

Mono is always great too! Best waiter! He is always giving excellent service and even recommend the quail with ikura. 

I gave a 4 because there is always a waiting time when we come. Usually the waiting estimates around 30 min or more but it is understandable as the food makes up for it!

4.30.11 I definitely enjoyed the atmosphere, it was cute for a huge restaurant. It was dim, but not to the point where you can't see anything. I really like their sushi bar it's really big.
