The tables in the restaurants are nicely spaced so you're not rubbing elbows with your neighbors. I'm not used to Japanese Restaurants that can accommodate several large parties. They had two private rooms and we were in another area that was semi-private. There were 9 of us and we sat comfortably. I really like the painting they had against the wall in our semi private area. It was actually the only painting I saw throughout the restaurant. 

I have never eaten at an AYCE sushi in Las Vegas away from the strip so I was super excited. I ordered their Agedashi tofu and it was so Salty! Stay away, ha ha. I was disappointed but quickly got over it when I tasted their poke salad. I remember ordering the Kimono Roll, Yellow Trio and dessert. I had more than that, but I was so amazed how refreshing everything tasted I was too excited to remember to write it down. When I ordered I stayed away from tempura or anything baked. I was not going to get full off that, I wanted fish. Their sushi was fresh and I especially remember the salmon handroll, it was perfect. I really enjoyed their food, although the oyster was okay and their uni really looked like it needed a makeover. 

Their Service was super duper good, although for some reason I was the last one to receive my order. That made me the last one to eat the desserts everyone was done while I was still waiting. Ha ha. Do not pass up on ordering their Mochi Ice Cream. Doesn't matter if you're full and your fly is about to pop, still order their dessert.

So overall, next time I will definitely come here for their AYCE! Their selection of rolls for their AYCE is plenty, not like other places its mainly filled with baked and tempura stuff. This one had plenty of raw fish in their rolls. Just the way I like it! 

Don't be a fool and miss out on this wonderful meal..

I've been here a total of 3 times for the dinner AYCE.
1st time:  pretty decent, will come again
2nd time:  hmmm...not as good as I had remembered it
3rd time:  nah, won't be coming back for AYCE, but for a la carte item.

There were a few items that my friend and I ordered that did not taste right.  The raw oysters were strangely bitter.  We let the kind manager/owner know about this and he apologized and took the plate away immediately.  The uni that came out had an off yellowish-brownish color.  I've had plenty of uni to know how it supposed to look, but this was slightly different. 

The star of the night was the agedashi tofu.  Yum yum yum.  Was quite tasty.  Another highlight of this AYCE meal is the fact that you can still chose a scoop of icecream along with whatever dessert you want.  I chose the green tea icecream and the creme brulee.  Was yummy.

The chefs, staff, manager/owner are all super friendly and the service is quick.  Food however...aight.

I'm just waiting for someone to post pictures of their sick mural so I can go get a life sized tatoo of their samurai looking warrior on my back. 

Their private rooms are comfortable and my party of 5 was diggin it Yakuza style watchin the Celtic's/Cav's game while listenin to some Alice DJ in the background. 

They have this Korean mouthwash dispenser in the bathroom that probably serves shots of sake/soju or something because that mutha was empty when I tried to hit it up for some mouth smell good. 

$21for all you can eat bomb ass sushi rolls! The rolls weren't janky all lopsided and crooked either. The fish was fresh and I know if they had one of these in the bay area that it would be soo popular.

I am so shocked that this place only has 3.5 stars! I am normally not a fan of "all you can eat" anything...but Oyshi is an exception. 

AYCE sushi includes their ENTIRE menu- including sushi, sashimi, dessert, hot foods, and all rolls. The real kicker...it's only $28. I live in CA but each time we go out to Vegas we stop at Oyshi before hitting The Strip.

Quick tip: If you sit at the bar they permit you to order half rolls.

This place is right next door to my house.  We came here when they first opened up and fell in love with it ever since.  Every dining experience has been excellent - the service is always friendly and attentive and food perfectly cooked/prepared.   We did a few ala cartes but most of the time it's always AYCE, both lunch and dinner.  Heck if they had breakfast I would do that too.  

Most sushi places have a few items that are exceptional and a few not so great, but everything here range from good to phenomenal.  

Let me talk a bit about their sashimi items.  I love sashimis and this place has some of the best sashimis i've ever eaten.  Their Seared Albacore with crispy onion in ginger sauce is oh so heavenly.  The only  problem is their sashimis are not included with the AYCE menu and that's understandable because the sashimis are pricier.  Another one is the Yellowtail sashimi with jalapeno and ponzu sauce.  OMG this melts in your mouth and it should be called screaming orgasm for your mouth!  amazing stuff!  How about this "Tuna sashimi with shaved daikon in a chef special sauce"? Everytime i finish this plate I want to lick the sauce off the plate but there's always people around me.  

Now for their rolls.  They make the typical rolls like Rainbow, Dragon, Spider, Dynamite and Catepillar taste amazing.  Flavor explosion with every bite.  They have a few rolls that are wrapped in thin soy paper sheet that are not as filling as the ones with rice.  Some days I do low carb and i would order a bunch of these.  Pink Lady and Oh My Heart are my favorites.  If you like scallop make sure you order the Volcano, baked scallop with yum yum sauce.  

Side dishes and appetizers are very small when you order with AYCE and that's a good thing cuz you just want to taste the variety of stuff.  Finish off with some mochi's and you can die happy.

This place is one of the best ayce sushi places in vegas. In the past I would go to Yama, but I recently moved to south vegas and wanted something closer. My friend and I tried Oyshi and I think this place gives Yama a run for the money. Things that stood out is the raw oysters and surf n turf.  All the sushi was good for ayce style, and the rice was in the nigiri wasn't hard and didn't fall apart like other ayce places. The negative aspects was that the service was a little slow for me, and they brought me one piece of yellow tail that looked like it had been sun bathing out back for the afternoon. Otherwise this place is great, and I'll be returning soon.
Great service and great food. First time at Oyshi's tonight! All you can eat ice cream! Hell yeah

Ahhhhh, Oyshi, my favorite sushi place.
I don't really like raw fish and I looooveee Oyshi's large selection of baked.
Not too expensive so far as sushi goes, and it is very good quality.
I've been coming here for years and love it!

Love this place! Been here over a dozen times. Staff is wonderful & attentive. Sushi is fresh. GREAT AYCE !!!! Great atmosphere with private rooms for party's. Expect to wait for a table during peak times. I'm not the only person who will go out of my way to eat here. The Mochi Ice Cream & the nuclear bomb roll are my FAVS... Num num.

Lousy service, mediocre food, dry saba, had to ask for tea 3x, no half rolls, "tip" already added into the final bill, too cold in the side room and no way to adjust. 

Why did I ever come here more than once?

It's true...I have fallen hard for yet another sushi place. AYCE, super unique rolls and here's the kicker...a very cool vibe! If you've ever been eating sushi and thought to yourself, this would be so much better with some Tiesto playing, this is your spot!

First off, don't be discouraged by the wait. They're busy and you should be happy for them. It's usually no more than 15 minutes and you can occupy yourself by practicing new dance moves. We always sit at the sushi bar and the service is friendly and fast. I once saw no less than 6 sushi chefs hustling in that narrow space so you'll be well taken care of. 

On to the tasty stuff. What I like most about this joint is if you like deep fried, baked, raw, hot, mild, funky they've got you covered. I hate places that are all cooked or all raw, you've gotta people please!  From the freshness of the fish, to the sauces they're paired with it's all a win. Their all you can eat knows almost no bounds so if you're not busting at the end you've done something wrong. To top it all off the strawberry ice cream they serve is surprisingly top notch, little strawberry swirl through it and everything. 

They also have 2 private rooms for large parties and I know this because I spied on them when I was there like a creeper. Try this place out next time you're in the southwest. We were happy to find it on our side of town and not have to venture to Sushi Blvd aka Eastern.

first time here & loved it!!
probably one of the best all-you-can-eat sushi places I have ever ate!
the only down side is its a bit pricey!! 21 for lunch & 26 for dinner.
but you get what you pay for! everything is made & comes out fresh once you order it!

-miso soup
delicious! wasnt salty at all! :)

-eel/avocado roll
not a big fish person...but i have to admit was good! the eel overpowered the avocado for sure.

-salmon with rice 
i dont eat raw fish or anything..but i had half of one piece and it wasnt bad at all!! it looked and tasted fresh! im sure all you salmon lovers would enjoy this very much.

-love affair
shrimp tempura roll with yum-yum lobster with crunch flakes & masago!! this was my favorite roll of the night! I finished the majority of the plate!! 

-crunch scallop
yummy!! taste had a sweetness to it and this was my second fav of the night.

-beef asparagus
delicious!! loved this and i would have eaten more if i wasnt so stuffed!! one of my favorites. simple but great!

-rib eye steak teriyaki
steak was tender!

-asian skirt steak
steak was tender and could taste the ginger like crazy in this dish! in fact, you can taste all the ingredients they used to make this dish, but the ginger enhances a bit.

-agedashi tofu
lightly fried soft tofu in green onion soy sauce! really light and it was phenomenol. I dont think you can ever ruin this dish.

-green tiramisu
sucked!!! never order this.

my auntie & uncle said their creme brulee, parfait is great! their rattlesnake roll is highly recommended!
Sucks. Not fresh.!!.not Japanese style at all. super Slow !! Waitress are like sleeping.. chefs are playing....

OUR FAVORITE SUSHI SPOT SINCE 2009. We've been here a few dozen times, and are never disappointed with the food or the service! The downfall is that wait times can be extensive at times depending on when you go, but average wait is 10-20 minutes... and it's oh-so worth the wait! Lunch is 22$, dinner is $27. (For children 12 and under, lunch is 16 and dinner is $19.) They use fresh ingredients, the food presentation is beautiful, the service is always great and we always leave so full & so happy! ^___^

We like to order:
APPETIZERS:
- Ahi poke
- Calamari 
- Fresh oysters (two pieces per order, one order per person only)
- Dynamite (scallop, shrimp, crab mix, mushroom & onion baked w/ yum yum sauce)
- Baked mussels (5 piece limit per person) 
- Asian skirt steak
- Yakitori shrimp & asparagus 
- Rib eye steak 
SUSHI ROLLS
- Love affair
- Vegas roll 
- Premium spider
- Japanese Garlic Lasagna 
- Lobster Affair 
- Oyshi roll 
- Salmon nigiri
- Unagi nigiri 
DESSERT:
- Green tea berry parfait
- Vanilla creme brulee 
- Green tea ice cream (desserts are one order per customer except for ice cream)

PRO TIP: If you have peanut allergies, you'll be happy to know they do not use ANYTHING with peanuts, none of their dressings contain it and they do not use peanut oil.

PRO TIP II: Also, For parties of 8 or more, 18% gratuity is added to the bill (this includes children and any patrons who are seated at the table, whether eating or not).
Great variety, great price, atmosphere. Best Screaming O I've tried at an AYCE place. Way better service and fish than the Sahara location

Oyshi is our go-to spot for AYCE sushi.  Everyone that works here is super cool and most nights the service is quick, unless they're slammed.  The variety of rolls is good  and they are generous with their sauces, which makes it for me.  They don't offer sashimi on the AYCE menu, but not many places do.  All of their hot dishes are yummy too!  They have specials that are written on the dry erase board on the wall behind the sushi bar.  We like to start with the Salmon Lover's Roll and I like to end on the sweet & cheesy Japanese Lasagna.

It's so close to my house I could walk there, but there's no way that I would be able to walk home!
One of our favorite sushi places in town. Reasonable priced all you can eat and sushi chefs are always super friendly! We love the upbeat atmosphere and music! We will keep going back for more!
Perfect. So friendly and great for our 4 year old son. Love the menu options. We will be back.

I used to love this place but the customer service sucks! We waited forever for our food and it wasn't even busy. I tried to give them a chance... Four chances infact and the service sucked every time. I will never recommend this place to anyone. I'm never coming back here.

Say what?! AYCE for $26?! Yes sir it's worth your whole $26, or if you're going for lunch, it's only $21 but you don't get oysters and who doesn't love oysters?! They have a vast selection of sushi rolls, some of my favorites are the Oyshi Roll which is a baked roll with dynamite topping, spicy tuna crunch, and the atomic roll. But the one thing that is worth every penny is their super white tuna. Have you had super white tuna?! No?! Well, get your butt over here and try it! It melts in your mouth like butter, it's the champagne of fish.. Yes, ahh thinking about it just makes my mouth drool, they top it off with ponzu sauce and it couldn't get any better than that.

Their appetizer list is ongoing and you have so many choices, that's what I like about their AYCE, you have many options to choose from. The calamari is nice and crispy on the outside and a little chewy when you bite into it. The surf and turf is awesome and they just have new meats to pick from that come in a griddle plate (is that what it's called?) it comes steaming hot and on a bed of cabbage and onions YUMMMM! They have a good ahi poke bowl that comes with cucumber slices and seaweed salad underneath, amazing. I could go on, but you really just have to get your butt over there and try it for yourself! Oh yeah, did I mention the desserts? Oh, I haven't.. Well I love their vanilla parfait! They also have creme brûlée, green tea tiramisu, and green tea and vanilla ice cream. Oh goodness, I'm hungry.

The food is great! There isn't anything on the menu that I don't like. Great food and great pricing equals an awesome night. I only rated it 4 stars because of the service. I've been there about ten times and only once did I get good service. I'm sure once their staff is a little more experienced I'll change my ratings to a 5.

Really best sushi in Vegas! Sometimes when I didn't have time to wait cause the wait line  was very long , i tried other sushi bars but honestly i always regret i didn't wait for Oyshi ... Everything is just yummy!

I went there tonight for a take out and it took them an hour to finish my order, plus it took another 15 minutes to be bagged.  I saw my order on the counter ready for bagging, but nobody was minding it.  If I did not asked about my order, it will be just sitting there.  They also forgot to put dressing on my sashimi salad.   Hence, the 2 stars.

Have had mixed experiences with service. Sushi is good but really only rolls with rice , no quality rolls without rice or other healthy options. The rolls we had were good, the spicy tuna is good no matter which roll choose

We waited an hour to get a table, after they told us it was a 30 minute wait. The table next to us arrived after us and left before us. Our table watched the next table get served diligently while we had trouble getting our waitress' attention. Note, our party was starving. When they did bring our food, the waiter's seemed as if they had some attitude. We had a problem with our absentee waitress all the way til we left. We spent about 3 hours in the restaurant. All in all, service was horrible, NOT coming back!!! AND they charged us 18% tip, which is undersrved! Had to ask for our check and walk the bill to them to pay.
Owner shows up late and place couldn't open for lunch, just lost a sushi fan due to lack of business ownership!

I went in recently for a birthday party for a work friend and loved all of the food! We were in a small room so it was hard to accommodate all of the birthday party guests. There were a lot of orders forgotten but with one server on our large party it was to be expected. The food was amazing though! If you are going in with a small party I highly recommend it, but there really isn't much space to have a big party. Other than the space issue everything was wonderful.

When it comes to "All You Can Eat Sushi" you have to be very careful. Low volume restaurants are not able to cycle through the fish making their offerings not so fresh.  The good news is Oyshi is always busy allowing them to offer fresh sushi every night of the week.  There are 2 private rooms, a large dining room and extended sushi bar with a lot of seating.  I highly recommend this sushi bar!

Yeah, the Husband and I are sushi snobs - at least we're upfront about it.  But when you're living in Vegas, the only way to go is to do AYCE, right?  After getting tons of recommendations for this place, we finally got around to seeing what the hype is all about.

All-you-can-eat dinner is $26/pp.  It was pretty busy on a Sunday night with a steady stream of customers (and large groups) coming in all night long.

Like Ned M. mentioned, the sushi rice is only okay...it could be better.  Perhaps that's what put us off already...we had to eat the rice and we weren't digging it.

We ordered lots of nigiri and found the fish to be okay too, some of it was mushy though.  As one friend mentioned, she wished the fish was a bit 'colder'.  Maybe we came on a bad night - but everyone is raving about the fish.  I'm also not too fond of 'sauce' added to my nigiri, and they added 'sauce' to a lot of my nigiri choices.  

They do offer a wider selection of side items like Asian style skirt steak, ribeye steak teriyaki, etc.  And for this reason, one friend prefers coming here over other AYCE places.  I do like their version of agadashi tofu though.

Limitations on their menu include:
* one order of uni and amaebi per person
* limit one order of oysters on the half shell (4 pieces) per person
* limit one order on desserts of creme brulee, mochi ice cream, berry parfait or green tea tiramisu (regular ice cream is AYCE though - plum, green tea, vanilla, and coffee)

Sitting at the sushi bar, service was pretty good.  The manager seemed like he was our main waiter and he was quite attentive.  We thought we were supposed to order our sushi from the sushi chef, but he asked the manager to take our sushi order instead.  He continued to take our orders throughout the night and refilled our beverages too.  There was a gap at one point where our tempura order was forgotten, had to be reordered again, and then had to be followed up on again before we got it.

I can see why this place is popular - there's definitely a mixed crowd and separate rooms for private parties.  The staff are busy and attentive and they definitely recognize the regulars.  They have a lot of rolls to choose from, something that we usually avoid.  Overall, we found Oyshi Sushi to be an average place for AYCE sushi.

After driving by this sushi place many, many times I finally decided it was a good night for take out-i ordered a veggie roll and Alaskan roll.......very disappointed...the Alaskan roll was mainly all rice, hardly any salmon, a sliver of asparagus and a smidge of avocado.  Won't be going back

(I'm a Chef) This place was recommended to me by two people whom i will never, ever take seriously again when it comes to food.    

Plus all the people that say this place is their favorite.. I feel like they are all clueless about food.. the service was ok but everything else was terrible..  

Mochi- tasted like it came straight from sams club.. its filled with sugary nasty goup instead of ice cream.

Ribeye-the beef is most definitely the worst cut of beef you can buy..  indistinguishable from wal mart beef no flavor.. no fat.. terrible thick cuts.. what the hell are they serving it for.. but beef that you would use with teriyaki or take it off the menu.. its not Ribeye!

all the crab is fake.. which is typical for sushi places but this imitation crab again tasted like sams club crap.. 

Tuna.. i don't know what is up with that tuna but I've had a lot of sushi and this tuna tasted like it had been frozen thawed, frozen, thawed, frozen and thawed.. thats the only way i can describe the taste and texture... plus the poke..

Poke isnt really poke.. there was 3 pieces of tuna in it.. rest was seaweed, and cucumber... don't call it poke.. i love poke.. i came here because i was told the poke is great... this was not poke.. and if it was it was the worst poke I've ever had.

Service was good.. Sushi chefs were great..  food is crap.

I have always been a fan of Oyshi Sushi as it took my sushi virginity! I wish the prices dropped to be more comparable to other sushi spots in the area but all one can do is hope. AYCE is the safest bet for a dinner out with a table for two or more. You ensure no one will need to wash dishes in the back if they get carried away with indulging. We all have those dinner friends who have the mindset of caviar budgets but the reality of dollar-value-menu wallets. 

Service is usually a hit or miss. I've gotten service that has made me not want to leave. On the other hand I've experienced servers at this establishment that made me want to request take-out. (which they do offer). 

The draw back for this place is they don't do half orders like other spots. It's also nowhere near the strip. Which is a catch-22. The wait can be timely depending on the day of the week. If it were closer to the strip it would be an endless wait.

Mussels, Love Affair, Lobster Fair, Oyshi Roll, and the Japanese Lasagna are my favorites!

Everything is so fresh here. One of our favorite sushi places in Las Vegas. The service is pretty good, sometimes you'll wait a bit to see your server during times. I would have done 5 stars but they don't offer any military discounts, so 4 stars is still good!
They take too long to bring out food for AYCE and the rice seems like its old. They didn't take our order for a long time. I didn't get my last order. Dessert took forever to come out also.
The food is great, the service is great. Always a good experience when we go. They definitely know our faces and are always welcoming us back. We only get the AYCE and it's always a great experience.

I went here with my Girlfriend last night, as she had wanted to revisit this place for some time, having visited herself once months ago.  I'll start off by saying I read a few reviews below and have to agree with something many have said and that is that you tend to have to wait a bit to get your orders in and then get served due to how busy the place is. My advice come early or come late ;) there open until 2 am Fridays and Saturdays.

We both got the AYCE deal; I think the bill came out to $64 for that and the two cokes. The sushi was fresh and very flavorful. The sauces were amazing. We had the simply shrimp roll (my favorite of the night), a deep fried spicy tuna roll and a few others. I tried something new for me and that was a tuna roll with scallions, which was a more fatty part of the tuna, more subtle and slightly fishier flavor that she did not enjoy, but I did. We finished off with a roll that had garlic sauce and wow that was seriously garlic flavored, so if you are not that into garlic, stay away from anything with garlic sauce. lol

The wait staff was nice, but again it was so busy they were all over the place and we tended to wait longer then I feel we or the other customers should have.

The place was ok and worth checking out if, you are in the area, but if you live across town like me it may not be worth the trip.

The first time I went here with a couple of friends was on New Year's Eve. The AYCE was WONDERFUL! OOOooo so good! My favorite had to be the Volcano Roll! The fish was super fresh and SO YUMMY! The service was also nice as we got to keep ordering in advance and the waitress was very helpful and courteous. HANDS DOWN A WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE FOR ALL!

The ambiance was very nice, but it was a little pricier than i was looking to pay especially for the all u can eat sushi. Its not a bad place to eat; it lends itself to groups well. But i will say, i've only been once and never needed to go back.

Alright this is all you need to know: it's a Japanese AYCE restaurant that's not Japanese. 

We came here for lunch and did the AYCE menu. For $25ish, its a steal of a deal just based on the cost basis of California style sushi at any other restaurant. 
And that my friends, is all we came here for.  If you have read any of my other Japanese restaurant reviews, you know that this is not my cup of tea so please don't unfollow me; the lady wanted to eat Cali style sushi so what the lady wants, the lady gets. 

Here is the fat skinny on this place: if you stick to just the sushi rolls, you will be satisfied. Lets do the math: the average price for a Cali style roll at any given sushi joint will run you about $10 so assuming you eat at least 2 rolls, then you will eat your money's worth. 
The rolls were decent but nothing spectacular. As mentioned previously I prefer the purist motherland style sushi. 

Notable misses for this place:
1. They charge extra for sashimi
2. Most of the cooked food is not very good. The steak did not taste good and the sizzling platter was loaded with onions as fluff. 


The gf was happy she got her Japanese lasagna and spider rolls so all in all an -ok dining experience I guess...
Always good! Friendly staff and outstanding food. Go hungry & get the "all you can eat" special. Parking is a premium so be prepared to look for a spot.

Food is very good and fresh, the restaurant is very clean and open spaced. Only issue is service. Wait staff is polite and attentive only problem is the venue is under staffed. 3 servers for an entire restaurant will cause problems.

Got HORRIBLE food poisoning here. 

So did the whole entire birthday party that I was with. Ate here on a Thursday late night, and started what felt like an exorcism that Saturday. I had to miss work on the weekend which is my money maker and it SUCKED so bad! I've never called into work or left early in 7 years and this did it for me. I've never thrown up so much throughout the whole entire night and next couple days like I did from this place. Holy crap, I will never eat sushi for as long as I live ever again. Thanks for completely ruining it for me. 

Please be careful here. They obviously screwed something up. But do they care? Probably not.

My experience at Oyshi was pleasant. I thought the staff was courteous and got all of our orders right. 

We had all you can eat and I enjoyed pretty much everything I ate. We ate AYCE so we had to pace ourselves or else you will get charged for wasted food.  I would start with the salad and calamari (2 dipping sauces) Some things that I really enjoyed were the Surf and Turf (good steak and grilled shrimp) dynamite roll and monster roll. For dessert I always enjoy a classic creme brûlée. The berry parfait was a berry ice cream Sundae and that was nice too. Only thing I was ehhh about for dessert was the green tea tiramisu cause it tasted like a heavier creamed cake with a very buttery taste. 

Overall I thought it was a nice location with nice atmosphere. Service was fine and good was good. Would I say that is the best sushi place in town? Not quite but I am not disappointed and I would come back again.
Great place to bring family or friends from out of town .. All you can eat appetizers as well as sushi ..!!

Okay so I just left this place about 20 minutes ago. Its okay. The fish was fresh and the service was excellent. The place is nice a bit Japo and a trendy feel to it as well. I could do without the techno music. The one thing i did not really care for was some of the pieces were pretty bland. Although fresh it could of use some kind of sauce on them to bring out flavors. If I go again I will be sure to re-post :)

one of my favorite sushi places! The all you can eat is at a great price. they have a huge selection and always have great specials! The rolls are unique! The staff is always kind. Thought I do have to agree with previous reviews that the service can be slow - my advice is know what you want and order a lot at once! They will bring it over as its ready. Plus we always sit at the sushi bar so you don't have to wait for a waitress to bring it to you :) There is usually a short wait but I've never waited more than 15minutes even on a Saturday night. ... For the price point, you cannot beat it!! delicious! and the atmosphere is very upbeat!

Amazing Service!! Amazing Food!!! The environment is also Amazing! What more can you ask for! If you love to eat sushi and want all you can eat this is the place to go to!! My favorite is the rib eye, poke, and simply shrimp roll! Check it out and you will not be disappointed!!

I've been here three times now because of how close it is to the house. Food is definitely decent here but the service is so slow that Oyshi is almost painful for me to dine at. One time it took almost 15 minutes for me just to get the check and it wasn't even that busy. Service is important to me, but if you have 2 hours to kill on a 1 hour dinner, by all means.

My husband and I eat out a lot and Oyshi Sushi is one of our favorite places, but our ONLY favorite sushi place. Best all you can eat. We get the Ahi Poke, Baked Mussels, Surf and Turf, Chicken Teriyaki, and Miso soup for appetizers. 
The Japanese Lasagna, Atomic Bomb, and Lobster Fair are a must! 


Always busy here so plan ahead. I think it's worth the wait though! 
Happy eating!

I've been here too many times to not write a review.

Service has always been great. Every waiter/waitress that have waited on my party and I have been attentive and polite.  We usually come here for dinner/late night. Our orders were always correct and it comes out pretty quick...I'd say within 10-15 minutes.

We ALWAYS order the ATOMIC BOMB ($11). And yes...it's bomb dot com. We also order the usual spicy tuna roll. Here at Oyshi they make one of the best spicy tuna rolls. Some spicy tuna rolls are not even spicy...but here, there's a great kick to it. 
We've also tried other rolls like Love Affair, Heart Attack ($9-13) and a few others. Didn't really leave a lasting impression. 
A few days ago, we tried the JAPANESE GARLIC LASAGNA and it was yummy!!!! Soooo now I got a new roll added to my usual two.

Can't wait to be back! Never disappoints! =)

Good clean fresh fish lots of specialized Rolls that are very good. Only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is there tables setup and timeliness. Been going here for years definitely needs a remodel or revamp on the setting.

Overall always a good experience.  I'm always ok with coming out here every time someone suggests even though I don't live near by.  They have a good selection that is diverse.  Service is nothing to write about but I'm always satisfied that they get everything to me in a timely fashion.  If there is anything I can  say about this place is that I'm a fan and would always want to come out here if it is suggested.

I've been to Oyshi on several occasions. The restaurant has been really hit or miss. The first time I went with my fiance and we sat near the window, close to the sushi bar. The quality was good and the service was prompt and friendly.

The second time we went we were put in the far corner, probably as far away from the sushi bar as you can get. The quality was still there but the service was terrible. We felt forgotten being so far away and it took a long time to get our first order. When doing AYCE we usually do a first round then inevitably get a second round. With the amount of time it took for the first, we didn't even want to wait for a second round. We left full from the tasty sushi, but disappointed with the service. 

This last time we went was for the AYCE lunch. We sat close to the sushi bar, but it didn't matter. We ordered Miso and Edamame to start. The miso was brought very quickly, but we waited easily 30 minutes for our edamame. The waitress came back during our waiting to take our order for sushi. We placed our order and also asked about or edamame. She clearly forgot judging by her reaction.

The sushi came before our edamame and the quality was poor. The albacore was mangled on the rice and didn't taste fresh. Same with the Salmon. 

The worst part about the last experience is that during our time waiting for edamame and sushi, we saw our waitress through the curtain in the kitchen eating food. Restaurant no-no 101. 

I don't plan on returning. It's disappointing because I like the atmosphere, their selection on their menu (AYCE even includes oysters on the half-shell and Uni!)

On to better places.

Finally got the chance to sample this southwestern sushi spot.

Restaurant design: very modern. Comfortable seats everywhere, very nice lounge with its own TV, huge counters at the bar. One of the largest interiors I've seen. The only weird thing is how low the armchairs in the lounge are. Luckily, we didn't have to deal with that since we didn't fill the table.

Service: consistent pacing throughout the night. Could be because we were the lounge table, but I'll take that versus sometimes being forgotten.

Picks:

Nigiri: everything was delicious through and through, even the tuna. The spicy tuna was a bit overwhelming for my sensitive palate. Smoked salmon special here is superior to Goyemon's special. Uni is the best quality other than when I tried Kaze's AYCE sashimi lunch. There were some issues with seaweed wrappers from different pieces sticking to each other though.
Oysters: no real off flavors and haven't gotten sick yet, so that's a win for me
Baked mussels: solid
Fried calamari: fine
Lasagna roll: didn't notice much difference with the inclusion of avocado, and good quality
Parfait: really, really good. Fruits and crunchy granola made me really happy. Glad I made this my limit-one-dessert-that-isn't-ice-cream-scoops choice.

Passable:

Dynamite: pretty good, but the sesame threw me off.
Surf n Turf sizzling plate: beef strips and shrimp on a bed of onions and cabbage. Not bad, but not great.
Hot sake: average, I suppose. Best part was that it was a Mon/Tues 2-for-1 special.

Pans:

Popcorn scallop: pretty useless.
Amaebi head: brain drained. I feel like they did this as a restaurant-wide strategy to appeal to a more mainstream palate (you can tell by how they let you order yum yum sauce on the side). Would've liked all off the flavors to be there.
Ice cream: while the green tea was pretty good, the vanilla was not that impressive and the texture of both had noticeable ice crystals

Overall, I enjoyed the meal with a few notable exceptions. It's worth the drive if you want a change from your normal sushi spot. I'd probably come back to explore the rolls since we didn't really plumb the depths of that extensive part of the menu.

The pro's fun ambiance, friendly staff, and quick service.

That being said the sushi here was lacking. We ordered the tuna poki, garlic albacore, salmon sashimi, and the screaming orgasm. The poki was mediocre but not bad. The salmon was also okay but once again not the best. The screaming orgasm was way over sauced in a creamy mayo sauce. I couldn't even taste the fish, although I do have to say they cut the tuna well. The worst was the albacore. It was bright red and tasted mushy and off. Needless to say we didn't finish it. I have a feeling if I want to find good sushi in this city I'm going to have to head to China Town.

Wow this place was definitely the best AYCE sushi I've ever had. First of all, the selection is AMAZING and overwhelming. It is a great deal for 21 dollars. Trust me and order the following items and you will be one satisfied customer with your belly about to explode. 

I will start off with the non-rolls food: Must get the surf and turf, ahi poke, sashimi salad, skirt steak, grilled asparagus and beef. There were a few other items that I would like to try next time. There were simpy so freaking many.
For rolls, try the Nuclear Bomb Roll, Lobster Fair, Paradise Roll, and oh what the heck, just try everything!
For desert, you definitely have to try the green tea tiramisu. 

The service was also great and very attentive. They will make great recommendations based off of your tastes. So trust me, if you're in Vegas, give this place a try.

I frequent this place. Not for the sushi.  The sushi is fresh but not super creative. I love that the all you can eat includes the appetizers which I love! The shrimp yakitori and sizzling plates keep me coming back! The service is amazing also. Jane may be the best server I've ever had.

For sure a new favorite spot for AYCE! The fish quality was awesome!!! Great atmosphere, upbeat music playing, but not too loud. Stefan was a great server and very knowledgeable. Used to go to Goyemon, no more!
The price was decent.  Service was great.  Sushi was the best I've had for an all you can eat place.

We come here when we want all you can eat sushi. I love that they have so many different rolls to choose from. Everything tastes delicious every time. My 5 year old loves them too!
 The service on the other hand is a hit or miss. The last time we went in it wasn't very busy, but we had to wait forever for our food! It was like they were out catching the fish as we were waiting for it.

My first time here , we were seated right away,  it's very noisy, so good for groups but not for romantic dinners,  it did tend to be less noisy as the night went on, the sushi was delicious and totally worth the price, in fact it was a steal , all u can eat off the menu, with exception of sashimi , I will definetly be back.
It's perfect for a large group, and especially for those with big appetites and those who want to try everything off the menu..
They do offer teriyaki which is tasty for those who do not like sushi...

While I was visiting my cousin in Las Vegas, we decided to try Oyshi Sushi.  The atmosphere was nice, the presentations were creative, and  great variety of rolls as well as decent prices. They have an all you can eat sushi menu that is perfection!  The only downside for me is that they only used imitation crab meat instead of real crab meat.

I love Oyshi! It's the best AYCE sushi spot I've ever been to! Love the food, love the service, love everything! I came with a party of 9, and our server was so attentive and accommodating that he came by our table a number of times to make sure if everything was ok or if we needed more food; even the host came by to check up on us, now that's good service. 

Not only that but the food came out extra fast, usually at the AYCE sushi spots that I go to in the LA/OC area the food kinda lags, maybe because they want you to get full and not order more? Just an assumption :P

All the items that came out were good quality food: 

- Oysters (limit one order (4 pieces) per person during dinner only)
- Appetizers
- Sushi
- Hand Rolls
- Speciality Rolls
- Dessert (limit one per person)

And the selection is pretty extensive! And if you're a roll person, then you're in luck because the rolls are pretty small so that means you get to have more variety by ordering other different rolls.
Great food, I'm very picky on sushi, and for an all you can eat place  this is pretty bomb!! You can pick any thing from sushi and appetizers and dessert

I highly recommend this place!  I did not think that an AYCE Sushi buffet would be that great since it's buffet food but they proved me wrong.  The sushi is very fresh and delicious.  The all you can eat menu has tons of food to pick from including sushi rolls, appetizers, salad, soup, uni, sweet shrimp, oysters and dessert.  You have 2 hours to eat your food which is plenty of time to enjoy and savor your meal.  The service is great and the restaurant is pretty spacious.  This is a must-visit restaurant almost every time I go to Vegas.

Just as I remembered it minus the suuuuper sloooow/bad service. Maybe we just had the worst server ever (Sang). Yes, I'm putting you on blast! He got flustered after taking orders from a third of our party and couldn't even get that right. Other servers had to help him as he was so overwhelmed. Our check was wrong. Luckily for Mr. Sang we were automatically charged 18% for having a large party. He wouldn't have gotten much otherwise.

The food was good when it finally arrived. Much better than most ayce places in Vegas. You really can't beat it for the price.

I usually love Oyshi, but I was disappointed when I reserved the large room for a birthday dinner. While the food was amazing, it took a while for us to receive it and the service was not as good as it normally is. We had to ask for water and out check in the main room because it seemed ole our server forgot about us. I only had a group of 9. The food was amazing, but I wouldn't recommend dining in the private dining room.

Didn't get a chance to eat here but felt like I would add a similar review I read.  

Tried to come on Saturday night at 12:50, place says it closes at 2am.  Walk in and they have already done last call and are closing.  I understand it's slow, but I'm not the first this has happened to...change your posted hours to 1am.  Then no harm done.
This is the 3rd time here and it still is a 2.5 star, 3 star at best. Service is terrible, food is either sweet or salty. I was hoping it would improve. Its consistently bad.
Just superb. Vince, our waiter, did an excellent job attending us and explaining how the AYCE menu works. This will be our go to place for sushi.

This place is okay. We got pretty terrible service so we will not be back. I refused to let my boyfriend leave her a good tip. She forgot out dessert, then she took forever to bring and pick up our check. Even the chef and other waiter kept apologizing for her. They do not have a good appetizer selection either. Oh and too much rice on the rolls!

This place is good if u want an easy all you can eat sushi restaurant. The quality of fish is of the all you can eat kind (not the best) but it's a nice layout and the have a big room in the back for large parties

I love the food at Oyshi but the service is incredibly slow. & of course it makes it worse when they have a full house too. Luckily both times here I had nice waiters though and when the food FINALLY came after what felt like over 30 minutes, it was delicious. The warm sake was also really good!

This is the closest sushi spot to me and I'm glad it's actually a decent place.  I go here with my little brother and so far it's been great.  The servers there are very friendly and usually have a smile on their face.  Our last server there when we went for ayce was pretty cute as well (always a plus).

As far as the sushi is concerned, I got my money's worth.  The fish was pretty fresh, not the freshest, but still good.  I prefer sushi that isn't drenched in sauce and the rolls that I had were good.  I got away with an extra dessert when you can only order one, thanks to our cute waitress.  The best rolls were the Hawaiian and the Yellowtail Trio.

They also have a great selection of entrees and apps to choose from.  I have had the teriyaki beef and that was really good.  They have something for everyone interested in Asian cuisine.

Whenever I feel like treating myself or my friends and family, this will definitely be the spot.

(4.5 stars)

My trip to Vegas would not be complete without a visit to Oyshi Sushi. Though it's off strip, I'm lucky my best friend lives close enough so we can make a trip every time I'm there. 

My last visit was the first time I've done their All You Can Eat deal, and for $26, it was WELL WORTH IT! The only things it DOESN'T include are the Chef's Special Sashimi, so all your appetizers, salads, specialty rolls and desserts are included. My friends and I went all out and ordered several to share of every course. Oysters were delicious and baked mussels (while too much mayo sauce) was to die for. Tempura dishes are nice and crispy and not too soggy or heavy. My favorite salad is their ahi poke on top of seaweed salad - YUM! We shared 6 specialty rolls that were all delicious in their own ways. Again their specialty "yum yum" sauce is "yum yum", but in small amounts. The mochi ice cream is like the type you buy at the store, but again, it's all part of the deal so might as well indulge! We also got a bottle of lychee flavored cold sake that was decently priced and balanced the sweet:alcohol ratio perfectly.

Service is good: unless its super busy, the wait staff always comes up to check on your group, make sure your water is filled, etc. As with any sushi place, baked rolls will take longer, so be patient! They did forget one of our orders at one point, but since we were eating so much, it gave us time to digest.

If you can make the trip out with a group who enjoys sharing specialty rolls and can throw down in eating, Oyshi is the place to go!

Hands down, the food is amazing!   That's why we come here, but you have to come at odd hours because the servers suck whether you sit at the bar or in the restaurant.   If you come when they are busy, the service is a D at best.  They act like their head is in the clouds.  

But for food, love the atomic bomb, love affair,  dynamite roll, etc.  I could keep going and love the all you can eat.  They just need help with how to be a good food server.

I only went once and I didn't have a great experience.  The food was fine and I enjoyed it, but it was the service that really turned me off.  They never came around, we would wait and wait til someone helped us and even when we got an order in, it took a while.  I'd visit again but it doesn't seem worth it.  Ehh.

I tried this restaurant with a meetup group.  I suppose we had 12 who met for AYCE lunch.  We all ordered so many different types of rolls and shared them.  I would have to say my favorite was the Pink Lady Roll.  That roll had several types of fish and wrapped in a pink soy wrapper.  Very nice.  We also tried the RockN' Roll, the Atomic Bomb, Salmon Lover, Yellowtail Trio, Hawaiian  and other specialty rolls.  

After eating at a different AYCE near Summerlin I had a fresh comparison.  I found what we had was all very fresh and tasty, prepared to order.  We also had seaweed salsa, rib eye appetizer, ahi poke,  and desert was included, too.  I had strawberry mochi ice cream and tasted the green tiramisu.

Thomas was our waiter and was very attentive in locating each of us with our orders.  He was very good.  Yes, it did take a little while to wait for some of the rolls, but we were ordering a lot of food and the quality and taste made it worth the wait.  

I will definitely be back with my friends and I'll bring a bigger appetite!

I get why they have four stars, it's a hip place with electronica music playing in the background, and that seems to be a Vegas standard now.  However, I can't say ill be making my way back.

They have a variety to choose from for AYCE, with the whole inside menu strictly rolls.  When I do AYCE, I only go for nigiri.  As I've posted before, I'm not really into rolls because its usually covered in sauce, with very little filling.  I guess it's what Americans love though... Sauce on everything.  I'm guilty as well, just not on my sushi.

Anyway, the fish was really poor quality.  After my initial order, I couldn't bring myself to order any more.  I love my fish to taste like fish (if that even makes sense).  The fish here had no taste whatsoever.  All I could taste was the vinegar from the rice.

I thought it was cool they served oysters, but it was pretty blah.  There was no flavor at all.  It tasted like water.  It did not have that "taste like the sea" quality.  I don't know.  It just didn't taste like anything.  The baked mussels were not very good. Overcooked. No flavor.  Too chewy.

Tofu was ok, but too much sauce, and it was overly sweet.  Desserts were boring.  No green tea ice cream. Creme brûlée was ok.  Ice cream parfait was ok.

Seriously, this place is lacking all types of flavors.

I like the fact that they serve "fresh" scallops, other places usually have the baby scallops drenched in yum yum sauce.  

Server was friendly.  

I'd pass on this place and go for Goymen, Sushi Komo, or even Kaya.

the hostess is rude and the service over all is extremely poor. It took over 1 1/2 to eat lunch. They did not have the lunch specials available nor did they have mochi ice cream. The customers next to us order gyozas and so did I. They sat down after us but still received their food before us. Also, we order their ice cream parfait and it took at least 15+ minutes to receive it. I would not recommend eating here!
My favorite sushi place in vegas, all you can eat or not.  Great staff, great food, great atmosphere.

I tried Oyshi on 7/6/09 on the recommendation of a friend. Everything was great! I found my server to be very friendly. She was truly a delight and she was very helpful! I had the Hot Tamale, Love Affair, and Crazy Philly rolls. All were superb especially the Love Affair. While I had more, I won't bore with a complete list.

I will come back for the all you can eat again. It was every bit as good as I was told when the place was recommended.

So yesterday for a late lunch/early dinner my friends wanted to try a new sushi place. He was going to drive so I said sure wherever you want to go. He and our other friend heard good things about this place. We arrive and it turns out our other friend has been here once but forgot (haha hope this isn't bad news). 

Turns out it was really good. I like the decor of the place and the music playing makes it feel kind of clubby haah. Our waitress was nice to let us switch from the table to the bar so we could get our orders in faster. We all stuffed our faces full of sushi. Large selection of sushi to choose from so you should find something you like. Since the day I had some cream cheese in sushi I am a fan so when I saw it on the menu I had to try everyone that had cream cheese haha. For dessert which I gave to my friend I had the strawberry mochi. He had the green tea ice cream.

I give it 3 stars. I love the sushi and the guys were friendly making the sushi and the waitress was friendly too. It's far for me but if in the area it is the place I would stop at.

I've been to this place well over 20 times and while sometimes the service is slow or sometimes there is a roll that isn't my favorite, it really is consistently great. I always do the all you can eat, and get a number of appetizers like seaweed salad and spicy sashimi salad, a couple hand rolls, and nigiri. I used to get a number of rolls, and find them great, but don't usually want that much rice and they're very filling.

Highly recommend this as a local sushi joint!
I love Oyshi Sushi! It's a fun environment with a great staff and excellent food! Love the half roll option with AYCE at the bar!

Like Soyo, I've been going to Oyshi since 2012.

Like all sushi restaurants, there is that all you can eat option.  Take it.  You'll be happy that you did.  sure there may be a few restrictions on what you can order, but when you have the ability to eat whatever the hell it is you want from the sushi and rolls sections, who cares?

Just remember, if you dine there, ask for Vincent as your server.  He's awesome.

Fabulous fresh sushi, polite and efficient staff and a great menu with lots of variety. The best deal however is the AYCE (All You Can Eat) menu! $27/pp and you can get everything from appetizers to rolls and other dishes, even dessert! We polished everything off! Delicious all around and we will now be regulars!!!!

Being from hawaii we have ALOT of great sushi restaurants, but i must say after living here for a little over a month and eating at a few different sushi places this by far is at the top of my list. I get the all you can eat because i can put down some sushi haha. The sushi here is sooooo good! The high roller, the different types of spicey tuna rolls, beef wrapped asparagus. So much variety and the service and staff is super quick and super friendly.  Then comes the desert, the deserts are awesome from green tea ice cream, to the mochi ice cream and some kind of berry ice cream cup, totally delicious.

The restaurant is easy to find and theres alot of free parking. You can also order individual rolls but i do suggest just doing the all you can eat buffet if you want to try a variety of the tasty items on the menu. They do serve alcohol as well and what better way to enjoy sushi then with some sake bombs and great friends! Definitely a place im bringing my friends from hawaii when they come to visit.

Their prices for lunch and dinner are on par with other places in the area, and the food is delicious. All you can eat is great, but I've only had one extremely nice and prompt waitress. Others have been begrudging in their obligation to help the customer even if their tip depends on it, and I usually tip at least 20 percent. Even the host who sat us kind of seemed to not want to be there in the slightest. I totally understand working in food and bev industry, have done it for years, but for gods sake at least pretend to want to be there. Anyway, other than the shifty service, everything there is fabulous.

Originally this place could not figure out a system to seat guests in the correct order of arrival and it would drive me crazy. As of lately, this problem seems to be fixed. 

Their appetizer menu is extensive and the main reason why we have AYCE. Their rolls are nothing special and their is limitation on dessert, but still not a bad deal. The restaurant is spacious and even when full, still feels fine.

Oyshi used to be my favorite AYCE sushi spot.  They had a wide variety of quality rolls, great tasting food, consistent service, and a really nice atmosphere that made for a great spot to have pre-game Friday night dinner. 

Although the sushi is still pretty good, the service and management has gone off the deep end and because of this, I don't think I'll ever eat at Oyshi again.  There are too many quality sushi restaurants in Las Vegas to justify returning to Oyshi where the last few visits, all I seem to get are orders that never show up, drinks that never get filled, waiters that refuse to come to our table or our spot at the bar (even though it's obvious that you've seen me flag you down), and servers/staff that are increasingly bitter and unfriendly.  

This stuff matters. Oddly enough, it's also the stuff that is easiest to fix. When you've already got quality menu items, quality sushi chefs, and quality sushi rolls that people rave about - why are you letting your terrible servers and management ruin your restaurant?

If I'm sitting at the sushi bar and I'm trying to order more beer and sake, why are people refusing to help me out? If I want to give you my money in exchange for some-what overpriced alcohol, why does it take more than 20 minutes for someone to take my drink order and then another 20 to bring me a couple of beers and sake? This should never be an issue with a sushi restaurant.  Never. Sure, AYCE places get really busy and I totally understand that. But, if you can't handle the heat - hire more servers. 

I shouldn't have to wait more than 45 minutes for my order. And when my order does come out, half of it shouldn't be missing. It also shouldn't take you another 30 minutes to bring out the pieces missing from my order. And you shouldn't have an attitude with customers just because they are asking for the items they originally ordered that are missing because you either forgot to put the orders in or there was a mix up in the kitchen. I am never rude to waiters or management and this last experience at Oyshi was no exception. I was pleasant and more than patient and if I still can't get someone to so much as offer an apology for missing orders/missing drinks and for treating me like I was more of a burden than a customer bringing a lot of business to the establishment, then I will happily take my business elsewhere. 

Sorry, Oyshi, it was good while it lasted!

I went to return movies at Blockbuster with my younger son and had the urge for some sushi. Since Oyshi was just across the street from Blockbuster, we stopped in for a quick sushi fix. I've been to Oyshi many times in the past, but this visit will be my last. Service at Oyshi in the past sucked, but tonight's service was just plain unacceptable. 
Being a server myself, I strive to be polite, easy, PATIENT, understanding, and tip well. When my son and I walked in, we waited a good 5 mins as the manager and servers walked passed us and no one even cared to seat us. I finally flagged down a server to seat us. If the establishment was busy, that's a different story, but this was at 10pm on a Thursday with only three other tables.
The girl that sat us gave us menus and asked if we were doing AYCE and I responded, "No"(I didn't want to stuff myself this late at night). I ordered water and told her I was ready to order, but she said she's not my server. 5 mins passed and our server came to take our drink order, and I told her I was ready to order. I ordered two waters, a miso soup, and 2 simple rolls. The waters and soup came in a timely manner, but I had to flag down a server for a spoon, straws, settings, and soy sauce. 
We waited, waited, and waited(@ least 30 mins), saw other customers get their food-while thinking...did they forget our rolls??? I lost patience and called the server over & told her if they haven't yet made our rolls, I wanted to cancel. She glared at me then went over to tell the sushi chef, and he miraculously & immediately passed her a plate with our rolls! What the heck?? While we were waiting forever for our rolls, the sushi chef had them.
We never even got an apology for the delay. Not once were we asked if we were ok or needed anything or even got a refill. As soon as we got our rolls, we gulped them down, asked for the check, paid, and bounced!! The rolls were mediocre. Being a good tipper, I left absolutely nothing for such horrible service(from the beginning to the end) :-/.

On our search for another epic place for sushi happens to fall onto this place as it drew us in for AYCE. I think a few of our friends had heard or were recommended to try this joint since they knew our group and how we can grub. The last place we went to before left a bad taste in my mouth and another a little ill from the meal, we were happy to try a completely different place. 

The atmosphere, ambience, are very inviting yet dark for those intimate encounters due to the dark wood finish everywhere. TVs around for those ackward silent moments if you're on a date or deep conversation in a larger group. I do like the mural on the back wall which was really impressive.

Now, down to the food, you can order anything on the menu but just watch for any restrictions such as only 1 order of uni for example. I do like the sound of appetizers you can order such as rib-eye steak which is really less than tapas on a sizzling plate and a bed of cabbage and onions. Another beef plate was the same which tasted good but I feel like I would have to order 5 of these to really make a good size order to be called an appetizer. 

The rolls are inventive and decorative which is a refreshing change from the other sushi places. My recommendation is to stick to the "designer" rolls rather than the sushi. I must strongly advise against ordering the uni which it could be me and an off night. I always try to be brave and order it knowing it could be really good or it could be really really bad. In fact, I didn't eat the second piece because the first one I ate tasted like iodine for some reason. Definitely may explain for my stomach pains on the way back to our place. Nausea may be another descriptive word for this feeling as well. The rolls taste great and presentation looks great but I may have to say no to sushi so far away from the coastline especially in the middle of the dessert. If you have reviewed or about to review this place and give it 5 stars, you may have to check yourself as your taste buds are a bit off for what great sushi really should be in quality.

Every time I come here, I leave feeling disappointed. Today was no different. 

I have been here on numerous occasions because this is where my friends want to go; ok, whatever.  We always come for AYCE dinner and the wait is always really long even with reservations. 

Once we are seated, it usually takes them a couple minutes to get our drinks and then a while long for our orders. We are so aware of their efficiency, or lack thereof, we would write down on a piece of paper of what we want and then just hand it to them. Kudos to us! 

The food would always take forever to arrive and the hot dishes are always what come out first. I never understand that since raw fish simply needs to be sliced and plated... Unless they wanna fill us up with the cheap stuff first...? Hmmmmmmm. 

And once the food arrives, they are always subpar or mediocre. Nothing ever wows my husband and I. 

Overall, service is extremely slow. This should be a french japanese fusion restaurant in the sense that it's gonna be a three hour meal eating japanese food. The food is mediocre. The price is not spectacular. I would never come back if I can help it. 

Oh, it's the same slowness at lunch, by the way. Most items on the menu is around $10-$12. The non sushi dishes came out first for my group today and halfway through their meal, my sushi bowl came out - mediocre yet again. 

That was my last straw; I am going somewhere else.

Wonderful restaurant!!! My new favorite sushi place in Vegas. Not only is it in "my neck of the woods"--SW Las Vegas, but it serves wonderful sushi and hot meals, has incredible service and inviting, fun atmosphere. Oyshi does not disappoint, and I have been to most sushi places in town. The fish is always incredibly fresh and delicisous and hot foods and rolls are creative and very tasty. The presentation is top notch too, especially for the price. That's right, the price is on the low side for "all you can eat" sushi as compared to other neighborhood sushi places in town; Big flat screen televisions, always running mini fountains and modern decor add to the wonderful, fun, yet inviting atmosphere. Servers all speak English and are knoweledgeable about all of the dishes and make great recommendations!!! I love this sushi restaurant and have frequented it about twice a month, if not more often. Oyshi in Japanese means "delicious" and this restaurant surely lives up to its name in every sense of the word. Highly recommended.

More like 2.5 stars...

I heard good things about this place so I checked it out finally, but the food was mediocre... Not a fan of the rolls - they were overly flavored and rolled messy.  I wanted to like this place, but there wasn't anything that cried great to me.  The seaweed salad was probably my favorite appetizer... 

The place is a quite overpriced for the food.  I didn't feel the fish was fresh and they used a lot of flavoring to cover-up the meh quality of its food.

I'm disappointed with the service I got tonight during my "AYCE" experience here. I understand that it can get busy here and there, but it would be nice to have your server check up on how things are going. NOT once did our server check on our table and we waited about 15 minutes per order.. Horrible! -_- 
2 stars for the bus boys!
I love this place. I've been coming here for a few years. The fresh wasabi is really good. My favorite is the Cajun albacore which most places don't have. Plus the deserts are more than just mochi.
Food was good and fresh! but not really happy for the service... It's all you can eat, sometimes missing some orders and the food come out quite slow!

This use to be my favorite sushi place and would have earned 5 stars. However, the last two times I've gone with my daughter I've been disappointed.  Not only did it take FOREVER to get our orders but the food was not the quality I've grown accustom to at Oyshi.  Some of the sushi tasted like it had previously been frozen -- not fresh at all.  I'm hoping it's just a blip in time as they opened a second location -- otherwise I'll have to find another place to call my "favorite sushi place".

CULTURE. FOOD. ATMOSPHERE. 

The sushi fad has been rising in Vegas and Oyshi has taken it even further. When I go into a sushi restaurant I look at 3 things:

1. How the restaurant looks.
2. Selection of sushi
3. How the restaurant makes me feel.

Right off the bat, you're welcomed with high end decor that depicts Japanese culture. Oyshi is nothing short of class. I'm a very limited sushi order. Ironically, I'm allergic to fish (I know, right?). However, I am able to eat shell fish, and that is good enough for me to fall in love with this new craze. They have fresh selections and a whole section of shell fish sushi. 

And what I love the most about Oyshi sushi, is that it's not some hole in the wall, dirty little restaurant. It's classy, sophisticated, and it's a spot you can bring your valued company. I actually refuse to bring dates here because I don't want them to tarnish this place for me. Highly recommended. They'll remember your name because they remember mine. But it doesn't help that I'm there every week.

My family has been coming to oyshi for as long as I can remember. At least twice a month. But in the last year the service, staff and food has gone down hill drastically. 
The food now takes a lot longer to come out and a lot of the rolls taste like they've been sitting and they started putting lemon juice type sauce on the sushi which makes everything taste horrible. They seem to have changed some rolls and not a change for the better. 
Luckily our server tonight has been wonderful, but I she will not make up for the past year. 

We now go to the one on Sahara and it seems to be a lot better. This location is so much closer to our house though...

I would give the food 5 stars but I had something strange happen to me the two times I was there and I'll never go back because of it. 

Both times I was there I was picking up take-out. The first time I was picking up my food, the total was something like $19.20 and I gave the very polite man a $20 bill. He didn't bring me any change, but asked me if I wanted something to drink while I waited. I though maybe when he brought me my food, he would give me my change but he didn't. I was going to tip him but since he never even mentioned my change, I let that be his "tip". 

The next and last time I went I got to go food again. It was the same guy and he took my order and the total was $43.50. I have him $45. So this is actual paper money now so I thought he would totally bring me my money back this time. Again, very polite, asked me if I wanted something to drink.....and never mentioned my change again! It's not the money that bothered me, it's the assumption that really irritates me. Now you may ask, why didn't I just ask for my change. Well it's kinda simple, why should i have to! He lost a customer and a word of mouth review for $1.50. 

I was almost tempted to try this theory again and pay for something with a $100 and see what the result would be. Does he only keep a certain amount of money, would something over $20, $40 $50 be pushing his luck....

So in short, the food is pretty good, the thieving man is very polite but I don't like when someone just assumes that my change is his tip.

AYCE is awesome.  Contains more items than you would usually find.  

Order is simple and the food comes out super quick.  Can't go wrong with this place!

The food was great. Too bad the service was horrible. We sat waiting at the sushi bar for 20 minutes before our waitress even came to check in, we'd been done eating and just wanted the check. We even asked the sushi chef when he asked if we were doing ok. He didn't do anything about it. Bummer. We won't be rushing back here, Sumos has great food and great service.

My friend suggested that we check this place out.  I was pleasantly surprised that the venue was much bigger than I thought it was.  Also the All You Can Eat Menu had a lot of different things that I haven't seen on other menus around town.  The sushi was great.  The one roll I compare restaurants with is the salmon skin roll and I liked it here.

Had lunch yesterday at Oyshi, it was the first time I'd ever been there.

I'd read some of the earlier reviews about poor service, but I have to say there was no trouble at all when I was there. The waiter (Vincent) was very attentive and friendly. He answered questions about menu items that we asked about and commented on his favorites. There were two other people that kept coming around and filling our water glasses whenever they got low. Food came out fast and was delicious!!!

I had the "Oh My Heart", the "Hawaiian" and the "Lobster Fair". All were exceptional!! I could have ordered 3 of the Oh My Hearts and been perfectly happy - it was awesome!! The last one I ate (Lobster Fair) was almost too big but very tasty!

Oh My Heart - Spicy Tuna, Crab Mix, Avocado and Shrimp Tempura rolled in Soy Paper. Eat this!!

On a Friday night passing by the area... we found this place.. wow.. the AYCE is excellent!! Boy was I stuffed.  Told the waitress keep bringing the rolls to me.  Haha.. One Word:  "Your unbelievable... "  I keep laughing and eating.. The special rolls are tasty, the sushi are fresh, and the chefs are awesome.

Service - 5 Stars
Food - 5 Stars
Cleanliness - 5 Stars

Overall, if your in the area and dig the AYCE got to try it out!!

$26 (Dinner) can't go wrong..

The all-you-can-eat is to die for!!! Be prepared to spend $40 for drinks and all you can eat but it's totally worth it. They have a wonderful selection ranging from mild to WAY spicy. It's definitely worth your time, I'm going back soon!

They have some of the best rolls I have ever tried, but their nigiris aren't the best. Their fish probably isn't as fresh as some other places but it's still decent. Some of my favorite rolls from Oyshi are the Snow Mountain Roll & the Kamikaze Roll. Not bad for lunch for $21

I have been here a few times and have always loved it. This place is so clean you could eat off the floors. No but really. I would come here more often if it werent so far away from me. Love the surf and tuf.

I used to HATE this place!  Many visits a couple years ago...all with slow service, room temperature nigiri, etc.  This was actually one of the only places that I told people NOT to go to for sushi....and never understood why others liked it so much.

A VERY reluctant lunch stop proved to be a much better experience this time around!

A few highlights :

Sea Scallops were awesome! Super fresh, buttery texture...melt in your mouth! 

Sake was very fresh today! Beautiful cuts of salmon....the Sake in Yuzu was very good as well, and not overpowering like yuzu can be sometimes.

The Ika with Mint. I really enjoyed this combination...and it was noticeably less chewy than most. 

Ahi. Fresh, but another odd cut...the darker area was a bit tougher...should have been removed by the chef.  Pic : http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/oyshi-sushi-las-vegas?select=UnVcwLiUog_Lmr-ZkUaKwQ#UnVcwLiUog_Lmr-ZkUaKwQ

Unagi. Nice crispy edges...good flavor! 

Ahi Poke. Tuna was fresh, and the seaweed salad was good too!

Sunomono. I liked their version here...thin cuts versus the larger circular cuts most use. The ginger sauce was good too.

Green Tea Creme Brulee. Delicious! Lots of tea flavor here 

Service was fairly quick, considering their tables were mostly full.

I would come back again now if I was already on this side of town :P

Used to be my go-to place for sushi but I've had so many bad experiences, especially at dinner that I just cant' stand it anymore.  I always gave them a pass because they were so close to my house.

Here's my list of gripes:

-Sushi is not the freshest in town in comparison to other AYCE.  I had some  Spanish mackerel that literally I had to spit out.
-Service is horrendous, especially for dinner when they are swamped with customers.
-Most of the non-fish dishes are greasy and badly cooked.

I suppose they are good because they are so huge they have a lot of variety.  But who cares when it doesn't taste good.
We are very disappointed with Love affairs.It's a little cold.Told the server but nothing she can do.She said she will tell the chef!That's it.

Loved the vibe and energy of the restaurant. Was really busy when I went but we didn't wait long for our food and drinks. Food was coming out fast and steady. The Cajun albacore is a must have. The menu is very diverse, there is something for everyone. I will go back for sure!

The service is horrible ! 
I've been here before and the sushi wasnt so good but I decided to give it another shot. Bad idea! I was on lunch break ordered two rolls and there. Were five sushi chefs. It wasn't even busy! Took thirty minutes to get my order right and the sushi was just plain messy.  I should've gone to Kobe down the street.

I ate here once...FANTASTIC!!  The sushi was fresh, Uni, sweet shrimp, and all the basics were as well.  They also have a great selection of cooked foods for my non sashimi eating friends that came with me. AYCE on top of that? Yeah this place is great when you just want to eat and want to get away from the bustle of the strip!  The staff was very attentive too.  I was very impressed!!

All-You-Can-Eat sushi places are very hit, or miss here in Las Vegas. Most of the time the fish is dry and not very flavorful. Oyshi breaks this trend. Their rolls are delicious. The Red Rock, Lobster Fair and Yellowtail Trio are must tries. Their fish is very fresh, moist and flavorful. For an All-You-Can-Eat sushi place, Oyshi is a cut above the rest.

Service at Oyshi is very friendly. The staff are knowledgeable about the menu and the art of sushi. They are always willing to suggest and prepare something new for you to try. I go here often and sit at the sushi bar. Both the servers and the sushi chefs know exactly what I like and how I like it prepared.

First timer, and it was good !! AYCE lunch $22 a person. They said 15 minute wait but it was like 5 minutes during lunch time on a Sunday. Sat at the bar and had good service. Fish was fresh, and big. I enjoyed my time. Oh and dessert was yummy. It was my friends birthday and they gave a slice of cake with a candle and sang happy birthday. So nice of them.

This place was delicious! And with the all you can eat prices, it is a good deal for sushi. I went here Friday night with my boyfriend and another couple, and we all got the all you can eat deal for dinner ($26/person) and we were able to order over 10 rolls and some appetizers and sides as well. We definitely ate well over $26 worth of rolls.

Driving down Rainbow with my dad and sister after some very exhausting furniture shopping, we decided to pick up sushi for dinner. There are several sushi restaurants along the way, so we pulled over to the first one we saw: Oyshi Sushi. 

The restaurant is very cute, decked out in the typical Japanese style (fountains, folding screens) with a modern feel. It could serve well as a date spot or a family dinner outing, based on the groups of people I spotted. While we waited for our take-out order, the host offered us beverages, which was a very nice touch.

I tend to judge restaurants based on how vegetarian- and vegan-friendly they are, and this place definitely passed. There are at least 10 or 12 vegetarian rolls to choose from. I ordered the asparagus and avocado roll, vegetable tempura and miso soup. All of them were very good. The sushi in particular was well-made and tasty, which was surprising considering that this restaurant advertises its All You Can Eat special. 

The prices are good, the food is better. We'll be back!

Best sushi for the best price! My recommendation is to get the all you can eat Buffett. My favorite roll are the rattlesnake and my husband's is the hot tamale. Hands down, rattlesnake is the best! 

I took off one star because the service is a hit or miss.

I've been going to the location on Sahara for a couple years now, but I have to be honest that the location on Rainbow IS THE BEST!!!!  Service was a amazing, food was great as always and the prices are unreal.   We recently moved to this side of town and will frequent this location often.  great job!!!!

I cannot say enough about Oyshi, the sushi is excellent and the selection is never ending. I highly recommend that anyone who finds themselves in Las Vegas to make the time and enjoy some of the best sushi around.

Love the food and service! Great spot for AYCE. Been going to this location for years and has always been great! Only complaint would be the hours. They say they're open until 2 am, but I have gone multiple times around 12 and they've been closing super early! 

I work in the restaurant industry and get it that on slower nights you might close early. But when there's a line out the door of people you are turning away, doesn't seem smart for business or for customer satisfaction. I would NEVER go to a restaurant 5 minutes or even an hour before close, but closing 2 hours early? Really?? 

Food is great tho. Just go in 4+ hours before close to ensure you can be seated.

This is by far my favorite sushi place to go to in Vegas. The sushi is always fresh and the Asian skirt steak is to die for! The service is usually pretty quick and very efficient. I eat here like once or twice a week.

This place is the perfect example of why I stopped going to AYCE sushi bars.  Lot's of our orders never showed up and the ones that did took forever. the Quality of the food  =   . I should have known better

All you can eat sushi! I'm in. Come hungry. Reasonable price. Nice staff. The baked mussels are divine. Loved the Japanese Lasagna roll. Oysters. Don't get me started. Yum. Just remember, if you can't finish it, you pay full price on it.

Love it love it love it!!! It's a regular sushi bar with an 'all you can eat' option. (Does not include sashimi). So delicious. You can even get 1/2 size sushi rolls to dance around the menu. The crunchy tuna was my favorite. I also loved that you can get soup, salad, tempura, poke, and all other appetizers included. Loved it so much I went 2 nights in a row.

Love going here,  sushi is the best of all the AYCE places.  Really like how they will spice it up and add extra hot sauces when I request it.  The spicy stuff at most of the other sushi places isn't hot enough to do the trick.

This place is always packed which makes for a good atmosphere. Sushi is edible but not the best in the area. You can find better all you can eat on the southwest side for the same price. They can accommodate large parties which is a huge plus.
