Took us 10 minutes to be seated and there was nobody else ahead of us in line. Not at all a traditional sushi place at all with terrible costumer service

This place has ALL-U-CAN-EAT sushi!!!!
And the menu for that option is pretty sweet!
It's been awhile since I've been here, but every roll i tasted was delish!  The portions are good and two rolls filled me up fast (so no I did not do the all-u-can-eat option! LoL)
I think here and Kaizen have the best rolls in Vegas....for now atleast!
And the decor is pretty modern and stylish so I especially enjoyed eating here!
;)

We moved into the neighborhood a few months ago and have been to Oyshi several times. The miso soup and the tempura veggies are delicious. overall this is some of the best sushi we've had. The only reason I didn't give a 5 star review is because the shrimp aren't fried to order for the rolls. The tiger roll is usually one of my favs but not when the shrimp are soggy.

I've been here multiple times with my family because of it's convenience in location and the wait time is pretty minimal. The food is decent if you're not a fish snob. I don't even think sashimi is served. All the rolls are heavily seasoned/ sauced-up and majority of them are stuffed with imitation crab (basically different variations of the california roll). I tried a spicy tuna handroll and the fish was not fresh so I had to return it (since you're charged for not eating everything that's ordered from the "all you can eat").

I stick with non-sushi items such as the udon or this teriyaki beef rice bowl. I do like the ninja meal (veggie and shrimp tempura, California roll, and teriyaki chicken) but I can only order it if my nephew comes along (for kids only-and they're really strict about it).  In fact they're so strict that my nephew ordered it and he drank a bottle of milk so he was too full to eat. They wouldn't even let us bring the kids meal home. We had to pay for it but we couldn't pack to go!

Ate here for a quick bite before doing my nails next door. Ate some sushi and some seaweed salad. I have had some amazing sushi so I have yet to taste something that compares. So it was good but not something to remember. However the seaweed salad was great! They were very polite and sat us quickly because we were in a rush. Prices were good. I saw that they have all you can eat sushi. Clean environment and food service overall.

Oyshi Sushi is a smart kid with ADHD.

We went with a good sized party and reservations. Got placed in a side room. The decor is solid but nothing spectacular. The party, with the exception of one tactically frugal individual all went All You Can Eat (AYCE).

Two things:
1) The sushi was great. Fresh, well put together, largelly plated well and highly satisfactory. Nothing mind blowing, but great stuff.

2) They brought it out seemingly at random. We'd not get rolls we ordered and get other rolls instead, no explanation. The waitress was reading our requests back and she appeared to be writing them down, but the correlation between food requested and food delivered was .71 tops.

Bizarre Food Fail: Surf and Turf was ordered. Turf and Turf was delivered. Apparently the shrimp staged a daring escape.

I will return here, but largelly because it's five minutes away and my friends have low standards.

Went here for the AYCE Sushi, and it was simply BOMB.COM. 
End of story. 

Ok, I'll tell you more. They have more than just sushi on the menu - great steak, delicious fresh oysters, and best of all GREAT SERVICE!! They didn't rush us, the sushi came out in a timely manner, but not all at once so we didn't get overwhelmed.

Did I mention the amazing service?? Cause it really was! I swear with all of the AYCE sushi places around Vegas, the menu doesn't vary too much, so the service really will determine if I come back to a place or not. 

And I will be BACK!! Thanks for a great experience, and obviously a full tummy :)

SBC VEGAS SERIES:9 of many reviews
I want some sushi NOW!!!!

Its hard to find sushi during lunch hours on the strip. Mind you that I didn't have any fancy jeezus phone or other interwebz navigating phone on me so I had to depend on my simple, yet reliable and dependable intuition... and lifelines. ;D  As I walked the strip during lunch hour sunshine I was rudely awakened to the fact after epic fail after epic fail that sushi apparently only open during dinner hours. FML!!!! 

I end up calling my cousin to yelp it... bare in mind he doesn't know how to use the ever HOLY YELP but does what he can for me off his interwebz capable cell. He forwards me a list and after several returned calls of being open hours later one of them responds that they are currently open. I tell the cabbie who then proceeds to drive my ass half an hour into the desert. Who knew????

WTF??

Well, I get there to this strip mall in the middle of no where and proceed to order and drink, drink and eat, and eat and drink some more. I dock them one star for the uni.. it wasn't as good as I would have expected but then again we are in the desert and I suppose should be grateful for anything shell fish. After ordering countless orders of sashimi and sushi I realize that they offer a all-you-can-eat sushi. 

Oh well!

It appears that a lot of people come here for this. I had no idea what to order so I flagged the closest waiter for assistance. The helpful and over zealous staff suggested a number of oddly named rolls which we humored them by ordering. Well, I can at least tell you that their menu offerings were pretty damned good. I wish I could remember the named of the lobster covered roll that I ordered because it was indulgent. So other than the uni I had no complaints about traveling the better part of an hour to get here. 

now how do i get back to the strip?
o_0

Very disappointed with my last few to go orders here. This used to be my go to neighborhood sushi spot but sadly I won't be visiting any more. The service is decent but the sushi is just not as delicious as it used to be. My last to go order, the rolls were very heavily overloaded with rice, over cooked rice, so much that both rolls were falling apart as soon as I opened the to go box. I'm a sushi addict and I know that some places that offer AYCE overload the rolls with rice to fill you up but it's very disappointing when you are paying al a carte prices at $30 for 2 rolls and you have to pull so much rice off it and still can't enjoy it. I order to go from other places like Sawa, Ojah, Goyemon and Kyara and have never had this problem with them. Also, the shrimp tempura was mushy, the tuna didn't taste fresh... I could go on and on. Sadly wouldn't recommend Oyshi, plenty of other places to eat at.
Food is really good the only reason why I took off one star is because there service really really sucks at times! I get so surprised if they actually are doing well.

Great food, great price and Nice cozy place. Love that it's all you can eat but made to order. Buffet sushi never appealed to me so this restaurant was a wonderful find. Will go anytime we are in Vegas!

The BEST sushi in town! It is a favorite spot for me and my friends. Have introduced some friends and clients to there from out of state, and it has now become a staple restauraunt whenever they come into town! 

Has a VIP room and a conference room for larger parties. Plasmas on the walls to watch the games and fights!

The staff is ultra friendly and is always around to check out how you are doing. has both all you can eat for lunch and dinner as well as entree, appetizer and dessert items!

This was one of my first times having AYCE sushi on the west coast! Oyshi was perfect! The wait on a Sunday night wasn't too long. We had waited about 10 mins and we were seated at a table right away. The menu here is vast and close to endless. Definitely many options for the different types of eaters in your party!

Some of my favorites were the oysters, the steak, the veggie and shrimp tempura, and most of the sushis we ordered. It was all you can eat so we had many on our table. 

Sad you can only have 1 dessert per person but I enjoyed my berry parfait. Great deal for all you can eat here!

Food is good. Service is the reason I probably won't return. I'll admit the food is awesome and the selection is extensive when you order ayce. I gave this place three strikes before I decided I won't come here again. The first time I came with a group of 4 friends. Waitresses were always slow to come to our table to order more sushi leaving us with nothing to eat multiple times. At the end of the day two of us got food poisoning the next day. Second time I came with my girlfriend. Again, waitresses don't check up on our table enough. Third time I came with a group of 8 friends. We waited over 30 minutes for our server to take our second order for ayce. We complained to the manager about our server and it seemed like he didn't care or address our concern. When our server did come we already lost our appetite and just wanted to leave. The food is amazing but the service needs an overhaul.

I'll be return every once in awhile but, previous experiences has kept Oyshi from being my #1 AYCE sushi.

More like three and a half, but I'll be nice.
Got here on a Friday night, no reservation. It was super busy, we waited about 25 minutes. We didn't mind the wait, we were pretty excited to try somewhere new. Our waiter immediately took our drink orders, and then asked if we'd like to order. All three of us got all you can eat, so we could try a bunch of stuff together. We got edemame, chicken yakitori, muscles, raw oysters, gyoza, yellowtail nigiri, miso soup, and a few rolls. The raw oysters were outstanding. Soooo fresh and good! The chicken was tasty, the muscles were fresh and not too much sauce,  the edemame was steamed perfectly. The nigiri was a little different, but tasted okay. The tiger roll and the screaming roll were only okay. An OVERLOAD of rice, it was almost astonishing. Like holy shit, that's a lot of rice, bro. The hawiaan and whatever rolls my friend got were pretty tasty. Overall, it's worth it just for the appetizers. I'll come back to try different rolls

By the way, when my friend got a refill on her sprite, he came back and she said that the syrup was all out, it just tasted like soda water. He was confused. Did she want another one? Uhm. Yeah. So he went into the kitchen, literally stood there for a few seconds, and came back and gave her the SAME glass. Oh boy. 
Other than that weird mishap, service was pretty good.

Plenty of sauce and plenty of rice.  You're better off going to a real buffet that doesn't add tons of sauce to everything you order so that it makes you gag.  Gagging will prevent you from eating more food.  In this case, the "quality" is not even up to par with Todai or any other buffet that serves mediocre sushi.  For $5 you can get a jar of mayonnaise or thousand island dressing to eat with your rice so that you can meet your 3000 calorie intake of carbs.

Avoid this place if you are a true sushi connoisseur, or simply like to eat good quality food.

We had a rental car so we decided to venture out of the strip and check this place out.   I'm sorry to write that Yelpers disappointed me this time.  AYCE sushi deal is a great value, no doubt.  However, if you like quality than quantity, then you will be disappointed too.  I get better sushi at mediocre places in east coast.   Yes, you would have to pay a bit more, however, I would rather  pay a bit more than be unhappy after spending almost $30 pp. I also wasn't keen on the house music being blasted like we are at some club.   
I do have to say that the service was pretty decent.  I don't think I would ever return.
Gotta love this place. Great Food and Great service and the staff is pro. Its my go to for sushi.

I love this restaurant! I've been coming here since it first opened. I've never gotten food poisoning here but if I did I wouldn't turn my back on it. Sushi is sushi. If you order sushi raw then you're taking a risk for food poisoning. It goes for any sushi restaurant because it's raw. Even if handled properly. There's always that small percent... But customer service just needs a little improvement. Overall the food is great!!!

Las Vegas 
Robbie's place
High roller ! 
Dynamite appetizer
Rock and roll (tiff would love this)
No oyster appetizer- gross
Oysha roll is good but a 2nd dynamite would be better
Love affair is good but not amazing
Surf and turf appetizer is pretty good.
Asparagus and beef is good

My oh my what can I say. It was definitely Oishi, even if they did spell it wrong.
I came to vegas to quell the beckoning of the seven deadly sins. And I can safely say I left knowing full well that Gluttony is very satisfied (there's got to be some sort of ironic word play here, but goodness I can never figure it out). Oyshi Sushi has definitely raised the bar for the SoCal AYCE sushi restaurants. I might even say it is comparable to the delicious and the very-missed Kami (RIP)

The SKINNY:
I came with a group of 12. I was one of the last to show up, and I was very surprised at the fact that it could seat 12 people. The usual AYCE sushi ordering paradigm (...i barreled through 4 seasons of The Big Bang Theory) is a check list that is given to the waitress, which will be dropped off at the chef, and eventually you'll be nom-noming your way through delectable bite size raw fish goodness. But here, there is no checklist, you order directly to the waitress. But amazingly almost all orders made by the 12 people were satisfied! This place has amazing service with a very patient staff, and a variety of Nigiri and Rolls that i so deeply yearn for here in california. It's 26 dollars well spent my friends. 

The Food:
Okay so originally we were suppose to go to Sushi Mon, but one thing led to another and we ended up at Oyshi. "they have a better variety of rolls, and most of our group prefers rolls...." Hearing it breaks my heart, but the need of the many outweighs the need of the few, so I had to comply. But! hot dam, this place got some unique selections for just the simple nigiri. Spanish Mackerel? Garlic Tuna? Halibut? Seriously, the Koreans owning our local southern california ayce sushi joints needs to take a page of the koreans owning Nevada's ayce sushi joints. I have to say, they were all amazing (with the exception of the cajun albacore. that was just good. But it's still better than bad)
I have to point out the fact that they offer a free order of Amaebi and Uni, AND 4 pcs of raw oysters per customer. Being that most of the people I went with was apprehensive to raw food, I ate more than enough free orders. My goodness, my raw oyster cravings won't start up for at least another month (seriously, it's like a menstrual cycle. I know, i'm disgusting). 
Everybody speaks of how great their rolls are, and sure they are pretty good. But honestly, I can't remember them for the life of me. So maybe they were more forgettable than spectacular. But who cares, give me another 4 pieces of raw oysters dammit! That's what's important here.

The Service: 
Oh poor poor waitress. She had to go through so much...good thing we tipped her generously (and this is coming from a Chiense man). The service is actually spot on, given that there were some dead times where our food arrived a bit slow, but its a minor issue. Afterall, there were probably 5 sushi chefs taking care of a whole restaurant, INCLUDING a party of 12. 

This place is a bit off the Vegas Strip, but who cares, it's all you can eat SUSHI. and It's good! The only reason why you wouldnt come out here is if you said "Oh i ate too much at the Wynn Buffet already." And that's barely an excuse.

Everytime I come the Oyshi it is a pleasure..

Whether you want to do AYCE or Sashimi or just have a snack this a great place. There are not a ton of rolls to pick from but their menu is perfectly sized because the rolls they have...are all great. They also do not overload you with rice.

The customer service here is also top notch and what you shoud be used to in good establishments. This place does get very busy during peak hours so plan your trip wisely and enjoy.

I love Oyshi Sushi! Some All You Can Eat sushi places have a separate menu for what you can and cannot order- not here. you can order right off the menu (with the exception of sashimi, that is not included). They have a large variety of rolls and sushi. I have tried many of them and they are all delish! There is usually a wait, but its never outrageous and the staff is always super friendly whenever I go.

Damn, where do I start... this place has one of the best AYCE sushi bar for a price under $30. I love Japanese food, so I'm quite critical when it comes to quality. The quality here is equal to the quality in Japan.

For starters, I'd begin with the Ahi Poke, Shrimp & Asparagus, Dynamite and Ribeye Steak Teriyaki. 

When you're ready for battle, I'd suggest the Yellowtail Trio, Atomic Bomb, Red Dragon, and Bonzai Rolls!

To complete the food madness, grab some mochi green tea ice cream!

So who's down for a Vegas run?

I can't believe I've never written a review for this..I've been going to Oyshi for years!

Oyshi is the best place to go for AYCE mainly because of their appetizer and dessert selections.  

What I love to get are baked mussels and sizzling plates: asian skirt steak and surf and turf.  If you're hungry, these plates aren't shareable, but most of the time they are.  The asian skirt steak has a hint of sweetness to it.  It comes on a bed of lettuce and onions that the cast iron plate cooks.  

The surf and turf is just a few pieces of tenderloin steak with 2 pieces of shrimp also on a bed of lettuce and onions that the cast iron plates cooks.  Very tender steak, and the shrimp was grilled to perfection.  

I like to get nigiris: salmon, garlic tuna, and yellowtail.  All the fish tastes fresh.  The salmon was orange and marbleized as it should be.  You can get your tuna 3 different ways, but garlic is my favorite.  Yellowtail I got plain.  Always a good tasting fish.  

Rolls:  Had a few and they were good, but none of them really caught my attention to be honest.   

Dessert: Vanilla creme brulee.  I had a bite of the green tea creme brulee, and that was good as well.  

Appetizers, soups, nigiris, and desserts are well worth the AYCE.

Place is pretty delicious.  Food is tasty, only thing that leaves to be desired is the speed at which the food actually comes out.  Servers were awesome and very attentive.  All you can eat is quite the deal so it is much recommended.  Just prepare to wait some time for food to come out as the kitchen sure likes to take their time.

For a sushi restaurant in the middle of the desert, they've got some pretty damn fresh fish and a huge all-you-can-eat (AYCE) menu.

Though there are appetizers and salads, I always go for the nigiri and the rolls to fill that insatiable need for fish and rice. Some of the maki come in hand rolls, while others are baked, deep-fried, full of veggies, spicy, or wrapped in soy paper. You definitely should be able to find at least one item you'll enjoy or you're just flat out doing it wrong.

Once the chopsticks are down and I'm ready to do the Slump of Defeat, the dessert conveniently reminds you that you can get only one of the green tea tiramisu, mochi ice cream, or some of the other selections. Except the ice cream scoops. You can get as many scoops as your dessert stomach can handle!

Service was pretty good, but could be a bit erratic.  They always came to refill our drinks, to check up on us, or to take additional orders.

It saddens me that the journey to Oyshi is so far, but I'm willing to travel the distance for the value and quality that they offer.
Great as usual, can never get enough of this place!! Love the all you can eat sushi and appetizers.

This place is the Bomb! The best sushi in town. Andy, the manager is always making sure people are happy and being well cared for. There is a sushi bar in addition to the tables, however it can get loud and the servers hand tickets to the sushi cooks going over you or around you and talking loudly to the cooks...If you are looking for great sushi try this place!!

came in last night with my boyfriend and one of our friends they had all you can eat and I just had some of the tapas. The food was amazing as usual but the server was extremely rude she took so long to come back for our orders and rarely checked up on us. I've always had very good experiences here but last night was not one of them. we shouldn't have had to wait so long for our server to come back and check on us. Several times other servers were the ones to take the orders.

Oyshi definitely has one of the most expansive AYCE selections in Vegas. Lots of appetizers are also included, my favorite being the Surf and Turf. The fish is always very fresh, and their special rolls are inventive and delicious! There are a few reviews that specifically mention the Monster Roll. I like it, but I find it very difficult to eat due to the size. My favorites are the Sunrise Roll and the Hawaiian Roll. 

I would avoid coming here during the lunch or dinner rush unless you're sitting at the counter, though...service tends to get really, really slow when they're busy and sometimes items from my order are forgotten. They do get very busy, so just keep that in mind. 

Oyshi is by far the best sushi restaurant on the southwest side, and despite some slow table service during their busiest hours and some sloppy sushi-making when they are extremely busy during weekend dinners, I will definitely continue to frequent it when I'm in the mood for sushi.

Oh, and make sure to save room for dessert: the Green Tea Tiramisu is amazing!

"I'm STARVING! waited 34 mins AFTER gettin seated just to flag a different waiter to take our All You Can Eat sushi order. This place used to be my favorite sushi spot but the service sticks out the most (above the food) and this place really went to the gutter."

This restaurant is always busy, so calling ahead will help with the long waits. They have a very large selection of sushi on the menu ranging from shashimi to baked rolls.  They have a wide variety of appetizers that come with the "All you can eat" menu.  If you like spicy rolls, go with the Nuclear Roll. It was by far my favorite of the night.  The staff was surprisingly on point with being attentive to as well, especially since it was a full house.
great ayce, they offer teriyaki steaks and dessert. Lunch is about 5 dollars cheaper

I am SAD that I wasn't able to eat more because I went there after a night of drinking and was severely hung over. I love the prices and the fact that its all you can eat!! Tip: Remember not to leave any food or rolls left over because they make you pay for it. Also you cannot take food home so order carefully and arrive here on an empty stomach.

Has been a looong time since I went to Oyshi, as my first experience here was less than memorable, and pre-Yelp.  

Some colleagues talked me into another visit recently, and I have to say, I was pleased with the AYCE lunch special.  I found a couple rolls that were interesting and spicy.  Enjoyed them both thoroughly.  My colleagues raved about their selections also.  The sushi chefs were very courteous, and the waitress was quick to assist with questions and recommendations.  

I will definitely keep this on my lunch list, and may have to make an evening visit, when you really decide on that last star at a local sushi spot!  "Kanpai!"

This place is truly a hidden gem.  The AYCE is not skimpy and reasonably priced.  Hawaiian rolls are my thing and theirs requires a re-order.
Very nice atmosphere and decent service.
I'm looking forward to going back soon!

Glad to say that Oyshi Sushi definitely gave me a good first impression! Although, the reason why I took a star off because my friend and I had to wait for a long time to get our sushi, we were a little irritated. Then again, it was definitely worth the wait. Best sushi I've tasted yet! Can't wait for my second time; highly recommend this place!

For the $2X price of lunch or dinner AYCE sushi this place is really not too shabby!  Basically everything on the menu minus the sashimi's on the menu are obtainable for the AYCE deal just make sure you can finish everything you order, or pay the price.
I liked the fact that the fish was actually cold to the touch when I was eating the rolls and what not...it gives me the false sense that it's fresher.
Like most AYCE if you have a big appetite it becomes a better deal for you but if you can only stomach two rolls max, might be better off ordering off the menu and skipping on the deal.

Great place to go for AYCE sushi. Friendly sushi chefs and pretty nice ambiance. Luckily as I went to the wrong door first a gentleman who happened to be a regular helped me out and sure enough ended up sitting next to my date and I at the bar so I instantly became friends with the manager and staff. I suppose I could credit all the special attention and custom rolls to his presence but then again maybe that's just how they do things here. 

Had a great experience and would come back again. Decent price, delicious rolls, friendly service.
Definitely one of the best sushi spots in town! Really good rolls and not very expensive! I go here all the time!

Keep coming back and this last time was back to the Oyshi we knew before. The food was great and staff was outstanding. My only concern is their choice of music if you're bringing family or children. That's minor.

Usually, when I walk into a Japanese restaurant, I get the boisterous greeting from the sushi chefs and wait staff. None here. No biggie. Nice, clean-looking restaurant.

The fish tasted fresh. Ordered the tuna and super white tuna. Both were tasty. The rolls, however, I found a little disappointing. The atomic bomb was the only roll I thought was pretty good, but it was nothing out of the ordinary. The Sunrise roll I did not care for at all. It tasted like it was soaked in a garlic soy sauce. The Iris Special roll was very difficult to eat. The sauce tasted very similar to the sauce in the Sunrise roll, but it was a completely different sauce. There was a pasty, yet grainy texture to it and the flavor was pretty gross. 

All in all, I don't think i'd go there again.
got the AYCE... overall is good... sashimi r not included in AYCE, and cant get half order of the rolls...

hands down. this is by far the best sushi place in all of vegas. i havent been to all, but  ive been to many sushi spots. ive explored what every sushi place i've been to has to offer as their signature rolls. but ive gotta say, Oyshi's all you can eat, is worthy of my twenty something dollars. reborn and raised on the turfs of this restaurant. speaking of,  surf & turf on a sizzling platter!? part of the all you can eat menu. come on. get real. they are. their "love affair" is part of my oyshi diet. its busy at night, you may have to wait. worth the wait. they even have 3 private rooms available to reserve if you're having a big group or a special occassion. good times every single visit. i have no complaints. if i had any complaints. its far from my house. but really worth the drive. it makes me appreciate them even more.

Great food and drinks. We didn't have the best service. They did run out of the plum wine which is my favorite but she did have recommendations for other types drinks. We ordered entree and several rolls everything tasted great.

Best place to go to pig out on fresh sushi....I don't get the negative reviews,,,,,been here several times always good, never got sick,,,rather go here than thanksgiving turkey We took a friend and he was amazed that there was so much variety...I guess he played it safe before with California rolls and never had "sushi" or sashimi.  Trust my Japanese relatives being an Aryan....Try the fish collar if you want an upgrade

I really love this place. The food is the best AYCE sushi in town, in my opinion.  But as for the service... VERY SLLLLOWWWWW. Waitresses don't come around to check up on you as often as they should, and the orders take a long time to get.  I waited 30 min for the waitress to return and another 20 min to get my order of rolls.  That would be my only complaint, which is sorta a big deal!

I absolutely love this place! Its delicious and the staff are not only sweet and kind they are very very attentive to anything you need!

I already went twice in a row last week and i cant wait for more! do the all you can eat sushi!

My favorite roll ever is the DOUBLE SCREAMING ROLL with cucumber squeeze some lemons on top of it and it tastes even better~!! YUUM

You also MUST TRY my second favorite its a tad spicy but is so good...Lava Flow &
 as for plates the sizzling steak plate is delicious.
Flavorless Gyoza, overcooked beef wrapped asparagus, and slow service. That about sums up my visit here.
I love the food here no doubt but I wish they learned how to make the sushi faster D; I guess they do that on purpose so we don't eat as much or something but I'll still go back [:

My wife (who surprisingly doesn't eat seafood) was introduced to this place and she's addicted.  She gets all the egg rolls and teriyaki chicken and beef she can eat, and even some rolls without fish.  The all you can eat deal it great.  I leave feeling like I will never need to eat again.  The food is great, the service is good, and the Mochi desert is interesting.  Even the kids meal is quite large for being only $6.  If you want good sushi, this is your place.  They make the rolls after you order them so be sure to be patient and order several rolls at a time so you don't have to wait for a long time between orders.

I love this place. The price is reasonable. Everyone pretty much summed it up. Their Oyshi rolls are the BOMB. I love their Surf and Turf too... Another thing that is awesome about this place is that they sometimes get the UFC fights and you get to eat all you can eat sushi for $26 and watch the fights for free... Like tomorrow night. Make sure you make reservations cause its pretty small and seats get filled fast!

Came here today and sat at the bar (because you can order half rolls). Exceptional service from the staff behind the bar, funny, quick witted and fun to be around. Food quality was great as usual. Ribeye steak sizzle plate and tiger rolls and you never go wrong.

Okay but not the best. 

Ate here today for the first time. The waiters were nice and they were very attentive, but the food took longer than expected, especially appetizers. All we ordered we poke bowls but it took about 15 mins to actually get it. Then we ordered 3 rolls and the restaurant wasn't even busy but it took them at least 20 mins... 

Also I wouldn't drink their water. Had a very metallic and off putting taste to it. No bueno. And their nigiri is very small! I was surprised at the amount of rice they had with each piece of nigiri! The rolls did taste good, they were just smaller compared to other rolls at other sushi restaurants.

Starting to become fond of this place. Always treated with great service, and great food! Spicy Tuna Roll is one you cant miss out on! And there pot stickers have a unique taste, and this really mind blowing with the sauce!

Forget about the sushi restaurants on the Strip. Go here. Seriously.

Located in Enterprise, I was a little skeptical about this place because it's centered within a weird strip mall that had a veternarian's office, Dairy Queen, and a Korean nail salon nearby. Whatever. That don't mean SHIT when it comes to delicious sushi.

With a great all-you-can-eat dinner price and the craziest variety of rolls to choose from, I don't see how you would NOT enjoy your sushi-licious dinner here.

Even though we were only in Vegas for 5 days, we managed to eat here TWICE because we were like "EFF THE STRIP!" and wanted to eat to our stomachs' content without the glare of neon lights.

Crunchy Spicy Tuna Roll? I dream about eating it every day for the rest of my life because that would be a DREAM COME TRUE, YOU GUYS.

We were in Vegas a few months ago when a stranger told us about this place.  I remembered the name and we had time to try it out a few days ago.  We got there at about 8pm and on a weekday so it wasn't packed.  We had the best waiters though.  Service was excellent from the get go.  The people that work there are friendly and nice.  We ordered a few rolls and some appetizers to begin with.  We just took our time eating.  We weren't in a rush.  At times, we would take breaks and the waiter/waitress would check to see if we wanted to order anything.  All the rolls were fresh and tasty.  It's AYCE but they ask that you eat everything that you order.  Everything that we ordered was delicious.  We also ordered the seaweed salad and that was very nice.  The music is loud but it is also a place with a lot of energy.  I thought it was perfect.  We had a great experience and we will be back the next time we're in Vegas.

Ok here come the Vegas reviews...yes, it's down the street from my house. Yes, it gets crowded. If you bring more than 4 friends, go off-time, meaning AFTER THE LUNCH CROWD or BEFORE THE DINNER CROWD, especially on weekends. 

Or split your party up but sit near each other. Trust me this is how you won't have to wait and salivate while others are dining and taking their time. (Just kidding) But seriously, like every other Yelper, it is a good deal. 

Highly popular with everybody. Highly.

One of my fave sushi restaurants! I love the service, quality food and its very fresh. The menu is on point. I really have nothing bad to say. I've been a few times, and both times were on point. Its worth the trip.

FLY IN SOY 

What is the first thing you do before the sushi gets to your table? You pour soy on that little plate, but the last thing you expect is a dead fly to come out of there! 

Now the fly is not the big problem, the problem was the waitress, instead of apologizing for the mishap she immediately started making excuses of how the fly's get into the restaurant ... I had to interrupt her by telling her to just change the set up. 

When the bill came, no attempt to apologize for that nasty surprise was made nether verbally or physically on the bill. 

Their food is decent but not great, I will never go there again nor tell others to go... too bad because its in my neighborhood .

My boyfriend took me here for my birthday and ever since then we love coming here. The staff is friendly and fast service! I love how it looks inside very modern. We can't find a place that's better then this place. They have quality fish for a great price!

Always one of my favorite places to eat.  Service is great, food is awesome, and after going there for the past year the chefs know already what I want.  Always recommend this place to family and friends.

Pros: $27 AYCE, fresh fish, dynamite app, big pieces of nigiri, multiple sake options, calamari, extra large selection of appetizers, short wait for food once ordered
Cons: Only 5 baked mussels per person, oysters tasted bad, seared tuna was closer to fully cooked than just seared, surf and turf was over cooked, tables who walked in after us were seated before us
Overall: The majority of food that we ordered was excellent with a few misses but the large pieces of fish that were fresh and tasty made up for the few bombs. Service was decent, not the quickest or most personable plus I had to ask for the check and plates stayed around longer than I would have preferred. One thing is for sure for me, great food outweighs decent service so we will be back soon, especially since it's 2 miles from my house.

Went back to Oyshi last Monday and the place was packed. A Little surprised but expected knowing this place is pretty popular. Anyway, did the AYCE again, but I ordered the Kami Kaze and NYI rolls. Word of warning, these things were HUGE. I thought the AYCE portions suppose to be smaller than the regular order. If this is smaller order, I'm afraid to ask what their regular size would be. These two rolls came out near the end of our meals and we were kinda full by that time already, so trying to stuff those two rolls down was a challenge. Next time, I won't order this roll unless I have 2 or 3 people to split it with. Anyway, the reason I reduced one star on this trip is that the sushi wasn't as fresh as my previous trip there. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't exceptional fresh either. I heard from some review, not sure if it's for Oyshi or Kobe, that it might be due to the fact that fish delivery comes on Tue, Thu and Sat.
Had dinner there tonight and it was amazing!!! Though they were busy, food was amazing! My BF and I had popcorn scallops, dynamite sushi, and red dragon! They were delicious! Definitely recommended

This is my favorite all your can eat sushi place in Vegas! You can always find a seat right off the bat (Which is a far cry from somewhere else Yama Sushi where I have waited up to 2 hours with a group of 6). The menu is much longer, and more unique than somewhere like Sushi Mon. The decor is pretty hip, staff very friendly. We go back at least once a month!

It saddens me to write this review because I really used to like Oyshi. We were so excited when they first opened, as there weren't any sushi restaurants nearby. We came here often and really enjoyed it. As time went on, we noticed changes in staff and service suffered. They also got busier, thus orders were taking way too long. 

The food has always remained pretty good (in my opinion). But good food doesn't make up for bad service or a bad experience.

The good news is, they have another location on Sahara, which is farther away from me, but less busy and usually has better service.

I've never been to a sushi buffet like this before.  Normally, places like Todai, Onami (now Tora in San Diego) have it set up where you walk up to the sushi bar and the rolls are there waiting for you to pick them up, at the same time they have a hot plate station, as well as desserts.

Oyshi is totally different due to the fact that you choose from the menu what you would like from the buffet section and it is made fresh for you to munch on.  Sushi is not the only thing part of the buffet menu, there are the small appetizer sushi's as well as tempura vegetables.  The best part are the specialty rolls, they are so freakin delicious.  I can't remember each of their names, but the cajun specialty roll, and the whatever screaming whatchamacalit are so damn good!

The ambience is pretty stylish and nice and I give them more props for playing house progressive music as we dine.  The staff is uber nice, especially since we went in a massive group that was pretty loud and would have drove most servers bonkers d bobcat.  Definitely gonna want to come here again next time I make a trip back out to visit the family in Vegas.

BEST SUSHI BUFFET EVER. 
BEST SUSHI BUFFET EVER. 
B_E_S_T  S_U_S_H_I B_U_F_F_E_T E_V_E_R!!!!!!

Okay, if this obnoxious review cannot convince you to try it out, then perhaps all the other positive ones will! 

Thanks to Yelp!, my friends took us here several months ago and the eight of us who went loved it! It seriously beat all the sushi-buffets I have ever been to. The sushi buffet menu is comprehensive! Every type of roll you can think of, Maki sushi, miso-soup, wakame salad(!!!), etc. etc. It even features menu items that even non-sushi lovers would enjoy -- tons of appetizers, surf and turf steak and shrimp, terayiki, tempura, etc. It comes with free tea, and a free dessert after your meal. And it's less expensive than a Vegas buffet! 

Totally worth it!! I went again a second time and introduced it to a new group and it did not disappoint. 

The only gripe I have is they have a rule that you have to eat most of the rice or there will be a surcharge. Only a slight bummer, but I cannot blame them. It is still a very fabulous place worth spending the $$$ you earned gambling!!!

4 words: All you can eat. That's the way to go. Being that I'm not from here, I was surprised at how fresh the sushi was. But it was! We ordered way too much but somehow found a way to finish it all. I would definitely come back.
Simply amazing is all I can say!  I am a Sushi rookie but this place makes me want to eat it all the time!

Oyshi was my first AYCE experience here in Vegas.  At first I thought it was one of the better AYCE sushi places in Vegas but lately it has gone down hill. Case in point my last visit.

We had a party of 6, waited about 15 minutes to be seated.  I've been here when it has been busy and tonight it wasn't that BUSY. We made our first round of orders and waited, waited some more and waited.  It was a good 25 minutes before we got our first round.  We didn't receive our complete order, I just said eh never mind. We ordered some more, and I ordered some Uni and oysters for our group. Again we waited, and waited again. We got the rest of our FIRST order and got some of the second but no uni or oysters. So I ordered some nigiri to hold me over until the uni and oysters came. My nigiri came but not the other items, finally the oysters came but no uni, i asked our server where is the uni and i she tells me 'oh, we ran out'. I was like WTF! Shouldn't you know that information before I ordered it or at least kept me updated. At this point some of my party was clearly upset and just ordered dessert but guess what? They were OUT of some the dessert items too! 

This last visit was VERY bad, I hope they improve cause I like this place a lot because they offer different items from other AYCE.

FYI: The table next to us, got up and left and never paid, I think it was due to the poor service they got.

I'll be back, MAYBE

I love this place. I normally get the AYCE sushi and always get my $$ worth. My favs are the Ono, Fresh scallop, Salmon and Yellowtail....heck they're all good.  Service is the bomb and i'm not sure if he's the owner or the floor manager but he's the dude in a shirt and tie, but he's a total team player. He's greeting and helping clear tables including taking orders if the waiter/waitresses are busy multi tasking. The game is always on and the atmosphere is lively and they open late. If you're craving of sushi and have a huge appetite, give them a shot.
Very good all you can eat sushi options. The monthly specials were exceptional all be it the salmon belt was average at best.  I would recommend this place and will come back again

I have gone to this place for a couple of years. And every time I come in I can see their popularity is rising. They have add more seating area which is great. I don't think I've ever waited for 20mins for a table. The food is always good. Everything I've ever had their is yummy! They added a sizzling plate which I really enjoyed. They have a couple ppl that walk around just to clear your table which is awesome. Your table is never cluttered.

We were just there on Sunday night and was very pleased with everything.  This was our first time there and we sat at the bar and had a blast of a time.  The guys behind the counter making the sushi were attentive to our needs and made us laugh.

When we go back to Vegas, we will make sure to go back to Oyshi Sushi again and bring friends.

This is the second time I've been here and I have yet to be impressed. 
The Oysters were UNEDIBLE, not fresh at all.
And the Sushi in general just didn't seem very fresh either AND they put quite a bit of rice with the nigiri to fill your ass up with THIN ass slices of fish!
Second time not impressed, not wasting anymore time, money or calories here. 
Sorry!

Great food!

Yes there is a wait, but that is because the food is cooked FRESH!

My wife was not a Sushi fan...but she is now because if Oyshi. 

Grew up eating Japanese food in San Francisco & this tops the list!!

It's all good, really....Me and my lady went on a Friday and had to wait 20-30mins but it was worth the wait. Got the all-you-can-eat YES!!! and everything I ordered was good.  Great place for a date...Cool music too.

Went to a nice lunch with a vendor.  My favorite foods were the garlic tuna, salmon belly and yellowtail trio.

Other than that, service was slower though the staff did their best.  Not my favorite, but good enough.  Since it is close to where my job is, there might be future plans to have lunch there....lol.
The All You Can Eat (AYCE) sushi and appetizers is a great deal, if you're hungry and you don't want sashimi (which isn't included).  Food is good.

The service is okay, depends on which server you get. The first time eating here our server was great. Food came out fast & tasted good. Second time eating here our server was nice but very slow. It was a long wait for the food & by the time it came out our "crispy" rolls weren't so crispy. Eating here for the third time was just like the second. I would say the service & quality of food is inconsistent. The sushi's okay, had better else where.

I found Oyshi by accident about 3 years ago an it's been my favorite Sushi spot since then. It's definitely the best sushi in Vegas - I always bring my friends so we can try a new roll or just really have a good time. 
I would give them 5, 6, 10 stars a couple years ago but the last time I was there I felt the quality of their food went down! The rolls didn't look fresh, the size of the salmon cuts or anything really are half now! I got very disappointed when I left the place, It use to be my favorite must go place in Vegas. 
The one good thing about them is I already complained about the service once and they took very good care of me, so I'm assuming if they figure it out the service went down considerably they will definitely take care and made it tool as good as before.
Mono was,awesome!!! He really made our experience great..he suggested a sake that was,exactly wat we were looking for. Loved it! We will b back! :)

Now I don't know how many check-in's I have on Yelp, but I've been here a fair amount of times to know what is good and what is bad about this place. This was the first AYCE sushi place I've been to here in the valley and it's not in my top 3 places. To sum it up, Oyshi is so hit or miss that it's almost a risk to come here. Yes, you'll come here see that there's a long wait and expect it to be great but the last few times I've been here and given chance after chance, I've left disappointed. 

First of all, I used to work in a restaurant. Server's know when it's busy, trust me, and as a customer I expect you to acknowledge that. The times that I've waited for a decent amount of time, I've never been apologized to about the wait or been given an explanation when the rolls I've ordered don't come out when it seems like people who just sat down are getting there's before me. 

I'm not that selfish, but I just feel like the service here is poorly conducted. I've felt that it takes a group of us to look around constantly before someone comes and asks if we need anything. The rolls are always very good, but the amount of time that it takes most times I'm there is not average to the sushi places I've been to. 

I will admit I do love their Salmon Nigiri and the Love Affair roll but a lot of the other rolls often feel like there is just too much going on. I don't like to complain, but the service isn't up to my standards and my standards aren't extremely high. I just expect my water to be refilled within a decent time and asked if I'd like to order more without having to ask to order more. 

I am very forgiving and I will come here, I just don't have the expectations that I once did. The sushi is usually very fresh and the options aside from the sushi are great. I always order the calamari and the surf-n-turf appetizers when I come here. I would recommend this place to a friend, I think I would just advise them to be go-getters with their servers and make it known when they want something. All in all, if someone said they were coming here tomorrow, I'd probably join them. Cheers!

First time visit 
Made a reservation 
Did not wait at all 
Food 
Sushi :  3 Star Too much Rice
Roll: Ok 
Appetiser : 3 Star  ( Surf And Turf, Fresh Oyster )
Table was sticky 
Staff : ok 
Overrall 3 star

01.07.12

Preface: This review had been shortened & edited from an 8-page thesis which I will someday publish as "Can Fresh Sushi be Found in the Middle of the Desert?"

POSITIVE: 
* My 18 y.o. niece (Las Vegas native) recommended this sushi restaurant. "Uncle, this place is the BOMB!"
* Off the L.V. Strip

NEGATIVE:
* Host not attentive to the waiting guests (first time I've ever seen a restaurant host partake in drinking with guests during a work shift).
* Waitress/Server never there when we needed her - asking if we needed anything every 90 seconds the last 15 minutes of our stay.
* Food seemed like it sat too long before reaching the table. 
* Beer not chilled enough. (maybe it sat out too long before being served as well).
* Water glasses were never serviced nor were we asked if we wanted anything else to drink.
* The time waiting to be seated succeeded the time spent eating at the table
* Overpriced less than average fare for an over-rated joint.

Will I return? Sure...if I sit at the sushi bar & someone else pays.

Truth! deez® out.

My husband and I have a new favorite place in town. We live in Summerlin and still drive to the Southwest side of town for sushi.

Portions for AYCE would fool you. Sushi pieces are generous and balls of rice are not enormous. The appetizers are good, you have to try Grilled beef asparagus!

Staff is friendly and do their best on busy nights. Make sure you call for reservations on weekend nights. 

Also, you can order half rolls from the sushi bar, not tables. So if we go, just the 2 of us, we will sit at the bar.

Shame! Shame! Shame on me! 

I have been here at least 4 times & have not given them some love!

Well, let me say... Oyshi is my new fav sushi place! Grrreeeattt Sushi at great prices... What can I say? I mean everything here is fabulous... I am a big raw eater - so, that is where I spend my calories & it is FRESH!  To agree with others, Yes, it is $26 for all you can eat!  However, there are also some great sides... they have these lil potato croquettes... sooo yummy... also, they have some steak wrapped asparagus :)  It is so hard to name all of the yummy eats they have there... this is def my place...  I do not mind the drive from Henderson, takes me 15 - 20min & I am in sushi heaven :)

Yes, you must go there! Go there and enjoy! You will not be sorry...

one thing though, since it has become popular a reservation is recommended on the weekends...

LOVE the Iris roll!

happy eating!

your constant companion,

~deirdra
Everything was great, especially the service.   Our waiter was on top of it!  Will most definitely come back.

I'm writhing in pain as I write this review because my stomach hurts so flipping bad after eating from here.  Prepare yourself for my meanest review yet.

First, NO.  Just no.  I want to shout this at the top of my lungs to the owner/manager/whatever of this place.  The sushi here was the WORST ever that Ive tasted.  They boast an impressive menu but too bad they do not know how to properly make each roll.  The fish was SLIMY and gross.  Sushi rolls should not slide down your throat, you should be able to chew them and relish in all the amazing flavors.  I couldn't distinguish any of the rolls apart and the WORST one was the Hawaiian roll.  It completely ruined my entire appetite and I couldnt eat any more sushi.  Like literally too disgusted.

Secondly, NO.  The service needed some help.  They were friendly but when they got busy they couldn't keep up.  There were 4 sushi chefs and 3 waitresses with the restaurant being full.  It took forever to get us seated (the hostess has to waitress just to keep up), forever to get our sushi rolls, and forever to get a refill and we went there when it was NOT busy.  

Lastly, my boyfriend and I both immediately felt sick to our stomachs when we left.  Like nauseous, clutch your stomach, take tiny sips of water and moan sick.

So why one star?  Why bother to give one?  Because the staff WAS friendly whenever they did talk to us.  

Also there were several flies in the restaurant.  DEE-SGUSTING

Harumph!

Had to give my two cents given all the overblown reviews this place has. Don't get me wrong the sushi was not bad - the albacore was tasty even though it was warm. Two of the rolls were ok, not delicious, but good. What this place needs to step up in is on service. Staff friendly but not as attentive as they could've been. I never received my Sapporo and was billed for it (I didn't pay for it).I imagine the trick is ordering the AYCE. The table next to us had it and received regular service, in fact, their water glasses were filled while ours were left empty. Place is not worth the lengthy drive from the strip.

Most locals know where to go for sushi! It's the best for carb loading after a long run! Menu is extensive that offers variety of choices for most. My fav are hot stuff like Asian skirt steak! Come for lunch or just come and fill up!

I've been going to this sushi restaurant for a little over 4years. I remember this place because it was where I had my first date on Valentines Day. My opinions on this restaurant has been consistent within these several years. I love this place. I eat here few times a month because I can't get enough of the food! Some reviewers may complain about the service, with a few exceptions, their service to us has been amazing. The thing I admire most about this restaurant is that the service isn't limited to just the servers, but the owner is running around serving people as well. I've been going here for so long, the owner recognizes us each time! 

Food: I am obsessed with their Ian's Special Roll. It has multiple layers of flavor goodness! 

Things to Try: Snow Mountain roll, Salmon Lover, Tiger Roll, Surf and Turf (appetizer), Ahi poke, Baked Mussels, Grilled Asparagus and Shrimp, and all the sushi fish you desire. Their Vanilla Parfait for dessert is pretty amazing too. 

I usually look forward to the Uni and the Oysters, but the reason why it's 4 stars and not 5 is because there have been times where it is not available. And it really puts a damper on my entire meal. Who doesn't want to get their money's worth! 

Overall, great experience! When anyone comes into town, this is the first place I take them, and they all love it as much as I do! It's pretty amazing! I've tried so many sushi restaurants here and out of state, and none compares to the sushi place here in Vegas!

Came here for bday dinner service sucked ass couldn't be bothered to even ask to refill our drinks waited forever to get our rolls when we went to order again we waited literally for 20 minutes to get our food or even see a waitress will not be back 
Very disappointed. Also watch your check they like adding on items and have an 18% mandatory tip that was not deserved.

The wait was a little long when it appeared that there was many open tables. The service was friendly and fast. 

The sushi was amazing, and the all you can eat was such s value!!  I highly recommend this place, and I'll be back.

My boyfriend absolutely loves this place. He's not really into AYCE sushi places, but he LOVES this one. Me? Yup, I thought it was pretty good too. Love that they give you small portions, so that you can try more things, and you don't get stuck trying to finish something you don't like. ~$26 per person for AYCE dinner. This includes everything on the menu except sashimi. Some of our favs were the Hawaiian Ahi Poke, Nigiri, Tiger Roll, and for dessert, Green Tea Ice Cream. It's about a 10 minute drive off the strip. Great for large parties, but make reservations. We went on a Monday night, and though we were able to get seats right away at 5:45pm, the place was pretty busy by the time we left.  We'll definitely be back.

Great sushi! 

I walked in and had to wait about 5 minutes which is not a big deal at all. I would wait much longer to eat here again. Waiter was very friendly and made suggestions. The menu is very big and definitely worth it if you are going to eat at least 3 rolls. Plus, you get the option of ordering appetizers and other sides. The only down side to Oyshi is the time it takes to bring out your food. Other sushi places in town are very quick to get orders to the table. I went a second time hoping it was just an off night in the kitchen but the service was still incredibly slow. We were at our table for 10 minutes before anyone came to greet us, which is annoying but the food here is worth the wait I suppose.
Food was ok. Very poor service. Took a long time just for appetizers. Rather go to the new location on west Sahara.

The quality of fish was not great. Another ayce sushi failure :/ fish to rice ratio was not good either. I asked not to put too much rice but they still did. Rice was too dense, felt like they really squeezed rice hard. Nothing was impressive here, I felt like it was waste of $26. 

On top of that, fish was really not fresh! I started feeling sick as returning to hotel and as soon as I got there I threw up everything. It was a bad experience. Won't return.

I still love this place. When we want sushi we want Oyshi!

With that said, here's my rant....no matter what night you go here it's ALWAYS packed. That's not my gripe. Upon our recent visit I noticed that they took out some of the tables to put in a rather large hostess stand. This place is already small and crowded, why would you take away seating???

Ok end rant.....

We went here for dinner last night. 4 adults and 2 kids, the service was good. 

For the value of what you pay, I think it was really good. We all got to try many things on the all you can eat. Everything was good. We ordered salmon and tuna sashimi off the regular menu also and it tasted fresh and really delicious. 

We got dessert too, our two friends ordered the green tea tiramisu and green tea creme brûlée, they both liked it, I got the ice cream which was also good. 

We would recommend it and would go again, I'm not sure why the bad reviews from others.

A friend of mine introduced me to this place last year. His selling point was that "real Japanese people" make the food. The funny thing is that the staff and owners are 90% Korean.

Does it matter either way? Masa or Jiro may not care much for it, but by AYCE standards, it's the best sushi in town (best a la carte goes to Naked Fish.) Service is okay but gets a little hectic when the restaurant is at full capacity. No big deal. As an added and bizarre surprise, the pint-sized creme brulee is the greatest I've ever had. If you can resist cramming your stomach with one more roll, be sure to end the meal with it.

I used to come here all the time with friends .. The last two times I was in they tried to charge me AYCE for my TWO YEAR OLD! Seriously?! She eats a few pieces of edemame and maybe a piece or two of sushi.. The sushi has always been ok.. Not bad for the price..

I usually go to oyshi often but the last time i went the service i had was extremely horrible... so ever since my last visit i never went back... dont get me wrong but the sushi there is really good but they just gotta work on the service... i could of seriously just walked out and they would not notice...

Very nice place and nicely decorated.  Service is fantastic. They are on point and very accommodating.  I wish I could say the same about the sushi. We had the AYCE, and the rolls were just mediocre.  They need to improve on the rice and the quality of the fish on the nigiri was lets just say doesn't look fresh.  I would go here again, but for their lunch special.

The sushi was good and for the all u can eat price and what they include its definetly worth it.  We sat at the sushi bar and interacted with the guys rolling our sushi and had a great experience. We got there before the dinner rush and would definetly recommend getting there before the rush because they fill up quick.  I will definetly be back.

Gave this place a shot because my friends are always raving about it. The hostess was friendly. We sat at the only two open seats at the bar. No greeting or anything so we left after about 8 minutes of awkward waiting. To their defense it was extremely busy. Maybe I'll give it another try when it's not so slammed..

Atlas my favorite sushi place in Las Vegas!

Unfortunately I'm unable to rate them a full 5 star due to their slowness on delivering plates. My group definitely has to order a lot of sushi at once to compensate for the wait time in between orders.

The environment is amazing. It's definitely the most up to date sushi restaurant in Las Vegas. I'm judging by the actual wall decor to the house music played.

My favorite dish would have to be A Lobster Affair. If you don't have a shellfish allergy give this dish a try.

I'm torn.

The sushi was outstanding and the All You Can Eat menu was expansive.

The service was terrible. There were many servers there on a Monday night and the place wasn't super busy. They kept forgetting about us and not once did anyone ask if everything was ok. We did the AYCE deal and after I finished a roll it would be like, 15 minutes before anyone asked for our next order. A few times we had to pester the bus boys to get our server because they were the only staff that was coming around. I saw the server at the table next to us check on them twice before anyone came to us even once. I understand if it's crazy busy and people are ordering sushi like it's going out of style, but I kept looking up at the servers standing around at the bar doing nothing but looking confused. Maybe they didn't know who had our table, I don't know. After we were done with our dessert we just sat there for another 10-15 minutes waiting for our check. Again, we had to literally get up out of our seats to find someone.

Any time I've done AYCE at other places, even busier places like Goyemon, the service has been fine. This was bad service to the point of being extreme.

Come on Oyshi, step it up! I really really like your sushi!

This was my go to place for AYCE and i dont care for ayce sushi places to be honest, but this one was really good. Ive been here easily over 10x and each time its gotten a little worse i hate to say....the service mainly. There was a few waitresses that were top notch but havent seen them last couple times in, hope they are still there. The food is good place is clean, the management is retarded though. The wait time ironically can be slower when they are not busy than when they are busy (maybe they feel the urgency when they are packed). Either way ill go back until its unbearable that i can no longer stand it there....i mean all you can eat little sliced up rib eye, i usually put down about 3-4lbs of that alone!
Fat pieces of fish on the nigiri, the ratio and freshness beats all of the other sushi joints I've tried out here.
AYCE for the win! With some beer and good company, it'll be a great meal for any occasion.

A few weeks ago, this is the first time I visited this place after a coworker recommended this place. Friends and I got AYCE. Disappointed that we couldn't order half rolls, only full rolls. So we couldn't try a variety of sushi because we got full fast. It's ok, the sushi all seemed the same. The creme brûlée was good, most memorable part of the experience. The green tea tiramisu someone got was ok. Didn't like how you can only order one dessert but unlimited ice cream. Got too full to try the ice cream. Their rules are weak compared to sushi mon or Yama sushi. Would not come back. I didn't think it was worth it.
Great food, I always come for their all you can eat Korean BBQ. The rolls out of this world, my go to sushi place, it does get busy sometimes though.

The sushi here is so good! Ever since I left there I've been craving their sushi. I'll definitely be coming back here ASAP. 
My only complaint is we had to wait a while to be seated when the waiters were just standing around, but they were pretty friendly and patient for a newcomer to sushi like myself
Always busy but awesome food. My hubby is a yelper, so read his detailed review(s) (Dan N.) . Must get the Atomic Bomb!
We always come in for sushi and food is always good and fresh.  Just want to say that our server Bess was super sweet, attentive and just awesome.

If you are a sushi snob, hit back on your browser and get a plane ticket to LA at least if not Tokyo. Las Vegas as far as I have seen as two sushi options... Buffet and the type of place you are subsidizing comped high rollers. 

Oyshi is the buffet type. $21 for lunch. $26 for dinner. I did not notice anything different between the two menus. The $5 vig is likely pure the night vig. 

Your options include sushi, rolls and hot dishes. Each is worth a paragraph. 

Sushi. Most AYCE places save $$$ by not offering albacore, ikura, scallops, uni and other such high end items. This is not the case for Oyshi, which makes me wonder where they cut corners. That being said, I believe the sushi is the highlight of the menu. Though the rice is not prepared to sushi standards, the rice portion is fairly small compared to the fish, so this does not take away too much from the bite. The actual fish itself is pretty good considering it is AYCE. Note that each order is a fairly small two pieces, so don't be shy about ordering a lot. Do eat the rice as well, though, as you will be penalized for going no-carbs. 

Rolls. Of the spider, bonsai, ebi ebi and volcano, I only liked the last two. I think the issue here is the sauces are pretty hit and miss. I think that AYCE places try to make their rolls filling, salty and sweet to induce satiation or in the case of bonsai nausea. That roll actually made me heave a little. Don't order too many rolls. It is sort of like how most of the menu is rolls like casinos mostly place slot machines on the casino floor. It's the most profitable. 

Last and definitely least is the appetizer menu. All the meat items suck. The beefs are stringy and sweet sauced up to disguise their cheapness and the chicken is dry. Don't waste gut space. If you wanted a nice surf and turf combo, you should be at a fine steakhouse. I was disappointed, but having a good appetizer menu at an AYCE sushi place would just be a bonus. I think some of the non-meat stuff is fairly safe, such as the miso soup (though don't expect the world). 

Drinks. Didn't sample the alcohol, but you have your usual assortment of sake and beer. Since I was there for lunch and was still tired from the previous night's drive, I passed. Tea is $2.50 in case you wanted to know and is pretty good to share since it is a flat fee for one pot with free hot water refills. 

Though Oyshi is in a strip mall on a nondescript corner of the Vegas suburbs, it wants you to think that you are in Caesar's Palace. Not necessarily a bad thing. 

There are two back rooms to accommodate large groups. Lunch is fairly quiet. I would expect dinner to be loud with the drinking and the karaoke. 

Services is good during lunch. Attentive and even proactive about making sure you order a lot. Nice. 

Overall, it is a good value at $21. This continually justifies my urge to stay away from the Strip for dining. Just don't expect tsukiji quality or anything and enjoy the relatively cheap eats.
Cheap under cooked rice, bad oysters, terrible service... This isnt sushi... So disappointed. Tried 3 times just bc i live so close but the food and service gets worse and worse.

Honestly if this review was based solely on the taste of the food it would probably get 5 starts but the service was sooooooo bad both times I was there. First of all they sat us at a dirty table and said they would have someone come clean it. Took 5 mins for someone to get there. Another 5 minutes for someone to take our drink orders. Now this is beyond me 5 minutes went by before my friends sprite hit the table and another 5 minutes for my coke. Why on earth they didnt come at the same time is beyond me and why it would 10 ten minutes pisses me off even more. We ordered a couple roles and some salads. The salads came and we ate them and then sat there and sat there for about 15 minutes before we could even get someones attention to say hey whats happened??  They must have known how shitty they were with out me even complaining becase when the rolls finally did come they told us the salads would be complimentary due to the lack of service. That is only reason they get 2 stars instead of one. Regardless after two shitty service experiences I have no interest in returning.

Just discovered this place thanks to a coworker. Great vibe, great food and decent prices. I have o admit I don't do all you can eat, however the deal was too good to pass up. Will definitely be back!

This place was actually really great. I have not heard of it and came here on a whim thanks to Yelp. I was pleasantly surprised by what I found. This place is a nice size restaurant with a large sushi bar-, which is a super plus. The wait staff was nice and the sushi chefs were super friendly. They were super helpful as well (not to mention one that was super cute lol.) I ordered two rolls, both spicy. One had a spicy chili such and was deep friend. The other had Cajun albacore on the top - SO AMAZING. I would go there and order everything with that on top of it. The flavor was nice with a subtle kick in the back. I also had the crème brulee trio- also called the trilogy (by the cite sushi chef) The green tea wasn't good at all- way too strong but the other two, vanilla and chocolate were excellent. The chocolate was absolutely fantastic and I'm not a huge fan of chocolate crème brulee. Also the fact that they're all you can eat was only 26.95 is a super plus. They have a variety of specialty salads and appetizers you can ad onto that that looked amazing. Unfortunately I didn't have enough room for that but Ill be back! Probably next week with a friend.

The BEST AYCE spot in town! Fish is incredibly fresh and such a great menu! Everything about this place is a plus. Even the other families and couples eating here are friendly. I think we made friends with 3 new couples in our last gisit
Horrible service and charged us extra on all you can eat sushi cause we didn't eat two of the rolls that we thought was just awful. Highly don't recommend

the service egain one sushi chef for the whoole restaurant, extra slow service,in other words bad service, we never went back, n not to organise, the sushi guy dress in adidas shirt n terrible hat, not drss properly to his job, thanks
Me and the wife love this place. The food is excellent. Service is slow at times, but the All you can eat price makes up for it.

Oyshi means YUMMY in Japanese! The sushi & rolls are delicious. Their fishes are so fresh that you can't even taste the fishiness! BUT! The service has decline over the years. They were great when they first open, now they are slow with everything. It takes at least 20 mins. to get your food. You'll even have to wait for a waiter to come around again just to pay your bill. Definitely give them a try but don't expect anything fast!

Great, fresh sushi at reasonable prices. All you can eat dinner for $26, plus free dessert to complete the meal. Only downsides to the AYCE is that 1) it doesn't include sashimi, and 2) if you don't finish everything you pay the $26 plus a charge for any remaining rolls. However, if you have one or two you that just can't handle they'll usually cut you slack. Service is decent and friendly. Overall a great hidden gem everyone should try.

OYSHI - I LOOOOOVEEEEE YOU.  HAHAHA.  No joke, the Love Affair roll = Delicious, Tiger Roll = super delicious..... nice selection of rolls and such ...   everytime I go there my server has been awesome...  all you can eat Sushi... sad that you cant have the Sashimi all you can eat... but still for the $26 all you can eat price point... I am by no means disappointed by it... if they wanted to throw some in though, I would welcome it with open arms....

Food is normally good but last night I waited over 20 minutes for one roll. All my stuff came out before my girlfriends. It was ridiculous also the server didn't speak that great of English. It was extremely hard to understand her and she had an attitude whenever we ordered something. I don't understand how a place can have prices that high and not have good service. It's completely unacceptable. I expect to be contacted by management with this review. I'm not impressed and I'm not happy with the service. On a side note they were playing rap and music that should not be played in a restaurant.
My favorite sushi place in southwest. Employees are always nice and food is always consistent which is important to me. Good music and def good drinks:)

I used to live right down the street from this restaurant and still wouldn't go there because of the slow service. The only time the service was good was when it was slow. Knowing this, I would just get to go orders and never had any problems with that. 

Fast forward about 1 year... I was excited to eat here because I was sure they would have their sh*t together by now. Boy was I wrong... Our first round took FOREVER AND A DAY and our server forgot a couple things I had ordered so I ordered once again. I swear saw her scribbling on her notepad while I was telling her what I would like to eat next.  It is quite possible that she was just jotting things down for the grocery store after her shift. We decided to order dessert from the waitress at the next table so that we could have it right after the rest of the sushi came. So, dessert came and we decided to let the creme brûlée sit there on our table until the rest of our sushi came. To our surprise the sushi and our waitress was nowhere to be found!!! A long while later I asked another waitress if she could check on our other sushi orders and she informed is that there were none and she could take our order if we wanted more. THIS IS THE SECOND TIME THIS HAPPENED IN ONE VISIT!!! I tried to give this place another chance and I just feel silly for expecting something better from a place that can't offer anything better than horribly slow service. They deserve NO stars but the sushi that actually made it to the table was okay.  Don't waste your time going here... Drive to Goyemon, SushiMon, or Sushi Twister. I promise, even though the drive is further it'll take even longer to wait around for sushi here.

Good service. But the last order we had put in took a long while to get. 
Lounge area was blowing cold a/c. Nice place but needs a little touches here and there.

I've been coming here since it opened a couple years ago.  It used to be my spot, but lately they just don't seem to care.  Last time I was in it took forever for someone to seat us and there were multiple open seats with no one in front of us.  The service was just plain bad.  We had multiple servers who couldn't keep my wife's order straight(not a sushi eater) but always loved their Teriyaki Chicken Skewers.  They either change their teriyaki recipe or screwed up and put something else on it because it wasn't teriyaki. Food quality declined.  The specialty rolls seems to consist of more mayo based sauces than other ingredients.  Had to go through 3 different people to find the person to give me my check. 

 I noticed that many of the guys who I would always see working there in the past weren't there, maybe a coincidence or maybe not.  

By the way Oyshi management-having your employees sleeping one off in the V.I.P. lounge in plain sight of customers is just irresponsible and lazy.

The sushi was great!  It was fresh and had great preserntation.  If you like both the traditional and contemporary sushi, this is the place to go.   I recommend getting the "all you can eat" selection.  You can order appetizers, rolls, hot food, and a dessert.  For $26.00 plus tip & tax, it's a grea value.  They also have a private room for small parties.

Hmmm...I was planning to lose my AYCE sushi virginity to Ms. Goyemon but there was a two hour wait so instead I opted for the next girl available named Ms. Oyshi....I'd rather like to think we didn't go all the way and I'm still saving myself for the former.  

For 26 bucks, I think it's definitely in line with Sushi Goyemon, but I happened to be in the company of some friends who had been there as well, so I was able to get some perspective as I proceeded with my first time navigating this a la carte ordering feeding frenzy.  The first few speed bumps which caught my eye were some ground rules listed in the menu:

1. No sashimi, only one order of oysters (4 pieces), uni, and sweet shrimp allowed...fair enough

2. No excess rice shall be allowed to remain uneaten on the plate, otherwise that order will be counted as extra on the final bill....have people been discarding their rice into a large pile assembling a massive sculptured mountain of rice?  The rice that was used to prepare the sushi was highly variable in quality  (too soft, too firm, or mixed) throughout the various rounds of ordering so it only motivated us to concoct creative methods for disposing the rice (hiding it in the tea jar, breaking it into tiny grains and scattering it across the plate so as to create the illusion of a clean plate, and to borrow a technique from a friend who disliked rice during her early childhood, placing said rice into mouth and going to bathroom to dispose in toilet/trash).  Of course none of this was done, but it was tempting nonetheless.

3.  Any orders which are unfinished in general will be counted as extra orders on the final bill...this was adhered yet strangely enough after receiving our final round of food (a modest 2-3 rolls) the server waited when we were rubbing our bellies and chimes in "you have two more rolls coming!" and none of us had any idea where these phantom rolls were coming from and she then replies with a snarky shrug  "I'll take them off your order" as if she was doing us a favor....pure shenanigans

4. The jalapeno poppers on the appetizer menu were not allowed to be included amongst the AYCE orders....what kind of crazy logic is this?  Wouldn't it be good strategy to fill your customers with heartburn due to fatty spicy cream cheese richness to slow down their intake of much much more expensive items?  Either these are the greatest jalapeno poppers in the history of appetizers or a missed business opportunity.   I don't even like jalapeno poppers but I almost was willing  to eat one just because this condition existed.

THE MEAL

The appetizers  (ahi poke, spicy sashimi salad, and miso soup)  The poke might as well have been unseasoned sashimi, whereas the sashimi salad was overdressed nearly drowning in the chili vinaigrette, and the miso soup was surprisingly not overly salty as I anticipated but ended up being the surprise highlight of the meal.

The "big three" (uni, raw oysters, and sweet shrimp)...not exceedingly fresh but no risk of possible food poisoning either, although the oysters had a watered down quality to them....only tasted good since they were not specifically paid for.

The nigiri:  I sampled the surfer clam, spanish mackerel, japanese yellowtail, and a few other standards....there was definitely something I couldn't put my finger on but the level of freshness just seemed 1 level below what you would expect if you ordered these same items at a regular reputable sushi bar.
