I'm thinking perhaps they were precut in mass production and by the time they arrived they were partially dried out from the external surface area of each piece of fish being exposed for a prolonged period of time.

The rolls:  Perhaps I've had enough sushi experiences to have progressed beyond rolls since they are drenched in so much sauce (seriously, what is the obsession with orgasm sauce in this town?), crispy shavings of empty calories, or packed with so many types of fish that I couldn't really differentiate any of them out of a sushi roll lineup much like the Seinfeld episode where George tries to catch the Twix bar candy thief ("It's a SETUP! They're all Caterpillar rolls!!")  I would try to limit your roll intake and focus on the other items to keep your palate from being overwhelmed(and to avoid the server from pulling that phantom roll maneuver as previously discussed)

Last but not least, we figured we had successfully navigated through the labyrinth of extra charges until we received the final bill which charged us for the hot tea...are you serious???  So you're telling me I could have drank an entire gallon of miso soup instead of one measly cup of hot green tea which cost you pennies to brew?  Perhaps these were some tea leaves taken from the Emperor's garden, but I would appreciate a warning next time.  

3 stars only because we definitely still got our money's worth, but I'm leaving a few more stars to be earned since my friends reassured me Goyemon is better.
Not a sushi eater but love love the chicken teriyaki the service and atmosphere is just right, server was on top of her game for a gathering of 11 people awesome service.

I found this place perusing Yelp sometime back in 2010. AYCE lunch $21, dinner $26 which is comparable to similar places. Ive come here about 2-3 times a month for the past 2yrs plus. Always do AYCE. The main thing that got me as a repeat customer is their service(at least in my experiences) is considerably better than most sushi places Ive visited. I counted and cant even believe Ive tried 12 different AYCE sushi spots in Vegas to date. Im not a big fan of the traditional sushi, more into the creative and many rolls that these places sell. I like to say Im more into the 'americanized' type of sushi and have been able to convince friends who dont even eat raw fish to try it with me and most liked it. So you can take what you want from my review based on that. This place does get very busy at dinner with sometimes long waits to be seated so I try to frequent at lunch. Service can take longer at times. I typically like to sit at the bar when I sushi. I have experienced faster service that way usually, so now I lean towards sitting at the bar. The ambiance, decor and music targets the more younger demographic.
Some items I favor are the seared salmon nigiri, cajun albacore nigiri, tiger roll, double screaming orgasm, heart attack, ian special, chung hua, kamikaze & surf n turf roll. At every AYCE I go for green tea ice cream and hamachi kama(not on AYCE here) if its available. They do also have brulees, mochi ice cream and parfaits for dessert. All desserts are limited to 1 per cept for ice cream. Dinner AYCE limits are 1 uni, 1 ama ebi and 2 raw oysters which is similar to most AYCEs. Theres a list of appetizers which I will order from ocassionally but I concentrate more on the sushi and green tea ice cream. :)
Is it the freshest and highest quality seafood? No. Its decent. It does say theres a time limit of, 90min I believe? Dont remember exactly atm since its never come into play. Ive never been rushed even tho I know I have passed the time limit before, or things like being reminded repeatedly on leftover charges. I realize this may not be everybodys cup of tea but for food and service Ive gotten here, I think you definitely get your moneys worth.

When my friend from Vegas recommended eating at an All-you-can-eat sushi place, first thing I thought of was Todai. NO THANK YOU!

But we went and for $21 (lunch), you can order ANYTHING except drinks. Man, we dined like kings and queens eating everything we could. The only thing was the yellowtail nigiri (usually a favorite of mine) was a pinkish color? huh? Probably wouldn't recommend that.

Rolls are AWESOME! Snow Mountain roll, all the of the baked stuff is good and tuna or salmon nigiri are really good. They don't drench sauce all over it to cover the quality, which I love.

Desserts: creme brulee (pretty good. 4 stars)
                   Mochi (exactly like the mochi icecreams you get at the grocery store. 4 stars)
                  Green tea icecream (didn't have it but heard it was decent too)

I think I just liked the fact that it was included in the all-u-can-eat package.

Would DEFINITELY recommend!!!!! GO NOW!!!

One of my favorite sushi spots in town. Their fish is superb and is always fresh. I also like it that they are open late! This is where we go for our sushi fix, it's also not to far from our house.

The service is not that good. So far most servers we've had we're a bit rude. This place gets packed especially by 8pm.

I used to go to Oishi Sushi frequently when I lived nearby. It's a very nice, cozy, somewhat upscale place with class and ambiance. Low noise  & dim lights make it great for dates. Best Red Dragon rolls in town (my personal favorite.)

Discovered a few more favorites:
-NYI roll
-banzai roll
-uni nigiri (be warned, some of the pieces were darker so I'm guessing they have a mixture between premium and select ca grades)

I guess I'll update this place with 5 stars because it seems to already have secured its spot in our vegas regimen. We even sit at the same table every time too (the big semiprivate one that's behind noren on the right side of the restaurant with the cool mural). As always, we ate til our hearts content. Food comes out reasonably timed and prompt for the most part and service is never lacking.
My favorite sushi place in Vegas so far. Love the Yellow Tail Trio roll, the poke appetizer, and the creme brûlée.

I was coming through vegas on my move across country, and great friend said he wanted to take me out for sushi.  This was a special occasion for several occasions:  we were meeting after knowing each other online for ten years, it was a few days before my birthday and most importantly, I'd never eaten sushi before. I told him to pick somewhere really special and where I could try several different things because I wasn't sure what I'd like.  He said that Oyshi was all you can eat, which meant I could sample just about anything I wanted.

We ordered everything. This little guy put away about 18 pieces of yellowtail.  I tried it and it was ok, though the rolls were definitely the star.  The fried calimari was amazing.  We ordered fantasy roll, sexy roll, love affair, and dragon roll.  It was all amazing! if I had to pick my favorite, it was the love affair.  We also got seaweed salad, sweet shrimp, and fried scallops. The only thing I didn't care for was octopus, but it was a personal preference.  it was amazingly good, all of it, and they were so nice! Service was excellent and since 2 people in our party were almost an hour and a half late, they even let us stay longer than the two hours allowed.  It was the best first experience having sushi that I could've had!

Yummy! Love this place but you can not get in for dinner without waiting. This place needs to expand or get a bigger space because a wait on a Tuesday night is not cool! Their food is really good and their portion sizes are good. Prices are fair, staff is nice, and restaurant has a nice contemporary atmosphere. The best time to go is lunch and they have some great lunch specials and menu. I love living close and being able to grab some food to go.

$26/per person for all-you-can-eat dinner sushi. Excellent service. Great tuna poke, seaweed salad and the Tiger Roll here is the best I've had yet. I also recommend the Pink Lady. I never had tried this before, but it was ahi tuna, cooked shrimp wrapped in pink soy paper. Delicious! The only complaint my friend made is that desert is limited to one item only. Boo!

My husband and I ate here for lunch and got their all you can eat option. There is a nice variety of sushi rolls, and various appetizers and side dish options to choose from. The atmosphere is upscale and pleasant. Our server was nice and brought our food out quickly. Everything we ordered was delicious. Would definitely recommend this restaurant for all you can eat sushi.

For people looking for variety, not so much into the raw fish part of sushi, this place has a lot of variety and their offerings are pretty good. 

But for the sushi purist and sushi snob it's a no go. The fish is not at its freshest/finest compared to other places, most of their rolls are stuffed full of imitation crab, and the rice is pretty inconsistent across chefs, getting bigger with the more you order. 

Their deserts are more unique than other places and pretty good. The parfait was the best out of the brulees and tiramisu that we tried among their offerings. 

No complaints about the service this day.

Ask for Haruka every time you go! Great waitress!! Most of the girl waitresses are rude so I always try to avoid them, but Haruka is a sweetheart and always takes great care of me. There is also a great Hispanic gentleman that works there that takes great care of me too when I go.

The sushi quality is great. I love the salmon lover, atomic bomb and their simple Philly roll. Mussels are great and they steam their edamame so it's VERY good
Excellent service. There's nothing special with the food. Fish is not fresh. Not enough varieties with the AYCE menu.

I'm no sushi expert by any means, but I know what's good to me. Baked rolls are great as are the spicy rolls. Seems like a younger crowd that hangs out here and they play great music. Definitely do the all you can eat so you can sample the different styles of rolls. Worth the $20 every time. Always take friends and family here when they are visiting. This place can get busy and service can be slow at times, but it is always worth it!
I am in love with this place! The green tea tiramisu is made in house and it is the best way to end a meal!

Since Kai by my house closed, I have been trowling my neighborhood looking for a new sushi spot.  Ventured a little outside the neighborhood to come to this place, but the reviews were so good on Yelp, I had to go and see for myself.  

Very friendly staff.  Always a plus.  Really bumping on a Thursday night.  It looked like a lot of 30 somethings come here for date night.  Definitely a good atmosphere. We tried to order all of the rolls that sounded spicy because that's our thing. Everything we tried was really good, just not quite spicy enough for me.  My favorite roll was the Volcano roll.  Good value for the AYCE price of $26. Will definitely return and be sure to request extra spice.  Still haven't found anything better than Sin City for AYCE.

I wish there were separate rating sections:
Rolls were not as tight as they should/could be- very sloppy though taste was still outstanding and fresh.
My waiter was great, attentive but not pushy nor lacking attention.
However!!!!!!
My biggest complaint is with the "supervisor" whom was conducting the business like the Soup Nazi from that Seinfeld episode.  Firstly, it wasn't busy at all, I have issues from the military and a long career working with criminals so I asked for a corner with a wall to my back.
She immediately said "can I put you at the table in the middle".........wow!!!!!!!! Pull the sushi out of your ears and think about what I asked for.
Then she proceeded to tell me once I was seated "it's ok THIs TIME since we aren't that busy, normally it wouldn't be"-  I told her frankly- "well I'm a veteran with PTSD so thank you for the exception"........
Waiter was great again btw!!!   I asked him if she was always that angry after she came in between me finishing my first round and waiting for round 2---- she asks "are you ok? You don't have food"........... now, I can see you might say she was just checking- but the way she did it, body language, tone of voice and previous interaction made me feel like I either had to have a constant stream of food coming, eating or I had to get out-  
VERY UNENJOYABLE thanks to this lady!!!!!!

I always come to this location when in town, but now- I think I'll go to the one on Saraha-  much more relaxed atmosphere and don't have to feel rushed or like I can't relax and enjoy my

I seriously five days a week pick  up sushi from this place for take out and maybe a couple times a month sit at all you can eat sushi it's literally down the street from my house and is totally affordable and crazy fresh and the customer service is pretty awesome
Excellent quick Service to my party of 15, everything was great from food to customer service, Thanks to my Server Mono!
Great food! All the sushi is nice and fresh. Great service. Only negative is how loud it can be with everyone talking. Must be the sake kicking in. LOL

Had a Great time here and had nice service, we got a  private room for our friends Birthday and the service was really friendly and quick ... And I know my group could be a lot to handle at times too ... They did make the stipulation that we could have the private room for 15 ppl if MOst of the group did all u can eat !!
Food is awesome here, always long waits to get in. My favorite sushi place in Vegas

Will not return. All you can eat at its WORST!! stay away. they have no idea about cleaning in this place. Check out they're recent health inspections no wonder we got sick!!!
http://www.southernnevadahealthdistrict.org/restaurants/inspections.php

Finally went to Oyshi yesterday (as it was recommended by my friend).  The atmosphere was pretty awesome.  They had a spacious seating arrangement, colorful decor, Xgames and the Laker's Game on TV, and Techno music playing in the background (not really what I had expected in a Sushi joint).  We came for the AYCE @ about $22.00 for dinner.  It's decently priced for AYCE.  The price does not include a drink.  The selection of food on the menu was pretty good.  They had a good assortment of appetizers, specialty rolls, and traditional Nigiri (not to mention hand cut Maki rolls).  I am a big fan of Sashimi, but like 99% of the time, the Sashimi is not included in the AYCE.  I did however stock up on the Sake (raw Salmon) Nigiri.  Being my favorite Nigiri, I found their Sake Nigiri to be very very fresh.  It was super bright orange and tasted incredible!  For dessert, they have a few different flavors of Mochi, but you can only get one.  If I remember correctly, the flavors are as follows: Green Tea, Mango, and Red Bean.  I opted for the Mango and wish I could have had a second since they were pretty small in size.  Anyhow, the Sake Nigiri alone would have gotten Oyshi 4 stars, but unfortunately the service was extremely slow.  On top of that, the only soup available was the Miso Soup.  How do you not have Udon on the AYCE menu?  Seriously?? They also did not have low-sodium soy sauce (I know it still has like 800mg per tbsp , but that's better than 1000mg).  Overall, I'd come here again... I just hope my server can keep my water cup filled.

I come here for sushi when I'm craving a solid AYCE menu with a lot of raw fish options. I find if you sit at the sushi bar and just ask the chefs for your order the menu is not very stringent and they are happy to really make you anything you ask for. I found the service of our waitress to be pretty bad. My drink was only refilled once and she was very inattentive. Quality of fish is always good and have never had a problem besides how full I leave. The other options are also very good, I always order the seaweed salad and seared ribeye steak which comes on a sizzling hot pan with cabbage and onions and is a great option on the AYCE menu for those that love a surf and turf. I say the food is great for the price, and the place is only getting 4 for the value I got which is something I look for. But the service was lacking. Still worth a trip!

I have to say this is the best sushi place I have ever been to and this is coming from someone that's from California! Their all you can eat appetizers are so delicious and great price! And the rolls are perfect size, amazing flavor and the service is attentive and very polite. I need one of these in California!

I love sushi and this was my first time here. All you can eat sushi? I said sign me up. I always, always try gyoza wherever I can and I wasn't disappointed here. The closest to my favorite restaurant.
But unfortunately, the sushi was not as good. The spider roll was absolutely amazing but my next two rolls dynamite and catercheese left a lot to be desired. So overall good place. Nice atmosphere and attentive waitstaff. (could also order half rolls which they failed to mention right away) and decent food. I'd go again for the spider roll and gyoza
Love it! Big menu and fresh sushi!!! Staff is always pleasant. It can get busy on the weekends but they have call ahead seating!

I am very disappointed with the ayce we had last night . I've been coming to oyshi since 08 and then ventured out since there was always a wait. 
We decided to go last night and the fish was NOT fresh at all . The Uni being the worst - was very brown and I had to send it back . The waitress even made a comment about it....
The tuna and salmon on our rolls were off colored - not the normal vibrant red and orange fresh versions should be. 

The nigiri pieces came out better - super white tuna was the best, salmon belly, and garlic tuna. 
Yellowtail was off perhaps I should've asked for a different cut . Oh and they put double rice to fish ratio which is annoying and takes away from the enjoyment of the fish 

All in all I was very disappointed in Oyshi's decline in quality and I won't be returning . The server was very attentive and quick . She's the reason for extra star . 

LESSON: walk up to the bar and check fish quality/freshness before committing to ayce or even eating there at all !

All you can eat menu is awesome! The fish is always fresh, and the environment is relaxing. Usually a wait after 6 pm, but the staff is very friendly. The wait time on fish can be quite a while at times but when it's busy I understand . My favorite is the Japanese lasagna roll! Will be returning!

We went for a late lunch.  The place wasn't crowded yet the service was a bit slow.  We were seated at the sushi bar but the sushi chefs seem to engrossed with their work that we had to wait to catch their eye so we can put more orders in.  Good thing there was some kind of shift change and the newer chef at least asked us once if we wanted to order more.  

As for the food, we started off with nigiri sushi, then moved on with the specialty rolls.  I quickly realized that their fish wasn't 100% fresh when it was laying simple and bare as nigiri sushi.  However, they do concoct good sauces and compose interesting rolls (maybe to compensate for the lesser quality of the fish).

The weird thing I noticed when we ordered unagi... In all other sushi bars I've been to, unagi is broiled for a few minutes before making it into sushi to give it nice caramelization.  Here, they skip it, and while the unagi seems slightly warm, it was not crispy and the flavor was a bit muted (I think broiling intensifies the flavor).  I guess next time I will ask them to make it "extra crispy".

This is a great go-to sushi spot. Love the many choices of rolls, and that they offer half rolls. Wish they had real crab, but the items I have tried are fresh. We didn't do all you can eat because a few rolls already filled us up. It's an upbeat, young crowd, and we appreciated being able to watch the football game too! We'd definitely come back when we're craving sushi!

Awesome! Great all you can eat price. Tons of fresh fish with as fast as they are going through it.  Amazing selection of rolls. I had to take a picture of the menu to give to my sushi chef back home so he can recreate them.  The Japanese Lasagna with Garlic if fantastic! Definitely come back here on my next trip through Vegas!

I remember this being my favorite place when I was needing an after gym food sesh.  Back in high school.  It seems like it's gotten more unprofessional and not as yummy as. Before. Its a bit pricey and better looking than better tasting.  This isn't a terrible foodie place, but there are better priced and better tasting sushi joints in vegas

We had a table of around 20 people, so the table was split between two waiters. We all got the AYCE dinner. Our waitress really sucked. It took an hour or so for our rolls and sashimi to come out. We've complained numerous times to her and she kept saying, "It's coming. The sushi chefs are working on it." The other half of the table with the other waiter had all of their rolls and sashimi out already.... we all ordered the same stuff! They were already on round 3 and we were still on round 1!!! Wth. 

The Uni was not good... looked old and dark. Fresh uni is supposed to be light yellow/orange color but this was DARK orange/brown. It tasted as if it had been refrigerated for a long time. Overall bad service and the food was not good. The only good thing was the creme brulee and ice cream.

I've been coming here for about 7 years... my favorite sushi spot. However,  tonight I've decided I'm going to start going elsewhere. Service has declined and the wait for food has become too long.  :(

You have to come and experience one of the best all you can eat sushi bars in Las Vegas . People I am telling you that this is quality sushi .. Not cheap crap. QUALITY .. The appetizer menu is also available for all you can eat . It's the best ! I go nowhere else when I am in Vegas for All you can eat sushi .

We used to be regulars here, but after the last 3 visits, we're finding a new spot. The food has declined and the customer service is even worse. The hostess, same one every time, literally rolls her eyes whenever someone enters and when approaching the podium, she doesn't even greet you with a welcome or anything, it's simply "how many?" And that's it. Then, after numerous of times coming here with our 1 and 2 year old, today, we are charged kids price for the all you can eat, when all the times before, each server did not even charge one cent for them since all they eat is the rice and miso soup (which tastes like salt water now.) The server we had was a woman today, Asian accent, long hair, and I don't even know her name since she never introduced herself and her name wasn't on the receipt. She was cold and couldn't even put a lid on a child's water cup right, which spilled everywhere when I picked it up. The food, although some were hits, majority were misses. The house salad tasted old, the cold tofu was room temp, the California roll was loose and not tightly rolled... Basically if you're ordering anything other than white rice and their ribeye sizzling plate, don't expect much! Overall, I am disappointed that this restaurant has declined over the 2 years we've been coming here, and no wonder for dinner on a Sunday night, there was more open tables than filled... And we still had to wait 15 mins to be seated!

Well I just ate at Oyshi an hour ago and this is my experience with them. First off I should have known better to eat there when I realized me and my friend were the only Asians in the restaraunt. If you are a Expert Sushi eater you would do well to stay away from Oyshi. The Sushi Rice was horrid. It was not cooked all the way and they pack the rice way too tight. I never got three things I ordered by the time I left which was such a turn off.  Some of the Nigiri was decent however some of it tasted not so fresh. The back of my throat was itching from their fish as I am very sensitive to bad fish. The server was super sweet however she was not attentive what so ever. 

    My child ordered the Teryaki kids meal and the first thing she said when I asked her how is it was my chicken is dry with no flavor so I had them take it back. 

   They do not understand how to make rolls there. I ordered the spicy tuna which was the worse spicy tuna. They had no cucumber in any rolls which that texture was missing from every roll. I do not think they understand the proper way to make sushi. 

  Discouraged from the sushi I tried to order some apps to get my moneys worth.... Bad idea the salad ...bad! The Calamri was the same frozen tiny dried over cooked calamari served at other pizza bistros. The sizzling rib eye was over cooked and dry and flavorless. The mussels had a garlic soy mayo sauce which was super salty and made the mussels super rich. 

   This place seems to be more for those who really do not know what good sushi is. If you were raised eating sushi then I would stay far away from Oyshi.  They seem concerned when they notice a customer is unhappy yet management or the servers do nothing to ammend the situation. 

  I ordered Sea Urchin, sunrise roll, white tuna, salmon, garlic tuna and a few other rolls and Nigiri. The only thing I liked or enjoyed was my water with lemon. 

  Now all I am thinking about is the money I wasted there. I have never been so displeased ergo why I tweeted to my 16 Thousand Followers that they should never eat at Oyshi .. HORRIBLE

Wide variety of food choices. Sushi was delicious and beautifully plated. Ver nice employees. FIRST TIME TRYING SOJU. Yes I got a little tipsy. I suggest the "White Peach" it's fruity and doesn't taste much like alcohol. Get a glass unless you're with a large group because it's a BIG glass 0.0 came here for lunch. Take advantage of the all you can eat. So get here with a big appetite.

They have fried veggies; yummy oysters!! And I recommend the Seaweed salad !! you'll love it ! Does not taste salty and gives the sushi that extra oomf :)

I gave this place 5 stars, because i honestly believe this is the best buffet/Ayce for the price in Vegas. I have gone to this place for almost 3 years now. The best part about this place are the appetizers. I love the Shrimp on skewers, Rib Eye, Asian Skirt Steak, Ahi Poke, Gyoza, and many more....Over the years their portions have gotten smaller, but i understand because it prevents from wasting food..BTW you can always get more....Their fresh sushi is amazing as well, big pieces of fish with small rice, and their Baked Rolls are very tasty. my favorites is the Lobster Fair and the Paradise rolls. Word of advice try to get there early around 5 for dinner, or you can expect a long wait. Service is really good, and ambiance is great with a younger japanese themed feel....Oyshi is the only reason my wife wants to go to Vegas...

A friend, and LV resident, brought a group of us here.  We were blown away the 1st time--$25 AYCE Sushi?!?!  (everything on the menu except sashimi).  Food and service was great that time.

But on the 2nd visit, there was a longer wait, prices had gone up and quality went down.  We all got horrible stomach aches and dehydration for hours after.  It's a great deal, but you'll pay the price.

I arrived at the restaurant with my party of 4 was told it would be a 15 min wait, even though 70% of the tables were empty. At this point we offered to sit at the bar  which only had more than 10 avail seats, and we were told the issue was the staff was backed up and we could not be seated there either. We waited approx 20 min before we were sat at a table that had more soy sauce on the menus than were in the soy sauce pots. We placed our order, half our party received their rolls within an acceptable 15 min (We took a soy sauce pot from another table that had been empty the entire time and that one was also empty) while the other half did not receive anything until 45 min had gone by and the other half of the table had eaten their entire order. After 1 hour the person next me and I had received 2 of the 3 rolls we initially ordered and we canceled the remaining order. The server took off our drinks and did not charge us the remaining rolls even though one of the elusive rolls showed up the min we tried to leave. Food was good/average for a sushi place in this price bracket waiter was prompt and courteous. The one star is for the food and the waiter otherwise I would select none.  Restaurant was just poorly staffed/operated. One last thing the was the restroom looked like it was hit by hurricane Sandy and the host really did not seem to care about anything. Who understaffs a restaurant on a Saturday night?

My go-to for sushi! I've tried countless other sushi restaurants of similar caliber, waiting for one to surpass this place and after years, still haven't found one. They have so many delicious rolls to choose from and don't over-do it with certain components like some other restaurants have. Quality is consistent time after time and great service. Thanks Oyshi!

By far the worst service I have received in a while. Literally waited an hour for an appetizer. Basically wasted time and money . Whenever we made an order we would wait FORVER for it to make our table. Not to mention half of our orders didn't make it to our table! We ended up asking for our check and what was funny is that the manager brought out the rest of our food. Seriously??? Yea total waste of $70!

Great sushi! So far the best I've had in Vegas! 
Fresh and good quality ! 
The restaurant is also very clean !

4.5 stars

Oh sheet, it's oyshi sushi. Definitely my favorite sushi place in Las Vegas. This is my go to place for sushi with my husband and his co workers

The wait can be long, so get here early. The longest we've ever waited is max 20 mins

AYCE for lunch is 21 and dinner is 26 bucks, not bad. Which includes a large amount of appetizers and desserts

Favorite rolls: spicy tuna crunch, tiger roll, snow mountains. 

The desserts are delicious. The biggest hits being green tea mochi ice cream and the green tea tiramisu.  

The service is excellent, the rolls take a while to come out but it's worth the wait because you can taste the freshness. 

Like all sushi places, they charge you if you waste food. One bite or two isn't a big deal but don't waste an entire roll.

The restaurant looks like a high ended sushi house, that's well decorated. Very clean and open. 

Can't wait to take my out of town friends here.

This place is pretty great! It was about a 25 minute wait on a Friday night, so not tooooo bad. Once we were seated we were promptly attended to. The menu has a large selection, which is great but makes for difficult decisions. We will definitely be back again!

By far the best all-you-can-eat sushi places I have ever been to.
My cousin, who lives in the area, claimed that this place has really good sushi and an even better all-you-can-eat deal. As I'm from San Francisco, I was a bit cautious and not too optimistic about the quality and freshness of the fish, however I was quickly impressed with the large variety of rolls, fish as well as other main entrées and appetizers on the menu.
I started with the simple seaweed salad and edamame, both which were well seasoned and served at the perfect temperature.
Typically I am a fancy, combo roll fan but I will have to say that the quality of fish made the simple rolls one of my favorites of the night. The spicy yellowtail roll was very good as was the salmon avocado.
To finish off, the all-you-can-eat menu there is a choice of dessert. I'm always a fan of the green tea ice cream and in this instant the ice cream was superb. 
Will def go back the next time I am in Vegas.
Tried the AYCE for lunch. Hated that they put so much imitation krab mix in almost every roll. Gross.

The best AYCE sushi place. Never disappoints. The nuclear bomb is amazing. The fish is so fresh. Even if you don't like sushi, you can have their ribeye steak, skirt steak, so many choices. The staff is always friendly. If you still have room, try the parfait or the cream brûlée.

I wasn't sure what to expect and struggled with deciding to go with the all you can eat option as I'm a small girl. Well...it was a great decision! All of the rolls are amazing, particularly the Oyshi roll and then you can change it up with a sizzling plate of skirt steak or some veggie tempura. Yum!

My boyfriend and I strolled into Oyshi on a weekend afternoon for some AYCE. From the moment we walked in the door the staff was rude and acted like we were bothering them from coming in. There were a few people helping us and not one of them were attentive. It took forever to refill waters and order more food. The staff was very standoffish and everyone from the management to servers to the sushi chefs looked miserable to be working there. I didn't like the atmosphere for an afternoon they were playing party music. Their quality of fish was low and didn't seem fresh. I was very disappointed with this place considering all of the reviews. I have to drive a little bit father for an AYCE sushi place now but it is well worth it, so everyone go to Sushi Koma instead!! Their staff is so friendly and the food is 100 times better!

So V. and I headed to this spot on our way out of Las Vegas to L.A. and i am adding this place to my favorites whenever in Vegas...

Service is Decent,The food is great and they have plasmas where i got to see the Lakers take on the Rockets! So that was awesome,Sushi and watching the game...How cooler can you get...jk

So this was what V and I had/tried:

Philly Roll
Rainbow Roll
Tiger Roll
Dynamite Roll
Ginza Roll
Spyder Roll
2 orders of Yellowtail
2 orders of Albacore
5 orders of Tuna
5 orders of Salmon
Vanilla Creme Brulee
Strawberry Mochi Ice Cream

Everything was really good and fresh(on a sunday!) 

yea,i have experienced some places on sunday,and the fish never tasted this fresh.

So the deal is this,Only 2 hours to eat and no Sashimi,that works for me,regardless!

Thanks for reading,hit this one spot when in Vegas!

food is average, just like all other sushi places in Vegas. 

my friend came here once, and apparently the tip she left wasn't as generous as the waitress expected. we came back a few weeks later, and the same waitress had the nerve to send another girl over and ask us, "*so-and-so over there wants to know why you tipped bad last time." Excuse us!? we don't have to tip you well if we feel like you don't deserve it. that's why it's called a TIP. extremely RUDE and UNPROFESSIONAL question to ask us.   

go to sushi kaya down on spring mountain. farther drive, but way better customer service and food. 

not going back here again.

Food is always good. But the service has been very slow lately. Its the second time we came and it took 20-25 min for the food to come. They are usually consistent with the fast service. We decided to order just one more roll and that took almost half hour. At one point we were going to cancel the order but they eventually bought the food. I dont know if the chefs are short? But it wasnt busy at all. But we will try again since it is my favorite sushi place... The service has just been tremendously slow lately.

Eh... that's how I feel about this place.

I will defo give this place a 4.5 star on the decor, the styling of their menu and placemats. BUT a 2 star on their food. 

When I get sushi, I rarely get anything baked. Which makes sense if you're doing AYCE. You don't want to get filled up quick. I had the AYCE but I was craving for nigiris. Got my usual salmon, tuna, albacore, yellow tail and cajun albacore. OMG, I tried picking up the nigiri, and rice literally just fell out. and the fish was too thick and kinda rubbery. Yuck.

Service was alright, the waiter checked on us couple times like how they should. I was told that their service was the worst, but in this case, it's the fish. 

I would come back, actually I wouldn't. Wait, I would if I got appetizers only not nigiris.
Very good quality sushi and great products and service. Always a very positive experience.

Compared to Oyshi Sushi in Sahara, this place is loser in taste.

We could not find any fresh fish and the appetizers are salty or poor looking. 

Only one that pleased us is ice cream as a dessert. 

I and my friend agreed not to come back again and not to recommend this place.

If you want to go AYCI sushi, rely on yelp review.
This place was amazing. The service was great - super fast. And the Sushi! So good. The All You Can Eat is totally worth it.

I really wish that we had an Oyshi near my house. Their all you can eat sushi is the best. Make sure you also ask for stuff that's not on the menu, such as white tuna.

Conclusion: high quality food that makes you satisfied

The sushi here was great! Really fresh. I do have another favorite sushi spot, so I do not treat myself to Oyshi as much as I'd like too, but the few times I do get over there, I definitely enjoy the rolls as well as the appetizers that are included in AYCE. I will say, that, like many AYCE sushi places, service is not the quickest. When ordering a roll, you may not get it for a while later. But it's understandable, as the place is busy. '
Overall, the sushi is pretty delicious.

This place is amazing! The fish is fresh and the service is great. I came for lunch and ordered all you can eat. Normally when I go out to eat sushi the all you can eat has a very limited menu. At Oyshi, the entire menu is all you can eat with the exception of sashimi. All you can eat is only 21$ for lunch and I left with a very full belly. I will deffinetly come back with friends!

Before you step into this restaurant, think again. There is a great five star restaurant next to it call soyo, you sure you wanna eat here?? Granted its a different type of restaurant but still, its money well spent if you spend $ 50 for two in soyo than here.

The reason why I am so harsh on this place. Well, sushi are just amazingly stupid. There is no artform whatsoever, sushi are art, even though you are an ayce restaurant. Its a reflection of the sushi chef how the presentation of the sushi went. 

This restaurant make all sushi look like california roll and to boot if you look at all the rolls it full of slimy crabmeat with mayonaisse combination to make you full right away. 

Sure, they do have other appetisers on the menu or dessert included, but there are lots of other japanese ayce around las vegas that offer the same things. 

All this yelper that commented how great this restaurant is must never really eat in a proper japanese restaurant. Service are ok but honestly this one is a one and done for me.

You can try and then pm me afterward, I will probably just say "see I told you so"

This place has gone downhill in a major way. It used to be good. I wonder if it's under new management or ownership.  The salmon nigiri was fresh, but everything else was just downright nasty. How do you mess up rolls that contain imitation crab? Which, by the way, a majority of the rolls contain. The imitation crab was mushy and sweet. The rolls were 7 day-old grocery store quality. I'm talking about Albertson's quality. The rolls at Whole Foods are way better than Oyshi's. Also, the rolls were loaded with way too much rice. I know that ayce places love to fill you up with rice, but this was ridiculous. Why have rolls called the yum yum scallop that contains one tiny sliver of scallop, or a lobster fair roll that has no lobster in it?  This was a waste of $72 for two people.

Very bad service !!! Food was good but u wait a long time for ur food.... The only thing the servers can do so quick is when they give you ur check....not very nice is like there doing it in purpose....i dnt ussually do this review but we were there 3x & still same .....
This is the 2nd time we've come early enough but the hostess didn't want to seat us so we are going elsewhere ... $300 tab .... Your loads mutha fuckas !!!!

This is probably one of my favorite all you can eat sushi places in town. We have been going here for years and its nice that it is by us. They have a variety of rolls and as well as appetizers on their menu. The only thing I am disappoint about is that they did not carry white tuna anymore the last time they went.
Excellent service we had Mono and Sia- all you can eat loved the skirt steak sizzling plate.

This place has now become my favorite! I love their all you can eat!! Unlike other places they serve u half rolls upon request & u can order as many rolls at a time that you want. Appetizers & dessert also included in the happy hour! My favorite dish was the surf & turf! Chef Ivan is pretty helpful when it comes to recommendations & his convo made the meal even more enjoyable! Thanks!!

This is not made up...

I am a patient man. My girlfriend and I work in the service industry. My girl even works at a sushi place. This is literally the worst service I have ever encountered. 

Sat down for Ayce lunch at 1:30.. Our first order of Nigiri hadn't came out, it was now 1:55. We didn't order anything special, just slice the fish and send it out. We ask the server about our order. She abruptly leaves, and I can see the sushi chef and the server arguing with each other.

She then advised us that she forgot to put the order in. I thought, ok.. Cool. The world isn't a perfect place, and we all make mistakes... But when we make a mistake, a good server should hurry to correct it and make it right. 

Waited 20 min... low and behold, she forgot to put the order in a second time. It has now been 45 min since I ordered the Nigiri.. No exaggeration. By this time I've lost my appetite. The restaurant isn't even busy, the place was half full.

I felt disgusted paying the $47 plus $10 tip.. I tipped 20 percent just because I'm in the tipping industry, and don't have the heart to stiff this chick. She also told me they don't do half rolls. I could have sworn they did before.

I will never come back to this establishment.
Thanks server with the black sketcher shoes.

$21 all you can eat sushi for lunch/$26 for dinner. 

I love how their specialty rolls are included...and the rolls are made fresh (compared to most sushi buffets).  My favorite rolls were the love affair roll and the monster roll.
Don't forget to get a dessert too! Their creme brulee is delicious! :)

I love their all you can eat sushi here... I wish they would put one in southern cali because this is THE restaurant to go to.  No matter what you order it is delicious and you can eat as much as you can of it!

Came for the 2nd time and it was even better than the first. Great food and the service today was the best I've had in a sushi restaurant. 
Will be back soon.

Setting: 11:30 on a Saturday night. SW Vegas. Rumbly tummies. Not too busy sushi spot.

On a budget so I opt for a teriyaki beef bowl instead of sushi.
On the go so I grab the menu and let them know it will be take out.

After approximately 1 minute and 42 seconds of looking of the menu I am ready to order. I am very decisive, a trait I value in myself. I look around for the waiter who, just a minute prior, had served my friend and me some water. 

5 minutes go by.
Then 10.
15.
Hello?

My friend goes in search of a waiter. He says he'll be over in a moment.

Okay. He finally comes over and takes my order.
It's seriously another 15 or 20 minutes for some beef teryaki to be done AND it wasn't even that good. The meat was tough and not very flavorful. I dunno if it was on purpose or not, but whoever brought us our food didn't bring the check with it. Perhaps it was a mistake on their part or perhaps they brought it over as a silent apology for the terrible service. We just walked out before they could say anything. Does that make me a terrible person? It was 45 minutes for a to go order! I wish i was decisive about leaving and going somewhere else. I know I will never decide to go there again.

All you can eat sushi... Who's idea was this? 

I came, I all-you-can-eated, I left in a near coma! 

Good sushi, I think it was like $26 for the all you can eat, comes with sushi, or hot food items (ie gyoza and such), you order from the server, they make it, bring it out, rinse repeat! 

Standard dinning room, sushi bar, or they have a couple of side rooms if you want to roll out here with a group of people or have a party and such here!

A little disappointed considering all the great reviews. I will have to give them another try sometime on someone else's dime. 

It's your typical AYCE pricing & rules (literally had a rule menu!!) 

First off, came here with 5 people for bday dinner with an expected group of 10, they wouldn't let us sit at our table (which was already reserved and waiting patiently for us) until our entire group arrived. 

Finally!!! Were seated. No sever. No water, no edamame. Just a bunch of hungry thirsty bums still waiting. 

It took forever to get water and edamame. The menu was extensive but boring. Most of the combo rolls seemed similar to other combo rolls minus or add one insignificant ingredient. I did very much enjoy the pork belly. 

Even my Sapporo beer experience was ruined but my non-chilled glass. Did I mention I thought I was at a club with the music blasting techno? Geezus. Overall, it sucked.

AYCE sushi for the win! This is a must go to spot when I hit Vegas. The customer service is straight and the rolls are delicious! The price is reasonable and a it's a great way to enjoy sushi and apps amongst friends!

I've been to Oyshi a couple times and have never left satisfied! The fish quality was not all that great, the rice was too wet for my taste & the service was quite slow! Also the stools at the sushi bar were being really weird and kept sinking down for some reason.. Maybe I'll give them another try..  MAYBE ! Haha

Always love coming here... They always go light on the rice, a quality you can't find in too many all you can eat spots. Some of the rolls are a little saucy for me but once you have it once just ask for easy sauce next time. Great service, good food... What else can you ask for?
Food is overall good but every roll has imitation crabmeat. I'm pretty sure this is their way of getting you full when you choose all you can eat.

My husband and I went here based upon a recommendation from a friend's friend.  My expectations weren't that high, since this is Vegas, but I just cannot recommend coming here.  Salmon is usually my safe bet when it comes to sushi, but after one piece of nigiri, I was done.   I couldn't believe how bad it was.  I can't remember what else we had, but it wasn't impressive enough to make up for the bad salmon.

I signed up for Yelp just to write this review and warn everyone that they have HORRIBLE service. their food is not any different from any other sushi restaurants. Trust me, Goymon or I love sushi has WAY BETTER SUSHI. so the night went like this...... I had guests all the way from KOREA. they are the ones who saw the review of this place and told me they want to go. I told them they are not that great (since I have been here several times) but regardless to my opinion, we went. We waited for 30 mins to be seated which is not a big deal. I understand sushi restaurants get busy for dinners.... We sat down and ordered a few nigiris.... THEY brounght 4 pcs every 20 minutes. Once again, I have been to other sushi restaurants and I KNOW FOR A FACT THAT NO MATTER HOW BUSY THE RESTURANT IS, nigiri never takes that long.. so as a result, within an hour... we ate 6 pcs between 3 people. I asked for a manager and told them the situation, and he said THERE IS NOTHING HE CAN DO. (NOT EVEN SORRY) so we said we want to leave and THEY CHARGED US FOR THE FULL AMOUNT OF 3ppl's ALL YOU CAN EAT. I am telling you right now, if you want to ruin our dinner with AWFUL FOOD and IRRESPONSIBLE and RUDE staffs, this is the place to be. NEVER EVER AGAIN. THE WORST DINING EXPERIENCE EVER.

It seems the quality has dropped in service and sushi. One theory my friend has is that it just gets bad at peak times. Lunch and dinner time on the weekends and holidays. 
Understaffed maybe? 

Our ahi poke seemed less than Fresh. Our shrimp tempura seemed rushed and not fully fried. Sushi rolls took forrreevvver to come out. And it seems like the creme brûlée serving gets smaller each time we visit.

This place gets five stars simply from being a non-buffet all-you-can-eat sushi restaurant! I tend to have slow moments so it wasn't until the end of the meal that realized that, with the exception of a few items, the whole darn menu (appetizers, soups, rolls, nigiri, tapas, and dessert) was included in one price! Lunch was less than $20 per adult, which I felt was a steal. The restaurant isn't on the strip but it's worth it for anyone visiting to venture off the beaten path for this great dining experience. Plus, it gives you the opportunity to see the residential side of things. This is now, without a doubt, one of my "must-visit" places when I come to Vegas.

I love love love Oyishi! 

The atmosphere is modern, clean, and always plays the best Pandora Stations! I have been going here for years and have seen it change over time physically, however the food is consistent - and that's why I go back! 

It's located on Rainbow and Windmill which is literally less than a two minute drive from where I live. It's super convenient - the southwest area is developing like crazy so make sure to call ahead and make sure there's a table for you if you have a big group. Sometimes you have a wait a bit to get seated even for 2 people on a high volume day, but if call ahead it shouldn't be a problem. They've been improving seating people right away I have noticed the past few times. Prices are affordable and they also offer all you can eat. They have a private parking lot too. 

Also, during the weekdays they have an awesome lunch special. I ordered their chicken teriyaki which was a generous serving with a California roll, miso soup, vegetable/shrimp tempura, and a house salad all for $12!!!! Who wouldn't be stoked about that? 

Overall, this place is great. I recommend to anyon

My fiancé and I love Oyshi. The fish taste fresh and they have a great menu! Good service, just don't expect to get a table without a reservation most nights of the week. It will be about an hour wait.

Average sushi at best but considering that for $27 you can get all you can eat lunch, I'm a fan.

Pros:
1. decent selection of rolls, sashimi, appetizers for the buffet option
2. friendly service

Cons:
1. No sweet shrimp or uni (sea urchin) for lunch buffet (dinner only)
2. Dynamite roll had wayyyy too much mayo which was gross
3. No all you can eat dessert!? Wanted some more of that strawberry mochi!

Recommendations: I'd choose the skirt steak over the other steaks. Yellow halibut is awesome (don't get the baby halibut as it is bland). Any of their rolls is decent but nothing really stood out to me in particular.

Definitely worth coming back for the lunch special

We came here at the recommendation of a friend who lives in Vegas after mentioning wanting to go to Nobu for dinner. (I'm from NY and like the Nobu location there). The decor is adequate, but the music was really odd for a restaurant: one of the first songs we heard was about eating pussy and there were many songs with the n word. I expect that while I'm at the club, but while I'm eating? Completely tasteless! 

The service was lacking but not the worst I've seen. At one point the waitress came over to check the amount of wine left in the bottle, then set it down and walked away even though two of our glasses were empty! The food came out very slowly, but that's typical of an all-you-can-eat place, where they want you to fill up in between courses and order less. 

The food itself was extremely disappointing. Most of the rolls had ingredients that are never in real sushi: cream cheese, cheddar cheese, and other odd things. They were presented attractively but were drenched in cream sauces and the ones that were fried were disgustingly greasy. The fish was fresh enough but not even close to the quality I'm used to. 

I guess if you've never had really high quality sushi you might enjoy this place (judging from other reviewers) but if you appreciate only the best sushi, you'll probably want to skip Oyshi. I definitely won't go back!
This place is better then what I expected. The service was good. The sushi is good with a lot of options to choose from. The red bean moochi is soo delicious!!!

Star # 1 - All you can eat sushi!  I mean that is a star in itself

Star # 2 - $26.95 for All you can eat sushi dinner ;) Good price because I can eat that much in sushi ...EASY!

Star # 3 - I have been to other all you can sushi places in Vegas and this one has the most variety.  The side dish list is much longer than others and offers some good stuff

Star # 4 - Customer service here is great. They treat you with great courtesy and always come back to make sure you are OK.

Star # 5 - Restaurant setting.  I mean they play a little bit too much trance and should maybe mix in the some r&b, or commercial hip hop, but the ambiance is still cool.  They have modern decor, and TVs in visible areas to watch ESPN...perfect! haha!

Come here hungry and beware how much you order.   Here are some good things I like to order:

Side dishes:
-Surf n Turf
-Baked Mussels
-Shrimp tempura
-Edamame (warm and with some salt! lol)
-Green Tea Ice Cream
-Green Tea Mochi

Sushi rolls:
-Spicy Tuna Crunch
-Spider Roll

I am a big fan of sushi.  We were apartment hunting and one of the leasing agents told us about Oyshi Sushi.  We were glad we did.  It was a very refreshing change from our normal haunting place here in Silverado Ranch.  Oyshi is very nice.  Most of their patrons are young adults and they have pop music in the background.  We really liked the ambiance of the restaurant.  The best part was the food, for an AYCE dinner, it is somewhat on the pricey side but we wanted to try their extensive sushis.  They have hand rolls, cut sushi, baked, deep fried, fusion, vegetarian, specialty, and sashimi (this isn't included in the AYCE price though).  You can also have some appetizers and various salads, rice bowls, and dessert with the AYCE price.  For the two of us with regular drinks, we spent $61 ($71 with tip), so as you can see, it can get pricey.  

Now, for the review of the food.  We ordered AYCE and we ate our fill of sushi.

My order:
1) Deep fried Philly - loved it!  It was cooked well and not dried up.  The sauce on it is enough that it doesn't require soy sauce to enjoy.
2) Rainbow Roll - so fresh and tasty.
3) Tiger Roll - it was so beautiful and enjoyed it immensely.
4)  Double Salmon - I enjoy salmon so this was a no brainer.

My partner:
1)  Supreme Vegetarian -  he liked it but it was wrapped in soy paper.  He liked the veggies that were rolled in the "sushi."
2)  Hawaiian Roll - this is a definite thing to order!
3)  California Roll - they were done well as they should be.  It is a staple in any sushi place.
4)  Japanese Lasagna - this one is baked.  He wasn't a fan of cooked sushi.

Then, the heavenly bites of dessert came.  My partner had the Strawberry Mochi and I had the Creme Brule.  I have to say, the Creme Brule was a taste of heaven.  I was so glad we got this for sure.

To end my LONGEST review(so far), this sushi place is definitely a go to place for us.  The ambiance was awesome, the food were tasty, and over all, its a definite place to try out.  Just be sure your wallet can afford the bill.

I just want to say Oyshi is one of the best All-you-can-eat sushi places around Las Vegas. In fact, a year ago I would have given it a 5 star rating. The reason I only gave a 4 star is because the quality of service has dropped. Largely due to the fact that it has gotten so much busier. There are more waiters but they do not tend to the customers fast enough. The food is great, but for an all-you-can-eat spot, you will enjoy the large menu they offer. The food is always fresh because of the amount of traffic they had. You can find your favorite server and request them to serve you.. Usually requesting anyone to serve you in particular will encourage them to serve you better. I am sure everyone was expecting my 4 star rating to be all positive but I've gone to Oyshi since it opened and I understand the restaurant has grown from what it originally was. The service has dropped a little but they still offer you great food for a great price.
All I gotta say CHI is the shiz net when it comes to his creations and sushi.  AYCE sushi is so bomb there.  Best appetizers in town, went to plenty of sushi joints, by far oyishi our #1 spot.

This place is amazing. we will never go to another all you can eat sushi restaurant .we've been there over 20 times always had consistency with the food experience . The fish is always fresh, Green mussel are amazing.The all you can eat menu is very large... Yummy yummy.

Hands down. One of my favorite sushi spots in town. This is mine and my best friend's go-to sushi spots. Sushi quality is amazing. We usually do All You Can Eat. Service is great. Sushi comes out quickly. Hands down, no complaints.

1 suggestion would be better discounts on alcohol for AYCE guests.

First time ever that I have had all you can eat sushi this style. Why doesn't New Orleans have this?? All you can eat on the menu for around $21! This deal more than filled my stomach. 

We started off with the grilled beef asparagus and baked green mussel. I love the beef that wraps around the asparagus which gives it a great taste to the asparagus. The sauce on the baked green mussel is also perfect. 

Overall i had  a great experience. We ordered most of the special rolls on the menu. I will definitely come back whenever I am back in town!

My boyfriend and I tried this place recently because we were getting tired of our regular spot and we loved it! the service was quick and friendly and their AYCE menu had lots of great options. We had a few rolls, as well as oysters, a seaweed salad and tons of nigiri sushi. It was all fresh and delicious and came out promptly. I think we've found our new favorite spot! As much as we love our old place it really is hard to find a good sushi place that also gives good service but this place has both!

Amazing! My mother in law, sister in law & I stayed in the area cause we had rented an air bnb for Memorial Day weekend and we were beyond happy we found this place. We were more sad we couldn't bring them back with us to California. The attention and the food were seriously spectacular! And the all you can eat had such a big variety that I didn't know what to do with my life. I seriously cannot wait to be back. Much love from California!

whenever im in vegas i always go out of my way from my mainstay on the strip to go here because its worth the side trip.

prior to XS, i brought my group of 8 here and it definitely started the night off correctly...the staff was friendly and seated us in the private room which provided a more intimate atmosphere given out attire.

in the main room, there is the usual sushi bar and a few flat screens to get a lil more rowdy. in essence, it caters to all types of occasions which i liked.

as far as the food goes- amazing. nuff' said

I've been wanting to try some other sushi spots for a while now, and when some friends from out of town flew in this week, another friend organized a dinner outing here.

Really, the food was "meh."  
They have a lot of options for all you can eat, and there were three dishes that were absolutely awesome: The fresh scallop, the amaebi (with the heads!), and the gyoza.  
Everything else that we ordered was just ok.  A little bland where there should have been more flavor.

The worst part about the evening though, was the service.  
While it was super polite and friendly, it was SO slow!  We were there for 2 hours, no joke.  
My fiance and I always order in rounds, so we'll do a few orders of several different nigiri options, and by the time we're done with the first one, we'll order more. 

We didn't receive several items, and had to go find a server to come back for our second round of orders.  

I had thought, briefly, that I'd be willing to come back to give it another go, but realistically...even the slow service at Sumo was better than this place.  

I might go back again, but I certainly wouldn't go out of my way for it, especially when the spots I frequent have better fish.

My girlfriend and I have been to Oyshi Sushi a couple of times and have thought that the food was good. Nothing spectacular. We have always gone if we are craving sushi and they have an AYCE option. We've never had the problem of getting seated right away which other people have mentioned, but I don't blame them because their staff and customer service is plain out horrible.

The first time my girlfriend took my to Oyshi she had an issue with the customer service that the waitress was giving her. She did not clarify the oysters which was a part of the AYCE and after she was very rude. After taking our order we saw her twice and then thereafter other waitresses had to take our order and deliver our food.

Our second time going to Oyshi it was fine. We were seated in a timely manner and received our orders of AYCE sushi without any issues.

The third time we went to Oyshi is WHY IM WRITING THIS REVIEW and have joined YELP and is also why I'm NOT GOING BACK THERE. We were seated in a timely manner and our order was taken in a timely manner as well, but after the waitress (Pinky) took our order of AYCE we never saw her again. That's when everything fell apart. Our food took at least 20 mins to come out and it wasn't even busy. Not only that, we always order baked mussels with our order  and that never came out to the point where we order a second round. We had to call over the host or the manager or whoever the guy that was dressed up with a tie was. When Pinky never came back a young waiter started to follow up on us. This waiter was "AWESOME!" NOT!!! The guy would only look at my girlfriend and never acknowledged me at all. I had to flag the guy down to get a refill on my drink because he would just ask my GF and leave. After waiting and losing our appetites we didn't even ask for dessert which is a part of the AYCE. We were so disgusted with the service that we just asked for the bill.

Lastly, THIS IS WHY I GAVE THEM A ONE STAR...

My bill came out to be $61.62 and because of the wait and the horrible customer service I DID NOT TIP THEM. SO TELL ME WHY AFTER A COUPLE OF DAYS MY ACCOUNT WAS CHARGED $72?!?!?!? 

Those ******** CHARGED MY CARD AN EXTRA $10.38 meaning they tipped themselves and FRAUDULENTLY CHARGED my card EXTRA!!!!

At what point do they think they deserve my $10.38?!?!

Never go to OYSHI SUSHI!!!! EVER!!!

Went here for dinner, a birthday party, and a graduation lunch and it was yummy! The waitress was nice but she did forget my drink while i sat there for 30 min thirsty while everyone had their drink! but other than that the food is DELICIOUS!!

Well I have raved about this place before but today I was sooooo disappointed  the food as always was great so keep it up chefs but as for the waitress we had well that's heads a totally different direction...

The place is always made by the environment around and today we definitely did not feel welcomed 

The hostess is greeted us and showed us to the table with a smile but that is where the courtesy ended...

We waited 15min to get asked for drinks, another 15 to order then even thought we were doing AYCE we waited 35 min to be able to add to our order at this point we felt ignored considering there were only 6 other tables occupied around us. We decided to cut it short and just go straight to dessert, we figured some ice cream could make us feel better, but upon ordering our desserts my hubby was given a creme brûlée when he told our waitress he wanted the berry parfait, it would have been fine had she just apologized when we brought it up to her but she says I pointed to the brûlée, ??? Well being that he ordered his own dessert we just looked away...at this point upset and confused we just paid our bill and left.... Sorry but no matter how great your food taste a staff with bad attitudes definitely brings your score down...

Sorry to say we won't be visiting this location anymore... Our best advice, perhaps order to go if you wanna try them out!

One of the best sushi we ever had!! We live in Germany and ate here once. We even want to make a reason to go back to Las Vegas just to eat at Oyshi Sushi. The staffs are friendly, sushi was prepared fresh. I envy all of you who live in Las Vegas so you can come and eat here more often.

Consistently consistent!  I have been coming here for at least 3 years now and still continue to bring out of town guests here.  We have had wonderful service whether we were dining for two or a table of 14.  Some of my local friends, who moved out of town still request Oyshi for their sushi cravings.  

Now onto the food.  For $26 (dinner) AYCE, you get beyond your money's worth.  The menu offers a variety of appetizers, rolls, nigiri, and dessert. (Of course, sashimi is NOT included).  Some of my favorites include:
Appetizers: oysters, mussels, rib eye, surf & turf, dynamite
Rolls: Ian special, double screaming & love affair
Nigiri: SUPER WHITE TUNA!, hamachi (yellowtail) & salmon
Dessert: creme brule & green tea ice cream parfait.

The overall restaurant has a great vibe, good energy/music, and attentive staff.  The last time we went here was a table of 14 and all of orders came out correct and in a timely manner.  Our server's name was Pink and she took wonderful care of us!
This is the best AYCE sushi in Vegas! We always come here for a great time and good eats!! The sushi chefs are amazing!!
Very fresh sushi. All you can eat for $26 which is a steal for the quality of the sushi here. Green tea tiramasui is equally creative and delicious. A sure winner for any dinner.

First time visiting this place and I was very pleasantly surprised.  We did have to wait a minute for a table during lunch but it was worth it. The amount of food for the price was great.  I got the teriyaki sizzling chicken platter and it was more than enough.  I would definitely return.

Literally sitting in the restaurant writing this review because I'm so upset with how slow the service is here. We ordered our food at 3:00 and all we asked for was 6 pieces of salmon, 2 pieces of Cajun albacore, and 2 pieces of escolar. It's 3:45 and we still haven't received our food. How hard is it to put some fish on top of rice? They aren't even busy right now.

been here several times. 1st time was for my 24th birthday. they dont take reservations, which was hard to plan out with 18+ people, but they were able to accommodate all of us, and the people who trickled in late. for the amount of people we had, the service was great! they even gave me a small bottle of hot sake on the house for waiting :]

the foods always been consistent every time i've come back. im not too big on the rolls (although there are a few i like). i get my fill on the hot items and appetizer items. they've added salad bowls and rice bowls as well.

favorites: poke, seaweed salad, oysters (dinner only), ribeye (its not a complete meal if i dont order at least 5 orders for myself), hamachi, salmon, and a few others. 

i only rated a 4 because service is never consistent. we sat at the bar one night, and had excellent service from our server (again, the name escapes me. i should really write these down!). another time, a group of maybe 9 or 10 of us went in for lunch, and if i remember right they were short handed at the sushi bar. hot food items came out before rolls did, and half of our groups didnt come out until the end of the meal (after asking servers several times about our food. the disappointing part was the table next to us got their food way before we did, and they sat well into half of our meal). 

this place is definitely a must try, if you've never been. but a regular spot? probably not. as a college student, its hard to pay $30 (including tip) for one meal as often as i'd like to. but when i do have some extra money, i will definitely be back!

Had dinner with a party of three on a Sunday night in April. We were seated promptly and our drink order was taken soon after. We all had AYCE and it was
delicious. I had the Red Rock Signature Roll, Snow Mountain Signature Roll and Salmon Lovers Roll. They were all delicious. I would also recommend having a refreshing Berry Parfait with Green Tea Ice Cream!
Oyshi, always a pleasure to eat at your establishment. Great service and awesome sushi.

Considering just the food, I have to say that it's really great here. Really quality sushi here. The All You Can Eat menu also includes other dishes besides sushi, such as Calamari or Asian Skirt Steak. The food here is pretty darn great.

However.... the service here is horrible. I've been here about 6 times and it's a bad experience most of the time. I wait for up to 30 minutes for my food. One time my server forgot to put in anything that I ordered so I didn't get my food for a whole 45 minutes.

I also had to wait to be seated for 20 minutes when I could clearly see that there were about a dozen free tables.

Also, one time I went there and the server recognized me from a week before. She remembered that I didn't tip so generously the last time I was there, so when we sat down, she told us "I hope you tip more this time". I believe that was extremely rude. It ruined my appetite for the rest of the meal.

I've been going to this place for a few years now and finally getting around to reviewing it. I have only had the all-you-can-eat here, so my 4-star rating is based on quality for an AYCE setting. 

Of all the AYCE places I've been to, Oyshi is definitely the best. Their variety of rolls, sushi, and appetizers is the largest. The fish is fresh and the appetizers are quite creative. I highly recommend the Red Rock Roll and Screaming Roll. For appetizers, the Ahi Poke and Agedashi Tofu is always very good. A welcomed difference from many other AYCE sushi places is that Oyshi is a very nice restaurant. It was built to be a sushi restaurant and has the ambiance of one. 

Ever since I found Oyshi a few years ago, I have not gone anywhere else in town for AYCE sushi. However, it has really caught on and their business seems to be booming, especially during the peak hours. Because of that, the last couple of time I've gone there, the service has been very, very slow. I actually tried a new place recently, because I didn't want to be there for 2+hours. Outside of that, it's definitely the best AYCE place in town.

The food has gotten a little better since the last two years or so. The service has ranged from mediocre to excellent; it seems to be hit or miss. The people who have worked there longer seem to be comfortable, whereas those who are newer work a little harder to ensure better service. Sometimes it takes a while for a waiter or waitress to come back and check on you, and sometimes they're always there. Sometimes the food comes timely, and sometimes not so quickly, even on the slower days. Again, hit or miss. 

This is a great place to bring company, as it is decently and comparably priced, clean, and modern. But we've also had better food at more hole-in-the wall places; the only thing is that it is not as presentable as Oyshi. I guess it depends on what you're looking for -- pretty decent food with a modern feel, or excellent food with a less presentable atmosphere.

This is by far one of the best sushi restsurants in town. The ACE is the best way to go and you definitely won't be disappointed. All the fish are fresh and for me, perfectly sliced. Sushi at other places are too bug for a mouthfull, but here its perfect. The eel is by far my favorite and the tuna and yellowfin are also top notch. The restaurant is charming and the staff are attentive. Pricing here us pretty standard so no suprises there. You can easily go here on a date or with your family. This place is my number one on my list of sushi restaurants.

We went back! Valentine's dinner at Oyshi sounded so good, so we went. When we got there, we ran into a bunch of people we knew. Lots of our friends are regulars there.

Our server Steven (maybe spelled Stephen) was very nice and paid special attention to us and started up real conversations about UNLV and stuff.

There was only 2 of us and we had to re-order/ask about a couple of things we ordered (same as when we were there with the big group), but it wasn't a big deal because since there was only 2 of us, we got full way faster and were glad to use the digestion breaks between eating.

The creme brulee was divine as always. It's just SO SAD how they only give you 1 dessert when you order AYCE (All You Can Eat) sushi. I want AYCE creme brulee!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

And still came home smelling like food. LOL.


#foodcrew

I reserved a table here for my brother's birthday and actually had to make a few last minute changes to the reservations and they didn't make a big deal out of it. 

We were seated in the private room that has a big flat screen tv with sofa seating. I suggest reserving this room for a special occasion or if you have a large party. 

We all had the all-you-can-eat sushi and for $26 it's a steal! There are a few catches though..only a 4 oyster limit per person and you have to eat the rice that comes with your sushi or they threaten to charge you for it . 

I think we ordered everything on the menu but a few dishes that stood out were: rib eye steak teriyaki (not over cooked at all), calamari (I didn't get a chance to try this but other people at our table kept ordering more of this) J&B roll (soooo good with the baked scallops on top). I thought the baked rolls were a lot larger than the other sushi rolls so be careful not to order too much (like we did). 

Our waiter was pretty attentive and even offered to take our picture for us. The owner was really nice. I think I talked to him about making the reservations and when he heard it was for a b-day he gave us the private room even though our party wasn't that big.  I'll definitely be coming back here the next time I'm Vegas.

Simply spectacular. First time here and I was very happy when I left. The white tuna was perfect. Vince was our server and he was so pleasant. We was so friendly and not overly present, but there before we even knew we needed him. Plates were constantly cleared from the table and the orders were brought out in a timely manner. I am definitely recommending this place to people I know. Especilally for their AYCE sushi. Two thumbs up, Oyshi!
My first time in this sushi place. It was great atmosphere. We ordered all of the spacial sushi, it was good except there salmon that I feel it was't sweet. Service was good.
Came in for lunch and the all-you-can-eat was great. They got super busy, but kept up with all their orders in a timely mannner.  The chefs were great!  Super friendly, fun to talk to at the bar.

Oyshi means "delicious" in Japanese and this restaurant doesn't disappoint. For local Las Vegans, this is the spot to go for delicious sushi!  Locals drive from the North (about 30-40 minutes away) just to eat here.

Sushi is fresh and tasty. Get the Nuclear Bomb and the Heart Attack! Even the dessert is good. Get the creme brulee!

If you go for dinner, make sure to choose all you can eat, otherwise you'll be paying buckos! All You Eat menu is anything except sashimi. As of this writing, $26 for All you can eat dinner, $21 for lunch. It will be worth your money.

Waitstaff is casual and easygoing. They play EDM music in the background which keeps the atmosphere upbeat and fun. 

Only reason not a 5 star is because there usually is a wait. Everytime we've gone, we have had to wait 20-30 minutes for a table. 

But it's always been worth the wait!  4 stars for us!

WOW!!! Love this place! My favorite is their salmon skin salad and they all so have all you can eat option. More bang for your buck! The staff are polite and very attentive. This place is pretty much pack so come in early.

I was visiting for work and one of my colleagues lives in the area and suggested Oyshi. It was such a great experience. 

ATMOSPHERE 
Decor is modern and zen feel. There was a range in ages, families etc. 

FOOD 
It is all you can eat. I'm usually not a fan, always think that's it's pre made rolls etc. NOT HERE. It is made to order. The quality of the sushi was just fine. Again it's not Nobu, but it really is a good value and just tasty. I had mostly nigiri (sushi). 
- albacore (regular, seared and Cajun)
- yellowtail - peppered with yuzu sauce
- roll forget the name, had tuna on the inside and albacore on top. 
- dynamite appetizer 
I enjoyed everything I ordered. 

PARKING 
Lots of free parking in the lot. 

Anytime I'm in town now, I will make an effort to come have a meal here. Totally worth the drive from the strip.

I did AYCE here pretty recently. The food is okay, but their selection was smaller than I expected. Also, the service here is definitely lacking. I came here midday on a weekday, and the restaurant wasn't anywhere near busy. They were pretty well staffed, but they still took forever to get anything done. I ordered appetizers and nigiri together when the waiter first came around, but I was left sitting around waiting for my food for ages. The waiter continuously delivered food to my table with no mention of my order for half an hour. I don't know if he forgot to put my order in? Anyways, the staff was far from friendly and attentive. There wasn't anything special about this place that would make me come back. I'd much rather go to Sushi Mon.
AMAZING FOOD! Horrible service. The manager didn't seem to care about his poor server we complained about either.

Great AYCE sushi :) 

Pros: Fresh, good portions, large selection. Good dessert.  

Cons: How far in on Rainbow it's located. Can be long waits-make RESERVATION! Lobster fair was not that great.  Fish without rice not option under AYCE.

Visited on 12/19/09,  very awesome all you can eat for $26.  We had a great time.  We visited there on the recommendation from others on Yelp.  Oyshi is now on our  "to do" list every time we're in Vegas.  Thanks Yelp!

I came here with 3 of my friends and we all got the AYCE sushi. 
This was my first time trying sushi and I really enjoyed it. 
The atmosphere was great, decent background music. 
My friends had been there numerous time before so the did all the ordering.
Our waiter was very friendly and the service was prompt. 
I loved the " Love Affair" it was delicious. 
I will definitely be returning to try more of the menu.

We made reservations for a party of 15 we didn't have to wait.  That part was great, as far as ordering and getting the food timely and accurately that is a different story.  I think it was because we had too many orders or something.  We had a group of people that loved to eat.  We order things that went to the table next to us they were a big party as well.  I heard our our screaming went to them because they didn't know what was ordered and they said okay we'll take it.  The food was okay not as good as I remember and I like another place that we go to better. . After to night experience it confirms that I wouldn't go there.  
The following I found 1 star:
Oysters (they taste really bad not fresh' and needed lemon)
Adegashi tofu (they give you one and it is now sweet or yummy. 

The decent but small pieces:
Fresh scallop
Eel
Fried scallops  the fried scallops was small size but tasted yummy.  Why not isn't everything fried best?
