The rib eye steak was ok but some of it was just too well done so it was tough.  
The surf and turf is better with the rib eye and two shrimps. It comes in a sizzling platter, 
Poke was like two little bites.  Photos of this was way generous then 

The favs for the night:
Garlic tuna
Albacore
Salmon belly
Octopus
Uni was low grade
Sweet shrimp eh.
We got a bunch of other rolls but really it is the atmosphere here that attract people imo.
The nigiri sushi was the best. 

The ice cream was out of mochi, the cream brûlée was in a small little ramekin.  They only allow one dessert order why is that so small?  The parfait on the other hand is like a shake glass and large.

I was back in Vegas for a trade show. We didn't want to wait an hour for Texas De Brazil, so my boss and a guest asked me about "that sushi place you rave about" off we went to Oyshi! My boss AND our guest are sushi snobs and all the way there they voiced their concerns. As soon as the appetizers were done and our first rolls served, they were hooked and raved about the great rolls and how they will be back themselves! Thank You Oyshi Sushi for making me a hero!

This is our favorite all you can eat sushi restaurant! Sushi is always fresh and we always leave like we've over ate. :) There is however, always a wait and a line but it's because the food is great! Don't mind waiting if the food is worth it! My boyfriend does not  eat sushi but he always has something to order. He orders the mussels, the dynamite, vegas roll, sizzling skirt and asian steak. He also loves the music they play.

Ate here 2x with the fam while visiting Vegas. 2nd time we decided to go with the All You Can Eat, and it was well worth it. If you're hungry, go for this one. They have a large menu, portion is good, price maybe $1-$2 more than what you may be used to. Service starts off slow, but once your first order comes out, everything else will follow. I know we'll be coming here whenever when in town.

The best sushi place in Vegas, and it's all-you-can eat.

It's been theorized by our mother that my brother and I have tapeworms with the amount of food we devour on a daily basis. With the amount of sushi we ate tonight, this could be true. Lunch is cheaper at $21 per person but I'm sure there are less things to order. We came for the all-you-can eat dinner ($26 per person) and ordered:

- yellowtail
- salmon
- tuna
- mackerel
- uni (sea urchin)
- oysters (limit 4 per person)
- red rock roll
- dynamite roll
- favorite roll
- and like, six other rolls.

The bottom line is that all the fish is fresh, the service is prompt and friendly, but the food can take a while to come out when they're busy (especially since it's an all you can eat place and there's a ton of things to make) so after your first order comes, order again immediately before you finish to insure it gets there on time. 

There is a 2 hour limit for the all you can eat option but I didn't have any issues with it. Most sushi places have this rule as a safety cushion for those rude customers who don't know any better and camp out in the restaurant for hours as if it were their last meal.

The decor is industrial Asian with exposed pipes, bricks, dim lighting, and colorful murals. It's a snazzy place in an unassuming location, but I'd totally take a date here.

With tip and tax, it came out to around $65 for two and that's including drinks and after devouring half the Pacific Ocean. We will be back with the whole family.

Love coming to this place for my sushi fix.  The only complaint is the service.  Even on a slow day when there's only 4 tables filled the rest empty it takes them forever to get to you.. There's only ONE server that I actually like there.. She's fast and efficient.

BOOM!!!! Best damn sushi joint in LV, hands down! Don't argue either....this place gets a 10. Their AYCE is ALWAYS fresh, and I dont think Ive seen or heard a compliment in the 20 times I've been here. Awesome vibe, highly reccomend.

Frequent patron of this establishment .. It is one of the few sushi restaurants I highly recommend. The wait to get seated can be gruesome depending on the time of arrival and time of the day. Once seated though service has always been great. Their rolls are fully stuffed so be careful, you can easily get stuffed with just a few. Start out light with a few Appetizers then go in on a roll or two. They do half orders also so that's always the best way to gonif you just want to taste a new roll. Sushi has always been fresh here and I hope it remains that way. I've been coming to this place for about 7yrs now. My first sushi restaurant experience and I'm glad its still around! Try this place out, you won't leave unsatisfied

Oyshi is right around the corner from where I reside so of course I'm gonna try it! Well this place rocks! Great service and and an always friendly staff. We always ask for Stacy if she is working and she has never let us down! I recommend the J&B roll as well as any of the tempura rolls...the baked mussels are amazing too! I highly recommend AYCE...worth every penny ;)

I don't know why I ate here, I guess I was in the area and craving sushi at 11pm.  I was excited when I saw that the menu was slightly different than the Oyshi on Sahara.  Unfortunately the food wasnt.  The oysters and muscles were bland. The fish all tasted the same.  
Let's put it this way...there was nothing I ate that made me even think "I want some more".  Instead I found myself trying to figure out where to hide the dry rice and fish  I couldn't stand eating.

We love this place. We have gone to some other "must go" AYCE sushi and wondered why we ever strayed. The fish is extremely fresh...especially for being in a desert.The atmosphere is great. We recently had family from out of town and brought them here. They loved it. 

You will never feel rushed or timed here,  which is a huge plus in my book. The only reason I don't give it five stars is that sometimes the service can get a little slow. But if you love sushi, then this is the spot.

Great place! While visiting my best friend who lives here, she highly recommended doing something off the strip and different. I had never heard of an all you can eat sushi place that wasn't at a disgusting buffet. This place is great because you can order sushi and small apps, including small plates and salads with the all you can eat special. Not only was the food delicious, but the music was just as good! I could have stayed in there all night. Loved it.

This is one of my favorite sushi places! The oysters are my fave aside from the unique rolls they have cause of the sauce they use. "All you can eat" is well worth it here & their customer service is great. Food takes a while to come out sometimes but it depends on what you order. So worth the wait though! One of the best rolls they have is the "love affair". You'll love it cause I do. :)

The only reason I didn't give this spot a 5... Blaring. House. And. Electronic. Music... Even on a weekday, during lunch time. I just don't get it?! I mean I can get down with some EDM, house, dub-step and whatever else they play, but it'd be nice if they can switch it up once in awhile.

On to the food. Double Screaming, Red Rock, High Roller... I mean I can keep going. So many yummy rolls. Definitely worth it to get AYCE. Just don't overdo it and look like half the people I see in there. Hunched over the table, sweating, trying to finish that last roll they regretted ordering in the first place! 

Wait, that was me last time. Hahaha

This place's not bad. I just feel like their food taste like any other place. The price is good for the amount you eat. I'd ordered the spider roll, crunchy scallop, seaweed salad and green tea. Those aren't good cooked dishes.

Came for a quick dinner & was craving sushi. Got seated at the bar right away. Sushi Chefs & entire staff are very friendly. I noticed they have A LOT of Chefs & restaurant staff, which is very good. We ordered some wine & raspberry sake. I liked my raspberry sake. Very fruity. We ordered the Lobster Affair (very yummy & had crunch topping), Heart Attack (spicy & decadent) & Oh my heart rolls (tasty). We truly enjoyed our food so much. We were very happy! The food came out fairly quick (than most places). The décor was really nice & modern. Overall food was great & staff were A++. This place never disappoints.
Love the quality, so many different flavors to chose from and their green tea ice cream it's just amazing!. The place it's always nice and clean and fancy by the way!

As a person who eats at many different sushi places I was disappointed when it came to the rolls here. Although we enjoyed our appetizers and desserts we lacked in fulfillment in our sushi. 

For a 5 order the size was well, but when it came to 6-8 piece orders the sizes were to larger as if they were buffing it with rice and lacking any taste. When eating sushi I want to enjoy it not have a mouthful of rice and if was a good size it felt as if the sushi chefs were using the crab as a crutch to fill most of the sushi. One of my most enjoyed rolls the rainbow roll consisted of no avocado, loads of crab, and poorly sliced pieces. 

This is my third time here and I'll say that every experience here has been a gradual decrease of pleasure. The nigiri was enjoyable but that was all. The servers and bussers were pleasant but the sushi chefs were acting as if it was a middle school sleepover, gossiping with each other about customers instead of actually communicating with them.

First of all, I'm a sushi chef.  I had the all you can eat here. For the fish, which you should always have first, was poor quality.  I gave that a 2.   As for the rolls if you like deep fried and spicy sauce all the way I gave it a 3.5 but it gets tiring real fast.  Many of the rolls where they say soft shell crab mix, only means 95% imitation crab mixed with 5% soft shell crab.  Was horrible.  Anyway I'm pretty sure if your not a sushi advocate then this place will be just as good for you, but I'm use eating good, real good so I'll give it an average rating of 3. The server was on point though.  Had to end it off with something nice i suppose.

I used to live in Green Valley and there was a great AYCE place on GVP and Pebble. It's closed now. I found that out the hard way many many moons ago. We used that place as a crutch and were afraid to try a new place (for fear it would not live up to the old place standards). 

I had passed Oyshi many times running errands and after driving back to the Southwest area of town, broken hearted about the closure of our "comfort zone" sushi venue, we decided to go to Oyshi and give it a try. 

I am happy to report that we were very satisfied and have been back MANY times. 

Recommendations 
1. Do the AYCE. We've calculated MANY times what our meal would have cost with out AYCE and we always come up winners. 
2. Don't go on Friday or Saturday nights if you are starving and just can't wait. It's busy, and that should say quite a bit about the quality. I don't mind the crowd or the wait, but sometimes my stomach wishes we had gotten there a little earlier. 

Likes 
1. House music in the background 
2. TVs behind the sushi bar for the sports fans. 
3. Ample bar seating - we ALWAYS sit at the bar
4. Extensive menu
5. Chef willing to let you make up your own rolls :)

We try to hit up Oyshi once a month or more if the Sushi cravings are just to hard to resist. I highly recommend. Yum (salivating as I write this)

Love this place! In my own opinion, this is the best AYCE sushi place in Vegas! There are many options here, even if you do not like sushi. AYCE menu also included rib eye steak platters, and a variety of other item you can order in small portions. The AYCE menu also includes a dessert.

I would say Oyshi is the 2nd best AYCE Sushi so far in my books! 

Pros: The quality of the food is fresh and delicious. Good customer service. They can accommodate large groups if you plan to throw a get together. Some menu highlights - they have AWESOME selections of sizzling iron plates of Steak Teriyaki, Chicken Teriyaki, and Grilled Salmon. (Unlimited too!) Annnd there Calamari and Popcorn Scallops are so yummy!

Cons: NO HALF-ROLLS available except if you eat at the sushi bar. Getting your sushi orders takes a long time! We waited for over a half an hour after putting our order for sushi, so I recommend that you know what you want and putting in a large order.
Great "all-you-can-eat" deal! Food is very good with friendly staff. Highly recommend!

This was my second visit. After reading those frightening November reviews of food poisoning I was very leery about returning. I think Alice W was more angry about the service and used the F.P. card. I've never heard of a whole family getting food poisoning so take that review with a grain of salt. 

 My first time was good, I just did not write about it. Today I went for lunch and had a great experience. They have a few new rolls and I tried 3 of them. They were all beautifully executed and tasted great. 

I'm usually not a fan of ponzu sauce but the Iris roll**** off the new menu was so good I had 2 of them. It had  Spicy albacore with cucumber, wrapped with avocado, and seared tuna. My eating partner in crime loved it. 

Screaming Roll****shrimp tempura roll wrapped with yum-yum cajun albacore and avocado with garlic ponzu sauce. Flavor of cajun albacore was awesome. 

Love Affair roll ***shrimp tempura roll with yum-yum lobster, crunch flakes and masago on top. This was good, but came in last of all the other rolls. 

Asian skirt steak*** is served teriaki style on a sizzling mini skillet. It was a nice addition to sushi.

Service was better than average. I always sit at the sushi bar. Here you order from a waiter instead of directly from sushi chefs. My waiter was attentive, I had enough H2O to drink and never had to wait on food or ordering more of it. 

The AYCE is $21.00 per person and well worth it. I wish they offered fried rice but there are lots of items offered on their menu.

I will return to Oyshi as it is the best sushi that is close to my house.

Oyshi Sushi- My go to! I love this place, and im there at least three times a month. I go for the AYCE option. It is like $23 for lunch and $27 for dinner. Try to go for lunch, there isn't a lot different in dinner except for a higher price. Service could be improved! 8/10 times I visit, I get wonderful servers! But then theres a few times I get a server who never refills drinks, slow on taking orders, not being very attentive. Other than that I love this place! The rolls are delicious! I reccomend the Love Affair (crab and crunchy flakes) or the Crunchy Roll (popcorn shrimp and yum yum sauce) or basically everything else on the menu. You get delicious food for a reasonable price, only wish servers were a little more welcoming but other than that, this is the place!!
Great sushi...All u can eat... Redrock, tigerroll, popcorn scallops and Japanese ribeye awesome!!!

Food is not fresh.....my family and I got food poisoning after our 11/20/11,visited. We went in around 9:45pm  not many customer besides few people sitting at the sushi bar. employees were talking and hanging out by the enterance. Took them 20 mins to bring water and coke, by the way, never get the refill within 1 1/2 hour stayed. The worst dishes was the one I ordered "gyo don" it supposed to come with really thin and tender beef with stir fried onion and half cooked sukiyaki soup based eggs. But disapointedly I recieved a mexivan style beef bawl. lots of green paper and sunny side up egg. Nothing like gyo don. 
Sushi was okay, until we got home, all 4 of us start feeling the stomach pain.went into quick care the next following day. 
One last thing to mntion is the lady waitress, she was really not professional. We asked her to clean up our dishes before the cakes come, she picked up 2 dishes then never come back. We have to ask anoyher waiter to clean up the rest of empty dishes. 
We live across st from thos restaurant, but we will nevrer come back again.

Found this place using the Yelp mobile app (so glad I did) - they have an all-you-can-eat menu, plenty of specialty rolls, and the tempura is awesome! 

Went with a big group of friends and everyone seemed to enjoy what they had. I got a spicy tuna handroll (yum) and one of the specialty tempura rolls which was also good. Service was a bit slow (hence the -1 star) but otherwise everything else was enjoyable!

My favorite sushi place!! The all you can eat has so many options, and is the best in town for cooked/fried/baked rolls in my opinion! The AYCE also has great options like surf and turf and tempura for those who are not too crazy about the rolls. Food is always fresh, staff is always friendly. Been going here for years, and it's still my favorite in town!

It's a great all you can eat spot with a large dining area. The servers are nice & the food is great. I enjoy getting all you can eat because I always try new things. 
I highly recommend the super white & they also have green tea creme brûlée for dessert! It's amazing. 
If you're into all you can eat, this place won't disappoint. It's a regular spot for me & I keep going back for more.

Ted, many of the girls in our group are in love with you. From your sweet smile to your jovial manner in serving a party of 15.

My friend had her birthday dinner here and we could not have asked for a better waiter than Ted. He was so attentive, happy, and energetic, especially with a mess of us indecisive girls and boys.

All you can eat sushi for $26! I ordered a la carte, but a majority of everyone did the AYCE. It is a great deal and usually, when you get such a good deal, you tend to sacrifice quality, but everything was really good. Fresh, amazing, whatever adjective you would like to use.

I really wish I could bring this place back home.

OYSHI ME!

P.S. My friend thought this place was near the strip, it was HELLA far away, so in case you plan to go, grab a lot of people and hop in a limo. It's the best way to do it.
Seriously is the best sushi place! And so affordable...and all the time fresh. My fav pace to go eat..i come here like once a month.
As a AYCE sushi veteran, I can honestly say that this is one of the best I've ever had. Food and service, top notch!

This place is AMAZING!!! During the week they do lunch specials, which is only $10 for my fav, the teriyaki chicken. It's amazing! Never had teriyaki chicken like this and so good!! It also comes with California rolls, fried vegetables, salad (I don't care for, I substitute it for white rice) AND miso soup. Way more than I can eat but I try!
They also have jalapeño poppers, which are not your ordinary jalapeño poppers. They are my FAV. I could eat them everyday, all day.
Also, fav sushi rolls-- spicy tuna crunch, love affair, full moon. They are all spectacular.
Their ice cream parfait dessert is also fantastic. All you can eat is great but doesn't include jalapeño poppers so I don't usually get it unless I'm in the mood for a big variety. I also love their egg rolls. Before I came here I HATED sushi! And seafood. Now I LOVE sushi, mainly only there's. basically everything is amazing here. I don't like how loud the music is, but if you ask they'll turn it down. Waiters are nice & atmosphere is very japanese (which I LOVE, love Japan & their culture!)

Love this place!  All you can eat sushi for $20, but they also have lunch specials on things like rice bowls and delicious salads!  I love that everything I eat there tastes fresh and finishes clean!  

A high quality restuarant with a muted, classy feel to it :)

I went here the other night because I wanted to try their dessert. It looked delicious! I spent hours looking at the menu items at their other location. It appears the Sahara location will have other menu options which is odd since they are owned by the same owner, but it may that they have different nightly specials. 

I really liked the quail egg sushi. It is a raw egg, but it tastes sunny side up egg which is perfect since I love egg yolk! I have heard that this place has horrible sushi, but it wasn't bad at all. I did not like their special of the day which was negotori (I'm not sure if that's correctly). When we looked it up, it said it was fatty tuna. When it did arrive, it was not solid and the rice tasted heavily of sesame oil. They did have white tuna, 

I do love that they also have a other options like their steak, surf and turf, spicy pork. I usually like to order a ton of appetizers and non sushi. Their tempera batter was okay. It wasn't as crispy and crunchy as I would have liked. It was the same thing with the calamari.  

I did not like the green tea tiramisu. It was very very wet. I do not like that you are only allowed to order one dessert per person.
I don't know why this place doesn't have 5 stars. I am an avid sushi eater and this place is awesome! Really great rolls, good atmosphere!

Thanks Yelpers!  This place is great.  Nice clean interior (they actually have a VIP room, guess that's a normal thing in Vegas to have everywhere though, eh?), friendly staff and an amazing deal for all-you-can-eat (AYCE) sushi.  

They do AYCE where you actually just order whatever you want off the regular menu and they make and deliver it to you.  My friends Andrea, Annie and James all chowed and put away an impressive amount of sushi.  Since Annie and Andrea are bodybuilders they usually can't get full but we were all about to burst as we waddled out of Oyshi.

The nigiri are pretty decently sized and the fish is quite good.  As far as AYCE, it's the best fish I've had.  They have a ton of crazy rolls and while I am not usually a roll guy for AYCE it's fun to try out so many options.

We went for lunch and it was $21 which we definitely got our money's worth.  It's also nice to get away from the Strip as we are here covering a bodybuilding show and the pace is less flashy and frenetic which is great.

Definitely make it out to Oyshi!

Delicious AYCE sushi. I go here when I want to 1) avoid the crowds and travel time required for Yama and 2) eat some meat on top of the sushi. Oyshi offers a selection of non-sushi foods such as sizzling steak, spicy pork, etc. They also have more than just ice cream and mochi to choose from on their dessert menu.

Excellent service as well as fresh high quality fish. I've read some reviews where people say the service was horrible and it took over 30 minutes to receive their food. Here's an idea... Enjoy the company and talk with the people around you instead of staring at your watch. I did not experience bad service. Everyone asked if we needed anything often enough to keep our glasses filled and our stomachs full. 

Now on to the amazing food! We had the ahi poke. Super fresh fish and delicious flavor. Ordered some hand rolls, yum yum and dragon. Once again the unagi and scallops were fresh and delicious. I have to say though that things only got better with the last two rolls. The double screaming roll and the Hawaiian roll made the meal! I used to be a huge sushi mon and wasabi fan but i think i found my new favorite. I was so impressed by the quality of food and the flavor I can't wait to go back.

Everything from the service to the quality and presentation I was very satisfied ,  will be returning 

Price for ayce  was 27 for dinner  23 for lunch

My family went here last night...as we go pretty often at least 2-3 times a month.  Hunby and I were so sick after eating here last night.  We were told that the chefs were behind, we waited 20 min for a seat, not even half the seats were filled.  The food tasted off...but since you have to pay for what you don't eat, my husband ate his knowing it wasn't quite right.  My son and I don't eat sushi, but the only thing my husband and I had that my son did not have was rice.  We were both so sick upon arriving home.  My husband said the kamakazi (spelling??) and tuna tasted funny but he ate it anyway.  Not sure we would eat here again.
Absolutely LOVE this place and my favorite AYCE sushi in Vegas.  The fish is always high quality and the appetizers and desserts are awesome and included in the price!

So disappointed! 
Went to this place for lunch nd felt so uncomfortable. I asked to be seated at the bar bc I was alone nd pregnant, so I thought it was good to see how they handle the food beside I expected it to be fun nd fast. I did all u can eat. Waited 30min for my app: gyoza. The chefs never said hi or even looked at my direction with care or happiness. "I have been always greeted at a bar/sushi bar", it is the least they can do. One of the chef made a silly comment as soon as I arrived at the bar, after that I knew I was at the wrong place. From 4 different kind of rolls I would only came back for 1 (maniac roll) it was the only one spice with no sweet sauce or fake crabmeat. Everything else was just blah blah blah. The service was polite but slow nd confused. I never had a refill on my water. Their (management/sushi chef) seems like to kiss the good looking/well dressed ppl ass. Everyone else were mistreated including myself. This was the worse place I have ever been. I would never come back here once I won't put my best clothes just to someone treat me with respect. Besides for 1 single good roll??? Forget it. I would prefer to drive to 808 sushi that' is not fancy but better quality sushi and a way better service. . The first roll I had was the monster (every single piece of it fell apart when trying to eat it. every single roll were ugly and tasteless except for the super sweet sauce and super sweet crabmeat combination they put on everything.
My experience at this place lasted around 1 1/2hour bc it would take between 25-35 min for every order. Plus 20min for the check. In the end I can say: The only good thing about this place is that you can do half order... That's all.

Had dinner here the other night and it was good ! The sushi came out super fast and was delicious. Took a little longer on the apps but overall good experience ! Biggest concern was the cleanliness ! Lots of dust in the ceiling area and food on the floor ! The ceilings are black and you could see layers of dust plus the curtain at the front is super dirty and looks horrible ! I would recommend cleaning and looking at brightening the place up a little,  especially because they are busy !!

THIS BUFFET IS HEAVEN!

Everytime I visit Vegas I will have to visit Oyshi. I live in Chicago and basically Oyshi's sushi buffet kicks all the other sushi buffet's butts in Chicago. Oyshi has a very contempory & modern decor to it, with a cool geisha painting on one of the huge walls. 

My dinner at Oyshi was so fast, I couldn't even comprehend the food I ate. For starters - the mussels are a MUST and so is the ahi poke which is very fresh tuna. 

Their sushi selection on the menu is so vast you don't even know what to order. If I had to pick only one sushi roll from the menu it would have to be the volcano roll.

The price is definitely worth this buffet which is around $26.
Great quality with great price.  Their dishes are more fusion Japanese than traditional, but I enjoyed it.  Sashimi grades are excellent

Best sushi that I ate so far since I moved here from Maui. Cool atmosphere and service are excellent. I give this place a 10... I will be back soon with wifey when she get here..Mahalo Oyshi!! You make me feel that I'm home in Maui :)

Love the food always taste amazing. Only complaint is that the service is sometimes really slow. I waited nearly 30 minutes to get a simply shrimp roll when the restaurant was not busy at all. All in all ill keep come here just for the food.
Love their AYCE (All you can eat) menu. The wait may be long but well worth the wait!

AYCE Sushi! Service was great.  Sushi was good for AYCE standards.

My picks if you're doing AYCE:

Seaweed Salad - pretty standard, kind of small
Tempura - SO GOOD! 
Agedashi Tofu - good flavor, but wasn't the best that I've had.
MOCHI ICE CREAM - you only get to choose one dessert, definitely choose this!!
Sunrise Roll - nice spicy flavor

Wait staff was really good at handling our large party of 16.  Kept track of most of the orders and checked on us often.

I go to Oyshi on a consistent basis, as I live just down the street. The food is always delicious and fresh, although I feel the AYCE is a tad overpriced for dinner as there are some odd restrictions (only one dessert per customer except for ice cream, etc.). The service is hit or miss; it's either excellent and quick, or exhaustingly slow. 

I usually do AYCE, but order mostly appetizers. The gyoza are fresh, crispy and delicious. The Asian Skirt Steak is wonderful. The Chicken Yakitori is also on my favorites list. As far as sushi rolls are concerned, I've always ordered the Crunch Shrimp Tempura roll. No complaints about the food, except for the cut pieces are sometimes too big to eat one piece at once.

Rice was undercooked. Seriously, they handle rice for a living and yet no one knew?  And the salmon was old. Disappointing. I would've went to 808 Sushi but they don't open for lunch on Sundays......next time I'll stick to 808 Sushi.

We've had lunch here for the second time in the last few weeks and it's true the place is rock solid as far as I can tell by our last two visits. I waited to post a review after our second visit because often the first time may not be enough of an experience to grade a restaurant properly. Excellent quality all around, good atmosphere and most importantly the food is prepared consistently which is the main flaw with most restaurants, not just sushi places. Service is very good and everyone seems to help each other deliver orders to the tables. We really like the fact that the fish inside the rolls are actually cool in temperature and not warm like most places we've tried. The sauces are light in flavor and not over powering, which can overwhelm and kill the fish flavor of good quality sushi rolls. My only negative remark would be that for some reason, after our initial order the second order (often our final order) which is probably 1 or 2 rolls it seems to take a while to come out. Also today my wife wore white pants and it seems there was some soy sauce spilled on the seat of the booth and it stained her pants which I noticed when we went shopping afterwards, but no big deal since it would be hard to see that soy sauce was spilled on a black booth cushion. "We ain't mad at ya", we will be back for more. We hardly tried the extensive offerings this menu features. The best All You Can Eat sushi in town!

Came here for lunch while I waited for my nail appointment next door. Amazing! Such a great serving size for a lunch special. I wasn't aware of this, as I ordered an extra roll. 

Chicken teriyaki lunch
Sizzling chicken teriyaki
California roll
Tempura
Soup
Salad 

And my extra 
Eel avocado roll. 

Yes, I boxed it up to go! 

Tempura is great.... Very lightly breaded. 

Staff is obviously skilled in teamwork and costumer service. It wasn't just one person tending to me, they worked as a team. 
I will definitely be back!!!!

Service for some reason is always slow even when it's not busy...
Sushi didn't taste so fresh this time. ..ordern n group messed up...
Going back to YAma & Sushi on Rainbow

I went there with my girlfriend and her brother for my girlfriends birthday last year. The place was pretty neat if you ask me. The restaurant was nice, plenty of open space with good music playing.

We went there for the "all you can eat" menu and we were not disappointed. There are only a few sections on the menu that were not included in the all you can eat price, but other than that the majority of the menu was free range. From appetizers to desserts, countless rolls and entrees this place really was a feast for the eyes and stomach.

But the only downside, there's only so much sushi you can eat before it just gets gross. After a few appetizers and 3 or 4 different rolls, we were ready to call it a night. From experiences at other sushi restaurants, this place was mediocre. The fish could have been fresher, but I'm guessing with the "All You Can Eat" staple on their menu, they get whatever fish they can and throw it in a roll.

This place was cool, but the long drive and mediocre cuisine left me wanting more from a sushi restaurant than just looks. I'd go back, I just wouldn't get the all you can eat offering again.

Horrible service. Just came in for the all you can eat, and in one hour wet were served one tiny rainbow roll... The guy didn't take the time to come and check on us. People next to use were served right away after coming in 20 minutes after us. Should have known it was going to be bad when I asked if they were open and was ignored.

Will never come here again.  Next time will check yelp as I see the yelp reviews are similar to mine. 

Just sad.
Very good sushi! Very fast & friendly service. Good price for all you can eat. IMHO, too many rolls with cream cheese. However, I will return! :-)

Yummy yummy. Great service..prices are good...warning the calamari is gross. No flavor. I love calamari but i wont ever order thei calamari ever again. I had them take ut off my bill and sent it back and i never do that. So far everything else is good. I have been there about 4 times no other complaints so far.

I used to go to this place two or 3 times a week. It was great; food and service were top notch. When they opened the second location things seemed to go downhill quickly. They changed the recipes and had terrible servers that didn't know their own menu items. But I didn't want to give up on them since it's been my go-to spot for so long. But after tonight -done! My brother and I went for the AYCE after work. We got an order of sashimi and that was it. Our server Toni, who's been there for as long as I can remember, was awesome as usual and tried to keep us  Happy while we waited. So props to her. But the chefs, new or not, were so unbelievably behind. We finally had to cancel our entire order and leave. (After 2 HOURS of waiting) Still hungry. I won't be back until they get their sh*t together. What a shame.
one of the best AYCE sushi places...not only in vegas..but anywhere.  they don't overload you with rice on the rolls, they let the fresh fish and their creative presentations speak from themselves.

Very disappointed ! I came and order assorted sashimi dish which is $25, I told them that I dont like tuna and I want anything else except tuna! They told me that the chef says he cant do it ! I don't see how hard it is to replace tuna with other fishes ! Never come back !

This place is A-OK indeed. The all-you-can eat is very enticing the first 3 times you have it but after that, I can't even imagine putting myself through that again. All-you-can eat on the menu except sashimi means you will stuffing yourself with rice at the end of the night which is not very enjoyable.

The best  deal is the kid's Ninja Meal which is what I want to eat every time I go here but I can't...They're very strict on it. I brought my nephew here last time and he was sleeping so I thought I could order this Ninja meal and take it to go for him. Well NO! "Kid's sleeping can't do it. Only when he wakes up." 

Bottom line. Obviously I'd eat here. But I'm not proud of it. I feel like I'm in a bad relationship where my girlfriend is abusive and I still take it. Thank god there's plenty of fishes in the sea...
My husband and I have been going since opening week! I looove their sushi and you cant beat the price! The love affair and the tuna! Always fresh! Also try that green tea ice cream.

This place has something for everyone good seating great ambience The food is really good away from the sushi menu this is a great place to take the first time Sushi Eater to experience different flavors and if they still don't like  Sushi there appetizers and side dishes are amazing I recommend the surf and turf and all the desserts are excellent

Horrible service... They make guests wait while they have open tables. This is the third time I have come here and it's the same story every time. Rude hostess, no customer service. I will never come back to this oyshi. If I could rate them a zero I would.

Great place for all you can eat sushi.  The sushi I've ordered has always been fresh (read --not fishy tasting) and the service was great.  I'm like a kid in a candy store with this place and I leave with the too full tummyache to show for it.

I'd been here about 5 times and I love the amazing all you can eat sushi they have here!  The fish is always fresh. I love their variety of  rolls,  appetizers, and dessert.  The price is decent for quality and amount of food you get. There usually is a wait I never had to wait more than 30 minutes, and I learn to go earlier or later then the rush hour times. The waiters/waitresses aren't attentive like in other reviews.  But then again, some Asians don't tip well, so I guess you don't need to tip them as much as other restaurant you normally go to.

I've been here so many times and yet I forgot to do a review. Me & the husband love this place. Andy the manager is always friendly and helpful. The fish is always fresh. I do like the variety of  rolls,  appetizers, and dessert.. Strangely enough, I've never really had any of their dessert because we seem to pig out of the AYCE and never have room for it at the end. The price is decent for quality and amount of food you get.  They have a large parking lot so, no worries about a parking space.

I've been here a few times and the sushi was mediocre at best. The last time I was there maybe 2 years ago (and the last time I will be there) the service was just horrible. The waitress sat me in a booth with a stack of dirty dishes sitting right next to me in the booth next to me. I looked at her like she was crazy, waiting to see when she would move the soiled disgusting dishes. They stayed there my entire meal. I think I pretty much mentally tuned out after that, but my water glass was constantly empty. I drink a ton of water with my meals. Everything took forever to come and the bill, of course, took forever as well. There are too many sushi places in Vegas to come back to this one to be grossed out having to sit next to dirty dishes my ENTIRE meal.  Service is an F minus. If I were rating the food this place would get 3 stars.

Typically pick up food here! Good menu options! Being from the east coast, I'm not very used to the chopped California rolls but theirs is pretty good! They are quick and accommodating! Definitely recommend it! The inside is very nice!

I have eaten here quite a bit and over the last 2 year the customer service and quality have gone WAAAAY down.  They need to hire more staff and get better fish suppliers.   I had to flag down a server 3 times to place an order.  Two orders were completely wrong.  My Tiger roll fell apart while trying to pick it up.  I waited 30 MINUTES for a Dynamite roll.  This was at 1:30 when I was 1 of 8 people in the place.  I will not go back.

For $21 (lunch) or $26 (dinner) you can indulge in all you can eat sushi and sides. The difference between lunch and dinner is that lunch excludes oysters and something else they list on the front of the menu. Aside from that, you can indulge in any roll or hot item. Sashimi's off limits. 

Keep in mind that the rolls, regular priced, run for about $13 each so you might as well pay the $26 the ayce option and sample as much as you feel like... unless you're one of those freaks that can eat ONE roll and be satisfied... 

The catch to the rolls was as I suspected- tons of rice. One roll was so loaded that I felt my body refusing to chew any more of it. The sushi was another story- the amount of rice was fair. Oh, and sidenote, you're charged regular price for anything you remove or fail to consume the rice from. 

It seems that the best way to fill up without tapping out too early is to focus on the hot items and sushi- fill up on surf and turf, calamari, and ahi poke salad and pick maybe one or two rolls that sound too good to deny yourself of them. Or, you could be me and go roll crazy and have to fight yourself to chew. 

There are very tempting dessert options, of which you're limited to one (sad!) Bring friends and share all four. The mochi (mango or raspberry) was tiny, but I can imagine it was a refreshing treat. I had the creme brulee and my friend had the green tiramisu. Both were absolutely wonderful. The green tiramisu was a first for me and it was so exciting to eat. Creamy, yet subtle, yet sweet. 

The only qualm I have with my experience was that we were there on a day when the sushi kitchen was hopelessly backed up. All of our hot food came out quickly, but the sushi took what felt like forever to appear. It became an issue for friends who didn't order hot food and waited well over an hour to eat anything. 

Luckily the two-hour ordering limit was not applied to us or else this would be a fishy deal!

servers should know what their guests order. my table only had 5 people. it's not like I'm asking you to remember what belongs to who because it's reasonable to not be able to remember that. I ordered the most simple order out of all my friends, which was 3 orders of masago and 1 order of uni with quail egg. My friends ordered actual rolls(such as volcano roll) that take forever to make and they finished all their food they ordered which was more than 15 different full sushi rolls. I had to tell the server to check on my food twice to actually get acknowledged. I then asked do you even know what we are missing ? and he was about to walk off not even knowing what order he's going to go check on. I will never come back or recommend this place again. I used to be a regular here and now it's ridiculously bad customer service. I already didn't want to come here but I was content with the service last time. it was neither good or too bad. you need to hire new servers.
Went halves with a friend. Rib eye steak teriyaki was alright, but the gyudon was really good. I would give it 3.5 stars if I could.
Lousy service up front. Each and every time I come to this place, the front service person is rude and unprofessional. The sushi is great, but not worth getting snarky remarks and attitude over.

I just wanted to update from my last review and say that ever since Andrew came back, the place has completely turned around for the better! I love Oyshi again and the service is waaay better!! They no longer mess up or forget my orders.

Loove Oyshi! Now I can say they have one of the best AYCE sushi dinners in Las Vegas. Everyone should try it!

The best All You Can Eat sushi restaurant I've ever been to by far. 

At first when I came here, I wasn't expecting any thing to be that great since it's all you can eat, the food will be soso.

Was I wrong or what.

Plenty to choose from the menu! From sushi rolls to chef specialties to chocolate mochi, each dish brought out a different and wonderful flavor that automatically send me to the roof. Every single dish that was brought out were delicious and off the hooooooook. Especially the raw oysters, mmmmmm! (That's my favorite!)

One thing to keep in mind: Each time you order, be sure to order alot since the dishes come out fairly slow. Otherwise you'll finish a dish before the next one comes out.

Introduced by a friend was very impressed. Came back a second time this time I bought friends we ate in VIP room it was dirty. But food still great. At the end I ordered 2 rolls to go for my friend who intro me to this spot cause he couldn't make it. I brought them to his store after dinner and left he texted me to ask what they were cause it was not what he ordered. We called oyshi manager Kevin and he told us he would take care of us next time. So a few days later (visit 3 in less then 10 days) we went again. This time my friend who intro the place made it. When we were done we asked for Kevin again the five of us ate ayces. My two boys both under 3 did not eat. Again we were in VIP room.  Kevin came up and we reminded him of our wrong roll order and the 22 buck credit we had. He said what rolls would you like to take home? We said none the guy we ordered them for is here and we ate enough fish tonight. He said well I'm not taking off check next time you do want rolls to go I will take care of you. Then the check came 18% gratuity for 5 people....... We paid it cause it was 24 dollars but the server actually screwed himself out of a bigger tip.  The service also sucked.. Hour for our first round of rolls to show to the table. It's fresh it's good. It will be closed soon if their attitudes don't change.

I just love sushi so I'm biased when it comes to sushi restaurants, however, Oyshi Sushi is my new fave in town! Ambiance is beautiful - they have a big Japanese mural in their private room ~ so lovely to look at.  Service is excellent ~ food is delicious ~ price is reasonable.  Highly recommended!!

compared to the sushi buffets in LA, ive gotta give oyshi 3 stars. the 2 things that trumps LA's sushi buffet is they serve seaweed salad and you get dessert at the end! main reason why it doesnt beat LA's sushi buffet: fish isnt as fresh and no sashimi!

what i recommend: seaweed salad, tempura, tofu appetizer, mango mochi icecream, green tea tiramisu, eel & avocado hand roll

the raw fish itself is alright, it's not that fresh...i would rate it 7/10

very slow only one sushi guy, i try to go per second time nobody seat me, nobody said hi,nobody ask me,me i help you,wold you like water,very poor service and unprofetional,we left to another sushi place after be seated for 10 minuts,look the sushi bar,dont look to clean,the sushi is ok,but if u like clean good profetional service DONT GO THERE worst service in town

Usually "all you can eat sushi" should be translated into "you shouldn't eat any sushi"... Happily, this place is the exception to that rule. The sushi chefs here are knowledgable, fun and skilled. The service here is fast and friendly even when this place is packed.  The sushi here wouldn't pass at the very top tier sushi restaurants in town (like nobu, shibuya etc.) but it is as good as the best normally priced sushi spots in town. Bottom line, great quality sushi and for $25 you can stuff yourself silly... Updated my review to three stars as the quality here has notably gone downhill in the last year... It's not unusual to have sushi come out cut inconsistently and sloppy. Also, service here has suffered. Hopefully push I gets its act together, but until then I'll eat somewhere else.

We've been coming to this place for 3 years now. We order about the same thing most of the time. We are big AYCE sushi fanatics. When we first ordered, we already gave them what we usually order all at once. Then, we were questioned if we can finish it. Of course we said yes. Then we gave them our second order which is about less than half of what we first ordered. When they came back with the albacore we ordered, they gave us a regular tuna. We asked a couple times if it was really albacore and they insisted it is. We know how an albacore looks and taste like. It's one of our favorite fish and it's a must have for us. It seems like they are trying to trick customers with a different but similar looking fish or low grade items. We've tried another sushi place that did this kind of deception before but this is a first from this place. We have plenty of good sushi places in our area but we go out of our way to go to this place. We will not be coming back here anymore and so will the rest of our  family. I'm giving it 2 stars because of the promptness of the food.
Best sushi in all of Las Vegas. I highly recommend sitting at the bar for AYCE because the service is better. We come come every other week

What can I say? All-you-can-eat sushi is always awesome! The plus is its all-you-can-eat sushi PLUS all-you-can-eat appetizers like kobe beef, tempura, oysters, mussels, etc.  Also you can have a choice of 1 out of 4 mini desserts.  After an all-you-can-eat fest one night here at Oyshi, my friends and I left full and very happy. :D

I love sushi.. and this place is just okay. located very close to me so I end up going here a lot and it's always iffy. Their one manager who has been working the last couple times I've gone is amazing. He's very attentive and talks to the tables and makes sure everyone has what they need. If he is not there.. it's not the same. The service is below average. If they are the slightest bit busy.. you have to wait sometimes 20 minutes before the server will even remember she has you at her table to put another order in. This can sometimes be good because if it's AYCE, you're completely hungry after waiting 20 mins between each roll... we also paid with cash once.. 12 over.. and never got our change. and the service was terrible that time. so really? you're just gonna assume the rest is your tip? mmm no. and then she never returned to the table even though we sat there and waited for quite awhile. oh well.. the food itself though is usually amazing. I've never really ordered anything that I didn't like. Except the mochi for dessert. everywhere else I go they cut it into quarters for you and sometimes even decorate it with chocolate sauce (sushi wa on eastern.. recommend there waaay over this place) .. but not this place.. you just gotta bite right into it and man does that hurt my sensitive teeth. But again, the food is good, and if you go on a less busy night the food comes out somewhat fast. 

Also, it can get pretty cramped. Last time I was there they sat a larger table next to us and put a chair on the end. I literally could have rested my head on the guys shoulder who say there. Really? I understand about wanting to accommodate every guest that comes in.. but what about the comfort ability of the other guests already there? mmmm not my favorite place yet I keep returning so it'll get 3 stars.

First time going here and thought it was very good, sushi was fresh and the service was excellent if I'm ever on this side of town again I will definitely go back. Also there spicy mayo is really good!
Fuck this place!  I can't believe I'm actually paying to eat here. If it wasn't for my kind hearted girlfriend this place would not be getting my money. We won't be back. Played shit music too.

My rating is bias on the food, that is why I gave 3 stars.  My friends and I originally game to that side of town for Goyemon, the wait was 1.5 hour, so we decided to head down to Oyshi to check out.  All the rolls were mediocre, nothing too special to make me crave to return to that specific location anytime soon.  A couple of stuff they could lay off the yum yum sauce, Kami-Kaze had so much yum yum it looked like pasta sheets as garnish lol.  The fish to rice ratio on the nigiri sushi was really good.

Service was another story.  We waited around 45 mins or more for our first round to come out....even the oyster apps.  Go figure why thier AYCE time limit is 2hrs, not the usually 1hr.  Our server wasn't the greatest, but she did follow up on us when she could.  I noticed she was busing several tables, which is probably why she never followed up with the food and why she was tired.  I have done that, so I know the feeling.  the facility needs to either have the host bus, or have someone to.

Good & decent lunch specials! However, I had to knock a couple stars because waitress came to our table at least 3 times & did not bother to fill water glasses. And we had to remind her for our roll that comes with lunch entreè! Fish was ok, not that fresh!

Their service kinda sucks, but the food is excellent.  I always do the AYCE and usually got for the Bonsai Roll, ahi poke, gyoza, miso soup, grilled beef asparagus and some sushi (garlic tuna, cajun albacore)  YUM!!
Excellent food and great service.  Ask for Thomas to be your server.  My favorite roll is the Hawaiian.

This place is a disappointment it used to be good but the service has gone way down. Got there at 3:30pm with my other half was gonna go sit at the bar since it wasnt that packed maybe like 3-4 people sitting then one of the servers stopped us this short asian server and said it will be a few minutes because they only had 3 servers. There was 7 tables occupied and 3 people at the bar and 1 large party in the back, i mean i guess they are rookies and couldn't handle a party of 2. so we waited. 3:44 rolls around and decided to ask again then he said that he's waiting for the 4pm servers to show up! Wtf? U coulda told us that in the beginning or at least got us sat with glasses of water. So we left and NEVER GOING BACK THERE AGAIN. HORRIBLE SERVICE!
This place is the bomb!! Excellent AYCE!! I'm in love with the Catercheese roll! Great place plus they're open until 2am!!

I eat sushi probably two times a week and I love trying new places around my area. I have tried this place three times and each time I have gone there the service was so HORRIBLE that I will NEVER go back. It took me 15 minutes for me to even have someone come greet my table and another 15 min to order. Now I would understand the long wait if it was around lunch or dinner time but this was at 2 in the afternoon on a weekday. When I finally ordered it took about another 45 minutes to even get my salad and sushi. They forgot some of my order and at this point I was done. The second time I went I was there for dinner and the same thing happend but a longer wait! The manager came over and took off our salad which only cost us 4.00, I would assume for such bad service that they would have tried to make us a little more happy but comp'ing off one salad was no acceptable. I will never go back there and I advise you all not to either!

ok i think i've mastered the art of the AYCE menu here now. lol

not sure why but the meal i had last night seemed to be better than my other visits. maybe because i didn't over order this time which i tend to do.

btw you may be wondering why i keep coming back here if i'm so unhappy with the service... it's because it's so close to where i stay.. and my friends like it and good company makes everything better.

so last night we started with some appetizers while we waited for a couple other friends to arrive. once they came we ordered rolls.. then continued with nigiri.. and finished off with dessert. a few appetizers were thrown in here and there.. and this strategy definitely worked.

stars of the night:

house salad: i really liked their dressing.. it was kinda a peanut ginger-y dressing. super refreshing and a decent size. it can definitely be shared

baked green mussels: not too fishy tasting and the sauce on top is super creamy and delicious

oysters: max order is 1 per person which comes with 4 oysters... tasty! 

sexy roll: i believe it has fried unagi on top with yum yum scallops inside and a creamy mango sauce on top... my favorite of the night.

agedashi tofu: their version is really tasty. the tofu itself stays crisp on the outside even after its been sitting there for a few minutes.. and the sauce is perfect.. not bland at all

premium spider roll: with avocado and cream cheese and possibly unagi on top. cant remember but it was deeeelicious!

service was ok in the beginning but really began to slow down as it got busy. we were seated in the area sectioned off to the side so it was easy to forget about us.. and we sure felt forgotten at times. 

as for dessert they were out of mochi the last time we were there.. this time they didnt have the strawberry. ooo my friends were super disappointed :(

tip: monday and tuesdays they have a 2 for 1 house sake special :)

My daughter and I make this our first stop when coming to Las Vegas.  Never disappoints.  Staff, chef's, food dynamite.

Making a reservation is suggested, because it fills up fast, but sitting at the bar you can watch chef's prepare your rolls, and sped is quality.

The all you can eat is the key.  Thanks once again; see you next year.
Wonderful Sushi!!! Did not expect to find this in the desert!! All the fish was fresh and oh so good!!!! Wish I took pics of all the food!! I had my sushi craving filled!!!!

I've been a long time fan of Sushi Mon for quite some time now. Wanted to give another AYCE sushi spot a try. Pulled up Yelp and this was one of the places with good reviews. First time coming here, it felt weird, like i was 'cheating' on Sushi Mon. It's a completely different restaurant. Different atmosphere with the trance music playing in a dimly lit restaurant.

To my surprise, the sushi was excellent! The cuts were amazingly generous and good quality too. I had to try the rolls, which I normally don't and it was great too! Didn't have any complaints at all. 

We had the green tea tiramisu and it was really good, and I was already stuffed. So that says something about it. Only bad part is, you only get one order of dessert... dunno if that's a good thing or bad thing.

Besides this place being full of snobby ass people who have a stick up their....... u kno where .....the food and service is amaze!!! they had a roll with jalapeno ( what big help huh) but it had cream cheese and something else it was so good!!!...and their frid calamari is the BUSINEESS!!! great servive, amazing food, keep it up yall!!!
very clean.  Good food.  too bad it's so crowded now.  Worth the wait though.

Ok so most All You Can Eat sushi restaurants have basically the same menu but this place has a few extras that make it beat Sushi Mon and all the other places alike. The uni was fresh and buttery and I liked the fried head of the sweet shrimp with ponzu. The tuna poke app was delicious and refreshing. Dinner was $26/person and we were lucky to get put in one of the private rooms. Also, the service was EXCELLENT! They were fast and kept our table clean and well maintained.

But the thing that made this place stand out in my opinion was.....their Green Tea Tiramisu. It was HANDS DOWN the best dessert that I have ever had in my life. I will drive 4 hours from LA to Las Vegas just for that!

The fish is unbelievably fresh for the desert.  The all you could eat menu is not limited to the sushi but practically every thing on their regular menu from steak appetizer to shrimp tempura and even includes dessert.  I would have given them a 5 star, but their wait staff seems to be inconsistent.  

We have been away from Las Vegas for over 2 years now and we haven't found a replacement in L.A. or the Bay Area and plan to go back every time we are in Vegas.

Went here on a suggestion and WOW is all I can say. The sushi was fresh and delicious and the variety is awesome. The fact that it is so close to where I live helps a lot also. The Green Tea ice cream is a perfect way to cap off a great dinner. Will definitely be back

I used to hate sushi but this place turned me into a sushi lover. Absolutely incredible food. Quality is impeccable, service is always great, there's usually a decent wait but it's because this place is incredible!! I refuse to get sushi anywhere but Oyshi! I've told all of my friends about it and they're all huge fans. Any one who's eaten here can attest to how fantastic this place is!! I wish I could remember our waiter/waitresses names but they're all awesome! Must try!!

Where do I start with this place? First of all, we have been visiting Oyshi for 3-4 years now and have had ours ups and downs. When the owner is not around, the place goes haywire. I will say the quality of food is usually pretty good and when the heavier gentleman is behind the sushi bar, we are treated phenomenally. This is where it ends. There is zero consistency. This evening we arrived around 11:30 PM. There were 6-8 tables seated as well as about 6 people at the sushi bar. We opted to sit at the bar. There were 2 sushi chefs for the entire restaurant so we already assumed the wait time on food would be a bit slow but being that it was so late at night this wasn't a problem. What was a problem was the HORRIBLE service we received. There was a group of what seemed to be off duty employees sitting in the back portion of the bar drinking. The chefs were going over to that side at least every 5 minutes, taking shots and conversing, as tickets sat in front of them. At one point one of the servers had to go through the kitchen and behind the bar to ask a chef for extra sauce. The woman who took our order came back once after 10 minutes and once more after about 25. We placed our order with another server who did not write anything down and alas, forgot 3 of the 4 items we ordered. At this point, visibly bothered, one of the chefs told us to order any sushi through him, which we did. That too was forgotten. We could not even enjoy the $60 dinner we paid for and rushed out of there as to flee a very uncomfortable situation. Unfortunately I think it is time to find a new neighborhood sushi spot as this place clearly allows their employees to run the show which shows in their service.

The absolute best all you can eat sushi restaurant I have ever been to!! 

I'm from Los Angeles but came here with my friends when we visited Vegas.  Loved it so much, that we went back the next trip after that. 

They are definitely not stingy with their sushi portions and you get a lot of bang for your buck.  It's about $25 and you for sure get your money's worth at Oyshi!  Not only are the sushi AYCE but the appetizers as well!  At the end of the meal, you get a free dessert too!  I had the creme brulee which was delicious! :) It would be my pleasure to come back here again!

I almost wrote this place off for the unusual amount of time I spent waiting to be seated but patience paid off.  I ordered the AYCE (All You Can Eat) lunch & had an egg roll, a spicy tuna crunch roll & a rainbow roll.  I informed my server of my food sensitivities & she assured me that I can make omissions :-) (some sushi places are funny about that)  My eggroll was ok, nothing special, but I have to say that both my sushi rolls were very tasty & fresh.  Although not totally family friendly, its a relaxed enough atmosphere that you could totally bring the kiddos.  The bathroom although small was neat & clean.  My one note is in regards to service.  The staff wasn't especially friendly nor were they cold.  A smile here or there definitely would earn another star.  That being said, a must for sushi lovers especially with the wide variety of choices on the AYCE menu.  I would definitely eat here again.

Here is my review:

HMMMMMMM HMM HMMM HMM WHEEEE

First, I would like to say that I am not AYCE kinda gal.  I just don't eat that much (contrary to what my appearance may say) but in this case I think it was worth it.  We went for lunch so it was a $21 price.  But if you figure most of the rolls I liked cost about $10-$12 anyways, 2 rolls and you are there.  Plus it's your choice of different things from the menu, not just sushi.  But there are rules, and not EVERYTHING on the menu is part of the AYCE.

There is a bit of lag time on getting your food, so don't go running in thinking you are going to be out in 15 minutes.  But do go with the expectation of enjoying the company you went with.  Our server was great and the food was really good.

Dawn C. and I decided to try a new place today for our sushi lunch, and decided on Oyshi based on the Yelp reviews and the fact that it was close enough to my work for me to get there eat and get back in around an hour. 

Oh, am I ever glad we decided to try a new place today! Oyshi is great, $21 AYCE lunch with a huge selection to choose from. We sat at the bar and had almost impeccable service. We did to request plates (they did not bring them out with the wasabi) but everyone that helped us was so pleasant and upbeat, and our drinks were refilled without us ever having to flag someone down. Our check was also brought out before we requested it, which I always appreciate when I am on my lunch break. 

We started out with some edamame, which is serves warm with a sprinkling of salt. We also tried the beef wrapped asparagus because a reviewer recommended it. It was ok, but I was there to eat fish not beef... so it was on to the rolls. We tried the Red Rock, a new roll called the Sexy something-or-other, Baked Philadelphia Roll and the Japanese Lasagna. All were very tasty. Some people may be turned off by the amount of sauce put on the rolls but I personally liked it. Rolls that come with sauces on top say so on the menu so if that's not your style, just ask the sushi chef to leave it off! 

For desert we had the green tea tiramisu and the berry parfait. The blueberries on the parfait were still crunchy from being frozen, and the tiramisu wasn't really as good as I had hoped. But I was so stuffed from the sushi it's probably better for my figure that the deserts weren't to die for! 

I will certainly be revisiting Oyshi on another lunch break in the near future.

So sad Sushi Factory closed down!! My group of 6 was looking for a buffet to eat after a fun, but exhausting day at Daylight and with it being July 4th weekend, we knew all the good buffets on the strip would have crazy waits. So, after finding out that Sushi Factory was closed, we got a recommendation from a friend to go here -- around $20 for AYCE sushi dinner, which included appetizers, rolls, nigiri, and dessert (only thing excluded was sashimi). Pretty good deal, especially for how extensive their menu is.

I wasn't really feeling like rolls, so I ordered and ate mostly nigiri -- so my 3 stars is based mostly on that. The pieces of fish were on the smaller side, and (obviously) the fish isn't the freshest you're going to find at a sushi joint (some of the uni looked a tad bit iffy, but I'm also on the paranoid side when eating raw stuff). But, if you're there more for the rolls and other items, I would probably give this place 4 stars.

Service was good, and it was easy to flag down our server whenever we wanted to order more food (which was often!).

Went here for my birthday. IT WAS AWSOME!!!
Food: 5 stars!
I used to not like sushi. But I decided to give it another try, see if I'll change my mind. After our visit, I discovered MY NEWFOUND LOVE!! Sushi!!!

Price: 5 stars!
Prices were reasonable. We went for their all-you-can-eat that costed about $26/person. I must say, we ate so much I think the store will go bankrupt! Jk. 

Service: 5 stars! 
Our server was also very nice. He always checked in on us to see if we're doing good. Very polite and quick. It seems like all of the servers there were.

Worth the time and money. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to everyone!
There is absolutely nothing to dislike about this place. Everything is made with top quality ingredients, the prices are excellent and the service is fast.

Oyshi is the closest AYCE sushi to my house, so I've been here quite a lot. Not my favorite place, but it's a solid option. The decor is very modern and trendy. They also play EDM music and have sports showing on the flat screens near the bar. All postitives in my eyes. I always sit at the bar, so the service is good. Normally I can just order directly from the sushi chef without waiting for a waiter. That really speeds up the ordering process. I can't speak to the service when seated anywhere else in the restaurant.

One disappointing thing about Oyshi is that it doesn't offer seafood salad on the AYCE menu. That automatically prevents it from a five star review in my eyes. On the bright side, the amount of fish on the nigiri sushi is ample. Very high fish to rice ratio. I also like the variety of desserts offered. You're not limited to the usual mochi or ice cream. Oyshi also offers creme brulee and a berry parfait. The berry parfait is my usual and it's a must have.

Gonna base this review with overall experience. Honesty I didn't enjoy myself besides the company I was with. The service there is horrible... Horrible!! I would've possibly given this review a 3 based on the fresh sushi.. Wasn't so bad.. But it slightly tastes fresh even if sitting at the bar not having been served ASAP to the customer.. So sushi pretty delish. 

But honestly the service there is beyond poopy because.. Sure went on a Sunday, did not wait for a seat but I did wait just to order a glass of water just about 15 minutes.. Just to order that damn water.. And behind me was a wife and kid and the server finally asked are you waiting for something? And she responded. "yes my sushi, I've been waiting for 20 minutes"

Yeah... Keep that in mind and enjoy!
Yummy! Get the Love Seduction (lobster roll)...wait was really long but food was good however the crunch roll was just alright

I ordered a la carte, and when I first looked at the menu, I thought to myself, "The pricing is on the in-expensive side". Then the food arrived. 

The cuts of fish were smaller than I am used to. So taking portion size into account, the a la carte pricing is fair. Which leads to this point: I think that part of the draw of this place is that they have an "AYCE" (All-You-Can-Eat) menu. The AYCE price is equivalent to what I paid for my a la carte meal (as described below).

As for my experience, I ordered: miso soup with clams; a California roll; tuna sushi, salmon sushi, Cajun tuna sushi, and halibut sushi. These are standard items, and I felt it would provide me with good gauge of the quality of their fish. The quality of the fish was very good.

Would I go again? Sure. But I would go for the AYCE.

BTW... the kitchen closes at 1:30am most nights (check the site for operating hours). Not bad for the suburbs.

Everything in the menu is delish!!!!!   Staff are all very nice and courteous, prompt and smile all the time.  I will recommend this restaurant anytime to everyone.
Love their weekly lunch special can't beat that too.  

Clean utensils and clean all around this place.  Real Japanese place.

This is my all time favorite all you can eat sushi place in Las Vegas. I've been coming here since right after I moved here when they were pretty new, in early 2008. I am pretty much obsessed with some of their rolls, my favorites are Full Moon, Lava Flow, Nyi, Red Rock, and Treasure, but I honestly haven't tried anything I don't like. The nigiri it's always delicious, and I also definitely recommend the Vanilla Berry Parfait for dessert. I am disappointed that they stopped carrying "white tuna" aka Escolar, but that seems to be city-wide. The private rooms are great for larger groups, I'd suggest making a reservation ahead of time for those. They have plenty of beer, wine, and sake, and the best part is that Oyshi is open until 3am! Best AYCE sushi in Vegas!

I came here with some co-workers after a recommendation from a friend. 
The chefs are so funny and the atmosphere is really friendly. 
I tried the Red Dragon roll and the Caterpillar roll- so delicious. 
The best part: their dipping sauce. I have no idea what their sauce is made out of because it's sweet and it has sesame seeds in it. 
Although their AYCE was a little pricey, it's worth it. 
Savor every bite when you go!

I live on this side of town and for an AYCE and high volume restaurant the service and quality is great! There is often a wait at prime dinner times but that a good sign if you ask me :-) We often do our girls nights here and I don't see that changing any time soon!

Great food! So fresh. The table management is god awful. People stacked on top on each other in the lobby with open tables and at least 6 seats at the sushi bar. We literally watched money walk out of the door as customers got frustrated with waiting. Lots of choices for food in our area and more restaurants opening every month. Get it together please!

Oyshi, well what can I say. It is an all you can eat sushi place that is run by Koreans. The decor is very modern and there are several water sculptures that is placed around the restaurant. They also have private rooms and large Plasma tvs that will show a basketball game or two. I was introduced to this sushi place by a friend of mines and went for the first time a couple of months ago. I have to say their appetizer menu is, by far, superior to all AYCE sushi places. Their surf and turf has this sweet and tangy sauce, it is served over a bed of shredded greens with steak and shrimp on a hot plate that is sizzling as it arrives. Their oysters are fairly good served with a bit of chili sauce and you can have max of 4. I have gone back to Oyshi about 3 times and this review is a collective of all the times I dined there. The first time I dined I ordered some salmon, tuna, yellowtail, nigiri. I was very very impressed with the quality and ratio of rice to fish. I asked the waiter what he would recommend as it was my first time dining there and he immediately chirped "love affair" you must have it. It was very very good. I do have to say it took them over 20 minutes to bring out my order of nigiri and even longer for the love affair roll. There were probably 10 people dining there. I was kind of confused as a couple that came after us got their roll first. I am normally a service junkie and if I don't get it I usually don't ever step back into the restaurant. This restaurant seemed like a place that deserved a second chance. I went another time with a group of 9 and were sat in a semi private area where the wall had a huge mural that seemed hand painted. We were seated and they took our orders. The wait wasn't as painful this time as they brought out the food fairly quickly. Once again, the love affair roll and my classic salmon, tuna and yellowtail nigiri were wonderful. The third time I went was pretty similar to the first time I dined here. The service was subpar and their food seemed to lack flavor. I have to say if their service was at par with how their decor is I would probably have given a higher rating, but without good service the clients will never return. Maybe they deserve another chance? I have to wait and see.

LETS START OFF WITH ALL YOU CAN EAT FOR TWO HOURS!!!

Yes two hours for one of the cheapest all you can eat sushi I've seen in Las Vegas myself. Some will say that service of the sushi is a tad slow but hey you get two hours. Who likes to be rushed when eating anyways? I enjoy food so I would like to enjoy it at a nice pace thank you.
If your with great company that gives some extra time for some intellectual exchange of words (conversation). Plus the two hours give enough time to let the rice settle a bit and enough time to try a good portion of the menu.

The service might be a tad slow but the workers are always pleasant. I actually feel like I'm wanted there.. not like that other Asian restaurants..
They also are very knowledgeable with the menu which leads to great sushi suggestions.

The sushi at Oyshi I say is the best I've had in Las Vegas! 
I would like to suggest the RED ROCK ROLL due to the fact that it contains "Orgasm Sauce."  The sauce is rightfully named this because it will climax your taste buds into ecstasy!

Conclusion.. YES!

Oyshi will always have a special place in my heart. My husband and I used to eat here when we were just friends. We would come at least once a month and hang out at the bar with David. Fast forward about a year...we finally went back to the place that brought us together. 

We got here on a Saturday around 6 pm. Fairly busy but not packed. A lot of new faces, but David remembered us as well as the manager that runs the floor (not sure of his name). It felt pretty good to be remembered and it made the meal better! I cannot eat sushi right now, but everything looked fresh. My husband said it was good, but he didn't want to rub it in my face that I cannot eat raw sushi. Oyshi has always been on par with their fish and it definitely seemed that way on Saturday. 

I was able to order items from the kitchen luckily since they have a wide variety of cooked items. Calamari is good with their 2 different dipping sauces and as was their gyozas. I can't remember what else I ordered, but everything was fairly good. 

I will be back when I can get some real sushi into me again! Service has always been attentive and that hasn't changed. Oyshi is a winner!
Really good food. AYCE is available. Only thing about this place is it's almost always packed and can get quite loud inside.
Very good sushi, love the cucumber salad as we'll.

Hubby and I were craving AYCE sushi and yelp app led me to Oyshi. $21 for the amount of food we had during lunch is no problemo. 

I'm so glad we went. The selection on the AYCE list FAR surpasses any AYCE places I've been to in Cali. Tons of premium rolls, tons and tons of appetizer items (seaweed salad, asparagus tips), you can customize your own sushi, hand roll list is extensive. And the sushi itself is B-O-M-B! 

I go to Vegas oftne and I'm so glad my relatives live near this place. I will be going here often. I can see it already. I wanna try the private dining areas for groups one day. Oh and props to the server, Angel. She knows her stuff and was very sweet and attentive!

This place has changed a lot since I first went there. 
Uni- I know not to expect too much from ayce uni, but the uni came out grey and slimy. 
Oysters- the oysters were nice and big. They tasted fresh, and not overpowered with sauce. Probably the best dish. 
Surf & turf - bland and flavorless. The shrimp was super rubbery due to being over cooked.
AGEDASHI TOFU- fried to a crisp, so when you cut into it.. the entire batter falls off. It should be light and easy to swallow.
NIGIRI- fish quality was decent, but filled with a lot of rice. The amaebi tasted ok, but there is a part of the shrimp head that they don't clean off and discard. This makes it very difficult to enjoy, and sharp on the gums. 
Asparagus Beef- asparagus wasn't shaved down enough at roots, so you get the bad stringy part stuck in your teeth if it's possible to even bite off. 
Beef and asparagus, shrimp skewers - very dry, overcooked, flavorless. ( a waste of stomach space )

Overall, really nothing special anymore. They don't allow half rolls which is unusual at an ayce spot. They seem to have cut the ayce app menu down a bit too. The service was good, and attentive. However, I would rather stick to umiya for ayce. They have a larger selection with much better quality.

I went to Oyshi for All you can eat last week. The all you can eat menu is huge!! there is so much to choose from and everything we ate was great! The atmosphere is great, the food is delicious and fresh, and the presentation if fantastic. They also play trance music - ha!

Dishes I liked:
Hamachi Trio Roll
Alaskan Roll
Dynamite (MMM)

There was a lot more but I can't remember anymore. The only one I wasn't so keen on was the cayenne albacore (this wasn't that great). 

for $26 per person for dinner, this is a great deal especially because you can easily eat more than that value!

Sushi-great ; service- great music- wtf?? Electronic dance music during dinner?? Ugh this is not Sushi Samba! Totally out of place. Annoying atmosphere to say the least. Unfortunately my wonderful dinner was accompanied by aweful club style trap music.. Very disappointing.

Pretty good sushi at a reasonable price. Better than average sushi. 

The servers kept brining me food I did not order though . It was pretty funny.

A local recommended Oyshi and I can see why.  Place was packed when we got here.  It's off the strip in a strip mall no doubt and people were waiting to be seated.  We ordered off the all-you-can-eat menu and believe me, it was a huge menu.  Will all restuarants like this, if you leave any leftovers, they will charge you, but I have a feeling they dont follow through w that.
